Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בִּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֗ה בָּֽרְבִיעִי֙ בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ וַאֲנִ֥י בְתֽוֹךְ־הַגּוֹלָ֖ה עַל־נְהַר־כְּבָ֑ר נִפְתְּחוּ֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וָאֶרְאֶ֖ה מַרְא֥וֹת אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: In the thirtieth year, on the fifth day of the fourth month, when I was in the community of exiles by the Chebar Canal, the heavens opened and I saw visions of God.
Transliteration: vayehiy visheloshiym shanah vareviyiy vachamishah lachodesh vaaniy vetvokhe-hagvolah al-nehar-khevar nifetechu hashamayiim vaereeh marevot Elohim

Hebrew: בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הִ֚יא הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַחֲמִישִׁ֔ית לְגָל֖וּת הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ יוֹיָכִֽין׃
Translated: (On the fifth day of the month—it was the fifth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin—
Transliteration: vachamishah lachodesh hiy hashanah hachamiyshiyt legalut hamelekhe yvoyakhiyn

Hebrew: הָיֹ֣ה הָיָ֣ה דְבַר־יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה אֶל־יְחֶזְקֵ֨אל בֶּן־בּוּזִ֧י הַכֹּהֵ֛ן בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֖ים עַל־נְהַר־כְּבָ֑ר וַתְּהִ֥י עָלָ֛יו שָׁ֖ם יַד־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: the word of G<small>OD</small> came to the priest Ezekiel son of Buzi, by the Chebar Canal, in the land of the Chaldeans. And the hand of G<small>OD</small> came upon him there.)
Transliteration: hayoh hayah devar-yehovah el-yechezekel ven-vuziy hakhohen veerets khashediym al-nehar-khevar vatehiy alayv sham yad-yehovah

Hebrew: וָאֵ֡רֶא וְהִנֵּה֩ ר֨וּחַ סְעָרָ֜ה בָּאָ֣ה מִן־הַצָּפ֗וֹן עָנָ֤ן גָּדוֹל֙ וְאֵ֣שׁ מִתְלַקַּ֔חַת וְנֹ֥גַֽהּ־ל֖וֹ סָבִ֑יב וּמִ֨תּוֹכָ֔הּ כְּעֵ֥ין הַחַשְׁמַ֖ל מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: I looked, and lo, a stormy wind came sweeping out of the north—a huge cloud and flashing fire, surrounded by a radiance; and in the center of it, in the center of the fire, a gleam as of amber.
Transliteration: vaere vehineh rucha searah vaah min-hatsafvon anan gadvol veesh mitelakachat venogah-lvo saviyv umitvokhah kheeyn hachashemal mitvokhe haesh

Hebrew: וּמִ֨תּוֹכָ֔הּ דְּמ֖וּת אַרְבַּ֣ע חַיּ֑וֹת וְזֶה֙ מַרְאֵיהֶ֔ן דְּמ֥וּת אָדָ֖ם לָהֵֽנָּה׃
Translated:
In the center of it were also the figures of four creatures. And this was their appearance:
They had the figures of human beings.
Transliteration: umitvokhah demut areva chayyvot vezeh mareeyhen demut adam lahenah

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה פָנִ֖ים לְאֶחָ֑ת וְאַרְבַּ֥ע כְּנָפַ֖יִם לְאַחַ֥ת לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: However, each had four faces, and each of them had four wings;
Transliteration: vearevaah faniym leechat veareva khenafayiim leachat lahem

Hebrew: וְרַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם רֶ֣גֶל יְשָׁרָ֑ה וְכַ֣ף רַגְלֵיהֶ֗ם כְּכַף֙ רֶ֣גֶל עֵ֔גֶל וְנֹ֣צְצִ֔ים כְּעֵ֖ין נְחֹ֥שֶׁת קָלָֽל׃
Translated: the legs of each were [fused into] a single rigid leg, and the feet of each were like a single calf’s hoof; and their sparkle was like the luster of burnished bronze.
Transliteration: verageleyhem regel yesharah vekhaf rageleyhem khekhaf regel egel venotsetsiym kheeyn nechoshet kalal

Hebrew: (וידו) [וִידֵ֣י] אָדָ֗ם מִתַּ֙חַת֙ כַּנְפֵיהֶ֔ם עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣עַת רִבְעֵיהֶ֑ם וּפְנֵיהֶ֥ם וְכַנְפֵיהֶ֖ם לְאַרְבַּעְתָּֽם׃
Translated: They had human hands below their wings. The four of them had their faces and their wings on their four sides.
Transliteration: (vydv) [viydey] adam mitachat khanefeyhem al arevaat riveeyhem ufeneyhem vekhanefeyhem learevaetam

Hebrew: חֹ֥בְרֹ֛ת אִשָּׁ֥ה אֶל־אֲחוֹתָ֖הּ כַּנְפֵיהֶ֑ם לֹא־יִסַּ֣בּוּ בְלֶכְתָּ֔ן אִ֛ישׁ אֶל־עֵ֥בֶר פָּנָ֖יו יֵלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: Each one’s wings touched those of the other. They did not turn when they moved; each could move in the direction of any of its faces.
Transliteration: choverot ishah el-achvotah khanefeyhem lo-yisavu velekhetan iysh el-ever fanayv eilekhu

Hebrew: וּדְמ֣וּת פְּנֵיהֶם֮ פְּנֵ֣י אָדָם֒ וּפְנֵ֨י אַרְיֵ֤ה אֶל־הַיָּמִין֙ לְאַרְבַּעְתָּ֔ם וּפְנֵי־שׁ֥וֹר מֵהַשְּׂמֹ֖אול לְאַרְבַּעְתָּ֑ן וּפְנֵי־נֶ֖שֶׁר לְאַרְבַּעְתָּֽן׃
Translated: Each of them had a human face [at the front]; each of the four had the face of a lion on the right; each of the four had the face of an ox on the left; and each of the four had the face of an eagle [at the back].
Transliteration: udemut feneyhem feney adam ufeney areeih el-hayamiyn learevaetam ufeney-shvor mehashemovl learevaetan ufeney-nesher learevaetan

Hebrew: וּפְנֵיהֶ֕ם וְכַנְפֵיהֶ֥ם פְּרֻד֖וֹת מִלְמָ֑עְלָה לְאִ֗ישׁ שְׁ֚תַּיִם חֹבְר֣וֹת אִ֔ישׁ וּשְׁתַּ֣יִם מְכַסּ֔וֹת אֵ֖ת גְּוִיֹּתֵיהֶֽנָה׃
Translated: Such were their faces. As for their wings, they were separated: above, each had two touching those of the others, while the other two covered its body.
Transliteration: ufeneyhem vekhanefeyhem ferudvot milemaelah leiysh shetayim chovervot iysh ushetayiim mekhasvot et geviyoteyhenah

Hebrew: וְאִ֛ישׁ אֶל־עֵ֥בֶר פָּנָ֖יו יֵלֵ֑כוּ אֶ֣ל אֲשֶׁר֩ יִֽהְיֶה־שָּׁ֨מָּה הָר֤וּחַ לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ יֵלֵ֔כוּ לֹ֥א יִסַּ֖בּוּ בְּלֶכְתָּֽן׃
Translated: And each could move in the direction of any of its faces; they went wherever the spirit impelled them to go, without turning when they moved.
Transliteration: veiysh el-ever fanayv eilekhu el asher yiheyeh-shamah harucha lalekhet eilekhu lo yisavu velekhetan

Hebrew: וּדְמ֨וּת הַחַיּ֜וֹת מַרְאֵיהֶ֣ם כְּגַחֲלֵי־אֵ֗שׁ בֹּֽעֲרוֹת֙ כְּמַרְאֵ֣ה הַלַּפִּדִ֔ים הִ֕יא מִתְהַלֶּ֖כֶת בֵּ֣ין הַחַיּ֑וֹת וְנֹ֣גַהּ לָאֵ֔שׁ וּמִן־הָאֵ֖שׁ יוֹצֵ֥א בָרָֽק׃
Translated: Such then was the appearance of the creatures. With them was something that looked like burning coals of fire. This fire, suggestive of torches, kept moving about among the creatures; the fire had a radiance, and lightning issued from the fire.
Transliteration: udemut hachayyvot mareeyhem khegachaley-esh voarvot khemareeh halafidiym hiy mitehalekhet veyn hachayyvot venogah laesh umin-haesh yvotse varak

Hebrew: וְהַחַיּ֖וֹת רָצ֣וֹא וָשׁ֑וֹב כְּמַרְאֵ֖ה הַבָּזָֽק׃
Translated: Dashing to and fro [among] the creatures was something that looked like flares.
Transliteration: vehachayyvot ratsvo vashvov khemareeh havazak

Hebrew: וָאֵ֖רֶא הַחַיּ֑וֹת וְהִנֵּה֩ אוֹפַ֨ן אֶחָ֥ד בָּאָ֛רֶץ אֵ֥צֶל הַחַיּ֖וֹת לְאַרְבַּ֥עַת פָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: As I gazed on the creatures, I saw one wheel on the ground next to each of the four-faced creatures.
Transliteration: vaere hachayyvot vehineh vofan echad vaarets etsel hachayyvot learevaat fanayv

Hebrew: מַרְאֵ֨ה הָאוֹפַנִּ֤ים וּמַֽעֲשֵׂיהֶם֙ כְּעֵ֣ין תַּרְשִׁ֔ישׁ וּדְמ֥וּת אֶחָ֖ד לְאַרְבַּעְתָּ֑ן וּמַרְאֵיהֶם֙ וּמַ֣עֲשֵׂיהֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יִהְיֶ֥ה הָאוֹפַ֖ן בְּת֥וֹךְ הָאוֹפָֽן׃
Translated: As for the appearance and structure of the wheels, they gleamed like beryl. All four had the same form; the appearance and structure of each was as of two wheels cutting through each other.
Transliteration: mareeh havofaniym umaasheyhem kheeyn tareshiysh udemut echad learevaetan umareeyhem umaasheyhem khaasher yiheyeh havofan vetvokhe havofan

Hebrew: עַל־אַרְבַּ֥עַת רִבְעֵיהֶ֖ן בְּלֶכְתָּ֣ם יֵלֵ֑כוּ לֹ֥א יִסַּ֖בּוּ בְּלֶכְתָּֽן׃
Translated: And when they moved, each could move in the direction of any of its four quarters; they did not veer when they moved.
Transliteration: al-arevaat riveeyhen velekhetam eilekhu lo yisavu velekhetan

Hebrew: וְגַ֨בֵּיהֶ֔ן וְגֹ֥בַהּ לָהֶ֖ם וְיִרְאָ֣ה לָהֶ֑ם וְגַבֹּתָ֗ם מְלֵאֹ֥ת עֵינַ֛יִם סָבִ֖יב לְאַרְבַּעְתָּֽן׃
Translated: Their rims were tall and frightening, for the rims of all four were covered all over with eyes.
Transliteration: vegaveyhen vegovah lahem veyireah lahem vegavotam meleot eynayiim saviyv learevaetan

Hebrew: וּבְלֶ֙כֶת֙ הַחַיּ֔וֹת יֵלְכ֥וּ הָאוֹפַנִּ֖ים אֶצְלָ֑ם וּבְהִנָּשֵׂ֤א הַחַיּוֹת֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָאָ֔רֶץ יִנָּשְׂא֖וּ הָאוֹפַנִּֽים׃
Translated: And when the creatures moved forward, the wheels moved at their sides; and when the creatures were borne above the earth, the wheels were borne too.
Transliteration: uvelekhet hachayyvot eilekhu havofaniym etselam uvehinashe hachayyvot meal haarets yinasheu havofaniym

Hebrew: עַ֣ל אֲשֶׁר֩ יִֽהְיֶה־שָּׁ֨ם הָר֤וּחַ לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ יֵלֵ֔כוּ שָׁ֥מָּה הָר֖וּחַ לָלֶ֑כֶת וְהָאוֹפַנִּ֗ים יִנָּֽשְׂאוּ֙ לְעֻמָּתָ֔ם כִּ֛י ר֥וּחַ הַחַיָּ֖ה בָּאוֹפַנִּֽים׃
Translated: Wherever the spirit impelled them to go, they went—wherever the spirit impelled them—and the wheels were borne alongside them; for the spirit of the creatures was in the wheels.
Transliteration: al asher yiheyeh-sham harucha lalekhet eilekhu shamah harucha lalekhet vehavofaniym yinasheu leumatam khiy rucha hachayah vavofaniym

Hebrew: בְּלֶכְתָּ֣ם יֵלֵ֔כוּ וּבְעׇמְדָ֖ם יַעֲמֹ֑דוּ וּֽבְהִנָּשְׂאָ֞ם מֵעַ֣ל הָאָ֗רֶץ יִנָּשְׂא֤וּ הָאֽוֹפַנִּים֙ לְעֻמָּתָ֔ם כִּ֛י ר֥וּחַ הַחַיָּ֖ה בָּאוֹפַנִּֽים׃
Translated: When those moved, these moved; and when those stood still, these stood still; and when those were borne above the earth, the wheels were borne alongside them—for the spirit of the creatures was in the wheels.
Transliteration: velekhetam eilekhu uveׇmedam yaamodu uvehinasheam meal haarets yinasheu havofaniym leumatam khiy rucha hachayah vavofaniym

Hebrew: וּדְמ֞וּת עַל־רָאשֵׁ֤י הַחַיָּה֙ רָקִ֔יעַ כְּעֵ֖ין הַקֶּ֣רַח הַנּוֹרָ֑א נָט֥וּי עַל־רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: Above the heads of the creatures was a form: an expanse, with an awe-inspiring gleam as of crystal, was spread out above their heads.
Transliteration: udemut al-rashey hachayah rakiya kheeyn hakerach hanvora natuy al-rasheyhem milemaelah

Hebrew: וְתַ֙חַת֙ הָרָקִ֔יעַ כַּנְפֵיהֶ֣ם יְשָׁר֔וֹת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחוֹתָ֑הּ לְאִ֗ישׁ שְׁתַּ֤יִם מְכַסּוֹת֙ לָהֵ֔נָּה וּלְאִ֗ישׁ שְׁתַּ֤יִם מְכַסּוֹת֙ לָהֵ֔נָּה אֵ֖ת גְּוִיֹּתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Under the expanse, each had one pair of wings extended toward those of the others; and each had another pair covering its body.
Transliteration: vetachat harakiya khanefeyhem yesharvot ishah el-achvotah leiysh shetayiim mekhasvot lahenah uleiysh shetayiim mekhasvot lahenah et geviyoteyhem

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁמַ֣ע אֶת־ק֣וֹל כַּנְפֵיהֶ֡ם כְּקוֹל֩ מַ֨יִם רַבִּ֤ים כְּקוֹל־שַׁדַּי֙ בְּלֶכְתָּ֔ם ק֥וֹל הֲמֻלָּ֖ה כְּק֣וֹל מַחֲנֶ֑ה בְּעׇמְדָ֖ם תְּרַפֶּ֥ינָה כַנְפֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: When they moved, I could hear the sound of their wings like the sound of mighty waters, like the sound of Shaddai, a tumult like the din of an army. When they stood still, they would let their wings droop.
Transliteration: vaeshema et-kvol khanefeyhem khekvol mayiim raviym khekvol-shaday velekhetam kvol hamulah khekvol machaneh veׇmedam terafeynah khanefeyhen

Hebrew: וַיְהִי־ק֕וֹל מֵעַ֕ל לָרָקִ֖יעַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־רֹאשָׁ֑ם בְּעׇמְדָ֖ם תְּרַפֶּ֥ינָה כַנְפֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: From above the expanse over their heads came a sound. When they stood still, they would let their wings droop.
Transliteration: vayehiy-kvol meal larakiya asher al-rosham veׇmedam terafeynah khanefeyhen

Hebrew: וּמִמַּ֗עַל לָרָקִ֙יעַ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־רֹאשָׁ֔ם כְּמַרְאֵ֥ה אֶבֶן־סַפִּ֖יר דְּמ֣וּת כִּסֵּ֑א וְעַל֙ דְּמ֣וּת הַכִּסֵּ֔א דְּמ֞וּת כְּמַרְאֵ֥ה אָדָ֛ם עָלָ֖יו מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: Above the expanse over their heads was the semblance of a throne, in appearance like sapphire; and on top, upon this semblance of a throne, there was the semblance of a human form.
Transliteration: umimaal larakiya asher al-rosham khemareeh even-safiyr demut khise veal demut hakhise demut khemareeh adam alayv milemaelah

Hebrew: וָאֵ֣רֶא ׀ כְּעֵ֣ין חַשְׁמַ֗ל כְּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֤שׁ בֵּֽית־לָהּ֙ סָבִ֔יב מִמַּרְאֵ֥ה מׇתְנָ֖יו וּלְמָ֑עְלָה וּמִמַּרְאֵ֤ה מׇתְנָיו֙ וּלְמַ֔טָּה רָאִ֙יתִי֙ כְּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֔שׁ וְנֹ֥גַֽהּ ל֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: From what appeared as the loins up, I saw a gleam as of amber—what looked like a fire encased in a frame; and from what appeared as the loins down, I saw what looked like fire. There was a surrounding radiance.
Transliteration: vaere kheeyn chashemal khemareeh-esh veyt-lah saviyv mimareeh mׇtenayv ulemaelah umimareeh mׇtenayv ulematah raiytiy khemareeh-esh venogah lvo saviyv

Hebrew: כְּמַרְאֵ֣ה הַקֶּ֡שֶׁת אֲשֶׁר֩ יִהְיֶ֨ה בֶעָנָ֜ן בְּי֣וֹם הַגֶּ֗שֶׁם כֵּ֣ן מַרְאֵ֤ה הַנֹּ֙גַהּ֙ סָבִ֔יב ה֕וּא מַרְאֵ֖ה דְּמ֣וּת כְּבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֑ה וָֽאֶרְאֶה֙ וָאֶפֹּ֣ל עַל־פָּנַ֔י וָאֶשְׁמַ֖ע ק֥וֹל מְדַבֵּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: Like the appearance of the bow that shines in the clouds on a day of rain, such was the appearance of the surrounding radiance. That was the appearance of the semblance of the Presence of G<small>OD</small>. When I beheld it, I flung myself down on my face. And I heard the voice of someone speaking.
Transliteration: khemareeh hakeshet asher yiheyeh veanan veyvom hageshem khen mareeh hanogah saviyv hu mareeh demut khevvod-yehovah vaereeh vaefol al-fanay vaeshema kvol medaver {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י בֶּן־אָדָם֙ עֲמֹ֣ד עַל־רַגְלֶ֔יךָ וַאֲדַבֵּ֖ר אֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: And it said to me, “O mortal, stand up on your feet that I may speak to you.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam amod al-rageleykha vaadaver otakhe

Hebrew: וַתָּ֧בֹא בִ֣י ר֗וּחַ כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר אֵלַ֔י וַתַּעֲמִדֵ֖נִי עַל־רַגְלָ֑י וָאֶשְׁמַ֕ע אֵ֖ת מִדַּבֵּ֥ר אֵלָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: As it spoke to me, a spirit entered into me and set me upon my feet; and I heard what was being spoken to me.
Transliteration: vatavo viy rucha khaasher diver elay vataamideniy al-ragelay vaeshema et midaver elay {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י בֶּן־אָדָם֙ שׁוֹלֵ֨חַ אֲנִ֤י אֽוֹתְךָ֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־גּוֹיִ֥ם הַמּוֹרְדִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָרְדוּ־בִ֑י הֵ֤מָּה וַֽאֲבוֹתָם֙ פָּ֣שְׁעוּ בִ֔י עַד־עֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: [God] said to me, “O mortal, I am sending you to the people of Israel, that nation of rebels, who have rebelled against Me.—They as well as their ancestors have defied Me to this very day;
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam shvolecha aniy votekha el-veney yisherael el-gvoyim hamvorediym asher maredu-viy hemah vaavvotam fasheu viy ad-etsem hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְהַבָּנִ֗ים קְשֵׁ֤י פָנִים֙ וְחִזְקֵי־לֵ֔ב אֲנִ֛י שׁוֹלֵ֥חַ אוֹתְךָ֖ אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: for the descendants are brazen of face and stubborn of heart. I send you to them, and you shall say to them: ‘Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>’—
Transliteration: vehavaniym keshey faniym vechizekey-lev aniy shvolecha votekha aleyhem veamareta aleyhem khoh amar adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ אִם־יִשְׁמְע֣וּ וְאִם־יֶחְדָּ֔לוּ כִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית מְרִ֖י הֵ֑מָּה וְיָ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֥י נָבִ֖יא הָיָ֥ה בְתוֹכָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: whether they listen or not, for they are a rebellious breed—that they may know that there was a prophet among them.
Transliteration: vehemah im-yishemeu veim-yechedalu khiy veyt meriy hemah veyadeu khiy naviy hayah vetvokham {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָ֠דָ֠ם אַל־תִּירָ֨א מֵהֶ֜ם וּמִדִּבְרֵיהֶ֣ם אַל־תִּירָ֗א כִּ֣י סָרָבִ֤ים וְסַלּוֹנִים֙ אוֹתָ֔ךְ וְאֶל־עַקְרַבִּ֖ים אַתָּ֣ה יוֹשֵׁ֑ב מִדִּבְרֵיהֶ֤ם אַל־תִּירָא֙ וּמִפְּנֵיהֶ֣ם אַל־תֵּחָ֔ת כִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית מְרִ֖י הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: “And you, mortal, do not fear them and do not fear their words, though thistles and thorns press against you, and you sit upon scorpions. Do not be afraid of their words and do not be dismayed by them, though they are a rebellious breed;
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam al-tiyra mehem umidivereyhem al-tiyra khiy saraviym vesalvoniym votakhe veel-akeraviym atah yvoshev midivereyhem al-tiyra umifeneyhem al-techat khiy veyt meriy hemah

Hebrew: וְדִבַּרְתָּ֤ אֶת־דְּבָרַי֙ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אִֽם־יִשְׁמְע֖וּ וְאִם־יֶחְדָּ֑לוּ כִּ֥י מְרִ֖י הֵֽמָּה׃ {פ}
Translated: but speak My words to them, whether they listen or not, for they are rebellious.
Transliteration: vedivareta et-devaray aleyhem im-yishemeu veim-yechedalu khiy meriy hemah {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם שְׁמַע֙ אֵ֤ת אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִי֙ מְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יךָ אַל־תְּהִי־מֶ֖רִי כְּבֵ֣ית הַמֶּ֑רִי פְּצֵ֣ה פִ֔יךָ וֶאֱכֹ֕ל אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֖י נֹתֵ֥ן אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: “And you, mortal, heed what I say to you: Do not be rebellious like that rebellious breed. Open your mouth and eat what I am giving you.”
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam shema et asher-aniy medaver eleykha al-tehiy-meriy kheveyt hameriy fetseh fiykha veekhol et asher-aniy noten eleykha

Hebrew: וָאֶרְאֶ֕ה וְהִנֵּה־יָ֖ד שְׁלוּחָ֣ה אֵלָ֑י וְהִנֵּה־ב֖וֹ מְגִלַּת־סֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: As I looked, there was a hand stretched out to me, holding a written scroll.
Transliteration: vaereeh vehineh-yad sheluchah elay vehineh-vvo megilat-sefer

Hebrew: וַיִּפְרֹ֤שׂ אוֹתָהּ֙ לְפָנַ֔י וְהִ֥יא כְתוּבָ֖ה פָּנִ֣ים וְאָח֑וֹר וְכָת֣וּב אֵלֶ֔יהָ קִנִ֥ים וָהֶ֖גֶה וָהִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: [God] unrolled it before me, and it was inscribed on both the front and the back; on it were written lamentations, dirges, and woes.
Transliteration: vayiferosh votah lefanay vehiy khetuvah faniym veachvor vekhatuv eleyha kiniym vahegeh vahiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־תִּמְצָ֖א אֱכ֑וֹל אֱכוֹל֙ אֶת־הַמְּגִלָּ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וְלֵ֥ךְ דַּבֵּ֖ר אֶל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: [God] said to me, “Mortal, eat what is offered you; eat this scroll, and go speak to the House of Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam et asher-timetsa ekhvol ekhvol et-hamegilah hazot velekhe daver el-veyt yisherael

Hebrew: וָאֶפְתַּ֖ח אֶת־פִּ֑י וַיַּ֣אֲכִילֵ֔נִי אֵ֖ת הַמְּגִלָּ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: So I opened my mouth, and I was given this scroll to eat,
Transliteration: vaefetach et-fiy vayaakhiyleniy et hamegilah hazot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י בֶּן־אָדָם֙ בִּטְנְךָ֤ תַֽאֲכֵל֙ וּמֵעֶ֣יךָ תְמַלֵּ֔א אֵ֚ת הַמְּגִלָּ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י נֹתֵ֣ן אֵלֶ֑יךָ וָאֹ֣כְלָ֔ה וַתְּהִ֥י בְּפִ֖י כִּדְבַ֥שׁ לְמָתֽוֹק׃ {פ}
Translated: as I was told, “Mortal, feed your stomach and fill your belly with this scroll that I give you.” I ate it, and it tasted as sweet as honey to me.
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam vitenekha taakhel umeeykha temale et hamegilah hazot asher aniy noten eleykha vaokhelah vatehiy vefiy khidevash lematvok {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם לֶךְ־בֹּא֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְדִבַּרְתָּ֥ בִדְבָרַ֖י אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Then [God] said to me, “Mortal, go to the House of Israel and repeat My very words to them.
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam lekhe-vo el-veyt yisherael vedivareta videvaray aleyhem

Hebrew: כִּ֡י לֹא֩ אֶל־עַ֨ם עִמְקֵ֥י שָׂפָ֛ה וְכִבְדֵ֥י לָשׁ֖וֹן אַתָּ֣ה שָׁל֑וּחַ אֶל־בֵּ֖ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For you are sent, not to a people of unintelligible speech and difficult language, but to the House of Israel—
Transliteration: khiy lo el-am imekey shafah vekhivedey lashvon atah shalucha el-veyt yisherael

Hebrew: לֹ֣א ׀ אֶל־עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֗ים עִמְקֵ֤י שָׂפָה֙ וְכִבְדֵ֣י לָשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תִשְׁמַ֖ע דִּבְרֵיהֶ֑ם אִם־לֹ֤א אֲלֵיהֶם֙ שְׁלַחְתִּ֔יךָ הֵ֖מָּה יִשְׁמְע֥וּ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: not to the many peoples of unintelligible speech and difficult language, whose talk you cannot understand. If I sent you to them, they would listen to you.
Transliteration: lo el-amiym raviym imekey shafah vekhivedey lashvon asher lo-tishema divereyhem im-lo aleyhem shelachetiykha hemah yishemeu eleykha

Hebrew: וּבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֹ֤א יֹאבוּ֙ לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ אֵלֶ֔יךָ כִּי־אֵינָ֥ם אֹבִ֖ים לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ אֵלָ֑י כִּ֚י כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל חִזְקֵי־מֵ֥צַח וּקְשֵׁי־לֵ֖ב הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: But the House of Israel will refuse to listen to you, for they refuse to listen to Me; for the whole House of Israel are brazen of forehead and stubborn of heart.
Transliteration: uveyt yisherael lo yovu lishemoa eleykha khiy-eynam oviym lishemoa elay khiy khׇl-veyt yisherael chizekey-metsach ukeshey-lev hemah

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה נָתַ֧תִּי אֶת־פָּנֶ֛יךָ חֲזָקִ֖ים לְעֻמַּ֣ת פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֶֽת־מִצְחֲךָ֥ חָזָ֖ק לְעֻמַּ֥ת מִצְחָֽם׃
Translated: But I will make your face as hard as theirs, and your forehead as brazen as theirs.
Transliteration: hineh natatiy et-faneykha chazakiym leumat feneyhem veet-mitsechakha chazak leumat mitsecham

Hebrew: כְּשָׁמִ֛יר חָזָ֥ק מִצֹּ֖ר נָתַ֣תִּי מִצְחֶ֑ךָ לֹֽא־תִירָ֤א אוֹתָם֙ וְלֹא־תֵחַ֣ת מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם כִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית מְרִ֖י הֵֽמָּה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will make your forehead like adamant, harder than flint. Do not fear them, and do not be dismayed by them, though they are a rebellious breed.”
Transliteration: kheshamiyr chazak mitsor natatiy mitsechekha lo-tiyra votam velo-techat mifeneyhem khiy veyt meriy hemah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם אֶת־כׇּל־דְּבָרַי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יךָ קַ֥ח בִּֽלְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְאׇזְנֶ֥יךָ שְּׁמָֽע׃
Translated: Then [God] said to me: “Mortal, listen with your ears and receive into your mind all the words that I speak to you.
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam et-khׇl-devaray asher adaver eleykha kach vilevavekha uveׇzeneykha shema

Hebrew: וְלֵ֨ךְ בֹּ֤א אֶל־הַגּוֹלָה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֔ךָ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֤ אֲלֵיהֶם֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה אִֽם־יִשְׁמְע֖וּ וְאִם־יֶחְדָּֽלוּ׃
Translated: Go to your people, the exile community, and speak to them. Say to them: Thus says the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—whether they listen or not.”
Transliteration: velekhe vo el-hagvolah el-veney amekha vedivareta aleyhem veamareta aleyhem khoh amar adonay yehovih im-yishemeu veim-yechedalu

Hebrew: וַתִּשָּׂאֵ֣נִי ר֔וּחַ וָאֶשְׁמַ֣ע אַחֲרַ֔י ק֖וֹל רַ֣עַשׁ גָּד֑וֹל בָּר֥וּךְ כְּבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמְּקוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then a spirit carried me away, and behind me I heard a great roaring sound: “Blessed is the Presence of G<small>OD</small>, in its place,”
Transliteration: vatishaeniy rucha vaeshema acharay kvol raash gadvol varukhe khevvod-yehovah mimekvomvo

Hebrew: וְק֣וֹל ׀ כַּנְפֵ֣י הַחַיּ֗וֹת מַשִּׁיקוֹת֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה אֶל־אֲחוֹתָ֔הּ וְק֥וֹל הָאוֹפַנִּ֖ים לְעֻמָּתָ֑ם וְק֖וֹל רַ֥עַשׁ גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: with the sound of the wings of the creatures beating against one another, and the sound of the wheels beside them—a great roaring sound.
Transliteration: vekvol khanefey hachayyvot mashiykvot ishah el-achvotah vekvol havofaniym leumatam vekvol raash gadvol

Hebrew: וְר֥וּחַ נְשָׂאַ֖תְנִי וַתִּקָּחֵ֑נִי וָאֵלֵ֥ךְ מַר֙ בַּחֲמַ֣ת רוּחִ֔י וְיַד־יְהֹוָ֥ה עָלַ֖י חָזָֽקָה׃
Translated: A spirit seized me and carried me away. I went in bitterness, in the fury of my spirit, while G<small>OD</small>’s hand was strong upon me.
Transliteration: verucha neshaateniy vatikacheniy vaelekhe mar vachamat ruchiy veyad-yehovah alay chazakah

Hebrew: וָאָב֨וֹא אֶל־הַגּוֹלָ֜ה תֵּ֣ל אָ֠בִ֠יב הַיֹּשְׁבִ֤ים אֶֽל־נְהַר־כְּבָר֙ (ואשר) [וָאֵשֵׁ֔ב] הֵ֖מָּה יוֹשְׁבִ֣ים שָׁ֑ם וָאֵשֵׁ֥ב שָׁ֛ם שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים מַשְׁמִ֥ים בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: And I came to the exile community that dwelt in Tel Abib by the Chebar Canal, and I remained where they dwelt. And for seven days I sat there stunned among them.
Transliteration: vaavvo el-hagvolah tel aviyv hayosheviym el-nehar-khevar (vshr) [vaeshev] hemah yvosheviym sham vaeshev sham shiveat yamiym mashemiym vetvokham

Hebrew:
וַיְהִ֕י מִקְצֵ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים {פ}
וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: After those seven days, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration:
vayehiy miketseh shiveat yamiym {f}
vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם צֹפֶ֥ה נְתַתִּ֖יךָ לְבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֤ מִפִּי֙ דָּבָ֔ר וְהִזְהַרְתָּ֥ אוֹתָ֖ם מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated: “O mortal, I appoint you lookout for the House of Israel; and when you hear a word from My mouth, you must warn them for Me.
Transliteration: ven-adam tsofeh netatiykha leveyt yisherael veshamaeta mifiy davar vehizehareta votam mimeniy

Hebrew: בְּאׇמְרִ֤י לָרָשָׁע֙ מ֣וֹת תָּמ֔וּת וְלֹ֣א הִזְהַרְתּ֗וֹ וְלֹ֥א דִבַּ֛רְתָּ לְהַזְהִ֥יר רָשָׁ֛ע מִדַּרְכּ֥וֹ הָרְשָׁעָ֖ה לְחַיֹּת֑וֹ ה֤וּא רָשָׁע֙ בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ יָמ֔וּת וְדָמ֖וֹ מִיָּדְךָ֥ אֲבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
Translated: If I say to someone wicked, ‘You shall die,’ and you do not give warning—you do not speak to warn them of their wicked course in order to save their life—then that wicked one shall die for their own iniquity, while from you I will require a reckoning for their blood.
Transliteration: veׇmeriy larasha mvot tamut velo hizeharetvo velo divareta lehazehiyr rasha midarekhvo hareshaah lechayotvo hu rasha vaavonvo yamut vedamvo miyadekha avakesh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ כִּי־הִזְהַ֣רְתָּ רָשָׁ֔ע וְלֹא־שָׁב֙ מֵֽרִשְׁע֔וֹ וּמִדַּרְכּ֖וֹ הָרְשָׁעָ֑ה ה֚וּא בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ יָמ֔וּת וְאַתָּ֖ה אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁךָ֥ הִצַּֽלְתָּ׃
Translated: But if you do warn someone wicked, and they do not turn back from their wickedness and their wicked course, they shall die for their iniquity, while you will have saved your own life.
Transliteration: veatah khiy-hizehareta rasha velo-shav merishevo umidarekhvo hareshaah hu vaavonvo yamut veatah et-nafeshekha hitsaleta

Hebrew: וּבְשׁ֨וּב צַדִּ֤יק מִצִּדְקוֹ֙ וְעָ֣שָׂה עָ֔וֶל וְנָתַתִּ֥י מִכְשׁ֛וֹל לְפָנָ֖יו ה֣וּא יָמ֑וּת כִּ֣י לֹ֤א הִזְהַרְתּוֹ֙ בְּחַטָּאת֣וֹ יָמ֔וּת וְלֹ֣א תִזָּכַ֗רְןָ צִדְקֹתָו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וְדָמ֖וֹ מִיָּדְךָ֥ אֲבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
Translated: Again, if someone righteous abandons righteousness and does wrong—when I put a stumbling block before them—they shall die. They shall die for their sins; the righteous deeds that they did shall not be remembered; while from you, because you did not warn them, I will require a reckoning for their blood.
Transliteration: uveshuv tsadiyk mitsidekvo veashah avel venatatiy mikheshvol lefanayv hu yamut khiy lo hizeharetvo vechatatvo yamut velo tizakharena tsidekotav asher ashah vedamvo miyadekha avakesh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה כִּ֧י הִזְהַרְתּ֣וֹ צַדִּ֗יק לְבִלְתִּ֥י חֲטֹ֛א צַדִּ֖יק וְה֣וּא לֹֽא־חָטָ֑א חָי֤וֹ יִֽחְיֶה֙ כִּ֣י נִזְהָ֔ר וְאַתָּ֖ה אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁךָ֥ הִצַּֽלְתָּ׃ {פ}
Translated: If, however, you warn someone righteous not to sin, and that righteous one does not sin, they shall live because they took warning, while you will have saved your own life.”
Transliteration: veatah khiy hizeharetvo tsadiyk leviletiy chato tsadiyk vehu lo-chata chayvo yicheyeh khiy nizehar veatah et-nafeshekha hitsaleta {f}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֥י עָלַ֛י שָׁ֖ם יַד־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י ק֥וּם צֵא֙ אֶל־הַבִּקְעָ֔ה וְשָׁ֖ם אֲדַבֵּ֥ר אוֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small>’s hand came upon me there, and I was told, “Arise, go out to the valley, and there I will speak with you.”
Transliteration: vatehiy alay sham yad-yehovah vayomer elay kum tse el-havikeah vesham adaver votakhe

Hebrew: וָאָקוּם֮ וָאֵצֵ֣א אֶל־הַבִּקְעָה֒ וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֤ם כְּבוֹד־יְהֹוָה֙ עֹמֵ֔ד כַּכָּב֕וֹד אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִ֖יתִי עַל־נְהַר־כְּבָ֑ר וָאֶפֹּ֖ל עַל־פָּנָֽי׃
Translated: I arose and went out to the valley, and there stood the Presence of G<small>OD</small>, like the Presence that I had seen at the Chebar Canal; and I flung myself down on my face.
Transliteration: vaakum vaetse el-havikeah vehineh-sham khevvod-yehovah omed khakhavvod asher raiytiy al-nehar-khevar vaefol al-fanay

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹא־בִ֣י ר֔וּחַ וַתַּעֲמִדֵ֖נִי עַל־רַגְלָ֑י וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר אֹתִי֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י בֹּ֥א הִסָּגֵ֖ר בְּת֥וֹךְ בֵּיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And a spirit entered into me and set me upon my feet. And [God] spoke to me, and said to me: “Go, shut yourself up in your house.
Transliteration: vatavo-viy rucha vataamideniy al-ragelay vayedaver otiy vayomer elay vo hisager vetvokhe veytekha

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם הִנֵּ֨ה נָתְנ֤וּ עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ עֲבוֹתִ֔ים וַאֲסָר֖וּךָ בָּהֶ֑ם וְלֹ֥א תֵצֵ֖א בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: As for you, O mortal, cords have been placed upon you, and you have been bound with them, and you shall not go out among the people.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam hineh natenu aleykha avvotiym vaasarukha vahem velo tetse vetvokham

Hebrew: וּלְשֽׁוֹנְךָ֙ אַדְבִּ֣יק אֶל־חִכֶּ֔ךָ וְנֶֽאֱלַ֔מְתָּ וְלֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לְאִ֣ישׁ מוֹכִ֑יחַ כִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית מְרִ֖י הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: And I will make your tongue cleave to your palate, and you shall be dumb; you shall not be a reprover to them, for they are a rebellious breed.
Transliteration: uleshvonekha adeviyk el-chikhekha veneelameta velo-tiheyeh lahem leiysh mvokhiycha khiy veyt meriy hemah

Hebrew: וּֽבְדַבְּרִ֤י אֽוֹתְךָ֙ אֶפְתַּ֣ח אֶת־פִּ֔יךָ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הַשֹּׁמֵ֤עַ ׀ יִשְׁמָע֙ וְהֶחָדֵ֣ל ׀ יֶחְדָּ֔ל כִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית מְרִ֖י הֵֽמָּה׃ {פ}
Translated: But when I speak with you, I will open your mouth, and you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>!’ Whoever listens will listen, and whoever does not will not—for they are a rebellious breed.”
Transliteration: uvedaveriy votekha efetach et-fiykha veamareta aleyhem khoh amar adonay yehovih hashomea yishema vehechadel yechedal khiy veyt meriy hemah {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה בֶן־אָדָם֙ קַח־לְךָ֣ לְבֵנָ֔ה וְנָתַתָּ֥ה אוֹתָ֖הּ לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְחַקּוֹתָ֥ עָלֶ֛יהָ עִ֖יר אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: “And you, O mortal, take a brick and put it in front of you, and incise on it a city, Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam kach-lekha levenah venatatah votah lefaneykha vechakvota aleyha iyr et-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֨ה עָלֶ֜יהָ מָצ֗וֹר וּבָנִ֤יתָ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ דָּיֵ֔ק וְשָׁפַכְתָּ֥ עָלֶ֖יהָ סֹלְלָ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֨ה עָלֶ֧יהָ מַחֲנ֛וֹת וְשִׂים־עָלֶ֥יהָ כָּרִ֖ים סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Set up a siege against it, and build towers against it, and cast a mound against it; pitch camps against it, and bring up battering rams round about it.
Transliteration: venatatah aleyha matsvor uvaniyta aleyha daeik veshafakheta aleyha solelah venatatah aleyha machanvot veshiym-aleyha khariym saviyv

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה קַח־לְךָ֙ מַחֲבַ֣ת בַּרְזֶ֔ל וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אוֹתָהּ֙ קִ֣יר בַּרְזֶ֔ל בֵּינְךָ֖ וּבֵ֣ין הָעִ֑יר וַהֲכִינֹתָה֩ אֶת־פָּנֶ֨יךָ אֵלֶ֜יהָ וְהָיְתָ֤ה בַמָּצוֹר֙ וְצַרְתָּ֣ עָלֶ֔יהָ א֥וֹת הִ֖יא לְבֵ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Then take an iron plate and place it as an iron wall between yourself and the city, and set your face against it. Thus it shall be under siege, you shall besiege it. This shall be an omen for the House of Israel.
Transliteration: veatah kach-lekha machavat varezel venatatah votah kiyr varezel veynekha uveyn haiyr vahakhiynotah et-faneykha eleyha vehayetah vamatsvor vetsareta aleyha vot hiy leveyt yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה שְׁכַב֙ עַל־צִדְּךָ֣ הַשְּׂמָאלִ֔י וְשַׂמְתָּ֛ אֶת־עֲוֺ֥ן בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עָלָ֑יו מִסְפַּ֤ר הַיָּמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁכַּ֣ב עָלָ֔יו תִּשָּׂ֖א אֶת־עֲוֺנָֽם׃
Translated: “Then lie on your left side, and let it bear the punishment of the House of Israel; for as many days as you lie on it you shall bear their punishment.
Transliteration: veatah shekhav al-tsidekha hashemaliy veshameta et-avon veyt-yisherael alayv misefar hayamiym asher tishekhav alayv tisha et-avonam

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י נָתַ֤תִּֽי לְךָ֙ אֶת־שְׁנֵ֣י עֲוֺנָ֔ם לְמִסְפַּ֣ר יָמִ֔ים שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת וְתִשְׁעִ֖ים י֑וֹם וְנָשָׂ֖אתָ עֲוֺ֥ן בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For I impose upon you three hundred and ninety days, corresponding to the number of the years of their punishment; and so you shall bear the punishment for the House of Israel.
Transliteration: vaaniy natatiy lekha et-sheney avonam lemisefar yamiym shelosh-mevot vetisheiym yvom venashata avon veyt-yisherael

Hebrew: וְכִלִּיתָ֣ אֶת־אֵ֗לֶּה וְשָׁ֨כַבְתָּ֜ עַֽל־צִדְּךָ֤ (הימיני) [הַיְמָנִי֙] שֵׁנִ֔ית וְנָשָׂ֖אתָ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן בֵּית־יְהוּדָ֑ה אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם י֧וֹם לַשָּׁנָ֛ה י֥וֹם לַשָּׁנָ֖ה נְתַתִּ֥יו לָֽךְ׃
Translated: When you have completed these, you shall lie another forty days on your right side, and bear the punishment of the House of Judah. I impose on you one day for each year.
Transliteration: vekhiliyta et-eleh veshakhaveta al-tsidekha (hymyny) [hayemaniy] sheniyt venashata et-avon veyt-yehudah arevaiym yvom yvom lashanah yvom lashanah netatiyv lakhe

Hebrew: וְאֶל־מְצ֤וֹר יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ תָּכִ֣ין פָּנֶ֔יךָ וּֽזְרֹעֲךָ֖ חֲשׂוּפָ֑ה וְנִבֵּאתָ֖ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: “Then, with bared arm, set your face toward besieged Jerusalem and prophesy against it.
Transliteration: veel-metsvor yerushala͏im takhiyn faneykha uzeroakha chashufah veniveta aleyha

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֛ה נָתַ֥תִּי עָלֶ֖יךָ עֲבוֹתִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־תֵהָפֵ֤ךְ מִֽצִּדְּךָ֙ אֶל־צִדֶּ֔ךָ עַד־כַּלּוֹתְךָ֖ יְמֵ֥י מְצוּרֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Now I put cords upon you, so that you cannot turn from side to side until you complete your days of siege.
Transliteration: vehineh natatiy aleykha avvotiym velo-tehafekhe mitsidekha el-tsidekha ad-khalvotekha yemey metsurekha

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֡ חִטִּ֡ין וּ֠שְׂעֹרִ֠ים וּפ֨וֹל וַעֲדָשִׁ֜ים וְדֹ֣חַן וְכֻסְּמִ֗ים וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אוֹתָם֙ בִּכְלִ֣י אֶחָ֔ד וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ אוֹתָ֛ם לְךָ֖ לְלָ֑חֶם מִסְפַּ֨ר הַיָּמִ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֣ה ׀ שׁוֹכֵ֣ב עַֽל־צִדְּךָ֗ שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֧וֹת וְתִשְׁעִ֛ים י֖וֹם תֹּאכְלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: “Further, take wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and emmer. Put them into one vessel and bake them into bread. Eat it as many days as you lie on your side: three hundred and ninety.
Transliteration: veatah kach-lekha chitiyn usheoriym ufvol vaadashiym vedochan vekhusemiym venatatah votam vikheliy echad veashiyta votam lekha lelachem misefar hayamiym asher-atah shvokhev al-tsidekha shelosh-mevot vetisheiym yvom tokhelenu

Hebrew: וּמַאֲכָֽלְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֹּאכְלֶ֔נּוּ בְּמִשְׁק֕וֹל עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שֶׁ֖קֶל לַיּ֑וֹם מֵעֵ֥ת עַד־עֵ֖ת תֹּאכְלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: The food that you eat shall be by weight, twenty shekels a day; this you shall eat in the space of a day.
Transliteration: umaakhalekha asher tokhelenu vemishekvol esheriym shekel layyvom meet ad-et tokhelenu

Hebrew: וּמַ֛יִם בִּמְשׂוּרָ֥ה תִשְׁתֶּ֖ה שִׁשִּׁ֣ית הַהִ֑ין מֵעֵ֥ת עַד־עֵ֖ת תִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated: And you shall drink water by measure; drink a sixth of a hin in the space of a day.
Transliteration: umayiim vimeshurah tisheteh shishiyt hahiyn meet ad-et tisheteh

Hebrew: וְעֻגַ֥ת שְׂעֹרִ֖ים תֹּאכְלֶ֑נָּה וְהִ֗יא בְּגֶֽלְלֵי֙ צֵאַ֣ת הָֽאָדָ֔ם תְּעֻגֶ֖נָה לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: “Eat it as a barley cake; you shall bake it on human excrement before their eyes.
Transliteration: veugat sheoriym tokhelenah vehiy vegeleley tseat haadam teugenah leeyneyhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה כָּ֣כָה יֹאכְל֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־לַחְמָ֖ם טָמֵ֑א בַּגּוֹיִ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַדִּיחֵ֖ם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: So,” said G<small>OD</small>, “shall the people of Israel eat their bread, impure, among the nations to which I will banish them.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah khakhah yokhelu veney-yisherael et-lachemam tame vagvoyim asher adiychem sham

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר אֲהָהּ֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנֵּ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י לֹ֣א מְטֻמָּאָ֑ה וּנְבֵלָ֨ה וּטְרֵפָ֤ה לֹא־אָכַ֙לְתִּי֙ מִנְּעוּרַ֣י וְעַד־עַ֔תָּה וְלֹא־בָ֥א בְּפִ֖י בְּשַׂ֥ר פִּגּֽוּל׃ {ס}
Translated: Then I said, “Ah, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, my person was never defiled; nor have I eaten anything that died of itself or was torn by beasts from my youth until now, nor has foul flesh entered my mouth.”
Transliteration: vaomar ahah adonay yehovih hineh nafeshiy lo metumaah unevelah uterefah lo-akhaletiy mineuray vead-atah velo-va vefiy veshar figul {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י רְאֵ֗ה נָתַ֤תִּֽי לְךָ֙ אֶת־[צְפִיעֵ֣י] (צפועי) הַבָּקָ֔ר תַּ֖חַת גֶּלְלֵ֣י הָאָדָ֑ם וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶֽת־לַחְמְךָ֖ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: The answer came: “See, I allow you cow’s dung instead of human excrement; prepare your bread on that.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay reeh natatiy lekha et-[tsefiyey] (tsfvy) havakar tachat geleley haadam veashiyta et-lachemekha aleyhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י בֶּן־אָדָם֙ הִנְנִ֨י שֹׁבֵ֤ר מַטֵּֽה־לֶ֙חֶם֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְאָכְלוּ־לֶ֥חֶם בְּמִשְׁקָ֖ל וּבִדְאָגָ֑ה וּמַ֕יִם בִּמְשׂוּרָ֥ה וּבְשִׁמָּמ֖וֹן יִשְׁתּֽוּ׃
Translated: And I was told, “O mortal, I am going to break the staff of bread in Jerusalem, and they shall eat bread by weight, in anxiety, and drink water by measure, in horror,
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam hineniy shover mateh-lechem viyrushala͏im veakhelu-lechem vemishekal uvideagah umayiim vimeshurah uveshimamvon yishetu

Hebrew: לְמַ֥עַן יַחְסְר֖וּ לֶ֣חֶם וָמָ֑יִם וְנָשַׁ֙מּוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ וְאָחִ֔יו וְנָמַ֖קּוּ בַּעֲוֺנָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: so that, lacking bread and water, they shall stare at each other, heartsick over their iniquity.
Transliteration: lemaan yacheseru lechem vamayiim venashamu iysh veachiyv venamaku vaavonam {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֨ה בֶן־אָדָ֜ם קַח־לְךָ֣ ׀ חֶ֣רֶב חַדָּ֗ה תַּ֤עַר הַגַּלָּבִים֙ תִּקָּחֶ֣נָּה לָּ֔ךְ וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ֥ עַל־רֹאשְׁךָ֖ וְעַל־זְקָנֶ֑ךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ לְךָ֛ מֹאזְנֵ֥י מִשְׁקָ֖ל וְחִלַּקְתָּֽם׃
Translated: “And you, O mortal, take a sharp knife; use it as a barber’s razor and pass it over your head and beard. Then take scales and divide the hair.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam kach-lekha cherev chadah taar hagalaviym tikachenah lakhe vehaavareta al-roshekha veal-zekanekha velakacheta lekha mozeney mishekal vechilaketam

Hebrew: שְׁלִשִׁ֗ית בָּא֤וּר תַּבְעִיר֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֔יר כִּמְלֹ֖את יְמֵ֣י הַמָּצ֑וֹר וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֗ית תַּכֶּ֤ה בַחֶ֙רֶב֙ סְבִ֣יבוֹתֶ֔יהָ וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁית֙ תִּזְרֶ֣ה לָר֔וּחַ וְחֶ֖רֶב אָרִ֥יק אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When the days of siege are completed, destroy a third part in fire in the city, take a third and strike it with the sword all around the city, and scatter a third to the wind and unsheathe a sword after them.
Transliteration: shelishiyt vaur taveiyr vetvokhe haiyr khimelot yemey hamatsvor velakacheta et-hashelishiyt takheh vacherev seviyvvoteyha vehashelishiyt tizereh larucha vecherev ariyk achareyhem

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ מִשָּׁ֖ם מְעַ֣ט בְּמִסְפָּ֑ר וְצַרְתָּ֥ אוֹתָ֖ם בִּכְנָפֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: “Take also a few [hairs] from there and tie them up in your skirts.
Transliteration: velakacheta misham meat vemisefar vetsareta votam vikhenafeykha

Hebrew: וּמֵהֶם֙ ע֣וֹד תִּקָּ֔ח וְהִשְׁלַכְתָּ֤ אוֹתָם֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ הָאֵ֔שׁ וְשָׂרַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בָּאֵ֑שׁ מִמֶּ֥נּוּ תֵֽצֵא־אֵ֖שׁ אֶל־כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: And take some more of them and cast them into the fire, and burn them in the fire. From this a fire shall go out upon the whole House of Israel.”
Transliteration: umehem vod tikach vehishelakheta votam el-tvokhe haesh vesharafeta otam vaesh mimenu tetse-esh el-khׇl-veyt yisherael {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה זֹ֚את יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בְּת֥וֹךְ הַגּוֹיִ֖ם שַׂמְתִּ֑יהָ וּסְבִיבוֹתֶ֖יהָ אֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I set this Jerusalem in the midst of nations, with countries round about her.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih zot yerushala͏im vetvokhe hagvoyim shametiyha useviyvvoteyha aratsvot

Hebrew: וַתֶּ֨מֶר אֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֤י לְרִשְׁעָה֙ מִן־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְאֶ֨ת־חֻקּוֹתַ֔י מִן־הָאֲרָצ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר סְבִיבוֹתֶ֑יהָ כִּ֤י בְמִשְׁפָּטַי֙ מָאָ֔סוּ וְחֻקּוֹתַ֖י לֹא־הָלְכ֥וּ בָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: But she rebelled against My rules and My laws, acting more wickedly than the nations and the countries round about her; she rejected My rules and disobeyed My laws.
Transliteration: vatemer et-mishefatay lerisheah min-hagvoyim veet-chukvotay min-haaratsvot asher seviyvvoteyha khiy vemishefatay maasu vechukvotay lo-halekhu vahem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה יַ֤עַן הֲמׇנְכֶם֙ מִן־הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר סְבִיבוֹתֵיכֶ֔ם בְּחֻקּוֹתַי֙ לֹ֣א הֲלַכְתֶּ֔ם וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֖י לֹ֣א עֲשִׂיתֶ֑ם וּֽכְמִשְׁפְּטֵ֧י הַגּוֹיִ֛ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר סְבִיבוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם לֹ֥א עֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because you have outdone the nations that are round about you—you have not obeyed My laws or followed My rules, nor have you even observed the rules of the nations round about you—
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih yaan hamׇnekhem min-hagvoyim asher seviyvvoteykhem vechukvotay lo halakhetem veet-mishefatay lo ashiytem ukhemishefetey hagvoyim asher seviyvvoteykhem lo ashiytem

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י עָלַ֖יִךְ גַּם־אָ֑נִי וְעָשִׂ֧יתִי בְתוֹכֵ֛ךְ מִשְׁפָּטִ֖ים לְעֵינֵ֥י הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I, in turn, am going to deal with you, and I will execute judgments in your midst in the sight of the nations.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy alayiikhe gam-aniy veashiytiy vetvokhekhe mishefatiym leeyney hagvoyim

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתִי בָ֗ךְ אֵ֚ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־עָשִׂ֔יתִי וְאֵ֛ת אֲשֶֽׁר־לֹא־אֶעֱשֶׂ֥ה כָמֹ֖הוּ ע֑וֹד יַ֖עַן כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבֹתָֽיִךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: On account of all your abominations, I will do among you what I have never done, and the like of which I will never do again.
Transliteration: veashiytiy vakhe et asher lo-ashiytiy veet asher-lo-eesheh khamohu vod yaan khׇl-tvoavotayiikhe {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן אָב֞וֹת יֹאכְל֤וּ בָנִים֙ בְּתוֹכֵ֔ךְ וּבָנִ֖ים יֹאכְל֣וּ אֲבוֹתָ֑ם וְעָשִׂ֤יתִי בָךְ֙ שְׁפָטִ֔ים וְזֵרִיתִ֥י אֶת־כׇּל־שְׁאֵרִיתֵ֖ךְ לְכׇל־רֽוּחַ׃ {ס}
Translated: Assuredly, parents shall eat their children in your midst, and children shall eat their parents. I will execute judgments against you, and I will scatter all your survivors in every direction.
Transliteration: lakhen avvot yokhelu vaniym vetvokhekhe uvaniym yokhelu avvotam veashiytiy vakhe shefatiym vezeriytiy et-khׇl-sheeriytekhe lekhׇl-rucha {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ אִם־לֹ֗א יַ֚עַן אֶת־מִקְדָּשִׁ֣י טִמֵּ֔את בְּכׇל־שִׁקּוּצַ֖יִךְ וּבְכׇל־תּוֹעֲבֹתָ֑יִךְ וְגַם־אֲנִ֤י אֶגְרַע֙ וְלֹא־תָח֣וֹס עֵינִ֔י וְגַם־אֲנִ֖י לֹ֥א אֶחְמֽוֹל׃
Translated: Assuredly, as I live—said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—because you defiled My Sanctuary with all your detestable things and all your abominations, I in turn will shear [you] away and show no pity. I in turn will show no compassion:
Transliteration: lakhen chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-lo yaan et-mikedashiy timet vekhׇl-shikutsayiikhe uvekhׇl-tvoavotayiikhe vegam-aniy egera velo-tachvos eyniy vegam-aniy lo echemvol

Hebrew: שְׁלִשִׁתֵ֞יךְ בַּדֶּ֣בֶר יָמ֗וּתוּ וּבָֽרָעָב֙ יִכְל֣וּ בְתוֹכֵ֔ךְ וְהַ֨שְּׁלִשִׁ֔ית בַּחֶ֖רֶב יִפְּל֣וּ סְבִיבוֹתָ֑יִךְ וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁית֙ לְכׇל־ר֣וּחַ אֱזָרֶ֔ה וְחֶ֖רֶב אָרִ֥יק אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: One-third of you shall die of pestilence or perish in your midst by famine, one-third shall fall by the sword around you, and I will scatter one-third in every direction and will unsheathe the sword after them.
Transliteration: shelishiteykhe vadever yamutu uvaraav yikhelu vetvokhekhe vehashelishiyt vacherev yifelu seviyvvotayiikhe vehasheliyshiyt lekhׇl-rucha ezareh vecherev ariyk achareyhem

Hebrew: וְכָלָ֣ה אַפִּ֗י וַהֲנִחוֹתִ֧י חֲמָתִ֛י בָּ֖ם וְהִנֶּחָ֑מְתִּי וְֽיָדְע֞וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה דִּבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ בְּקִנְאָתִ֔י בְּכַלּוֹתִ֥י חֲמָתִ֖י בָּֽם׃
Translated: I will vent all My anger and satisfy My fury upon them; and when I vent all My fury upon them, they shall know that I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken in My passion.
Transliteration: vekhalah afiy vahanichvotiy chamatiy vam vehinechametiy veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah divaretiy vekineatiy vekhalvotiy chamatiy vam

Hebrew: וְאֶתְּנֵךְ֙ לְחׇרְבָּ֣ה וּלְחֶרְפָּ֔ה בַּגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר סְבִיבוֹתָ֑יִךְ לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־עוֹבֵֽר׃
Translated: I will make you a ruin and a mockery among the nations round about you, in the sight of every passerby.
Transliteration: veetenekhe lechׇrevah ulecherefah vagvoyim asher seviyvvotayiikhe leeyney khׇl-vover

Hebrew: וְֽהָ֨יְתָ֜ה חֶרְפָּ֤ה וּגְדוּפָה֙ מוּסָ֣ר וּמְשַׁמָּ֔ה לַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר סְבִיבוֹתָ֑יִךְ בַּעֲשׂ֩וֹתִי֩ בָ֨ךְ שְׁפָטִ֜ים בְּאַ֤ף וּבְחֵמָה֙ וּבְתֹכְח֣וֹת חֵמָ֔ה אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּֽרְתִּי׃
Translated: And when I execute judgment upon you in anger and rage and furious chastisement, you shall be a mockery and a derision, a warning and a horror, to the nations round about you: I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken.
Transliteration: vehayetah cherefah ugedufah musar umeshamah lagvoyim asher seviyvvotayiikhe vaashvotiy vakhe shefatiym veaf uvechemah uvetokhechvot chemah aniy yehovah divaretiy

Hebrew: בְּֽשַׁלְּחִ֡י אֶת־חִצֵּי֩ הָרָעָ֨ב הָרָעִ֤ים בָּהֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָי֣וּ לְמַשְׁחִ֔ית אֲשֶׁר־אֲשַׁלַּ֥ח אוֹתָ֖ם לְשַׁחֶתְכֶ֑ם וְרָעָב֙ אֹסֵ֣ף עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְשָׁבַרְתִּ֥י לָכֶ֖ם מַטֵּה־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: When I loose the deadly arrows of famine against those doomed to destruction, when I loose them against you to destroy you, I will heap more famine upon you and break your staff of bread.
Transliteration: veshalechiy et-chitsey haraav haraiym vahem asher hayu lemashechiyt asher-ashalach votam leshachetekhem veraav osef aleykhem veshavaretiy lakhem mateh-lachem

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּחְתִּ֣י עֲ֠לֵיכֶ֠ם רָעָ֞ב וְחַיָּ֤ה רָעָה֙ וְשִׁכְּלֻ֔ךְ וְדֶ֥בֶר וָדָ֖ם יַעֲבׇר־בָּ֑ךְ וְחֶ֙רֶב֙ אָבִ֣יא עָלַ֔יִךְ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּֽרְתִּי׃ {פ}
Translated: I will let loose against you famine and wild beasts and they shall bereave you; pestilence and bloodshed shall sweep through you, and I will bring the sword upon you. I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy aleykhem raav vechayah raah veshikhelukhe vedever vadam yaavׇr-vakhe vecherev aviy alayiikhe aniy yehovah divaretiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם שִׂ֥ים פָּנֶ֖יךָ אֶל־הָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהִנָּבֵ֖א אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: O mortal, turn your face toward the mountains of Israel and prophesy to them
Transliteration: ven-adam shiym faneykha el-harey yisherael vehinave aleyhem

Hebrew: וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ הָרֵי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱ֠הֹוִ֠ה לֶהָרִ֨ים וְלַגְּבָע֜וֹת לָאֲפִיקִ֣ים (ולגיאות) [וְלַגֵּיאָי֗וֹת] הִנְנִ֨י אֲנִ֜י מֵבִ֤יא עֲלֵיכֶם֙ חֶ֔רֶב וְאִבַּדְתִּ֖י בָּמוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: and say: O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>. Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> to the mountains and the hills, to the streams and the valleys: See, I will bring a sword against you and destroy your shrines.
Transliteration: veamareta harey yisherael shimeu devar-adonay yehovih khoh-amar adonay yehovih lehariym velagevavot laafiykiym (vlgyvt) [velageyayvot] hineniy aniy meviy aleykhem cherev veivadetiy vamvoteykhem

Hebrew: וְנָשַׁ֙מּוּ֙ מִזְבְּח֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם וְנִשְׁבְּר֖וּ חַמָּנֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִפַּלְתִּי֙ חַלְלֵיכֶ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י גִּלּוּלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Your altars shall be wrecked and your incense stands smashed, and I will hurl down your slain in front of your fetishes.
Transliteration: venashamu mizevechvoteykhem venisheveru chamaneykhem vehifaletiy chaleleykhem lifeney giluleykhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֗י אֶת־פִּגְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִפְנֵ֖י גִּלּוּלֵיהֶ֑ם וְזֵרִיתִי֙ אֶת־עַצְמ֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם סְבִיב֖וֹת מִזְבְּחוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will cast the corpses of the people of Israel in front of their fetishes, and scatter your bones around your altars
Transliteration: venatatiy et-figerey veney yisherael lifeney giluleyhem vezeriytiy et-atsemvoteykhem seviyvvot mizevechvoteykhem

Hebrew: בְּכֹל֙ מוֹשְׁב֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם הֶעָרִ֣ים תֶּחֱרַ֔בְנָה וְהַבָּמ֖וֹת תִּישָׁ֑מְנָה לְמַ֩עַן֩ יֶחֶרְב֨וּ וְיֶאְשְׁמ֜וּ מִזְבְּחֽוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם וְנִשְׁבְּר֤וּ וְנִשְׁבְּתוּ֙ גִּלּ֣וּלֵיכֶ֔ם וְנִגְדְּעוּ֙ חַמָּ֣נֵיכֶ֔ם וְנִמְח֖וּ מַעֲשֵׂיכֶֽם׃
Translated: in all your settlements. The towns shall be laid waste and the shrines shall be devastated. Thus your altars shall be laid waste and bear their punishment; your fetishes shall be smashed and annihilated, your incense stands cut down, and your handiwork wiped out;
Transliteration: vekhol mvoshevvoteykhem heariym techeravenah vehavamvot tiyshamenah lemaan yecherevu veyeeshemu mizevechvoteykhem venisheveru venishevetu giluleykhem venigedeu chamaneykhem venimechu maasheykhem

Hebrew: וְנָפַ֥ל חָלָ֖ל בְּתוֹכְכֶ֑ם וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and the slain shall fall in your midst. Then you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venafal chalal vetvokhekhem viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְהוֹתַרְתִּ֗י בִּהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֛ם פְּלִ֥יטֵי חֶ֖רֶב בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם בְּהִזָּרוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם בָּאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: Yet I will leave a remnant, in that some of you shall escape the sword among the nations and be scattered through the lands.
Transliteration: vehvotaretiy viheyvot lakhem feliytey cherev vagvoyim vehizarvoteykhem vaaratsvot

Hebrew: וְזָכְר֨וּ פְלִיטֵיכֶ֜ם אוֹתִ֗י בַּגּוֹיִם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁבּוּ־שָׁם֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֜רְתִּי אֶת־לִבָּ֣ם הַזּוֹנֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁר־סָר֙ מֵֽעָלַ֔י וְאֵת֙ עֵֽינֵיהֶ֔ם הַזֹּנ֕וֹת אַחֲרֵ֖י גִּלּוּלֵיהֶ֑ם וְנָקֹ֙טּוּ֙ בִּפְנֵיהֶ֔ם אֶל־הָֽרָעוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂ֔וּ לְכֹ֖ל תּוֹעֲבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And those of you that escape will remember Me among the nations where they have been taken captive, how I was brokenhearted through their faithless hearts that turned away from Me, and through their eyes that lusted after their fetishes. And they shall loathe themselves for all the evil they committed and for all their abominable deeds.
Transliteration: vezakheru feliyteykhem votiy vagvoyim asher nishevu-sham asher nishevaretiy et-livam hazvoneh asher-sar mealay veet eyneyhem hazonvot acharey giluleyhem venakotu vifeneyhem el-haravot asher ashu lekhol tvoavoteyhem

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֤א אֶל־חִנָּם֙ דִּבַּ֔רְתִּי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לָהֶ֖ם הָרָעָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃ {פ}
Translated: Then they shall realize it was not without cause that I, G<small>OD</small>, resolved to bring this evil upon them.
Transliteration: veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah lo el-chinam divaretiy laashvot lahem haraah hazot {f}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הַכֵּ֨ה בְכַפְּךָ֜ וּרְקַ֤ע בְּרַגְלְךָ֙ וֶאֱמׇר־אָ֔ח אֶ֛ל כׇּל־תּוֹעֲב֥וֹת רָע֖וֹת בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֗ר בַּחֶ֛רֶב בָּרָעָ֥ב וּבַדֶּ֖בֶר יִפֹּֽלוּ׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Strike your hands together and stamp your feet and cry: Aha! over all the vile abominations of the House of Israel who shall fall by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih hakheh vekhafekha ureka veragelekha veemׇr-ach el khׇl-tvoavvot ravot veyt yisherael asher vacherev varaav uvadever yifolu

Hebrew: הָרָח֞וֹק בַּדֶּ֣בֶר יָמ֗וּת וְהַקָּרוֹב֙ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפּ֔וֹל וְהַנִּשְׁאָר֙ וְהַנָּצ֔וּר בָּרָעָ֖ב יָמ֑וּת וְכִלֵּיתִ֥י חֲמָתִ֖י בָּֽם׃
Translated: Those who are far away shall die of pestilence, and those who are nearby shall fall by the sword, and anyone who survives and is protected shall die of famine. Thus I will spend My fury upon them.
Transliteration: harachvok vadever yamut vehakarvov vacherev yifvol vehanishear vehanatsur varaav yamut vekhileytiy chamatiy vam

Hebrew: וִֽידַעְתֶּם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּֽהְי֣וֹת חַלְלֵיהֶ֗ם בְּתוֹךְ֙ גִּלּ֣וּלֵיהֶ֔ם סְבִיב֖וֹת מִזְבְּחוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם אֶל֩ כׇּל־גִּבְעָ֨ה רָמָ֜ה בְּכֹ֣ל ׀ רָאשֵׁ֣י הֶהָרִ֗ים וְתַ֨חַת כׇּל־עֵ֤ץ רַֽעֲנָן֙ וְתַ֙חַת֙ כׇּל־אֵלָ֣ה עֲבֻתָּ֔ה מְק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָֽתְנוּ־שָׁם֙ רֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ לְכֹ֖ל גִּלּוּלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>, when your slain lie among the fetishes round about their altars, on every high hill, on all the mountaintops, under every green tree, and under every leafy oak—wherever they presented pleasing odors to all their fetishes.
Transliteration: viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah viheyvot chaleleyhem vetvokhe giluleyhem seviyvvot mizevechvoteyhem el khׇl-giveah ramah vekhol rashey hehariym vetachat khׇl-ets raanan vetachat khׇl-elah avutah mekvom asher natenu-sham reycha niychocha lekhol giluleyhem

Hebrew: וְנָטִ֤יתִי אֶת־יָדִי֙ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וְנָתַתִּ֨י אֶת־הָאָ֜רֶץ שְׁמָמָ֤ה וּמְשַׁמָּה֙ מִמִּדְבַּ֣ר דִּבְלָ֔תָה בְּכֹ֖ל מוֹשְׁבֽוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will stretch out My hand against them, and lay the land waste and desolate in all their settlements, from the wilderness as far as Diblah; then they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venatiytiy et-yadiy aleyhem venatatiy et-haarets shemamah umeshamah mimidevar divelatah vekhol mvoshevvoteyhem veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֧י יֱהֹוִ֛ה לְאַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל קֵ֑ץ בָּ֣א הַקֵּ֔ץ עַל־[אַרְבַּ֖ע] (ארבעת) כַּנְפ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: You, O mortal, [say:] Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> to the land of Israel: Doom! Doom is coming upon the four corners of the land.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam khoh-amar adonay yehovih leademat yisherael kets va hakets al-[areva] (rvt) khanefvot haarets

Hebrew: עַתָּה֙ הַקֵּ֣ץ עָלַ֔יִךְ וְשִׁלַּחְתִּ֤י אַפִּי֙ בָּ֔ךְ וּשְׁפַטְתִּ֖יךְ כִּדְרָכָ֑יִךְ וְנָתַתִּ֣י עָלַ֔יִךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבוֹתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Now doom is upon you! I will let loose My anger against you and judge you according to your ways; I will requite you for all your abominations.
Transliteration: atah hakets alayiikhe veshilachetiy afiy vakhe ushefatetiykhe khiderakhayiikhe venatatiy alayiikhe et khׇl-tvoavvotayiikhe

Hebrew: וְלֹא־תָח֥וֹס עֵינִ֛י עָלַ֖יִךְ וְלֹ֣א אֶחְמ֑וֹל כִּ֣י דְרָכַ֜יִךְ עָלַ֣יִךְ אֶתֵּ֗ן וְתוֹעֲבוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ בְּתוֹכֵ֣ךְ תִּֽהְיֶ֔יןָ וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will show you no pity and no compassion; but I will requite you for your ways and for the abominations in your midst. And you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velo-tachvos eyniy alayiikhe velo echemvol khiy derakhayiikhe alayiikhe eten vetvoavvotayiikhe vetvokhekhe tiheyeyna viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה רָעָ֛ה אַחַ֥ת רָעָ֖ה הִנֵּ֥ה בָאָֽה׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: A singular disaster; a disaster is coming.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih raah achat raah hineh vaah

Hebrew: קֵ֣ץ בָּ֔א בָּ֥א הַקֵּ֖ץ הֵקִ֣יץ אֵלָ֑יִךְ הִנֵּ֖ה בָּאָֽה׃
Translated: Doom is coming! The hour of doom is coming! It stirs against you; there it comes!
Transliteration: kets va va hakets hekiyts elayiikhe hineh vaah

Hebrew: בָּ֧אָה הַצְּפִירָ֛ה אֵלֶ֖יךָ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֑רֶץ בָּ֣א הָעֵ֗ת קָר֛וֹב הַיּ֥וֹם מְהוּמָ֖ה וְלֹא־הֵ֥ד הָרִֽים׃
Translated: The cycle has come around for you, O inhabitants of the land; the time has come; the day is near. There is panic on the mountains, not joy.
Transliteration: vaah hatsefiyrah eleykha yvoshev haarets va haet karvov hayyvom mehumah velo-hed hariym

Hebrew: עַתָּ֣ה מִקָּר֗וֹב אֶשְׁפּ֤וֹךְ חֲמָתִי֙ עָלַ֔יִךְ וְכִלֵּיתִ֤י אַפִּי֙ בָּ֔ךְ וּשְׁפַטְתִּ֖יךְ כִּדְרָכָ֑יִךְ וְנָתַתִּ֣י עָלַ֔יִךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבוֹתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Very soon I will pour out My wrath upon you and spend My anger on you; I will judge you according to your ways, and I will requite you for all your abominations.
Transliteration: atah mikarvov eshefvokhe chamatiy alayiikhe vekhileytiy afiy vakhe ushefatetiykhe khiderakhayiikhe venatatiy alayiikhe et khׇl-tvoavvotayiikhe

Hebrew: וְלֹא־תָח֥וֹס עֵינִ֖י וְלֹ֣א אֶחְמ֑וֹל כִּדְרָכַ֜יִךְ עָלַ֣יִךְ אֶתֵּ֗ן וְתוֹעֲבוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ בְּתוֹכֵ֣ךְ תִּהְיֶ֔יןָ וִידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מַכֶּֽה׃
Translated: I will show you no pity and no compassion; but I will requite you for your ways, and for the abominations in your midst. And you shall know it was I, G<small>OD</small>, who punished.
Transliteration: velo-tachvos eyniy velo echemvol khiderakhayiikhe alayiikhe eten vetvoavvotayiikhe vetvokhekhe tiheyeyna viydaetem khiy aniy yehovah makheh

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה הַיּ֖וֹם הִנֵּ֣ה בָאָ֑ה יָֽצְאָה֙ הַצְּפִרָ֔ה צָ֚ץ הַמַּטֶּ֔ה פָּרַ֖ח הַזָּדֽוֹן׃
Translated: Here is the day! See, the cycle has come round; it has appeared. The rod has blossomed; arrogance has budded,
Transliteration: hineh hayyvom hineh vaah yatseah hatsefirah tsats hamateh farach hazadvon

Hebrew: הֶחָמָ֥ס <small>׀</small> קָ֖ם לְמַטֵּה־רֶ֑שַׁע לֹא־מֵהֶ֞ם וְלֹ֧א מֵהֲמוֹנָ֛ם וְלֹ֥א מֶהֱמֵהֶ֖ם וְלֹא־נֹ֥הַּ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: lawlessness has grown into a rod of wickedness. Nothing comes of them, nor of their abundance, nor of their wealth; nor is there preeminence among them.
Transliteration: hechamas <small></small> kam lemateh-resha lo-mehem velo mehamvonam velo mehemehem velo-noha vahem

Hebrew: בָּ֤א הָעֵת֙ הִגִּ֣יעַ הַיּ֔וֹם הַקּוֹנֶה֙ אַל־יִשְׂמָ֔ח וְהַמֹּכֵ֖ר אַל־יִתְאַבָּ֑ל כִּ֥י חָר֖וֹן אֶל־כׇּל־הֲמוֹנָֽהּ׃
Translated: The time has come, the day has arrived. Let not the buyer rejoice nor the seller mourn—for divine wrath shall overtake all Jerusalem’s multitude.
Transliteration: va haet higiya hayyvom hakvoneh al-yishemach vehamokher al-yiteaval khiy charvon el-khׇl-hamvonah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הַמֹּכֵ֗ר אֶל־הַמִּמְכָּר֙ לֹ֣א יָשׁ֔וּב וְע֥וֹד בַּחַיִּ֖ים חַיָּתָ֑ם כִּֽי־חָז֤וֹן אֶל־כׇּל־הֲמוֹנָהּ֙ לֹ֣א יָשׁ֔וּב וְאִ֧ישׁ בַּעֲוֺנ֛וֹ חַיָּת֖וֹ לֹ֥א יִתְחַזָּֽקוּ׃
Translated: For the seller shall not return to what was sold so long as both parties remain among the living. For the vision concerns all her multitude, it shall not be revoked. And because of their own guilt, none shall hold fast to their life.
Transliteration: khiy hamokher el-hamimekhar lo yashuv vevod vachayiym chayatam khiy-chazvon el-khׇl-hamvonah lo yashuv veiysh vaavonvo chayatvo lo yitechazaku

Hebrew: תָּקְע֤וּ בַתָּק֙וֹעַ֙ וְהָכִ֣ין הַכֹּ֔ל וְאֵ֥ין הֹלֵ֖ךְ לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה כִּ֥י חֲרוֹנִ֖י אֶל־כׇּל־הֲמוֹנָֽהּ׃
Translated: They have sounded the horn, and all is prepared; but no one goes to battle, for My wrath is directed against all her multitude.
Transliteration: takeu vatakvoa vehakhiyn hakhol veeyn holekhe lamilechamah khiy charvoniy el-khׇl-hamvonah

Hebrew: הַחֶ֣רֶב בַּח֔וּץ וְהַדֶּ֥בֶר וְהָרָעָ֖ב מִבָּ֑יִת אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּשָּׂדֶה֙ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יָמ֔וּת וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּעִ֔יר רָעָ֥ב וָדֶ֖בֶר יֹאכְלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: The sword is outside and pestilence and famine are inside; those in the field shall die by the sword, those in the town shall be devoured by famine and pestilence.
Transliteration: hacherev vachuts vehadever veharaav mivayiit asher vashadeh vacherev yamut vaasher vaiyr raav vadever yokhelenu

Hebrew: וּפָֽלְטוּ֙ פְּלִ֣יטֵיהֶ֔ם וְהָי֣וּ אֶל־הֶהָרִ֗ים כְּיוֹנֵ֧י הַגֵּאָי֛וֹת כֻּלָּ֖ם הֹמ֑וֹת אִ֖ישׁ בַּעֲוֺנֽוֹ׃
Translated: And if any survive, they shall take to the mountains; they shall be like doves of the valley, moaning together—everyone for their own iniquity.
Transliteration: ufaletu feliyteyhem vehayu el-hehariym kheyvoney hageayvot khulam homvot iysh vaavonvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַיָּדַ֖יִם תִּרְפֶּ֑ינָה וְכׇל־בִּרְכַּ֖יִם תֵּלַ֥כְנָה מָּֽיִם׃
Translated: All hands shall grow weak, and all knees shall turn to water.
Transliteration: khׇl-hayadayiim tirefeynah vekhׇl-virekhayiim telakhenah mayiim

Hebrew: וְחָגְר֣וּ שַׂקִּ֔ים וְכִסְּתָ֥ה אוֹתָ֖ם פַּלָּצ֑וּת וְאֶ֤ל כׇּל־פָּנִים֙ בּוּשָׁ֔ה וּבְכׇל־רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם קׇרְחָֽה׃
Translated: They shall gird on sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; every face shall betray shame, and every head shall be made bald.
Transliteration: vechageru shakiym vekhisetah votam falatsut veel khׇl-faniym vushah uvekhׇl-rasheyhem kׇrechah

Hebrew: כַּסְפָּ֞ם בַּחוּצ֣וֹת יַשְׁלִ֗יכוּ וּזְהָבָם֮ לְנִדָּ֣ה יִֽהְיֶה֒ כַּסְפָּ֨ם וּזְהָבָ֜ם לֹא־יוּכַ֣ל לְהַצִּילָ֗ם בְּיוֹם֙ עֶבְרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה נַפְשָׁם֙ לֹ֣א יְשַׂבֵּ֔עוּ וּמֵעֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֣א יְמַלֵּ֑אוּ כִּֽי־מִכְשׁ֥וֹל עֲוֺנָ֖ם הָיָֽה׃
Translated: They shall throw their silver into the streets, and their gold shall be treated as something unclean. Their silver and gold shall not avail to save them in the day of G<small>OD</small>’s wrath—to satisfy their hunger or to fill their stomachs. Because they made them stumble into guilt—
Transliteration: khasefam vachutsvot yasheliykhu uzehavam lenidah yiheyeh khasefam uzehavam lo-yukhal lehatsiylam veyvom everat yehovah nafesham lo yeshaveu umeeyhem lo yemaleu khiy-mikheshvol avonam hayah

Hebrew: וּצְבִ֤י עֶדְיוֹ֙ לְגָא֣וֹן שָׂמָ֔הוּ וְצַלְמֵ֧י תוֹעֲבֹתָ֛ם שִׁקּוּצֵיהֶ֖ם עָ֣שׂוּ ב֑וֹ עַל־כֵּ֛ן נְתַתִּ֥יו לָהֶ֖ם לְנִדָּֽה׃
Translated: for out of their beautiful adornments, in which they took pride, they made their images and their detestable abominations—therefore I will make their adornments a source of uncleanness to them.
Transliteration: utseviy edeyvo legavon shamahu vetsalemey tvoavotam shikutseyhem ashu vvo al-khen netatiyv lahem lenidah

Hebrew: וּנְתַתִּ֤יו בְּיַֽד־הַזָּרִים֙ לָבַ֔ז וּלְרִשְׁעֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ לְשָׁלָ֑ל (וחללוה) [וְחִלְּלֽוּהוּ]׃
Translated: I will give them as spoil to strangers, and as plunder to the wicked of the earth; and they shall defile them.
Transliteration: unetatiyv veyad-hazariym lavaz ulerisheey haarets leshalal (vchllvh) [vechileluhu]

Hebrew: וַהֲסִבּוֹתִ֤י פָנַי֙ מֵהֶ֔ם וְחִלְּל֖וּ אֶת־צְפוּנִ֑י וּבָאוּ־בָ֥הּ פָּרִיצִ֖ים וְחִלְּלֽוּהָ׃ {פ}
Translated: I will turn My face from them, and My treasures shall be defiled; ruffians shall invade it and defile it.
Transliteration: vahasivvotiy fanay mehem vechilelu et-tsefuniy uvau-vah fariytsiym vechileluha {f}

Hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֖ה הָרַתּ֑וֹק כִּ֣י הָאָ֗רֶץ מָֽלְאָה֙ מִשְׁפַּ֣ט דָּמִ֔ים וְהָעִ֖יר מָלְאָ֥ה חָמָֽס׃
Translated: Forge the chain, for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of lawlessness.
Transliteration: asheh haratvok khiy haarets maleah mishefat damiym vehaiyr maleah chamas

Hebrew: וְהֵֽבֵאתִי֙ רָעֵ֣י גוֹיִ֔ם וְיָרְשׁ֖וּ אֶת־בָּתֵּיהֶ֑ם וְהִשְׁבַּתִּי֙ גְּא֣וֹן עַזִּ֔ים וְנִחֲל֖וּ מְקַֽדְשֵׁיהֶֽם׃
Translated: I will bring in the worst of the nations to take possession of their houses; so shall I turn to naught the pride of the powerful, and their sanctuaries shall be defiled.
Transliteration: vehevetiy raey gvoyim veyareshu et-vateyhem vehishevatiy gevon aziym venichalu mekadesheyhem

Hebrew: קְפָ֖דָה־בָ֑א וּבִקְשׁ֥וּ שָׁל֖וֹם וָאָֽיִן׃
Translated: Horror comes, and they shall seek safety, but there shall be none.
Transliteration: kefadah-va uvikeshu shalvom vaayiin

Hebrew: הֹוָ֤ה עַל־הֹוָה֙ תָּב֔וֹא וּשְׁמֻעָ֥ה אֶל־שְׁמוּעָ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶ֑ה וּבִקְשׁ֤וּ חָזוֹן֙ מִנָּבִ֔יא וְתוֹרָה֙ תֹּאבַ֣ד מִכֹּהֵ֔ן וְעֵצָ֖ה מִזְּקֵנִֽים׃
Translated: Calamity shall follow calamity, and rumor follow rumor. Then they shall seek vision from the prophet in vain; instruction shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the elders.
Transliteration: hovah al-hovah tavvo ushemuah el-shemuah tiheyeh uvikeshu chazvon minaviy vetvorah tovad mikhohen veetsah mizekeniym

Hebrew: הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יִתְאַבָּ֗ל וְנָשִׂיא֙ יִלְבַּ֣שׁ שְׁמָמָ֔ה וִידֵ֥י עַם־הָאָ֖רֶץ תִּבָּהַ֑לְנָה מִדַּרְכָּ֞ם אֶעֱשֶׂ֤ה אֹתָם֙ וּבְמִשְׁפְּטֵיהֶ֣ם אֶשְׁפְּטֵ֔ם וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The king shall mourn, the prince shall clothe himself with desolation, and the hands of the people of the land shall tremble. I will treat them in accordance with their own ways and judge them according to their deserts. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hamelekhe yiteaval venashiy yilevash shemamah viydey am-haarets tivahalenah midarekham eesheh otam uvemishefeteyhem eshefetem veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשִּׁשִּׁ֗ית בַּשִּׁשִּׁי֙ בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ אֲנִי֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּבֵיתִ֔י וְזִקְנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה יוֹשְׁבִ֣ים לְפָנָ֑י וַתִּפֹּ֤ל עָלַי֙ שָׁ֔ם יַ֖ד אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: In the sixth year, on the fifth day of the sixth month, I was sitting at home, and the elders of Judah were sitting before me, and there the hand of the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> fell upon me.
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hashishiyt vashishiy vachamishah lachodesh aniy yvoshev veveytiy vezikeney yehudah yvosheviym lefanay vatifol alay sham yad adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וָאֶרְאֶ֗ה וְהִנֵּ֤ה דְמוּת֙ כְּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֔שׁ מִמַּרְאֵ֥ה מׇתְנָ֛יו וּלְמַ֖טָּה אֵ֑שׁ וּמִמׇּתְנָ֣יו וּלְמַ֔עְלָה כְּמַרְאֵה־זֹ֖הַר כְּעֵ֥ין הַחַשְׁמַֽלָה׃
Translated: As I looked, there was a figure that had the appearance of fire: from what appeared as the loins down, [there was] fire; and from the loins up, the appearance was resplendent and had the color of amber.
Transliteration: vaereeh vehineh demut khemareeh-esh mimareeh mׇtenayv ulematah esh umimׇtenayv ulemaelah khemareeh-zohar kheeyn hachashemalah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ תַּבְנִ֣ית יָ֔ד וַיִּקָּחֵ֖נִי בְּצִיצִ֣ת רֹאשִׁ֑י וַתִּשָּׂ֣א אֹתִ֣י ר֣וּחַ <small>׀</small> בֵּֽין־הָאָ֣רֶץ וּבֵ֣ין הַשָּׁמַ֡יִם וַתָּבֵא֩ אֹתִ֨י יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ְמָה בְּמַרְא֣וֹת אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֶל־פֶּ֜תַח שַׁ֤עַר הַפְּנִימִית֙ הַפּוֹנֶ֣ה צָפ֔וֹנָה אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֣ם מוֹשַׁ֔ב סֵ֖מֶל הַקִּנְאָ֥ה הַמַּקְנֶֽה׃
Translated: The form of a hand stretched out, and took me by the hair of my head. A spirit lifted me up between heaven and earth and brought me in visions of God to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the Penimith Gate that faces north; that was the site of the infuriating image that provokes fury.
Transliteration: vayishelach taveniyt yad vayikacheniy vetsiytsit roshiy vatisha otiy rucha <small></small> veyn-haarets uveyn hashamayiim vatave otiy yerushala͏emah vemarevot Elohim el-fetach shaar hafeniymiyt hafvoneh tsafvonah asher-sham mvoshav semel hakineah hamakeneh

Hebrew: וְהִ֨נֵּה־שָׁ֔ם כְּב֖וֹד אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּמַּרְאֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִ֖יתִי בַּבִּקְעָֽה׃
Translated: And the Presence of the God of Israel appeared there, like the vision that I had seen in the valley.
Transliteration: vehineh-sham khevvod elohey yisherael khamareeh asher raiytiy vavikeah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם שָׂא־נָ֥א עֵינֶ֖יךָ דֶּ֣רֶךְ צָפ֑וֹנָה וָאֶשָּׂ֤א עֵינַי֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ צָפ֔וֹנָה וְהִנֵּ֤ה מִצָּפוֹן֙ לְשַׁ֣עַר הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ סֵ֛מֶל הַקִּנְאָ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה בַּבִּאָֽה׃
Translated: And I was told, “O mortal, turn your eyes northward.” I turned my eyes northward, and there, north of the gate of the altar, was that infuriating image on the approach.
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam sha-na eyneykha derekhe tsafvonah vaesha eynay derekhe tsafvonah vehineh mitsafvon leshaar hamizevecha semel hakineah hazeh vaviah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הֲרֹאֶ֥ה אַתָּ֖ה (מהם) [מָ֣ה הֵ֣ם] עֹשִׂ֑ים תּוֹעֵב֨וֹת גְּדֹל֜וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל ׀ עֹשִׂ֣ים פֹּ֗ה לְרׇֽחֳקָה֙ מֵעַ֣ל מִקְדָּשִׁ֔י וְעוֹד֙ תָּשׁ֣וּב תִּרְאֶ֔ה תּוֹעֵב֖וֹת גְּדֹלֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: And [God] said to me, “Mortal, do you see what they are doing, the terrible abominations that the House of Israel is practicing here, to drive Me far from My Sanctuary? You shall yet see even greater abominations!”
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam haroeh atah (mhm) [mah hem] oshiym tvoevvot gedolvot asher veyt yisherael oshiym foh lerׇchokah meal mikedashiy vevod tashuv tireeh tvoevvot gedolvot {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתִ֖י אֶל־פֶּ֣תַח הֶחָצֵ֑ר וָאֶרְאֶ֕ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה חֹר־אֶחָ֖ד בַּקִּֽיר׃
Translated: Then [God] brought me to the entrance of the court; and I looked, and there was a hole in the wall.
Transliteration: vayave otiy el-fetach hechatser vaereeh vehineh chor-echad vakiyr

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י בֶּן־אָדָ֖ם חֲתׇר־נָ֣א בַקִּ֑יר וָאֶחְתֹּ֣ר בַּקִּ֔יר וְהִנֵּ֖ה פֶּ֥תַח אֶחָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: I was told, “Mortal, break through the wall”; so I broke through the wall and found an entrance.
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam chatׇr-na vakiyr vaechetor vakiyr vehineh fetach echad {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י בֹּ֤א וּרְאֵה֙ אֶת־הַתּוֹעֵב֣וֹת הָרָע֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥ם עֹשִׂ֖ים פֹּֽה׃
Translated: And I was told, “Enter and see the vile abominations that they are practicing here.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay vo ureeh et-hatvoevvot haravot asher hem oshiym foh

Hebrew: וָאָבוֹא֮ וָאֶרְאֶה֒ וְהִנֵּ֨ה כׇל־תַּבְנִ֜ית רֶ֤מֶשׂ וּבְהֵמָה֙ שֶׁ֔קֶץ וְכׇל־גִּלּוּלֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מְחֻקֶּ֥ה עַל־הַקִּ֖יר סָבִ֥יב <small>׀</small> סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: I entered and looked, and there all detestable forms of creeping things and beasts and all the fetishes of the House of Israel were depicted over the entire wall.
Transliteration: vaavvo vaereeh vehineh khׇl-taveniyt remesh uvehemah shekets vekhׇl-giluley veyt yisherael mechukeh al-hakiyr saviyv <small></small> saviyv

Hebrew: וְשִׁבְעִ֣ים אִ֣ישׁ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י בֵֽית־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל וְיַאֲזַנְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־שָׁפָ֜ן עֹמֵ֤ד בְּתוֹכָם֙ עֹמְדִ֣ים לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם וְאִ֥ישׁ מִקְטַרְתּ֖וֹ בְּיָד֑וֹ וַעֲתַ֥ר עֲנַֽן־הַקְּטֹ֖רֶת עֹלֶֽה׃
Translated: Before them stood seventy of the elders of the House of Israel, with Jaazaniah son of Shaphan standing in their midst. Everyone had a censer in his hand, and a thick cloud of incense smoke ascended.
Transliteration: veshiveiym iysh mizikeney veyt-yisherael veyaazaneyahu ven-shafan omed vetvokham omediym lifeneyhem veiysh miketaretvo veyadvo vaatar anan-haketoret oleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַי֮ הֲרָאִ֣יתָ בֶן־אָדָם֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר זִקְנֵ֤י בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ עֹשִׂ֣ים בַּחֹ֔שֶׁךְ אִ֖ישׁ בְּחַדְרֵ֣י מַשְׂכִּית֑וֹ כִּ֣י אֹמְרִ֗ים אֵ֤ין יְהֹוָה֙ רֹאֶ֣ה אֹתָ֔נוּ עָזַ֥ב יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Again [God] spoke to me, “O mortal, have you seen what the elders of the House of Israel are doing in the darkness, everyone in his image-covered chamber? For they say, ‘G<small>OD</small> does not see us; G<small>OD</small> has abandoned the country.’”
Transliteration: vayomer elay haraiyta ven-adam asher zikeney veyt-yisherael oshiym vachoshekhe iysh vechaderey mashekhiytvo khiy omeriym eyn yehovah roeh otanu azav yehovah et-haarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י ע֣וֹד תָּשׁ֥וּב תִּרְאֶ֛ה תּוֹעֵב֥וֹת גְּדֹל֖וֹת אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥מָּה עֹשִֽׂים׃
Translated: And [God]said to me, “You shall see even more terrible abominations that they practice.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay vod tashuv tireeh tvoevvot gedolvot asher-hemah oshiym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֣א אֹתִ֗י אֶל־פֶּ֙תַח֙ שַׁ֣עַר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֶל־הַצָּפ֑וֹנָה וְהִנֵּה־שָׁם֙ הַנָּשִׁ֣ים יֹשְׁב֔וֹת מְבַכּ֖וֹת אֶת־הַתַּמּֽוּז׃ {ס}
Translated: Next [God] brought me to the entrance of the north gate of the House of G<small>OD</small>; and there sat the women bewailing Tammuz.
Transliteration: vayave otiy el-fetach shaar veyt-yehovah asher el-hatsafvonah vehineh-sham hanashiym yoshevvot mevakhvot et-hatamuz {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלַ֖י הֲרָאִ֣יתָ בֶן־אָדָ֑ם ע֣וֹד תָּשׁ֥וּב תִּרְאֶ֛ה תּוֹעֵב֖וֹת גְּדֹל֥וֹת מֵאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: I was told, “Have you seen, O mortal? You shall see even more terrible abominations than these.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay haraiyta ven-adam vod tashuv tireeh tvoevvot gedolvot meeleh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֣א אֹתִ֗י אֶל־חֲצַ֣ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָה֮ הַפְּנִימִית֒ וְהִנֵּה־פֶ֜תַח הֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֗ה בֵּ֤ין הָֽאוּלָם֙ וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ כְּעֶשְׂרִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אִ֑ישׁ אֲחֹ֨רֵיהֶ֜ם אֶל־הֵיכַ֤ל יְהֹוָה֙ וּפְנֵיהֶ֣ם קֵ֔דְמָה וְהֵ֛מָּה מִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֥ם קֵ֖דְמָה לַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: Then [God] brought me into the inner court of the House of G<small>OD</small>, and there, at the entrance to the Temple of G<small>OD</small>, between the portico and the altar, were about twenty-five men, their backs to the Temple of G<small>OD</small> and their faces to the east; they were bowing low to the sun in the east.
Transliteration: vayave otiy el-chatsar veyt-yehovah hafeniymiyt vehineh-fetach heykhal yehovah veyn haulam uveyn hamizevecha kheesheriym vachamishah iysh achoreyhem el-heykhal yehovah ufeneyhem kedemah vehemah mishetachaviytem kedemah lashamesh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַי֮ הֲרָאִ֣יתָ בֶן־אָדָם֒ הֲנָקֵל֙ לְבֵ֣ית יְהוּדָ֔ה מֵעֲשׂ֕וֹת אֶת־הַתּוֹעֵב֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂוּ־פֹ֑ה כִּֽי־מָלְא֨וּ אֶת־הָאָ֜רֶץ חָמָ֗ס וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ לְהַכְעִיסֵ֔נִי וְהִנָּ֛ם שֹׁלְחִ֥ים אֶת־הַזְּמוֹרָ֖ה אֶל־אַפָּֽם׃
Translated: And I was told, “Do you see, O mortal? Is it not enough for the House of Judah to practice the abominations that they have committed here, that they must fill the country with lawlessness and provoke Me still further and thrust the branch to their nostrils?
Transliteration: vayomer elay haraiyta ven-adam hanakel leveyt yehudah meashvot et-hatvoevvot asher ashu-foh khiy-maleu et-haarets chamas vayashuvu lehakheiyseniy vehinam sholechiym et-hazemvorah el-afam

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִי֙ אֶעֱשֶׂ֣ה בְחֵמָ֔ה לֹא־תָח֥וֹס עֵינִ֖י וְלֹ֣א אֶחְמֹ֑ל וְקָרְא֤וּ בְאׇזְנַי֙ ק֣וֹל גָּד֔וֹל וְלֹ֥א אֶשְׁמַ֖ע אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: I in turn will act with fury, I will show no pity or compassion; though they cry aloud to Me, I will not listen to them.”
Transliteration: vegam-aniy eesheh vechemah lo-tachvos eyniy velo echemol vekareu veׇzenay kvol gadvol velo eshema votam

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א בְאׇזְנַ֗י ק֤וֹל גָּדוֹל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר קָרְב֖וּ פְּקֻדּ֣וֹת הָעִ֑יר וְאִ֛ישׁ כְּלִ֥י מַשְׁחֵת֖וֹ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then [God] called loudly in my hearing, saying, “Approach, you who are in charge of the city, each bearing his weapons of destruction!”
Transliteration: vayikera veׇzenay kvol gadvol lemor karevu fekudvot haiyr veiysh kheliy mashechetvo veyadvo

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה שִׁשָּׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֡ים בָּאִ֣ים ׀ מִדֶּרֶךְ־שַׁ֨עַר הָעֶלְי֜וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ מׇפְנֶ֣ה צָפ֗וֹנָה וְאִ֨ישׁ כְּלִ֤י מַפָּצוֹ֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ וְאִישׁ־אֶחָ֤ד בְּתוֹכָם֙ לָבֻ֣שׁ בַּדִּ֔ים וְקֶ֥סֶת הַסֹּפֵ֖ר בְּמׇתְנָ֑יו וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ וַיַּ֣עַמְד֔וּ אֵ֖צֶל מִזְבַּ֥ח הַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: And six figures entered by way of the upper gate that faces north, each with his club in his hand; and among them was another one, clothed in linen, with a writing case at his waist. They came forward and stopped at the bronze altar.
Transliteration: vehineh shishah anashiym vaiym miderekhe-shaar haeleyvon asher mׇfeneh tsafvonah veiysh kheliy mafatsvo veyadvo veiysh-echad vetvokham lavush vadiym vekeset hasofer vemׇtenayv vayavou vayaamedu etsel mizevach hanechoshet

Hebrew: וּכְב֣וֹד ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נַֽעֲלָה֙ מֵעַ֤ל הַכְּרוּב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֣ה עָלָ֔יו אֶ֖ל מִפְתַּ֣ן הַבָּ֑יִת וַיִּקְרָ֗א אֶל־הָאִישׁ֙ הַלָּבֻ֣שׁ הַבַּדִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֛ר קֶ֥סֶת הַסֹּפֵ֖ר בְּמׇתְנָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Now the Presence of the God of Israel had moved from the cherub on which it had rested to the platform of the House. The figure clothed in linen with the writing case at his waist was summoned;
Transliteration: ukhevvod elohey yisherael naalah meal hakheruv asher hayah alayv el mifetan havayiit vayikera el-haiysh halavush havadiym asher keset hasofer vemׇtenayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלָ֔ו עֲבֹר֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֔יר בְּת֖וֹךְ יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְהִתְוִ֨יתָ תָּ֜ו עַל־מִצְח֣וֹת הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים הַנֶּֽאֱנָחִים֙ וְהַנֶּ֣אֱנָקִ֔ים עַ֚ל כׇּל־הַתּ֣וֹעֵב֔וֹת הַֽנַּעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּתוֹכָֽהּ׃
Translated: and G<small>OD</small> said to him, “Pass through the city, through Jerusalem, and put a mark on the foreheads of the persons who moan and groan because of all the abominations that are committed in it.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elav avor vetvokhe haiyr vetvokhe yerushala͏im vehiteviyta tav al-mitsechvot haanashiym haneenachiym vehaneenakiym al khׇl-hatvoevvot hanaashvot vetvokhah

Hebrew: וּלְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אָמַ֣ר בְּאׇזְנַ֔י עִבְר֥וּ בָעִ֛יר אַחֲרָ֖יו וְהַכּ֑וּ (על) [אַל־]תָּחֹ֥ס (עיניכם) [עֵינְכֶ֖ם] וְאַל־תַּחְמֹֽלוּ׃
Translated: The others were told in my hearing, “Follow him through the city and strike; show no pity or compassion.
Transliteration: uleeleh amar veׇzenay iveru vaiyr acharayv vehakhu (l) [al-]tachos (ynykhm) [eynekhem] veal-tachemolu

Hebrew: זָקֵ֡ן בָּח֣וּר וּבְתוּלָה֩ וְטַ֨ף וְנָשִׁ֜ים תַּהַרְג֣וּ לְמַשְׁחִ֗ית וְעַל־כׇּל־אִ֨ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־עָלָ֤יו הַתָּו֙ אַל־תִּגַּ֔שׁוּ וּמִמִּקְדָּשִׁ֖י תָּחֵ֑לּוּ וַיָּחֵ֙לּוּ֙ בָּאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הַזְּקֵנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: Kill off graybeard, youth and maiden, women and children; but do not touch any person who bears the mark. Begin here at My Sanctuary.” So they began with the elders who were in front of the House.
Transliteration: zaken vachur uvetulah vetaf venashiym taharegu lemashechiyt veal-khׇl-iysh asher-alayv hatav al-tigashu umimikedashiy tachelu vayachelu vaanashiym hazekeniym asher lifeney havayiit

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם טַמְּא֣וּ אֶת־הַבַּ֗יִת וּמַלְא֧וּ אֶת־הַחֲצֵר֛וֹת חֲלָלִ֖ים צֵ֑אוּ וְיָצְא֖וּ וְהִכּ֥וּ בָעִֽיר׃
Translated: And [God] said to them, “Defile the House and fill the courts with the slain. Then go forth.” So they went forth and began to kill in the city.
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem tameu et-havayiit umaleu et-hachatservot chalaliym tseu veyatseu vehikhu vaiyr

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כְּהַכּוֹתָ֔ם וְנֵֽאשְׁאַ֖ר אָ֑נִי וָאֶפְּלָ֨ה עַל־פָּנַ֜י וָאֶזְעַ֗ק וָֽאֹמַר֙ אֲהָהּ֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הֲמַשְׁחִ֣ית אַתָּ֗ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּשׇׁפְכְּךָ֥ אֶת־חֲמָתְךָ֖ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: When they were out killing, and I remained alone, I flung myself on my face and cried out, “Ah, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! Are you going to annihilate all that is left of Israel, pouring out Your fury upon Jerusalem?”
Transliteration: vayehiy khehakhvotam veneshear aniy vaefelah al-fanay vaezeak vaomar ahah adonay yehovih hamashechiyt atah et khׇl-sheeriyt yisherael veshׇfekhekha et-chamatekha al-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י עֲוֺ֨ן בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל וִֽיהוּדָה֙ גָּדוֹל֙ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד וַתִּמָּלֵ֤א הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ דָּמִ֔ים וְהָעִ֖יר מָלְאָ֣ה מֻטֶּ֑ה כִּ֣י אָמְר֗וּ עָזַ֤ב יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאֵ֥ין יְהֹוָ֖ה רֹאֶֽה׃
Translated: The answer came, “The iniquity of the Houses of Judah and Israel is very very great, the land is full of crime and the city is full of corruption. For they say, ‘G<small>OD</small> has forsaken the land, and G<small>OD</small> does not see.’
Transliteration: vayomer elay avon veyt-yisherael viyhudah gadvol vimeod meod vatimale haarets damiym vehaiyr maleah muteh khiy ameru azav yehovah et-haarets veeyn yehovah roeh

Hebrew: וְגַ֨ם־אֲנִ֔י לֹא־תָח֥וֹס עֵינִ֖י וְלֹ֣א אֶחְמֹ֑ל דַּרְכָּ֖ם בְּרֹאשָׁ֥ם נָתָֽתִּי׃
Translated: I, in turn, will show no pity or compassion; I will give them their deserts.”
Transliteration: vegam-aniy lo-tachvos eyniy velo echemol darekham verosham natatiy

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֞ה הָאִ֣ישׁ ׀ לְבֻ֣שׁ הַבַּדִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר הַקֶּ֙סֶת֙ בְּמׇתְנָ֔יו מֵשִׁ֥יב דָּבָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר עָשִׂ֕יתִי (כאשר) [כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר] צִוִּיתָֽנִי׃ {פ}
Translated: And then the one clothed in linen with the writing case at his waist brought back word, saying, “I have done as You commanded me.”
Transliteration: vehineh haiysh levush havadiym asher hakeset vemׇtenayv meshiyv davar lemor ashiytiy (khshr) [khekhol asher] tsiviytaniy {f}

Hebrew: וָאֶרְאֶ֗ה וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֶל־הָרָקִ֙יעַ֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַכְּרֻבִ֔ים כְּאֶ֣בֶן סַפִּ֔יר כְּמַרְאֵ֖ה דְּמ֣וּת כִּסֵּ֑א נִרְאָ֖ה עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: I looked, and on the expanse over the heads of the cherubs, there was something like a sapphire stone; an appearance resembling a throne could be seen over them.
Transliteration: vaereeh vehineh el-harakiya asher al-rosh hakheruviym kheeven safiyr khemareeh demut khise nireah aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֜אמֶר אֶל־הָאִ֣ישׁ ׀ לְבֻ֣שׁ הַבַּדִּ֗ים וַיֹּ֡אמֶר בֹּא֩ אֶל־בֵּינ֨וֹת לַגַּלְגַּ֜ל אֶל־תַּ֣חַת לַכְּר֗וּב וּמַלֵּ֨א חׇפְנֶ֤יךָ גַֽחֲלֵי־אֵשׁ֙ מִבֵּינ֣וֹת לַכְּרֻבִ֔ים וּזְרֹ֖ק עַל־הָעִ֑יר וַיָּבֹ֖א לְעֵינָֽי׃
Translated: [God] spoke to the figure clothed in linen and said, “Step inside the wheelwork, under the cherubs, and fill your hands with glowing coals from among the cherubs, and scatter them over the city.” And he went in as I looked on.
Transliteration: vayomer el-haiysh levush havadiym vayomer vo el-veynvot lagalegal el-tachat lakheruv umale chׇfeneykha gachaley-esh miveynvot lakheruviym uzerok al-haiyr vayavo leeynay

Hebrew: וְהַכְּרֻבִ֗ים עֹ֥מְדִ֛ים מִימִ֥ין לַבַּ֖יִת בְּבֹא֣וֹ הָאִ֑ישׁ וְהֶעָנָ֣ן מָלֵ֔א אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֖ר הַפְּנִימִֽית׃
Translated: Now the cherubs were standing on the south side of the House when that figure entered, and the cloud filled the inner court.
Transliteration: vehakheruviym omediym miymiyn lavayiit vevovo haiysh veheanan male et-hechatser hafeniymiyt

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤רׇם כְּבוֹד־יְהֹוָה֙ מֵעַ֣ל הַכְּר֔וּב עַ֖ל מִפְתַּ֣ן הַבָּ֑יִת וַיִּמָּלֵ֤א הַבַּ֙יִת֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָנָ֔ן וְהֶֽחָצֵר֙ מָֽלְאָ֔ה אֶת־נֹ֖גַהּ כְּב֥וֹד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But when the Presence of G<small>OD</small> moved from the cherubs to the platform of the House, the House was filled with the cloud, and the court was filled with the radiance of the Presence of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayarׇm khevvod-yehovah meal hakheruv al mifetan havayiit vayimale havayiit et-heanan vehechatser maleah et-nogah khevvod yehovah

Hebrew: וְקוֹל֙ כַּנְפֵ֣י הַכְּרוּבִ֔ים נִשְׁמַ֕ע עַד־הֶחָצֵ֖ר הַחִֽיצֹנָ֑ה כְּק֥וֹל אֵל־שַׁדַּ֖י בְּדַבְּרֽוֹ׃
Translated: The sound of the cherubs’ wings could be heard as far as the outer court, like the voice of El Shaddai when speaking.
Transliteration: vekvol khanefey hakheruviym nishema ad-hechatser hachiytsonah khekvol el-shaday vedavervo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּצַוֺּתוֹ֙ אֶת־הָאִ֤ישׁ לְבֻֽשׁ־הַבַּדִּים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר קַ֥ח אֵשׁ֙ מִבֵּינ֣וֹת לַגַּלְגַּ֔ל מִבֵּינ֖וֹת לַכְּרוּבִ֑ים וַיָּבֹא֙ וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֔ד אֵ֖צֶל הָאוֹפָֽן׃
Translated: When [God] commanded the figure clothed in linen: “Take fire from among the cherubs within the wheelwork,” he went in and stood beside a wheel.
Transliteration: vayehiy vetsavotvo et-haiysh levush-havadiym lemor kach esh miveynvot lagalegal miveynvot lakheruviym vayavo vayaamod etsel havofan

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ הַכְּר֨וּב אֶת־יָד֜וֹ מִבֵּינ֣וֹת לַכְּרוּבִ֗ים אֶל־הָאֵשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ בֵּינ֣וֹת הַכְּרֻבִ֔ים וַיִּשָּׂא֙ וַיִּתֵּ֔ן אֶל־חׇפְנֵ֖י לְבֻ֣שׁ הַבַּדִּ֑ים וַיִּקַּ֖ח וַיֵּצֵֽא׃
Translated: And a cherub stretched out a hand among the cherubs to the fire that was among the cherubs; he took some and put it into the hands of the one clothed in linen, who took it and went out.
