Transliteration: vayishelach hakheruv et-yadvo miveynvot lakheruviym el-haesh asher veynvot hakheruviym vayisha vayiten el-chׇfeney levush havadiym vayikach vayetse

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֖א לַכְּרֻבִ֑ים תַּבְנִית֙ יַד־אָדָ֔ם תַּ֖חַת כַּנְפֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The cherubs appeared to have the form of a human hand under their wings.
Transliteration: vayera lakheruviym taveniyt yad-adam tachat khanefeyhem

Hebrew: וָאֶרְאֶ֗ה וְהִנֵּ֨ה אַרְבָּעָ֣ה אוֹפַנִּים֮ אֵ֣צֶל הַכְּרוּבִים֒ אוֹפַ֣ן אֶחָ֗ד אֵ֚צֶל הַכְּר֣וּב אֶחָ֔ד וְאוֹפַ֣ן אֶחָ֔ד אֵ֖צֶל הַכְּר֣וּב אֶחָ֑ד וּמַרְאֵה֙ הָא֣וֹפַנִּ֔ים כְּעֵ֖ין אֶ֥בֶן תַּרְשִֽׁישׁ׃
Translated: I could see that there were four wheels beside the cherubs, one wheel beside each of the cherubs; as for the appearance of the wheels, they gleamed like the beryl stone.
Transliteration: vaereeh vehineh arevaah vofaniym etsel hakheruviym vofan echad etsel hakheruv echad vevofan echad etsel hakheruv echad umareeh havofaniym kheeyn even tareshiysh

Hebrew: וּמַ֨רְאֵיהֶ֔ם דְּמ֥וּת אֶחָ֖ד לְאַרְבַּעְתָּ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יִהְיֶ֥ה הָאוֹפַ֖ן בְּת֥וֹךְ הָאוֹפָֽן׃
Translated: In appearance, the four had the same form, as if there were two wheels cutting through each other.
Transliteration: umareeyhem demut echad learevaetam khaasher yiheyeh havofan vetvokhe havofan

Hebrew: בְּלֶכְתָּ֗ם אֶל־אַרְבַּ֤עַת רִבְעֵיהֶם֙ יֵלֵ֔כוּ לֹ֥א יִסַּ֖בּוּ בְּלֶכְתָּ֑ם כִּ֣י הַמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִפְנֶ֤ה הָרֹאשׁ֙ אַחֲרָ֣יו יֵלֵ֔כוּ לֹ֥א יִסַּ֖בּוּ בְּלֶכְתָּֽם׃
Translated: And when they moved, each could move in the direction of any of its four quarters; they did not veer as they moved. The [cherubs] moved in the direction in which one of the heads faced, without turning as they moved.
Transliteration: velekhetam el-arevaat riveeyhem eilekhu lo yisavu velekhetam khiy hamakvom asher-yifeneh harosh acharayv eilekhu lo yisavu velekhetam

Hebrew: וְכׇל־בְּשָׂרָם֙ וְגַבֵּהֶ֔ם וִידֵיהֶ֖ם וְכַנְפֵיהֶ֑ם וְהָאוֹפַנִּ֗ים מְלֵאִ֤ים עֵינַ֙יִם֙ סָבִ֔יב לְאַרְבַּעְתָּ֖ם אוֹפַנֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Their entire bodies—backs, hands, and wings—and the wheels, the wheels of the four of them, were covered all over with eyes.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-vesharam vegavehem viydeyhem vekhanefeyhem vehavofaniym meleiym eynayiim saviyv learevaetam vofaneyhem

Hebrew: לָא֖וֹפַנִּ֑ים לָהֶ֛ם קוֹרָ֥א הַגַּלְגַּ֖ל בְּאׇזְנָֽי׃
Translated: It was these wheels that I had heard called “the wheelwork.”
Transliteration: lavofaniym lahem kvora hagalegal veׇzenay

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה פָנִ֖ים לְאֶחָ֑ד פְּנֵ֨י הָאֶחָ֜ד פְּנֵ֣י הַכְּר֗וּב וּפְנֵ֤י הַשֵּׁנִי֙ פְּנֵ֣י אָדָ֔ם וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי֙ פְּנֵ֣י אַרְיֵ֔ה וְהָרְבִיעִ֖י פְּנֵי־נָֽשֶׁר׃
Translated: Each one had four faces: One was a cherub’s face, the second a human face, the third a lion’s face, and the fourth an eagle’s face.
Transliteration: vearevaah faniym leechad feney haechad feney hakheruv ufeney hasheniy feney adam vehasheliyshiy feney areeih vehareviyiy feney-nasher

Hebrew: וַיֵּרֹ֖מּוּ הַכְּרוּבִ֑ים הִ֣יא הַחַיָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִ֖יתִי בִּֽנְהַר־כְּבָֽר׃
Translated: The cherubs ascended; those were the creatures that I had seen by the Chebar Canal.
Transliteration: vayeromu hakheruviym hiy hachayah asher raiytiy vinehar-khevar

Hebrew: וּבְלֶ֙כֶת֙ הַכְּרוּבִ֔ים יֵלְכ֥וּ הָאוֹפַנִּ֖ים אֶצְלָ֑ם וּבִשְׂאֵ֨ת הַכְּרוּבִ֜ים אֶת־כַּנְפֵיהֶ֗ם לָרוּם֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָאָ֔רֶץ לֹֽא־יִסַּ֧בּוּ הָאוֹפַנִּ֛ים גַּם־הֵ֖ם מֵאֶצְלָֽם׃
Translated: Whenever the cherubs went, the wheels went beside them; and when the cherubs lifted their wings to ascend from the earth, the wheels did not roll away from their side.
Transliteration: uvelekhet hakheruviym eilekhu havofaniym etselam uvisheet hakheruviym et-khanefeyhem larum meal haarets lo-yisavu havofaniym gam-hem meetselam

Hebrew: בְּעׇמְדָ֣ם יַעֲמֹ֔דוּ וּבְרוֹמָ֖ם יֵר֣וֹמּוּ אוֹתָ֑ם כִּ֛י ר֥וּחַ הַחַיָּ֖ה בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: When those stood still, these stood still; and when those ascended, these ascended with them, for the spirit of the creature was in them.
Transliteration: veׇmedam yaamodu uvervomam eirvomu votam khiy rucha hachayah vahem

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה מֵעַ֖ל מִפְתַּ֣ן הַבָּ֑יִת וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד עַל־הַכְּרוּבִֽים׃
Translated: Then the Presence of G<small>OD</small> left the platform of the House and stopped above the cherubs.
Transliteration: vayetse khevvod yehovah meal mifetan havayiit vayaamod al-hakheruviym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֣וּ הַכְּרוּבִ֣ים אֶת־כַּ֠נְפֵיהֶ֠ם וַיֵּר֨וֹמּוּ מִן־הָאָ֤רֶץ לְעֵינַי֙ בְּצֵאתָ֔ם וְהָאוֹפַנִּ֖ים לְעֻמָּתָ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֗ד פֶּ֣תַח שַׁ֤עַר בֵּית־יְהֹוָה֙ הַקַּדְמוֹנִ֔י וּכְב֧וֹד אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: And I saw the cherubs lift their wings and rise from the earth, with the wheels beside them as they departed; and they stopped at the entrance of the eastern gate of the House of G<small>OD</small>, with the Presence of the God of Israel above them.
Transliteration: vayisheu hakheruviym et-khanefeyhem vayervomu min-haarets leeynay vetsetam vehavofaniym leumatam vayaamod fetach shaar veyt-yehovah hakademvoniy ukhevvod elohey-yisherael aleyhem milemaelah

Hebrew: הִ֣יא הַחַיָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִ֛יתִי תַּ֥חַת אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּֽנְהַר־כְּבָ֑ר וָאֵדַ֕ע כִּ֥י כְרוּבִ֖ים הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: They were the same creatures that I had seen below the God of Israel at the Chebar Canal; so now I knew that they were cherubs.
Transliteration: hiy hachayah asher raiytiy tachat elohey-yisherael vinehar-khevar vaeda khiy kheruviym hemah

Hebrew: אַרְבָּעָ֨ה אַרְבָּעָ֤ה פָנִים֙ לְאֶחָ֔ד וְאַרְבַּ֥ע כְּנָפַ֖יִם לְאֶחָ֑ד וּדְמוּת֙ יְדֵ֣י אָדָ֔ם תַּ֖חַת כַּנְפֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Each one had four faces and each had four wings, with the form of human hands under the wings.
Transliteration: arevaah arevaah faniym leechad veareva khenafayiim leechad udemut yedey adam tachat khanefeyhem

Hebrew: וּדְמ֣וּת פְּנֵיהֶ֔ם הֵ֣מָּה הַפָּנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר רָאִ֙יתִי֙ עַל־נְהַר־כְּבָ֔ר מַרְאֵיהֶ֖ם וְאוֹתָ֑ם אִ֛ישׁ אֶל־עֵ֥בֶר פָּנָ֖יו יֵלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: As for the form of their faces, they were the very faces that I had seen by the Chebar Canal—their appearance and their features—and each could move in the direction of any of its faces.
Transliteration: udemut feneyhem hemah hafaniym asher raiytiy al-nehar-khevar mareeyhem vevotam iysh el-ever fanayv eilekhu

Hebrew: וַתִּשָּׂ֨א אֹתִ֜י ר֗וּחַ וַתָּבֵ֣א אֹ֠תִ֠י אֶל־שַׁ֨עַר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֤ה הַקַּדְמוֹנִי֙ הַפּוֹנֶ֣ה קָדִ֔ימָה וְהִנֵּה֙ בְּפֶ֣תַח הַשַּׁ֔עַר עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אִ֑ישׁ וָאֶרְאֶ֨ה בְתוֹכָ֜ם אֶת־יַאֲזַנְיָ֧ה בֶן־עַזֻּ֛ר וְאֶת־פְּלַטְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־בְּנָיָ֖הוּ שָׂרֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then a spirit lifted me up and brought me to the east gate of the House of G<small>OD</small>, which faces eastward; and there, at the entrance of the gate, were twenty-five men, among whom I saw Jaazaniah son of Azzur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah, leaders of the people.
Transliteration: vatisha otiy rucha vatave otiy el-shaar veyt-yehovah hakademvoniy hafvoneh kadiymah vehineh vefetach hashaar esheriym vachamishah iysh vaereeh vetvokham et-yaazaneyah ven-azur veet-felateyahu ven-venayahu sharey haam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם אֵ֣לֶּה הָאֲנָשִׁ֞ים הַחֹשְׁבִ֥ים אָ֛וֶן וְהַיֹּעֲצִ֥ים עֲצַת־רָ֖ע בָּעִ֥יר הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: [G<small>OD</small>] said to me, “O mortal, these are the men who plan iniquity and plot wickedness in this city,
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam eleh haanashiym hachosheviym aven vehayoatsiym atsat-ra vaiyr hazot

Hebrew: הָאֹ֣מְרִ֔ים לֹ֥א בְקָר֖וֹב בְּנ֣וֹת בָּתִּ֑ים הִ֣יא הַסִּ֔יר וַאֲנַ֖חְנוּ הַבָּשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: who say: ‘There is no need now to build houses; this [city] is the pot, and we are the meat.’
Transliteration: haomeriym lo vekarvov venvot vatiym hiy hasiyr vaanachenu havashar {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֖ן הִנָּבֵ֣א עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם הִנָּבֵ֖א בֶּן־אָדָֽם׃
Translated: I adjure you, prophesy against them; prophesy, O mortal!”
Transliteration: lakhen hinave aleyhem hinave ven-adam

Hebrew: וַתִּפֹּ֣ל עָלַי֮ ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָה֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י אֱמֹר֙ כֹּֽה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה כֵּ֥ן אֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּמַעֲל֥וֹת רוּחֲכֶ֖ם אֲנִ֥י יְדַעְתִּֽיהָ׃
Translated: Thereupon the spirit of G<small>OD</small> fell upon me, and I was told, “Speak: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Such are your thoughts, O House of Israel; I know what comes into your mind.
Transliteration: vatifol alay rucha yehovah vayomer elay emor khoh-amar yehovah khen amaretem veyt yisherael umaalvot ruchakhem aniy yedaetiyha

Hebrew: הִרְבֵּיתֶ֥ם חַלְלֵיכֶ֖ם בָּעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֑את וּמִלֵּאתֶ֥ם חוּצֹתֶ֖יהָ חָלָֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Many have you slain in this city; you have filled its streets with corpses.
Transliteration: hireveytem chaleleykhem vaiyr hazot umiletem chutsoteyha chalal {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּֽה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ חַלְלֵיכֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שַׂמְתֶּ֣ם בְּתוֹכָ֔הּ הֵ֥מָּה הַבָּשָׂ֖ר וְהִ֣יא הַסִּ֑יר וְאֶתְכֶ֖ם הוֹצִ֥יא מִתּוֹכָֽהּ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus says the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: The corpses that you have piled up in it are the meat for which it is the pot; but you shall be taken out of it.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih chaleleykhem asher shametem vetvokhah hemah havashar vehiy hasiyr veetekhem hvotsiy mitvokhah

Hebrew: חֶ֖רֶב יְרֵאתֶ֑ם וְחֶ֙רֶב֙ אָבִ֣יא עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: You feared the sword, and the sword I will bring upon you—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: cherev yeretem vecherev aviy aleykhem neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְהוֹצֵאתִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ מִתּוֹכָ֔הּ וְנָתַתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּיַד־זָרִ֑ים וְעָשִׂ֥יתִי בָכֶ֖ם שְׁפָטִֽים׃
Translated: I will take you out of it and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and I will execute judgments upon you.
Transliteration: vehvotsetiy etekhem mitvokhah venatatiy etekhem veyad-zariym veashiytiy vakhem shefatiym

Hebrew: בַּחֶ֣רֶב תִּפֹּ֔לוּ עַל־גְּב֥וּל יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶשְׁפּ֣וֹט אֶתְכֶ֑ם וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall fall by the sword; I will punish you at the border of Israel. And you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vacherev tifolu al-gevul yisherael eshefvot etekhem viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: הִ֗יא לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֤ה לָכֶם֙ לְסִ֔יר וְאַתֶּ֛ם תִּהְי֥וּ בְתוֹכָ֖הּ לְבָשָׂ֑ר אֶל־גְּב֥וּל יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶשְׁפֹּ֥ט אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: This [city] shall not be a pot for you, nor you the meat in it; I will punish you at the border of Israel.
Transliteration: hiy lo-tiheyeh lakhem lesiyr veatem tiheyu vetvokhah levashar el-gevul yisherael eshefot etekhem

Hebrew: וִֽידַעְתֶּם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּחֻקַּי֙ לֹ֣א הֲלַכְתֶּ֔ם וּמִשְׁפָּטַ֖י לֹ֣א עֲשִׂיתֶ֑ם וּֽכְמִשְׁפְּטֵ֧י הַגּוֹיִ֛ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר סְבִיבוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם עֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
Translated: Then you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>, whose laws you did not follow and whose rules you did not obey, acting instead according to the rules of the nations around you.”
Transliteration: viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah asher vechukay lo halakhetem umishefatay lo ashiytem ukhemishefetey hagvoyim asher seviyvvoteykhem ashiytem

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כְּהִנָּ֣בְאִ֔י וּפְלַטְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־בְּנָיָ֖ה מֵ֑ת וָאֶפֹּ֨ל עַל־פָּנַ֜י וָאֶזְעַ֣ק קוֹל־גָּד֗וֹל וָֽאֹמַר֙ אֲהָהּ֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה כָּלָה֙ אַתָּ֣ה עֹשֶׂ֔ה אֵ֖ת שְׁאֵרִ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Now, as I prophesied, Pelatiah son of Benaiah dropped dead. I threw myself upon my face and cried out aloud, “Ah, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! You are wiping out the remnant of Israel!”
Transliteration: vayehiy khehinaveiy ufelateyahu ven-venayah met vaefol al-fanay vaezeak kvol-gadvol vaomar ahah adonay yehovih khalah atah osheh et sheeriyt yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם אַחֶ֤יךָ אַחֶ֙יךָ֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י גְאֻלָּתֶ֔ךָ וְכׇל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כֻּלֹּ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֩ אָמְר֨וּ לָהֶ֜ם יֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם רַֽחֲקוּ֙ מֵעַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה לָ֥נוּ הִ֛יא נִתְּנָ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ לְמוֹרָשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: “O mortal, [I will save] your kinsfolk, your relatives—your next of kin—all of that very House of Israel to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem say, ‘Keep far from G<small>OD</small>; the land has been given as a heritage to us.’
Transliteration: ven-adam acheykha acheykha aneshey geulatekha vekhׇl-veyt yisherael khuloh asher ameru lahem yoshevey yerushala͏im rachaku meal yehovah lanu hiy nitenah haarets lemvorashah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן אֱמֹ֗ר כֹּֽה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ כִּ֤י הִרְחַקְתִּים֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם וְכִ֥י הֲפִיצוֹתִ֖ים בָּאֲרָצ֑וֹת וָאֱהִ֤י לָהֶם֙ לְמִקְדָּ֣שׁ מְעַ֔ט בָּאֲרָצ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אוּ שָֽׁם׃ {ס}
Translated: Say then: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I have indeed removed them far among the nations and have scattered them among the countries, and I have become to them a diminished sanctity in the countries whither they have gone.
Transliteration: lakhen emor khoh-amar adonay yehovih khiy hirechaketiym vagvoyim vekhiy hafiytsvotiym vaaratsvot vaehiy lahem lemikedash meat vaaratsvot asher-vau sham {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן אֱמֹ֗ר כֹּֽה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ וְקִבַּצְתִּ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ מִן־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים וְאָסַפְתִּ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם מִן־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר נְפֹצוֹתֶ֖ם בָּהֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֥י לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־אַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Yet say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will gather you from the peoples and assemble you out of the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the Land of Israel.
Transliteration: lakhen emor khoh-amar adonay yehovih vekivatsetiy etekhem min-haamiym veasafetiy etekhem min-haaratsvot asher nefotsvotem vahem venatatiy lakhem et-ademat yisherael

Hebrew: וּבָ֖אוּ־שָׁ֑מָּה וְהֵסִ֜ירוּ אֶת־כׇּל־שִׁקּוּצֶ֛יהָ וְאֶת־כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבוֹתֶ֖יהָ מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated: And they shall return there, and do away with all its detestable things and all its abominations.
Transliteration: uvau-shamah vehesiyru et-khׇl-shikutseyha veet-khׇl-tvoavvoteyha mimenah

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י לָהֶם֙ לֵ֣ב אֶחָ֔ד וְר֥וּחַ חֲדָשָׁ֖ה אֶתֵּ֣ן בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וַהֲסִ֨רֹתִ֜י לֵ֤ב הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ מִבְּשָׂרָ֔ם וְנָתַתִּ֥י לָהֶ֖ם לֵ֥ב בָּשָֽׂר׃
Translated: I will give them one heart and put a new spirit in them; I will remove the heart of stone from their bodies and give them a heart of flesh,
Transliteration: venatatiy lahem lev echad verucha chadashah eten vekirevekhem vahasirotiy lev haeven mivesharam venatatiy lahem lev vashar

Hebrew: לְמַ֙עַן֙ בְּחֻקֹּתַ֣י יֵלֵ֔כוּ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֥י יִשְׁמְר֖וּ וְעָשׂ֣וּ אֹתָ֑ם וְהָיוּ־לִ֣י לְעָ֔ם וַאֲנִ֕י אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: that they may follow My laws and faithfully observe My rules. Then they shall be My people and I will be their God.
Transliteration: lemaan vechukotay eilekhu veet-mishefatay yishemeru veashu otam vehayu-liy leam vaaniy eheyeh lahem lelohiym

Hebrew: וְאֶל־לֵ֧ב שִׁקּוּצֵיהֶ֛ם וְתוֹעֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֖ם לִבָּ֣ם הֹלֵ֑ךְ דַּרְכָּם֙ בְּרֹאשָׁ֣ם נָתַ֔תִּי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: But as for them whose heart is set upon their detestable things and their abominations, I will repay them for their conduct—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: veel-lev shikutseyhem vetvoavvoteyhem livam holekhe darekham verosham natatiy neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֤וּ הַכְּרוּבִים֙ אֶת־כַּנְפֵיהֶ֔ם וְהָאוֹפַנִּ֖ים לְעֻמָּתָ֑ם וּכְב֧וֹד אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: Then the cherubs, with the wheels beside them, lifted their wings, while the Presence of the God of Israel rested above them.
Transliteration: vayisheu hakheruviym et-khanefeyhem vehavofaniym leumatam ukhevvod elohey-yisherael aleyhem milemaelah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַל֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֔ה מֵעַ֖ל תּ֣וֹךְ הָעִ֑יר וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ עַל־הָהָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִקֶּ֥דֶם לָעִֽיר׃
Translated: The Presence of G<small>OD</small> ascended from the midst of the city and stood on the hill east of the city.
Transliteration: vayaal khevvod yehovah meal tvokhe haiyr vayaamod al-hahar asher mikedem laiyr

Hebrew: וְר֣וּחַ נְשָׂאַ֗תְנִי וַתְּבִאֵ֤נִי כַשְׂדִּ֙ימָה֙ אֶל־הַגּוֹלָ֔ה בַּמַּרְאֶ֖ה בְּר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיַּ֙עַל֙ מֵֽעָלַ֔י הַמַּרְאֶ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִֽיתִי׃
Translated: A spirit carried me away and brought me in a vision by the spirit of God to the exile community in Chaldea. Then the vision that I had seen left me,
Transliteration: verucha neshaateniy vatevieniy khashediymah el-hagvolah vamareeh verucha Elohim vayaal mealay hamareeh asher raiytiy

Hebrew: וָאֲדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־הַגּוֹלָ֑ה אֵ֛ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶרְאָֽנִי׃ {פ}
Translated: and I told the exiles all the things that G<small>OD</small> had shown me.
Transliteration: vaadaver el-hagvolah et khׇl-diverey yehovah asher hereaniy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם בְּת֥וֹךְ בֵּית־הַמֶּ֖רִי אַתָּ֣ה יֹשֵׁ֑ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֵינַ֩יִם֩ לָהֶ֨ם לִרְא֜וֹת וְלֹ֣א רָא֗וּ אׇזְנַ֨יִם לָהֶ֤ם לִשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ וְלֹ֣א שָׁמֵ֔עוּ כִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית מְרִ֖י הֵֽם׃
Translated: O mortal, you dwell among the rebellious breed. They have eyes to see but see not, ears to hear but hear not; for they are a rebellious breed.
Transliteration: ven-adam vetvokhe veyt-hameriy atah yoshev asher eynayiim lahem lirevot velo rau ׇzenayiim lahem lishemoa velo shameu khiy veyt meriy hem

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם עֲשֵׂ֤ה לְךָ֙ כְּלֵ֣י גוֹלָ֔ה וּגְלֵ֥ה יוֹמָ֖ם לְעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם וְגָלִ֨יתָ מִמְּקוֹמְךָ֜ אֶל־מָק֤וֹם אַחֵר֙ לְעֵ֣ינֵיהֶ֔ם אוּלַ֣י יִרְא֔וּ כִּ֛י בֵּ֥ית מְרִ֖י הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: Therefore, mortal, get yourself gear for exile, and go into exile by day before their eyes. Go into exile from your home to another place before their very eyes; perhaps they will take note, even though they are a rebellious breed.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam asheh lekha kheley gvolah ugeleh yvomam leeyneyhem vegaliyta mimekvomekha el-makvom acher leeyneyhem ulay yireu khiy veyt meriy hemah

Hebrew: וְהוֹצֵאתָ֨ כֵלֶ֜יךָ כִּכְלֵ֥י גוֹלָ֛ה יוֹמָ֖ם לְעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם וְאַתָּ֗ה תֵּצֵ֤א בָעֶ֙רֶב֙ לְעֵ֣ינֵיהֶ֔ם כְּמוֹצָאֵ֖י גּוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Carry out your gear as gear for exile by day before their very eyes; and go out again in the evening before their eyes, as one who goes out into exile.
Transliteration: vehvotseta kheleykha khikheley gvolah yvomam leeyneyhem veatah tetse vaerev leeyneyhem khemvotsaey gvolah

Hebrew: לְעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם חֲתׇר־לְךָ֣ בַקִּ֑יר וְהוֹצֵאתָ֖ בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Before their eyes, break through the wall and carry [the gear] out through it;
Transliteration: leeyneyhem chatׇr-lekha vakiyr vehvotseta vvo

Hebrew: לְעֵ֨ינֵיהֶ֜ם עַל־כָּתֵ֤ף תִּשָּׂא֙ בָּעֲלָטָ֣ה תוֹצִ֔יא פָּנֶ֣יךָ תְכַסֶּ֔ה וְלֹ֥א תִרְאֶ֖ה אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּֽי־מוֹפֵ֥ת נְתַתִּ֖יךָ לְבֵ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: before their eyes, carry it on your shoulder. Take it out in the dark, and cover your face that you may not see the land; for I make you a portent to the House of Israel.
Transliteration: leeyneyhem al-khatef tisha vaalatah tvotsiy faneykha tekhaseh velo tireeh et-haarets khiy-mvofet netatiykha leveyt yisherael

Hebrew: וָאַ֣עַשׂ כֵּן֮ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צֻוֵּ֒יתִי֒ כֵּ֠לַ֠י הוֹצֵ֜אתִי כִּכְלֵ֤י גוֹלָה֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וּבָעֶ֛רֶב חָתַֽרְתִּי־לִ֥י בַקִּ֖יר בְּיָ֑ד בָּעֲלָטָ֥ה הוֹצֵ֛אתִי עַל־כָּתֵ֥ף נָשָׂ֖אתִי לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: I did just as I was ordered: I took out my gear by day as gear for exile, and in the evening I broke through the wall with my own hands. In the darkness I carried [the gear] out on my shoulder, carrying it before their eyes.
Transliteration: vaaash khen khaasher tsuveytiy khelay hvotsetiy khikheley gvolah yvomam uvaerev chataretiy-liy vakiyr veyad vaalatah hvotsetiy al-khatef nashatiy leeyneyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלַ֖י בַּבֹּ֥קֶר לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the morning, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay vavoker lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הֲלֹ֨א אָמְר֥וּ אֵלֶ֛יךָ בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑רִי מָ֖ה אַתָּ֥ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: O mortal, did not the House of Israel, that rebellious breed, ask you, “What are you doing?”
Transliteration: ven-adam halo ameru eleykha veyt yisherael veyt hameriy mah atah osheh

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הַנָּשִׂ֞יא הַמַּשָּׂ֤א הַזֶּה֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְכׇל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥מָּה בְתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: Say to them: “Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: This pronouncement concerns the prince in Jerusalem and all the House of Israel who are in it.”
Transliteration: emor aleyhem khoh amar adonay yehovih hanashiy hamasha hazeh viyrushala͏im vekhׇl-veyt yisherael asher-hemah vetvokham

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֖ר אֲנִ֣י מֽוֹפֶתְכֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֗יתִי כֵּ֚ן יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם בַּגּוֹלָ֥ה בַשְּׁבִ֖י יֵלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: Say: “I am a portent for you: As I have done, so shall it be done to them; they shall go into exile, into captivity.
Transliteration: emor aniy mvofetekhem khaasher ashiytiy khen eiasheh lahem vagvolah vasheviy eilekhu

Hebrew: וְהַנָּשִׂ֨יא אֲשֶׁר־בְּתוֹכָ֜ם אֶל־כָּתֵ֤ף יִשָּׂא֙ בָּעֲלָטָ֣ה וְיֵצֵ֔א בַּקִּ֥יר יַחְתְּר֖וּ לְה֣וֹצִיא ב֑וֹ פָּנָ֣יו יְכַסֶּ֔ה יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יִרְאֶ֥ה לַעַ֛יִן ה֖וּא אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And the prince among them shall carry his gear on his shoulder as he goes out in the dark. He shall break through the wall in order to carry [his gear] out through it; he shall cover his face, because he himself shall not see the land with his eyes.”
Transliteration: vehanashiy asher-vetvokham el-khatef yisha vaalatah veeitse vakiyr yacheteru lehvotsiy vvo fanayv yekhaseh yaan asher lo-yireeh laayiin hu et-haarets

Hebrew: וּפָרַשְׂתִּ֤י אֶת־רִשְׁתִּי֙ עָלָ֔יו וְנִתְפַּ֖שׂ בִּמְצוּדָתִ֑י וְהֵבֵאתִ֨י אֹת֤וֹ בָבֶ֙לָה֙ אֶ֣רֶץ כַּשְׂדִּ֔ים וְאוֹתָ֥הּ לֹֽא־יִרְאֶ֖ה וְשָׁ֥ם יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: I will spread My net over him, and he shall be caught in My snare. I will bring him to Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, but he shall not see it; and there he shall die.
Transliteration: ufarashetiy et-rishetiy alayv venitefash vimetsudatiy vehevetiy otvo vavelah erets khashediym vevotah lo-yireeh vesham yamut

Hebrew: וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר סְבִיבֹתָ֥יו עֶזְרֹ֛ה וְכׇל־אֲגַפָּ֖יו אֱזָרֶ֣ה לְכׇל־ר֑וּחַ וְחֶ֖רֶב אָרִ֥יק אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And all those around him, his helpers and all his troops, I will scatter in every direction; and I will unsheathe the sword after them.
Transliteration: vekhol asher seviyvotayv ezeroh vekhׇl-agafayv ezareh lekhׇl-rucha vecherev ariyk achareyhem

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בַּהֲפִיצִ֤י אוֹתָם֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם וְזֵרִיתִ֥י אוֹתָ֖ם בָּאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: Then, when I have scattered them among the nations and dispersed them through the countries, they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah vahafiytsiy votam vagvoyim vezeriytiy votam vaaratsvot

Hebrew: וְהוֹתַרְתִּ֤י מֵהֶם֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י מִסְפָּ֔ר מֵחֶ֖רֶב מֵרָעָ֣ב וּמִדָּ֑בֶר לְמַ֨עַן יְסַפְּר֜וּ אֶת־כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבֽוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם בַּגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣אוּ שָׁ֔ם וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But I will spare a few of them from the sword, from famine, and from pestilence, that they may recount all their abominable deeds among the nations to which they come; and they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>!
Transliteration: vehvotaretiy mehem aneshey misefar mecherev meraav umidaver lemaan yesaferu et-khׇl-tvoavvoteyhem vagvoyim asher-vau sham veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם לַחְמְךָ֖ בְּרַ֣עַשׁ תֹּאכֵ֑ל וּמֵימֶ֕יךָ בְּרׇגְזָ֥ה וּבִדְאָגָ֖ה תִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated: O mortal, eat your bread in trembling and drink your water in fear and anxiety.
Transliteration: ven-adam lachemekha veraash tokhel umeymeykha verׇgezah uvideagah tisheteh

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֶל־עַ֣ם הָאָ֡רֶץ כֹּֽה־אָמַר֩ אֲדֹנָ֨י יֱהֹוִ֜ה לְיוֹשְׁבֵ֤י יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ אֶל־אַדְמַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לַחְמָם֙ בִּדְאָגָ֣ה יֹאכֵ֔לוּ וּמֵימֵיהֶ֖ם בְּשִׁמָּמ֣וֹן יִשְׁתּ֑וּ לְמַ֜עַן תֵּשַׁ֤ם אַרְצָהּ֙ מִמְּלֹאָ֔הּ מֵחֲמַ֖ס כׇּֽל־הַיֹּשְׁבִ֥ים בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: And say to the people of the land: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem in the land of Israel: They shall eat their bread in anxiety and drink their water in desolation, because their land will be desolate of its multitudes on account of the lawlessness of all its inhabitants.
Transliteration: veamareta el-am haarets khoh-amar adonay yehovih leyvoshevey yerushala͏im el-ademat yisherael lachemam videagah yokhelu umeymeyhem veshimamvon yishetu lemaan tesham aretsah mimeloah mechamas khׇl-hayosheviym vah

Hebrew: וְהֶעָרִ֤ים הַנּֽוֹשָׁבוֹת֙ תֶּחֱרַ֔בְנָה וְהָאָ֖רֶץ שְׁמָמָ֣ה תִֽהְיֶ֑ה וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The inhabited towns shall be laid waste and the land shall become a desolation; then you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veheariym hanvoshavvot techeravenah vehaarets shemamah tiheyeh viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם מָֽה־הַמָּשָׁ֤ל הַזֶּה֙ לָכֶ֔ם עַל־אַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר יַֽאַרְכוּ֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וְאָבַ֖ד כׇּל־חָזֽוֹן׃
Translated: O mortal, what is this proverb that you have in the land of Israel, that you say, “The days grow many and every vision comes to naught?”
Transliteration: ven-adam mah-hamashal hazeh lakhem al-ademat yisherael lemor yaarekhu hayamiym veavad khׇl-chazvon

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן אֱמֹ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ הִשְׁבַּ֙תִּי֙ אֶת־הַמָּשָׁ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יִמְשְׁל֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ ע֖וֹד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֚י אִם־דַּבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם קָֽרְבוּ֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וּדְבַ֖ר כׇּל־חָזֽוֹן׃
Translated: Assuredly, say to them, Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will put an end to this proverb; it shall not be used in Israel anymore. Speak rather to them: The days draw near, and the fulfillment of every vision.
Transliteration: lakhen emor aleyhem khoh-amar adonay yehovih hishevatiy et-hamashal hazeh velo-yimeshelu otvo vod veyisherael khiy im-daver aleyhem karevu hayamiym udevar khׇl-chazvon

Hebrew: כִּ֠י לֹ֣א יִהְיֶ֥ה ע֛וֹד כׇּל־חֲז֥וֹן שָׁ֖וְא וּמִקְסַ֣ם חָלָ֑ק בְּת֖וֹךְ בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For there shall no longer be any false vision or soothing divination in the House of Israel.
Transliteration: khiy lo yiheyeh vod khׇl-chazvon shave umikesam chalak vetvokhe veyt yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲדַבֵּר֙ אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲדַבֵּ֤ר דָּבָר֙ וְיֵ֣עָשֶׂ֔ה לֹ֥א תִמָּשֵׁ֖ךְ ע֑וֹד כִּ֣י בִימֵיכֶ֞ם בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֗רִי אֲדַבֵּ֤ר דָּבָר֙ וַעֲשִׂיתִ֔יו נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But whenever I, G<small>OD</small>, speak what I speak, that word shall be fulfilled without any delay; in your days, O rebellious breed, I will fulfill every word I speak—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy aniy yehovah adaver et asher adaver davar veeiasheh lo timashekhe vod khiy viymeykhem veyt hameriy adaver davar vaashiytiyv neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם הִנֵּ֤ה בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֹֽמְרִ֔ים הֶחָז֛וֹן אֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא חֹזֶ֖ה לְיָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וּלְעִתִּ֥ים רְחוֹק֖וֹת ה֥וּא נִבָּֽא׃
Translated: See, O mortal, the House of Israel says, “The vision that he sees is far ahead, and he prophesies for the distant future.”
Transliteration: ven-adam hineh veyt-yisherael omeriym hechazvon asher-hu chozeh leyamiym raviym uleitiym rechvokvot hu niva

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן אֱמֹ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה לֹא־תִמָּשֵׁ֥ךְ ע֖וֹד כׇּל־דְּבָרָ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲדַבֵּ֤ר דָּבָר֙ וְיֵ֣עָשֶׂ֔ה נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Assuredly, say to them: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: There shall be no more delay; whenever I speak a word, that word shall be fulfilled—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lakhen emor aleyhem khoh amar adonay yehovih lo-timashekhe vod khׇl-devaray asher adaver davar veeiasheh neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הִנָּבֵ֛א אֶל־נְבִיאֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הַנִּבָּאִ֑ים וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ לִנְבִיאֵ֣י מִלִּבָּ֔ם שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: O mortal, prophesy against the prophets of Israel who prophesy; say to those who prophesy out of their own imagination: Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>!
Transliteration: ven-adam hinave el-neviyey yisherael hanivaiym veamareta lineviyey milivam shimeu devar-yehovah

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה ה֖וֹי עַל־הַנְּבִיאִ֣ים הַנְּבָלִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֹלְכִ֛ים אַחַ֥ר רוּחָ֖ם וּלְבִלְתִּ֥י רָאֽוּ׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Woe to the degenerate prophets, who follow their own fancy, without having had a vision!
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih hvoy al-haneviyiym hanevaliym asher holekhiym achar rucham uleviletiy rau

Hebrew: כְּשֻׁעָלִ֖ים בׇּחֳרָב֑וֹת נְבִיאֶ֥יךָ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הָיֽוּ׃
Translated: Your prophets, O Israel, have been like jackals among ruins.
Transliteration: kheshualiym vׇchoravvot neviyeykha yisherael hayu

Hebrew: לֹ֤א עֲלִיתֶם֙ בַּפְּרָצ֔וֹת וַתִּגְדְּר֥וּ גָדֵ֖ר עַל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לַעֲמֹ֥ד בַּמִּלְחָמָ֖ה בְּי֥וֹם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You did not enter the breaches and repair the walls for the House of Israel, that they might stand up in battle in the day of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lo aliytem vaferatsvot vatigederu gader al-veyt yisherael laamod vamilechamah veyvom yehovah

Hebrew: חָ֤זוּ שָׁוְא֙ וְקֶ֣סֶם כָּזָ֔ב הָאֹֽמְרִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֣א שְׁלָחָ֑ם וְיִחֲל֖וּ לְקַיֵּ֥ם דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: They prophesied falsehood and lying divination; they said, “Declares G<small>OD</small>,” when G<small>OD</small> did not send them, and then they waited for their word to be fulfilled.
Transliteration: chazu shave vekesem khazav haomeriym neum-yehovah vayhovah lo shelacham veyichalu lekayem davar

Hebrew: הֲל֤וֹא מַֽחֲזֵה־שָׁוְא֙ חֲזִיתֶ֔ם וּמִקְסַ֥ם כָּזָ֖ב אֲמַרְתֶּ֑ם וְאֹֽמְרִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַאֲנִ֖י לֹ֥א דִבַּֽרְתִּי׃ {ס}
Translated: It was false visions you prophesied and lying divination you uttered, saying, “Declares G<small>OD</small>,” when I had not spoken.
Transliteration: halvo machazeh-shave chaziytem umikesam khazav amaretem veomeriym neum-yehovah vaaniy lo divaretiy {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֚עַן דַּבֶּרְכֶ֣ם שָׁ֔וְא וַחֲזִיתֶ֖ם כָּזָ֑ב לָכֵן֙ הִנְנִ֣י אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because you speak falsehood and prophesy lies, assuredly, I will deal with you—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan daverekhem shave vachaziytem khazav lakhen hineniy aleykhem neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֣ה יָדִ֗י אֶֽל־הַנְּבִיאִ֞ים הַחֹזִ֣ים שָׁוְא֮ וְהַקֹּסְמִ֣ים כָּזָב֒ בְּס֧וֹד עַמִּ֣י לֹֽא־יִֽהְי֗וּ וּבִכְתָ֤ב בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֹ֣א יִכָּתֵ֔בוּ וְאֶל־אַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֣א יָבֹ֑אוּ וִידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֥י אֲנִ֖י אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: My hand will be against the prophets who prophesy falsehood and utter lying divination. They shall not remain in the assembly of My people, they shall not be inscribed in the lists of the House of Israel, and they shall not come back to the land of Israel. Thus shall you know that I am the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehayetah yadiy el-haneviyiym hachoziym shave vehakosemiym khazav vesvod amiy lo-yiheyu uvikhetav veyt-yisherael lo yikhatevu veel-ademat yisherael lo yavou viydaetem khiy aniy adonay yehovih

Hebrew: יַ֣עַן וּבְיַ֜עַן הִטְע֧וּ אֶת־עַמִּ֛י לֵאמֹ֥ר שָׁל֖וֹם וְאֵ֣ין שָׁל֑וֹם וְהוּא֙ בֹּ֣נֶה חַ֔יִץ וְהִנָּ֛ם טָחִ֥ים אֹת֖וֹ תָּפֵֽל׃
Translated: Inasmuch as they have misled My people, saying, “It is well,” when nothing is well, daubing with plaster the flimsy wall that the people were building,
Transliteration: yaan uveyaan hiteu et-amiy lemor shalvom veeyn shalvom vehu voneh chayiits vehinam tachiym otvo tafel

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֛ר אֶל־טָחֵ֥י תָפֵ֖ל וְיִפֹּ֑ל הָיָ֣ה ׀ גֶּ֣שֶׁם שׁוֹטֵ֗ף וְאַתֵּ֜נָה אַבְנֵ֤י אֶלְגָּבִישׁ֙ תִּפֹּ֔לְנָה וְר֥וּחַ סְעָר֖וֹת תְּבַקֵּֽעַ׃
Translated: say to those daubers of plaster: It shall collapse; a driving rain shall descend—and you, O great hailstones, shall fall—and a hurricane wind shall rend it.
Transliteration: emor el-tachey tafel veyifol hayah geshem shvotef veatenah aveney elegaviysh tifolenah verucha searvot tevakea

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֖ה נָפַ֣ל הַקִּ֑יר הֲלוֹא֙ יֵאָמֵ֣ר אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם אַיֵּ֥ה הַטִּ֖יחַ אֲשֶׁ֥ר טַחְתֶּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Then, when the wall collapses, you will be asked, “What became of the plaster you daubed on?”
Transliteration: vehineh nafal hakiyr halvo eiamer aleykhem ayeh hatiycha asher tachetem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וּבִקַּעְתִּ֥י רוּחַ־סְעָר֖וֹת בַּחֲמָתִ֑י וְגֶ֤שֶׁם שֹׁטֵף֙ בְּאַפִּ֣י יִֽהְיֶ֔ה וְאַבְנֵ֥י אֶלְגָּבִ֖ישׁ בְּחֵמָ֥ה לְכָלָֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: In My fury I will let loose hurricane winds; in My anger a driving rain shall descend, and great hailstones in destructive fury.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih uvikaetiy rucha-searvot vachamatiy vegeshem shotef veafiy yiheyeh veaveney elegaviysh vechemah lekhalah

Hebrew: וְהָ֨רַסְתִּ֜י אֶת־הַקִּ֨יר אֲשֶׁר־טַחְתֶּ֥ם תָּפֵ֛ל וְהִגַּעְתִּ֥יהוּ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְנִגְלָ֣ה יְסֹד֑וֹ וְנָֽפְלָה֙ וּכְלִיתֶ֣ם בְּתוֹכָ֔הּ וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will throw down the wall that you daubed with plaster, and I will raze it to the ground so that its foundation is exposed; and when it falls, you shall perish in its midst; then you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veharasetiy et-hakiyr asher-tachetem tafel vehigaetiyhu el-haarets venigelah yesodvo venafelah ukheliytem vetvokhah viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְכִלֵּיתִ֤י אֶת־חֲמָתִי֙ בַּקִּ֔יר וּבַטָּחִ֥ים אֹת֖וֹ תָּפֵ֑ל וְאֹמַ֤ר לָכֶם֙ אֵ֣ין הַקִּ֔יר וְאֵ֖ין הַטָּחִ֥ים אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: And when I have spent My fury upon the wall and upon those who daubed it with plaster, I will say to you: Gone is the wall and gone are its daubers,
Transliteration: vekhileytiy et-chamatiy vakiyr uvatachiym otvo tafel veomar lakhem eyn hakiyr veeyn hatachiym otvo

Hebrew: נְבִיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הַֽנִּבְּאִים֙ אֶל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְהַחֹזִ֥ים לָ֖הּ חֲז֣וֹן שָׁלֹ֑ם וְאֵ֣ין שָׁלֹ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: the prophets of Israel who prophesy about Jerusalem and see a vision of well-being for her when there is no well-being—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: neviyey yisherael haniveiym el-yerushala͏im vehachoziym lah chazvon shalom veeyn shalom neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם שִׂ֤ים פָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־בְּנ֣וֹת עַמְּךָ֔ הַמִּֽתְנַבְּא֖וֹת מִֽלִּבְּהֶ֑ן וְהִנָּבֵ֖א עֲלֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: And you, O mortal, set your face against the women of your people, who prophesy out of their own imagination. Prophesy against them
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam shiym faneykha el-venvot amekha hamitenavevot milivehen vehinave aleyhen

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֞ כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הוֹי֩ לִֽמְתַפְּר֨וֹת כְּסָת֜וֹת עַ֣ל ׀ כׇּל־אַצִּילֵ֣י יָדַ֗י וְעֹשׂ֧וֹת הַמִּסְפָּח֛וֹת עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ כׇּל־קוֹמָ֖ה לְצוֹדֵ֣ד נְפָשׁ֑וֹת הַנְּפָשׁוֹת֙ תְּצוֹדֵ֣דְנָה לְעַמִּ֔י וּנְפָשׁ֖וֹת לָכֶ֥נָה תְחַיֶּֽינָה׃
Translated: and say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Woe to those who sew pads on all arm-joints and make bonnets for the head of every person, in order to entrap! Can you hunt down lives among My people, while you preserve your own lives?
Transliteration: veamareta khoh-amar adonay yehovih hvoy limetafervot khesatvot al khׇl-atsiyley yaday veoshvot hamisefachvot al-rosh khׇl-kvomah letsvoded nefashvot hanefashvot tetsvodedenah leamiy unefashvot lakhenah techayeynah

Hebrew: וַתְּחַלֶּלְ֨נָה אֹתִ֜י אֶל־עַמִּ֗י בְּשַׁעֲלֵ֣י שְׂעֹרִים֮ וּבִפְת֣וֹתֵי לֶחֶם֒ לְהָמִ֤ית נְפָשׁוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־תְמוּתֶ֔נָה וּלְחַיּ֥וֹת נְפָשׁ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־תִֽחְיֶ֑ינָה בְּכַ֨זֶּבְכֶ֔ם לְעַמִּ֖י שֹׁמְעֵ֥י כָזָֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: You have profaned My name among My people in return for handfuls of barley and morsels of bread; you have announced the death of persons who will not die and the survival of persons who will not live—lying to My people, who listen to your lies.
Transliteration: vatechalelenah otiy el-amiy veshaaley sheoriym uvifetvotey lechem lehamiyt nefashvot asher lo-temutenah ulechayyvot nefashvot asher lo-ticheyeynah vekhazevekhem leamiy shomeey khazav {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנְנִ֤י אֶל־כִּסְּתוֹתֵיכֶ֙נָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַ֠תֵּ֠נָה מְצֹדְד֨וֹת שָׁ֤ם אֶת־הַנְּפָשׁוֹת֙ לְפֹ֣רְח֔וֹת וְקָרַעְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל זְרוֹעֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי֙ אֶת־הַנְּפָשׁ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם מְצֹדְד֥וֹת אֶת־נְפָשִׁ֖ים לְפֹרְחֹֽת׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deal with your pads, by which you hunt down lives like birds, and I will tear them from your arms and free the persons whose lives you hunt down like birds.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineniy el-khisetvoteykhenah asher atenah metsodedvot sham et-hanefashvot leforechvot vekaraetiy otam meal zervooteykhem veshilachetiy et-hanefashvot asher atem metsodedvot et-nefashiym leforechot

Hebrew: וְקָרַעְתִּ֞י אֶת־מִסְפְּחֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם וְהִצַּלְתִּ֤י אֶת־עַמִּי֙ מִיֶּדְכֶ֔ן וְלֹא־יִהְי֥וּ ע֛וֹד בְּיֶדְכֶ֖ן לִמְצוּדָ֑ה וִידַעְתֶּ֖ן כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will tear off your bonnets and rescue My people from your hands, and they shall no longer be prey in your hands; then you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vekaraetiy et-misefechoteykhem vehitsaletiy et-amiy miyedekhen velo-yiheyu vod veyedekhen limetsudah viydaeten khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: יַ֣עַן הַכְא֤וֹת לֵב־צַדִּיק֙ שֶׁ֔קֶר וַאֲנִ֖י לֹ֣א הִכְאַבְתִּ֑יו וּלְחַזֵּק֙ יְדֵ֣י רָשָׁ֔ע לְבִלְתִּי־שׁ֛וּב מִדַּרְכּ֥וֹ הָרָ֖ע לְהַחֲיֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Because you saddened the heart of the innocent with lies, when I would not inflict suffering on them, and encouraged the wicked not to repent of their evil ways and so gain life—
Transliteration: yaan hakhevot lev-tsadiyk sheker vaaniy lo hikheavetiyv ulechazek yedey rasha leviletiy-shuv midarekhvo hara lehachayotvo

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן שָׁ֚וְא לֹ֣א תֶחֱזֶ֔ינָה וְקֶ֖סֶם לֹא־תִקְסַ֣מְנָה ע֑וֹד וְהִצַּלְתִּ֤י אֶת־עַמִּי֙ מִיֶּדְכֶ֔ן וִידַעְתֶּ֖ן כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: assuredly, you shall no longer prophesy lies or practice divination! I will save My people from your hands, and you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lakhen shave lo techezeynah vekesem lo-tikesamenah vod vehitsaletiy et-amiy miyedekhen viydaeten khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּב֤וֹא אֵלַי֙ אֲנָשִׁ֔ים מִזִּקְנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ לְפָנָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: Certain elders of Israel came to me and sat down before me.
Transliteration: vayavvo elay anashiym mizikeney yisherael vayeshevu lefanay {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הֶעֱל֤וּ גִלּֽוּלֵיהֶם֙ עַל־לִבָּ֔ם וּמִכְשׁ֣וֹל עֲוֺנָ֔ם נָתְנ֖וּ נֹ֣כַח פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם הַאִדָּרֹ֥שׁ אִדָּרֵ֖שׁ לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: O mortal, these men have turned their thoughts upon their fetishes and set their minds upon the sin through which they stumbled: Shall I respond to their inquiry?
Transliteration: ven-adam haanashiym haeleh heelu giluleyhem al-livam umikheshvol avonam natenu nokhach feneyhem haidarosh idaresh lahem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן דַּבֵּר־א֠וֹתָ֠ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֨ אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אִ֣ישׁ אִ֣ישׁ מִבֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ יַעֲלֶ֨ה אֶת־גִּלּוּלָ֜יו אֶל־לִבּ֗וֹ וּמִכְשׁ֤וֹל עֲוֺנוֹ֙ יָשִׂים֙ נֹ֣כַח פָּנָ֔יו וּבָ֖א אֶל־הַנָּבִ֑יא אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה נַעֲנֵ֧יתִי ל֦וֹ (בה) [בָ֖א] בְּרֹ֥ב גִּלּוּלָֽיו׃
Translated: Now speak to them and tell them: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: If anyone at all of the House of Israel turns their thoughts upon their fetishes and sets their mind upon the sin through which they stumbled, and yet comes to the prophet, I, G<small>OD</small>, will respond as they come with their multitude of fetishes.
Transliteration: lakhen daver-votam veamareta aleyhem khoh-amar adonay yehovih iysh iysh miveyt yisherael asher yaaleh et-gilulayv el-livvo umikheshvol avonvo yashiym nokhach fanayv uva el-hanaviy aniy yehovah naaneytiy lvo (vh) [va] verov gilulayv

Hebrew: לְמַ֛עַן תְּפֹ֥שׂ אֶת־בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּלִבָּ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָזֹ֙רוּ֙ מֵֽעָלַ֔י בְּגִלּוּלֵיהֶ֖ם כֻּלָּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus I will hold the House of Israel to account for their thoughts, because they have all been estranged from Me through their fetishes.
Transliteration: lemaan tefosh et-veyt-yisherael velivam asher nazoru mealay vegiluleyhem khulam {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן אֱמֹ֣ר ׀ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה שׁ֣וּבוּ וְהָשִׁ֔יבוּ מֵעַ֖ל גִּלּוּלֵיכֶ֑ם וּמֵעַ֥ל כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם הָשִׁ֥יבוּ פְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Now say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Repent, and turn back from your fetishes and turn your minds away from all your abominations.
Transliteration: lakhen emor el-veyt yisherael khoh amar adonay yehovih shuvu vehashiyvu meal giluleykhem umeal khׇl-tvoavoteykhem hashiyvu feneykhem

Hebrew: כִּי֩ אִ֨ישׁ אִ֜ישׁ מִבֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּמֵהַגֵּר֮ אֲשֶׁר־יָג֣וּר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְיִנָּזֵ֣ר מֵאַחֲרַ֗י וְיַ֤עַל גִּלּוּלָיו֙ אֶל־לִבּ֔וֹ וּמִכְשׁ֣וֹל עֲוֺנ֔וֹ יָשִׂ֖ים נֹ֣כַח פָּנָ֑יו וּבָ֤א אֶל־הַנָּבִיא֙ לִדְרׇשׁ־ל֣וֹ בִ֔י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה נַעֲנֶה־לּ֖וֹ בִּֽי׃
Translated: For if anyone at all of the House of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell in Israel, breaks away from Me and turns their thoughts upon their fetishes and sets their mind upon the sins through which they stumbled, and then goes to the prophet to inquire of Me through him, I, G<small>OD</small>, will respond directly.
Transliteration: khiy iysh iysh miveyt yisherael umehager asher-yagur veyisherael veyinazer meacharay veyaal gilulayv el-livvo umikheshvol avonvo yashiym nokhach fanayv uva el-hanaviy liderׇsh-lvo viy aniy yehovah naaneh-lvo viy

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֨י פָנַ֜י בָּאִ֣ישׁ הַה֗וּא וַהֲשִׂמֹתִ֙יהוּ֙ לְא֣וֹת וְלִמְשָׁלִ֔ים וְהִכְרַתִּ֖יו מִתּ֣וֹךְ עַמִּ֑י וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: I will set My face against that party and make them a sign and a byword, and I will cut them off from the midst of My people. Then you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venatatiy fanay vaiysh hahu vahashimotiyhu levot velimeshaliym vehikheratiyv mitvokhe amiy viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וְהַנָּבִ֤יא כִֽי־יְפֻתֶּה֙ וְדִבֶּ֣ר דָּבָ֔ר אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ פִּתֵּ֔יתִי אֵ֖ת הַנָּבִ֣יא הַה֑וּא וְנָטִ֤יתִי אֶת־יָדִי֙ עָלָ֔יו וְהִ֨שְׁמַדְתִּ֔יו מִתּ֖וֹךְ עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And if a prophet is seduced and does speak a word [to such people], it was I, G<small>OD</small>, who seduced that prophet; I will stretch out My hand and destroy that prophet from among My people Israel.
Transliteration: vehanaviy khiy-yefuteh vediver davar aniy yehovah fiteytiy et hanaviy hahu venatiytiy et-yadiy alayv vehishemadetiyv mitvokhe amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וְנָשְׂא֖וּ עֲוֺנָ֑ם כַּעֲוֺן֙ הַדֹּרֵ֔שׁ כַּעֲוֺ֥ן הַנָּבִ֖יא יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Thus they shall bear their punishment: The punishment of the inquirer and the punishment of the prophet shall be the same,
Transliteration: venasheu avonam khaavon hadoresh khaavon hanaviy yiheyeh

Hebrew: לְ֠מַ֠עַן לֹא־יִתְע֨וּ ע֤וֹד בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵֽאַחֲרַ֔י וְלֹא־יִטַּמְּא֥וּ ע֖וֹד בְּכׇל־פִּשְׁעֵיהֶ֑ם וְהָיוּ־לִ֣י לְעָ֗ם וַאֲנִי֙ אֶהְיֶ֤ה לָהֶם֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: so that the House of Israel may never again stray from Me and defile itself with all its transgressions. Then they shall be My people and I will be their God—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lemaan lo-yiteu vod veyt-yisherael meacharay velo-yitameu vod vekhׇl-fisheeyhem vehayu-liy leam vaaniy eheyeh lahem lelohiym neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם אֶ֚רֶץ כִּ֤י תֶֽחֱטָא־לִי֙ לִמְעׇל־מַ֔עַל וְנָטִ֤יתִי יָדִי֙ עָלֶ֔יהָ וְשָׁבַ֥רְתִּי לָ֖הּ מַטֵּה־לָ֑חֶם וְהִשְׁלַחְתִּי־בָ֣הּ רָעָ֔ב וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י מִמֶּ֖נָּה אָדָ֥ם וּבְהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: O mortal, if a land were to sin against Me and commit a trespass, and I stretched out My hand against it and broke its staff of bread, and sent famine against it and cut off human and animal from it,
Transliteration: ven-adam erets khiy techeta-liy limeׇl-maal venatiytiy yadiy aleyha veshavaretiy lah mateh-lachem vehishelachetiy-vah raav vehikheratiy mimenah adam uvehemah

Hebrew: וְ֠הָי֠וּ שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ בְּתוֹכָ֔הּ נֹ֖חַ (דנאל) [דָּנִיֵּ֣אל] וְאִיּ֑וֹב הֵ֤מָּה בְצִדְקָתָם֙ יְנַצְּל֣וּ נַפְשָׁ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: even if these three men—Noah, Daniel, and Job—should be in it, they would by their righteousness save only themselves—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehayu sheloshet haanashiym haeleh vetvokhah nocha (dnl) [daniyel] veiyyvov hemah vetsidekatam yenatselu nafesham neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: לוּ־חַיָּ֥ה רָעָ֛ה אַעֲבִ֥יר בָּאָ֖רֶץ וְשִׁכְּלָ֑תָּה וְהָיְתָ֤ה שְׁמָמָה֙ מִבְּלִ֣י עוֹבֵ֔ר מִפְּנֵ֖י הַחַיָּֽה׃
Translated: Or, if I were to send wild beasts to roam the land and they depopulated it, and it became a desolation with none passing through it because of the beasts,
Transliteration: lu-chayah raah aaviyr vaarets veshikhelatah vehayetah shemamah miveliy vover mifeney hachayah

Hebrew: שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵלֶּה֮ בְּתוֹכָהּ֒ חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה אִם־בָּנִ֥ים וְאִם־בָּנ֖וֹת יַצִּ֑ילוּ הֵ֤מָּה לְבַדָּם֙ יִנָּצֵ֔לוּ וְהָאָ֖רֶץ תִּהְיֶ֥ה שְׁמָמָֽה׃
Translated: as I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—those three men in it would save neither sons nor daughters; they alone would be saved, but the land would become a desolation.
Transliteration: sheloshet haanashiym haeleh vetvokhah chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-vaniym veim-vanvot yatsiylu hemah levadam yinatselu vehaarets tiheyeh shemamah

Hebrew: א֛וֹ חֶ֥רֶב אָבִ֖יא עַל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֑יא וְאָמַרְתִּ֗י חֶ֚רֶב תַּעֲבֹ֣ר בָּאָ֔רֶץ וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י מִמֶּ֖נָּה אָדָ֥ם וּבְהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: Or, if I were to bring the sword upon that land and say, “Let a sword sweep through the land so that I may cut off from it human and animal,”
Transliteration: vo cherev aviy al-haarets hahiy veamaretiy cherev taavor vaarets vehikheratiy mimenah adam uvehemah

Hebrew: וּשְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵ֘לֶּה֮ בְּתוֹכָהּ֒ חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה לֹ֥א יַצִּ֖ילוּ בָּנִ֣ים וּבָנ֑וֹת כִּ֛י הֵ֥ם לְבַדָּ֖ם יִנָּצֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: if those three men should be in it, as I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—they would save neither sons nor daughters, but they alone would be saved.
Transliteration: usheloshet haanashiym haeleh vetvokhah chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih lo yatsiylu vaniym uvanvot khiy hem levadam yinatselu

Hebrew: א֛וֹ דֶּ֥בֶר אֲשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֑יא וְשָׁפַכְתִּ֨י חֲמָתִ֤י עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ בְּדָ֔ם לְהַכְרִ֥ית מִמֶּ֖נָּה אָדָ֥ם וּבְהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: Or, if I let loose a pestilence against that land, and poured out My fury upon it in blood, cutting off from it human and animal,
Transliteration: vo dever ashalach el-haarets hahiy veshafakhetiy chamatiy aleyha vedam lehakheriyt mimenah adam uvehemah

Hebrew: וְנֹ֨חַ (דנאל) [דָּנִיֵּ֣אל] וְאִיּוֹב֮ בְּתוֹכָהּ֒ חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה אִם־בֵּ֥ן אִם־בַּ֖ת יַצִּ֑ילוּ הֵ֥מָּה בְצִדְקָתָ֖ם יַצִּ֥ילוּ נַפְשָֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated: should Noah, Daniel, and Job be in it, as I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—they would save neither son nor daughter; they would save themselves alone by their righteousness.
Transliteration: venocha (dnl) [daniyel] veiyyvov vetvokhah chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-ven im-vat yatsiylu hemah vetsidekatam yatsiylu nafesham {f}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ כֹ֨ה אָמַ֜ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אַ֣ף כִּֽי־אַרְבַּ֣עַת שְׁפָטַ֣י <small>׀</small> הָרָעִ֡ים חֶ֠רֶב וְרָעָ֞ב וְחַיָּ֤ה רָעָה֙ וָדֶ֔בֶר שִׁלַּ֖חְתִּי אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לְהַכְרִ֥ית מִמֶּ֖נָּה אָדָ֥ם וּבְהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: How much less [should any escape] now that I have let loose against Jerusalem all four of My terrible punishments—the sword, famine, wild beasts, and pestilence—to cut off human and animal from it!
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih af khiy-arevaat shefatay <small></small> haraiym cherev veraav vechayah raah vadever shilachetiy el-yerushala͏im lehakheriyt mimenah adam uvehemah

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה נֽוֹתְרָה־בָּ֜הּ פְּלֵטָ֗ה הַֽמּוּצָאִים֮ בָּנִ֣ים וּבָנוֹת֒ הִנָּם֙ יוֹצְאִ֣ים אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וּרְאִיתֶ֥ם אֶת־דַּרְכָּ֖ם וְאֶת־עֲלִילוֹתָ֑ם וְנִחַמְתֶּ֗ם עַל־הָרָעָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֵבֵ֙אתִי֙ עַל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵבֵ֖אתִי עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Yet there are survivors left of it, sons and daughters who are being brought out. They are coming out to you; and when you see their ways and their deeds, you will be consoled for the disaster that I brought on Jerusalem, for all that I brought on it.
Transliteration: vehineh nvoterah-vah feletah hamutsaiym vaniym uvanvot hinam yvotseiym aleykhem ureiytem et-darekham veet-aliylvotam venichametem al-haraah asher hevetiy al-yerushala͏im et khׇl-asher hevetiy aleyha

Hebrew: וְנִחֲמ֣וּ אֶתְכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־תִרְא֥וּ אֶת־דַּרְכָּ֖ם וְאֶת־עֲלִילוֹתָ֑ם וִידַעְתֶּ֗ם כִּי֩ לֹ֨א חִנָּ֤ם עָשִׂ֙יתִי֙ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֣יתִי בָ֔הּ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: You will be consoled through them, when you see their ways and their deeds and realize that not without cause did I do all that I did in it—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venichamu etekhem khiy-tireu et-darekham veet-aliylvotam viydaetem khiy lo chinam ashiytiy et khׇl-asher-ashiytiy vah neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם מַה־יִּהְיֶ֥ה עֵץ־הַגֶּ֖פֶן מִכׇּל־עֵ֑ץ הַזְּמוֹרָ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה בַּעֲצֵ֥י הַיָּֽעַר׃
Translated: O mortal, how is the wood of the grapevine better than the wood of any branch to be found among the trees of the forest?
Transliteration: ven-adam mah-yiheyeh ets-hagefen mikhׇl-ets hazemvorah asher hayah vaatsey hayaar

Hebrew: הֲיֻקַּ֤ח מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ עֵ֔ץ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת לִמְלָאכָ֑ה אִם־יִקְח֤וּ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ יָתֵ֔ד לִתְל֥וֹת עָלָ֖יו כׇּל־כֶּֽלִי׃
Translated: Can wood be taken from it for use in any work? Can one take a peg from it to hang any vessel on?
Transliteration: hayukach mimenu ets laashvot limelakhah im-yikechu mimenu yated litelvot alayv khׇl-kheliy

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה לָאֵ֖שׁ נִתַּ֣ן לְאׇכְלָ֑ה אֵת֩ שְׁנֵ֨י קְצוֹתָ֜יו אָכְלָ֤ה הָאֵשׁ֙ וְתוֹכ֣וֹ נָחָ֔ר הֲיִצְלַ֖ח לִמְלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: Now suppose it was thrown into the fire as fuel and the fire consumed its two ends and its middle was charred—is it good for any use?
Transliteration: hineh laesh nitan leׇkhelah et sheney ketsvotayv akhelah haesh vetvokhvo nachar hayitselach limelakhah

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֙ בִּֽהְיוֹת֣וֹ תָמִ֔ים לֹ֥א יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה לִמְלָאכָ֑ה אַ֣ף כִּי־אֵ֤שׁ אֲכָלַ֙תְהוּ֙ וַיֵּחָ֔ר וְנַעֲשָׂ֥ה ע֖וֹד לִמְלָאכָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Even when it was whole it could not be used for anything; how much less when fire has consumed it and it is charred! Can it still be used for anything?
Transliteration: hineh viheyvotvo tamiym lo eiasheh limelakhah af khiy-esh akhalatehu vayechar venaashah vod limelakhah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עֵץ־הַגֶּ֙פֶן֙ בְּעֵ֣ץ הַיַּ֔עַר אֲשֶׁר־נְתַתִּ֥יו לָאֵ֖שׁ לְאׇכְלָ֑ה כֵּ֣ן נָתַ֔תִּי אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Like the wood of the grapevine among the trees of the forest, which I have designated to be fuel for fire, so will I treat the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih khaasher ets-hagefen veets hayaar asher-netatiyv laesh leׇkhelah khen natatiy et-yoshevey yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־פָּנַי֙ בָּהֶ֔ם מֵהָאֵ֣שׁ יָצָ֔אוּ וְהָאֵ֖שׁ תֹּאכְלֵ֑ם וִֽידַעְתֶּם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּשׂוּמִ֥י אֶת־פָּנַ֖י בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: I will set My face against them; they escaped from fire, but fire shall consume them. When I set my face against them, you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-fanay vahem mehaesh yatsau vehaesh tokhelem viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah veshumiy et-fanay vahem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ שְׁמָמָ֑ה יַ֚עַן מָ֣עֲלוּ מַ֔עַל נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will make the land a desolation, because they committed trespass—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-haarets shemamah yaan maalu maal neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הוֹדַ֥ע אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אֶת־תּוֹעֲבֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: O mortal, proclaim Jerusalem’s abominations to her,
Transliteration: ven-adam hvoda et-yerushala͏im et-tvoavoteyha

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֞ כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ לִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם מְכֹרֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ וּמֹ֣לְדֹתַ֔יִךְ מֵאֶ֖רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֑י אָבִ֥יךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֖י וְאִמֵּ֥ךְ חִתִּֽית׃
Translated: and say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> to Jerusalem: By origin and birth you are from the land of the Canaanites—your father was an Amorite and your mother a Hittite.
Transliteration: veamareta khoh-amar adonay yehovih liyrushala͏im mekhorotayiikhe umoledotayiikhe meerets hakhenaaniy aviykhe haemoriy veimekhe chitiyt

Hebrew: וּמוֹלְדוֹתַ֗יִךְ בְּי֨וֹם הוּלֶּ֤דֶת אוֹתָךְ֙ לֹא־כׇרַּ֣ת שׇׁרֵּ֔ךְ וּבְמַ֥יִם לֹא־רֻחַ֖צְתְּ לְמִשְׁעִ֑י וְהׇמְלֵ֙חַ֙ לֹ֣א הֻמְלַ֔חַתְּ וְהׇחְתֵּ֖ל לֹ֥א חֻתָּֽלְתְּ׃
Translated: As for your birth, when you were born your navel cord was not cut, and you were not bathed in water to smooth you; you were not rubbed with salt, nor were you swaddled.
Transliteration: umvoledvotayiikhe veyvom huledet votakhe lo-khׇrat shׇrekhe uvemayiim lo-ruchatsete lemisheiy vehׇmelecha lo humelachate vehׇchetel lo chutalete

Hebrew: לֹא־חָ֨סָה עָלַ֜יִךְ עַ֗יִן לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לָ֛ךְ אַחַ֥ת מֵאֵ֖לֶּה לְחֻמְלָ֣ה עָלָ֑יִךְ וַֽתֻּשְׁלְכִ֞י אֶל־פְּנֵ֤י הַשָּׂדֶה֙ בְּגֹ֣עַל נַפְשֵׁ֔ךְ בְּי֖וֹם הֻלֶּ֥דֶת אֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: No one pitied you enough to do any one of these things for you out of compassion for you; on the day you were born, you were left lying, rejected, in the open field.
Transliteration: lo-chasah alayiikhe ayiin laashvot lakhe achat meeleh lechumelah alayiikhe vatushelekhiy el-feney hashadeh vegoal nafeshekhe veyvom huledet otakhe

Hebrew: וָאֶעֱבֹ֤ר עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ וָֽאֶרְאֵ֔ךְ מִתְבּוֹסֶ֖סֶת בְּדָמָ֑יִךְ וָאֹ֤מַר לָךְ֙ בְּדָמַ֣יִךְ חֲיִ֔י וָאֹ֥מַר לָ֖ךְ בְּדָמַ֥יִךְ חֲיִֽי׃
Translated: When I passed by you and saw you wallowing in your blood, I said to you: “Live despite your blood.” Yea, I said to you: “Live despite your blood.”
Transliteration: vaeevor alayiikhe vaereekhe mitevvoseset vedamayiikhe vaomar lakhe vedamayiikhe chayiy vaomar lakhe vedamayiikhe chayiy

Hebrew: רְבָבָ֗ה כְּצֶ֤מַח הַשָּׂדֶה֙ נְתַתִּ֔יךְ וַתִּרְבִּי֙ וַֽתִּגְדְּלִ֔י וַתָּבֹ֖אִי בַּעֲדִ֣י עֲדָיִ֑ים שָׁדַ֤יִם נָכֹ֙נוּ֙ וּשְׂעָרֵ֣ךְ צִמֵּ֔חַ וְאַ֖תְּ עֵרֹ֥ם וְעֶרְיָֽה׃
Translated:
I let you grow like the plants of the field; and you continued to grow up until you attained to womanhood, until your breasts became firm and your hair sprouted.
You were still naked and bare
Transliteration: revavah khetsemach hashadeh netatiykhe vatireviy vatigedeliy vatavoiy vaadiy adayiym shadayiim nakhonu ushearekhe tsimecha veate erom veereyah

Hebrew: וָאֶעֱבֹ֨ר עָלַ֜יִךְ וָאֶרְאֵ֗ךְ וְהִנֵּ֤ה עִתֵּךְ֙ עֵ֣ת דֹּדִ֔ים וָאֶפְרֹ֤שׂ כְּנָפִי֙ עָלַ֔יִךְ וָאֲכַסֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתֵ֑ךְ וָאֶשָּׁ֣בַֽע לָ֠ךְ וָאָב֨וֹא בִבְרִ֜ית אֹתָ֗ךְ נְאֻ֛ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה וַתִּֽהְיִי־לִֽי׃
Translated: when I passed by you [again] and saw that your time for love had arrived. So I spread My robe over you and covered your nakedness, and I entered into a covenant with you by oath—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>; thus you became Mine.
Transliteration: vaeevor alayiikhe vaereekhe vehineh itekhe et dodiym vaeferosh khenafiy alayiikhe vaakhaseh erevatekhe vaeshava lakhe vaavvo viveriyt otakhe neum adonay yehovih vatiheyiy-liy

Hebrew: וָאֶרְחָצֵ֣ךְ בַּמַּ֔יִם וָאֶשְׁטֹ֥ף דָּמַ֖יִךְ מֵעָלָ֑יִךְ וָאֲסֻכֵ֖ךְ בַּשָּֽׁמֶן׃
Translated: I bathed you in water, and washed the blood off you, and anointed you with oil.
Transliteration: vaerechatsekhe vamayiim vaeshetof damayiikhe mealayiikhe vaasukhekhe vashamen

Hebrew: וָאַלְבִּישֵׁ֣ךְ רִקְמָ֔ה וָאֶנְעֲלֵ֖ךְ תָּ֑חַשׁ וָאֶחְבְּשֵׁ֣ךְ בַּשֵּׁ֔שׁ וַאֲכַסֵּ֖ךְ מֶֽשִׁי׃
Translated: I clothed you with embroidered garments, and gave you sandals of dolphin leather to wear, and wound fine linen about your head, and dressed you in silks.
Transliteration: vaaleviyshekhe rikemah vaenealekhe tachash vaecheveshekhe vashesh vaakhasekhe meshiy

Hebrew: וָאֶעְדֵּ֖ךְ עֶ֑דִי וָאֶתְּנָ֤ה צְמִידִים֙ עַל־יָדַ֔יִךְ וְרָבִ֖יד עַל־גְּרוֹנֵֽךְ׃
Translated: I decked you out in finery and put bracelets on your arms and a chain around your neck.
Transliteration: vaeedekhe ediy vaetenah tsemiydiym al-yadayiikhe veraviyd al-gervonekhe

Hebrew: וָ֥אֶתֵּֽן־נֶ֙זֶם֙ עַל־אַפֵּ֔ךְ וַעֲגִילִ֖ים עַל־אׇזְנָ֑יִךְ וַעֲטֶ֥רֶת תִּפְאֶ֖רֶת בְּרֹאשֵֽׁךְ׃
Translated: I put a ring in your nose, and earrings in your ears, and a splendid crown on your head.
Transliteration: vaeten-nezem al-afekhe vaagiyliym al-ׇzenayiikhe vaateret tifeeret veroshekhe

Hebrew: וַתַּעְדִּ֞י זָהָ֣ב וָכֶ֗סֶף וּמַלְבּוּשֵׁךְ֙ (ששי) [שֵׁ֤שׁ] וָמֶ֙שִׁי֙ וְרִקְמָ֔ה סֹ֧לֶת וּדְבַ֛שׁ וָשֶׁ֖מֶן (אכלתי) [אָכָ֑לְתְּ] וַתִּ֙יפִי֙ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד וַֽתִּצְלְחִ֖י לִמְלוּכָֽה׃
Translated: You adorned yourself with gold and silver, and your apparel was of fine linen, silk, and embroidery. Your food was choice flour, honey, and oil. You grew more and more beautiful, and became fit for royalty.
Transliteration: vataediy zahav vakhesef umalevushekhe (shshy) [shesh] vameshiy verikemah solet udevash vashemen (khlty) [akhalete] vatiyfiy vimeod meod vatitselechiy limelukhah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צֵא לָ֥ךְ שֵׁ֛ם בַּגּוֹיִ֖ם בְּיׇפְיֵ֑ךְ כִּ֣י ׀ כָּלִ֣יל ה֗וּא בַּהֲדָרִי֙ אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי עָלַ֔יִךְ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: Your beauty won you fame among the nations, for it was perfected through the splendor that I set upon you—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayetse lakhe shem vagvoyim veyׇfeeikhe khiy khaliyl hu vahadariy asher-shametiy alayiikhe neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וַתִּבְטְחִ֣י בְיׇפְיֵ֔ךְ וַתִּזְנִ֖י עַל־שְׁמֵ֑ךְ וַתִּשְׁפְּכִ֧י אֶת־תַּזְנוּתַ֛יִךְ עַל־כׇּל־עוֹבֵ֖ר לוֹ־יֶֽהִי׃
Translated: But confident in your beauty and fame, you played the whore: you lavished your favors on every passerby; they were his.
Transliteration: vativetechiy veyׇfeeikhe vatizeniy al-shemekhe vatishefekhiy et-tazenutayiikhe al-khׇl-vover lvo-yehiy

Hebrew: וַתִּקְחִ֣י מִבְּגָדַ֗יִךְ וַתַּֽעֲשִׂי־לָךְ֙ בָּמ֣וֹת טְלֻא֔וֹת וַתִּזְנִ֖י עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם לֹ֥א בָא֖וֹת וְלֹ֥א יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: You even took some of your cloths and made yourself tapestried platforms and fornicated on them—not in the future; not in time to come.
Transliteration: vatikechiy mivegadayiikhe vataashiy-lakhe vamvot teluvot vatizeniy aleyhem lo vavot velo yiheyeh

Hebrew: וַתִּקְחִ֞י כְּלֵ֣י תִפְאַרְתֵּ֗ךְ מִזְּהָבִ֤י וּמִכַּסְפִּי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תִּי לָ֔ךְ וַתַּעֲשִׂי־לָ֖ךְ צַלְמֵ֣י זָכָ֑ר וַתִּזְנִי־בָֽם׃
Translated: You took your beautiful things, made of the gold and silver that I had given you, and you made yourself phallic images and fornicated with them.
Transliteration: vatikechiy kheley tifearetekhe mizehaviy umikhasefiy asher natatiy lakhe vataashiy-lakhe tsalemey zakhar vatizeniy-vam

Hebrew: וַתִּקְחִ֛י אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י רִקְמָתֵ֖ךְ וַתְּכַסִּ֑ים וְשַׁמְנִי֙ וּקְטׇרְתִּ֔י (נתתי) [נָתַ֖תְּ] לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: You took your embroidered cloths to cover them; and you set My oil and My incense before them.
Transliteration: vatikechiy et-vigedey rikematekhe vatekhasiym veshameniy uketׇretiy (ntty) [natate] lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וְלַחְמִי֩ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֨תִּי לָ֜ךְ סֹ֣לֶת וָשֶׁ֤מֶן וּדְבַשׁ֙ הֶאֱכַלְתִּ֔יךְ וּנְתַתִּ֧יהוּ לִפְנֵיהֶ֛ם לְרֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ וַיֶּ֑הִי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: The food that I had given you—the choice flour, the oil, and the honey that I had provided for you to eat—you set it before them for a pleasing odor. And so it went—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velachemiy asher-natatiy lakhe solet vashemen udevash heekhaletiykhe unetatiyhu lifeneyhem lereycha niychocha vayehiy neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וַתִּקְחִ֞י אֶת־בָּנַ֤יִךְ וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָלַ֣דְתְּ לִ֔י וַתִּזְבָּחִ֥ים לָהֶ֖ם לֶאֱכ֑וֹל הַמְעַ֖ט (מתזנותך) [מִתַּזְנוּתָֽיִךְ]׃
Translated: You even took the sons and daughters that you bore to Me and sacrificed them to those [images] as food—as if your whorings were not enough,
Transliteration: vatikechiy et-vanayiikhe veet-venvotayiikhe asher yaladete liy vatizevachiym lahem leekhvol hameat (mtznvtkh) [mitazenutayiikhe]

Hebrew: וַֽתִּשְׁחֲטִ֖י אֶת־בָּנָ֑י וַֽתִּתְּנִ֔ים בְּהַעֲבִ֥יר אוֹתָ֖ם לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: you slaughtered My children and presented them as offerings to them!
Transliteration: vatishechatiy et-vanay vatiteniym vehaaviyr votam lahem

Hebrew: וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ וְתַזְנֻתַ֔יִךְ לֹ֥א (זכרתי) [זָכַ֖רְתְּ] אֶת־יְמֵ֣י נְעוּרָ֑יִךְ בִּֽהְיוֹתֵךְ֙ עֵירֹ֣ם וְעֶרְיָ֔ה מִתְבּוֹסֶ֥סֶת בְּדָמֵ֖ךְ הָיִֽית׃
Translated: In all your abominations and whorings, you did not remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and bare, and lay wallowing in your blood.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-tvoavotayiikhe vetazenutayiikhe lo (zkhrty) [zakharete] et-yemey neurayiikhe viheyvotekhe eyrom veereyah mitevvoseset vedamekhe hayiyt

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י אַחֲרֵ֖י כׇּל־רָעָתֵ֑ךְ א֣וֹי א֣וֹי לָ֔ךְ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: After all your wickedness (woe, woe to you!)—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey khׇl-raatekhe voy voy lakhe neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וַתִּבְנִי־לָ֖ךְ גָּ֑ב וַתַּעֲשִׂי־לָ֥ךְ רָמָ֖ה בְּכׇל־רְחֽוֹב׃
Translated: you built yourself an eminence and made yourself a mound in every square.
Transliteration: vativeniy-lakhe gav vataashiy-lakhe ramah vekhׇl-rechvov

Hebrew: אֶל־כׇּל־רֹ֣אשׁ דֶּ֗רֶךְ בָּנִית֙ רָמָתֵ֔ךְ וַתְּתַֽעֲבִי֙ אֶת־יׇפְיֵ֔ךְ וַתְּפַשְּׂקִ֥י אֶת־רַגְלַ֖יִךְ לְכׇל־עוֹבֵ֑ר וַתַּרְבִּ֖י אֶת־[תַּזְנוּתָֽיִךְ] (תזנותך)׃
Translated: You built your mound at every crossroad; and you sullied your beauty and spread your legs to every passerby, and you multiplied your whoredoms.
Transliteration: el-khׇl-rosh derekhe vaniyt ramatekhe vatetaaviy et-yׇfeeikhe vatefashekiy et-ragelayiikhe lekhׇl-vover vatareviy et-[tazenutayiikhe] (tznvtkh)

Hebrew: וַתִּזְנִ֧י אֶל־בְּנֵי־מִצְרַ֛יִם שְׁכֵנַ֖יִךְ גִּדְלֵ֣י בָשָׂ֑ר וַתַּרְבִּ֥י אֶת־תַּזְנֻתֵ֖ךְ לְהַכְעִיסֵֽנִי׃
Translated: You played the whore with your neighbors, the lustful Egyptians—you multiplied your whoredoms to anger Me.
Transliteration: vatizeniy el-veney-mitserayiim shekhenayiikhe gideley vashar vatareviy et-tazenutekhe lehakheiyseniy

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה נָטִ֤יתִי יָדִי֙ עָלַ֔יִךְ וָאֶגְרַ֖ע חֻקֵּ֑ךְ וָאֶתְּנֵ֞ךְ בְּנֶ֤פֶשׁ שֹׂנְאוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ בְּנ֣וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים הַנִּכְלָמ֖וֹת מִדַּרְכֵּ֥ךְ זִמָּֽה׃
Translated: Now, I will stretch out My arm against you and withhold your maintenance; and I will surrender you to the will of your enemies, the Philistine women, who are shocked by your lewd behavior.
Transliteration: vehineh natiytiy yadiy alayiikhe vaegera chukekhe vaetenekhe venefesh shonevotayiikhe venvot felishetiym hanikhelamvot midarekhekhe zimah

Hebrew: וַתִּזְנִי֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י אַשּׁ֔וּר מִבִּלְתִּ֖י שׇׂבְעָתֵ֑ךְ וַתִּזְנִ֕ים וְגַ֖ם לֹ֥א שָׂבָֽעַתְּ׃
Translated: In your insatiable lust you also played the whore with the Assyrians; you played the whore with them, but were still unsated.
Transliteration: vatizeniy el-veney ashur miviletiy shׇveatekhe vatizeniym vegam lo shavaate

Hebrew: וַתַּרְבִּ֧י אֶת־תַּזְנוּתֵ֛ךְ אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנַ֖עַן כַּשְׂדִּ֑ימָה וְגַם־בְּזֹ֖את לֹ֥א שָׂבָֽעַתְּ׃
Translated: You multiplied your whoredoms with Chaldea, that land of traders; yet even with this you were not satisfied.
Transliteration: vatareviy et-tazenutekhe el-erets khenaan khashediymah vegam-vezot lo shavaate

Hebrew: מָ֤ה אֲמֻלָה֙ לִבָּתֵ֔ךְ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה בַּֽעֲשׂוֹתֵךְ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֔לֶּה מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה אִשָּֽׁה־זוֹנָ֖ה שַׁלָּֽטֶת׃
Translated: How sick was your heart—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—when you did all those things, the acts of a self-willed whore,
Transliteration: mah amulah livatekhe neum adonay yehovih vaashvotekhe et-khׇl-eleh maasheh ishah-zvonah shalatet

Hebrew: בִּבְנוֹתַ֤יִךְ גַּבֵּךְ֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ כׇּל־דֶּ֔רֶךְ וְרָמָתֵ֥ךְ (עשיתי) [עָשִׂ֖ית] בְּכׇל־רְח֑וֹב וְלֹא־[הָיִ֥ית] (הייתי) כַּזּוֹנָ֖ה לְקַלֵּ֥ס אֶתְנָֽן׃
Translated: building your eminence at every crossroad and setting your mound in every square! Yet you were not like a prostitute, for you spurned fees;
Transliteration: vivenvotayiikhe gavekhe verosh khׇl-derekhe veramatekhe (shyty) [ashiyt] vekhׇl-rechvov velo-[hayiyt] (hyyty) khazvonah lekales etenan

Hebrew: הָאִשָּׁ֖ה הַמְּנָאָ֑פֶת תַּ֣חַת אִישָׁ֔הּ תִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־זָרִֽים׃
Translated: [you were like] the adulterous wife who welcomes strangers instead of her husband.
Transliteration: haishah hamenaafet tachat iyshah tikach et-zariym

Hebrew: לְכׇל־זֹנ֖וֹת יִתְּנוּ־נֵ֑דֶה וְאַ֨תְּ נָתַ֤תְּ אֶת־נְדָנַ֙יִךְ֙ לְכׇל־מְאַֽהֲבַ֔יִךְ וַתִּשְׁחֳדִ֣י אוֹתָ֗ם לָב֥וֹא אֵלַ֛יִךְ מִסָּבִ֖יב בְּתַזְנוּתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Gifts are made to all prostitutes, but you made gifts to all your lovers, and bribed them to come to you from every quarter for your whoring.
Transliteration: lekhׇl-zonvot yitenu-nedeh veate natate et-nedanayiikhe lekhׇl-meahavayiikhe vatishechodiy votam lavvo elayiikhe misaviyv vetazenutayiikhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִי־בָ֨ךְ הֵ֤פֶךְ מִן־הַנָּשִׁים֙ בְּתַזְנוּתַ֔יִךְ וְאַחֲרַ֖יִךְ לֹ֣א זוּנָּ֑ה וּבְתִתֵּ֣ךְ אֶתְנָ֗ן וְאֶתְנַ֛ן לֹ֥א נִתַּן־לָ֖ךְ וַתְּהִ֥י לְהֶֽפֶךְ׃
Translated: You were the opposite of other women: you solicited instead of being solicited; you paid fees instead of being paid fees. Thus you were just the opposite!
Transliteration: vayehiy-vakhe hefekhe min-hanashiym vetazenutayiikhe veacharayiikhe lo zunah uvetitekhe etenan veetenan lo nitan-lakhe vatehiy lehefekhe

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן זוֹנָ֔ה שִׁמְעִ֖י דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Now, O whore, hear the word of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lakhen zvonah shimeiy devar-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה יַ֣עַן הִשָּׁפֵ֤ךְ נְחֻשְׁתֵּךְ֙ וַתִּגָּלֶ֣ה עֶרְוָתֵ֔ךְ בְּתַזְנוּתַ֖יִךְ עַל־מְאַֽהֲבָ֑יִךְ וְעַל֙ כׇּל־גִּלּוּלֵ֣י תוֹעֲבוֹתַ֔יִךְ וְכִדְמֵ֣י בָנַ֔יִךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תְּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because of your brazen effrontery, offering your nakedness to your lovers for whoring—just like the blood of your children, which you gave to all your abominable fetishes:—
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih yaan hishafekhe nechushetekhe vatigaleh erevatekhe vetazenutayiikhe al-meahavayiikhe veal khׇl-giluley tvoavvotayiikhe vekhidemey vanayiikhe asher natate lahem

Hebrew: לָ֠כֵ֠ן הִנְנִ֨י מְקַבֵּ֤ץ אֶת־כׇּל־מְאַהֲבַ֙יִךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָרַ֣בְתְּ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָהַ֔בְתְּ עַ֖ל כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׂנֵ֑את וְקִבַּצְתִּי֩ אֹתָ֨ם עָלַ֜יִךְ מִסָּבִ֗יב וְגִלֵּיתִ֤י עֶרְוָתֵךְ֙ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וְרָא֖וּ אֶת־כׇּל־עֶרְוָתֵֽךְ׃
Translated: I will assuredly assemble all the lovers to whom you gave your favors, along with everybody you accepted and everybody you rejected. I will assemble them against you from every quarter, and I will expose your nakedness to them, and they shall see all your nakedness.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy mekavets et-khׇl-meahavayiikhe asher aravete aleyhem veet khׇl-asher ahavete al khׇl-asher shanet vekivatsetiy otam alayiikhe misaviyv vegileytiy erevatekhe alehem verau et-khׇl-erevatekhe

Hebrew: וּשְׁפַטְתִּיךְ֙ מִשְׁפְּטֵ֣י נֹאֲפ֔וֹת וְשֹׁפְכֹ֖ת דָּ֑ם וּנְתַתִּ֕יךְ דַּ֥ם חֵמָ֖ה וְקִנְאָֽה׃
Translated: I will inflict upon you the punishment of women who commit adultery and murder, and I will direct bloody and impassioned fury against you.
Transliteration: ushefatetiykhe mishefetey noafvot veshofekhot dam unetatiykhe dam chemah vekineah

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֨י אֹתָ֜ךְ בְּיָדָ֗ם וְהָרְס֤וּ גַבֵּךְ֙ וְנִתְּצ֣וּ רָמֹתַ֔יִךְ וְהִפְשִׁ֤יטוּ אוֹתָךְ֙ בְּגָדַ֔יִךְ וְלָקְח֖וּ כְּלֵ֣י תִפְאַרְתֵּ֑ךְ וְהִנִּיח֖וּךְ עֵירֹ֥ם וְעֶרְיָֽה׃
Translated: I will deliver you into their hands, and they shall tear down your eminence and level your mounds; and they shall strip you of your clothing and take away your dazzling jewels, leaving you naked and bare.
Transliteration: venatatiy otakhe veyadam veharesu gavekhe venitetsu ramotayiikhe vehifeshiytu votakhe vegadayiikhe velakechu kheley tifearetekhe vehiniychukhe eyrom veereyah

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱל֤וּ עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ קָהָ֔ל וְרָגְמ֥וּ אוֹתָ֖ךְ בָּאָ֑בֶן וּבִתְּק֖וּךְ בְּחַרְבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Then they shall assemble a mob against you to pelt you with stones and pierce you with their swords.
Transliteration: veheelu alayiikhe kahal veragemu votakhe vaaven uvitekukhe vecharevvotam

Hebrew: וְשָׂרְפ֤וּ בָתַּ֙יִךְ֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ וְעָשׂוּ־בָ֣ךְ שְׁפָטִ֔ים לְעֵינֵ֖י נָשִׁ֣ים רַבּ֑וֹת וְהִשְׁבַּתִּיךְ֙ מִזּוֹנָ֔ה וְגַם־אֶתְנַ֖ן לֹ֥א תִתְּנִי־עֽוֹד׃
Translated: They shall put your houses to the flames and execute punishment upon you in the sight of many women; thus I will put a stop to your whoring, and you shall pay no more fees.
Transliteration: vesharefu vatayiikhe vaesh veashu-vakhe shefatiym leeyney nashiym ravvot vehishevatiykhe mizvonah vegam-etenan lo titeniy-vod

Hebrew: וַהֲנִחֹתִ֤י חֲמָתִי֙ בָּ֔ךְ וְסָ֥רָה קִנְאָתִ֖י מִמֵּ֑ךְ וְשָׁ֣קַטְתִּ֔י וְלֹ֥א אֶכְעַ֖ס עֽוֹד׃
Translated: When I have satisfied My fury upon you and My rage has departed from you, then I will be tranquil; I will be angry no more.
Transliteration: vahanichotiy chamatiy vakhe vesarah kineatiy mimekhe veshakatetiy velo ekheas vod

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־[זָכַרְתְּ֙] (זכרתי) אֶת־יְמֵ֣י נְעוּרַ֔יִךְ וַתִּרְגְּזִי־לִ֖י בְּכׇל־אֵ֑לֶּה וְגַם־אֲנִ֨י הֵ֜א דַּרְכֵּ֣ךְ ׀ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ נָתַ֗תִּי נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וְלֹ֤א (עשיתי) [עָשִׂית֙] אֶת־הַזִּמָּ֔ה עַ֖ל כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבֹתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
Because you did not remember the days of your youth, but infuriated Me with all those things, I will pay you back for your conduct—declares the Sovereign GOD.
Have you not committed depravity on top of all your other abominations?
Transliteration: yaan asher lo-[zakharete] (zkhrty) et-yemey neurayiikhe vatiregeziy-liy vekhׇl-eleh vegam-aniy he darekhekhe verosh natatiy neum adonay yehovih velo (shyty) [ashiyt] et-hazimah al khׇl-tvoavotayiikhe

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֙ כׇּל־הַמֹּשֵׁ֔ל עָלַ֥יִךְ יִמְשֹׁ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר כְּאִמָּ֖הֿ בִּתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Why, everyone who uses proverbs applies to you the proverb “Like mother, like daughter.”
Transliteration: hineh khׇl-hamoshel alayiikhe yimeshol lemor kheimahֿ vitah

Hebrew: בַּת־אִמֵּ֣ךְ אַ֔תְּ גֹּעֶ֥לֶת אִישָׁ֖הּ וּבָנֶ֑יהָ וַאֲח֨וֹת אֲחוֹתֵ֜ךְ אַ֗תְּ אֲשֶׁ֤ר גָּֽעֲלוּ֙ אַנְשֵׁיהֶ֣ן וּבְנֵיהֶ֔ן אִמְּכֶ֣ן חִתִּ֔ית וַאֲבִיכֶ֖ן אֱמֹרִֽי׃
Translated: You are the daughter of your mother, who rejected her husband and children. And you are the sister of your sisters, who rejected their husbands and children; for you are daughters of a Hittite mother and an Amorite father.
Transliteration: vat-imekhe ate goelet iyshah uvaneyha vaachvot achvotekhe ate asher gaalu anesheyhen uveneyhen imekhen chitiyt vaaviykhen emoriy

Hebrew: וַאֲחוֹתֵ֨ךְ הַגְּדוֹלָ֤ה שֹׁמְרוֹן֙ הִ֣יא וּבְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ הַיּוֹשֶׁ֖בֶת עַל־שְׂמֹאולֵ֑ךְ וַאֲחוֹתֵ֞ךְ הַקְּטַנָּ֣ה מִמֵּ֗ךְ הַיּוֹשֶׁ֙בֶת֙ מִֽימִינֵ֔ךְ סְדֹ֖ם וּבְנוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Your elder sister was Samaria, who lived with her daughters to the north of you; your younger sister was Sodom, who lived with her daughters to the south of you.
Transliteration: vaachvotekhe hagedvolah shomervon hiy uvenvoteyha hayyvoshevet al-shemovlekhe vaachvotekhe haketanah mimekhe hayyvoshevet miymiynekhe sedom uvenvoteyha

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א בְדַרְכֵיהֶן֙ הָלַ֔כְתְּ וּכְתוֹעֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֖ן (עשיתי) [עָשִׂ֑ית] כִּמְעַ֣ט קָ֔ט וַתַּשְׁחִ֥תִי מֵהֵ֖ן בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Did you not walk in their ways and practice their abominations? Why, you were almost more corrupt than they in all your ways.
Transliteration: velo vedarekheyhen halakhete ukhetvoavvoteyhen (shyty) [ashiyt] khimeat kat vatashechitiy mehen vekhׇl-derakhayiikhe

Hebrew: חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה אִם־עָֽשְׂתָה֙ סְדֹ֣ם אֲחוֹתֵ֔ךְ הִ֖יא וּבְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔ית אַ֖תְּ וּבְנוֹתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: As I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—your sister Sodom and her daughters did not do what you and your daughters did.
Transliteration: chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-ashetah sedom achvotekhe hiy uvenvoteyha khaasher ashiyt ate uvenvotayiikhe

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־זֶ֣ה הָיָ֔ה עֲוֺ֖ן סְדֹ֣ם אֲחוֹתֵ֑ךְ גָּא֨וֹן שִׂבְעַת־לֶ֜חֶם וְשַׁלְוַ֣ת הַשְׁקֵ֗ט הָ֤יָה לָהּ֙ וְלִבְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ וְיַד־עָנִ֥י וְאֶבְי֖וֹן לֹ֥א הֶחֱזִֽיקָה׃
Translated: Only this was the sin of your sister Sodom: arrogance! She and her daughters had plenty of bread and untroubled tranquility; yet she did not support the poor and the needy.
Transliteration: hineh-zeh hayah avon sedom achvotekhe gavon shiveat-lechem veshalevat hasheket hayah lah velivenvoteyha veyad-aniy veeveyvon lo hecheziykah

Hebrew: וַֽתִּגְבְּהֶ֔ינָה וַתַּעֲשֶׂ֥ינָה תוֹעֵבָ֖ה לְפָנָ֑י וָאָסִ֥יר אֶתְהֶ֖ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִֽיתִי׃ {ס}
Translated: In their haughtiness, they committed abomination before Me; and so I removed them, as you saw.
Transliteration: vatigeveheynah vataasheynah tvoevah lefanay vaasiyr etehen khaasher raiytiy {s}

Hebrew: וְשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן כַּחֲצִ֥י חַטֹּאתַ֖יִךְ לֹ֣א חָטָ֑אָה וַתַּרְבִּ֤י אֶת־תּוֹעֲבוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ מֵהֵ֔נָּה וַתְּצַדְּקִי֙ אֶת־[אֲחוֹתַ֔יִךְ] (אחותך) בְּכׇל־תּוֹעֲבֹתַ֖יִךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר (עשיתי) [עָשִֽׂית]׃
Translated: Nor did Samaria commit even half your sins. You committed more abominations than they, and by all the abominations that you committed you made your sisters look righteous.
Transliteration: veshomervon khachatsiy chatotayiikhe lo chataah vatareviy et-tvoavvotayiikhe mehenah vatetsadekiy et-[achvotayiikhe] (chvtkh) vekhׇl-tvoavotayiikhe asher (shyty) [ashiyt]

Hebrew: גַּם־אַ֣תְּ ׀ שְׂאִ֣י כְלִמָּתֵ֗ךְ אֲשֶׁ֤ר פִּלַּלְתְּ֙ לַאֲחוֹתֵ֔ךְ בְּחַטֹּאתַ֛יִךְ אֲשֶׁר־הִתְעַ֥בְתְּ מֵהֵ֖ן תִּצְדַּ֣קְנָה מִמֵּ֑ךְ וְגַם־אַ֥תְּ בּ֙וֹשִׁי֙ וּשְׂאִ֣י כְלִמָּתֵ֔ךְ בְּצַדֶּקְתֵּ֖ךְ אַחְיוֹתֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Truly, you must bear the disgrace of serving as your sisters’ advocate: Since you have sinned more abominably than they, they appear righteous in comparison. So be ashamed and bear your disgrace, because you have made your sisters look righteous.
Transliteration: gam-ate sheiy khelimatekhe asher filalete laachvotekhe vechatotayiikhe asher-hiteavete mehen titsedakenah mimekhe vegam-ate vvoshiy usheiy khelimatekhe vetsadeketekhe acheyvotekhe

Hebrew: וְשַׁבְתִּי֙ אֶת־שְׁבִ֣יתְהֶ֔ן אֶת־[שְׁב֤וּת] (שבית) סְדֹם֙ וּבְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ וְאֶת־[שְׁב֥וּת] (שבית) שֹׁמְר֖וֹן וּבְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ (ושבית) [וּשְׁב֥וּת] שְׁבִיתַ֖יִךְ בְּתוֹכָֽהְנָה׃
Translated: I will restore their fortunes—the fortunes of Sodom and her daughters and the fortunes of Samaria and her daughters—and your fortunes along with theirs.
Transliteration: veshavetiy et-sheviytehen et-[shevut] (shvyt) sedom uvenvoteyha veet-[shevut] (shvyt) shomervon uvenvoteyha (vshvyt) [ushevut] sheviytayiikhe vetvokhahenah

Hebrew: לְמַ֙עַן֙ תִּשְׂאִ֣י כְלִמָּתֵ֔ךְ וְנִכְלַ֕מְתְּ מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֑ית בְּנַחֲמֵ֖ךְ אֹתָֽן׃
Translated: Thus you shall bear your disgrace and feel your disgrace for behaving in such a way that they could take comfort.
Transliteration: lemaan tisheiy khelimatekhe venikhelamete mikhol asher ashiyt venachamekhe otan

Hebrew: וַאֲחוֹתַ֗יִךְ סְדֹ֤ם וּבְנוֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ תָּשֹׁ֣בְןָ לְקַדְמָתָ֔ן וְשֹֽׁמְרוֹן֙ וּבְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ תָּשֹׁ֖בְןָ לְקַדְמָתָ֑ן וְאַתְּ֙ וּבְנוֹתַ֔יִךְ תְּשֻׁבֶ֖ינָה לְקַדְמַתְכֶֽן׃
Translated: Then your sister Sodom and her daughters shall return to their former state, and Samaria and her daughters shall return to their former state, and you and your daughters shall return to your former state.
Transliteration: vaachvotayiikhe sedom uvenvoteyha tashovena lekadematan veshomervon uvenvoteyha tashovena lekadematan veate uvenvotayiikhe teshuveynah lekadematekhen

Hebrew: וְל֤וֹא הָֽיְתָה֙ סְדֹ֣ם אֲחוֹתֵ֔ךְ לִשְׁמוּעָ֖ה בְּפִ֑יךְ בְּי֖וֹם גְּאוֹנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Was not your sister Sodom a byword in your mouth in the days of your pride,
Transliteration: velvo hayetah sedom achvotekhe lishemuah vefiykhe veyvom gevonayiikhe

Hebrew: בְּטֶ֘רֶם֮ תִּגָּלֶ֣ה רָעָתֵךְ֒ כְּמ֗וֹ עֵ֚ת חֶרְפַּ֣ת בְּנוֹת־אֲרָ֔ם וְכׇל־סְבִיבוֹתֶ֖יהָ בְּנ֣וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים הַשָּׁאט֥וֹת אוֹתָ֖ךְ מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated: before your own wickedness was exposed? So must you now bear the mockery of the daughters of Aram and all her neighbors, the daughters of Philistia who jeer at you on every side.
Transliteration: veterem tigaleh raatekhe khemvo et cherefat venvot-aram vekhׇl-seviyvvoteyha venvot felishetiym hashatvot votakhe misaviyv

Hebrew: אֶת־זִמָּתֵ֥ךְ וְאֶת־תּוֹעֲבוֹתַ֖יִךְ אַ֣תְּ נְשָׂאתִ֑ים נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: You yourself must bear your depravity and your abominations—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: et-zimatekhe veet-tvoavvotayiikhe ate neshatiym neum yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה (ועשית) [וְעָשִׂ֥יתִי] אוֹתָ֖ךְ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֑ית אֲשֶׁר־בָּזִ֥ית אָלָ֖ה לְהָפֵ֥ר בְּרִֽית׃
Translated: Truly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will deal with you as you have dealt, for you have spurned the pact and violated the covenant.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih (vshyt) [veashiytiy] votakhe khaasher ashiyt asher-vaziyt alah lehafer veriyt

Hebrew: וְזָכַרְתִּ֨י אֲנִ֧י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֛י אוֹתָ֖ךְ בִּימֵ֣י נְעוּרָ֑יִךְ וַהֲקִימוֹתִ֥י לָ֖ךְ בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Nevertheless, I will remember the covenant I made with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish it with you as an everlasting covenant.
Transliteration: vezakharetiy aniy et-veriytiy votakhe viymey neurayiikhe vahakiymvotiy lakhe veriyt volam

Hebrew: וְזָכַ֣רְתְּ אֶת־דְּרָכַ֘יִךְ֮ וְנִכְלַמְתְּ֒ בְּקַחְתֵּ֗ךְ אֶת־אֲחוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ הַגְּדֹל֣וֹת מִמֵּ֔ךְ אֶל־הַקְּטַנּ֖וֹת מִמֵּ֑ךְ וְנָתַתִּ֨י אֶתְהֶ֥ן לָ֛ךְ לְבָנ֖וֹת וְלֹ֥א מִבְּרִיתֵֽךְ׃
Translated: You shall remember your ways and feel ashamed, when you receive your older sisters and your younger sisters, and I give them to you as daughters, though they are not of your covenant.
Transliteration: vezakharete et-derakhayiikhe venikhelamete vekachetekhe et-achvotayiikhe hagedolvot mimekhe el-haketanvot mimekhe venatatiy etehen lakhe levanvot velo miveriytekhe

Hebrew: וַהֲקִימֹתִ֥י אֲנִ֛י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וְיָדַ֖עַתְּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vahakiymotiy aniy et-veriytiy itakhe veyadaate khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן תִּזְכְּרִי֙ וָבֹ֔שְׁתְּ וְלֹ֨א יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֥ךְ עוֹד֙ פִּתְח֣וֹן פֶּ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י כְּלִמָּתֵ֑ךְ בְּכַפְּרִי־לָךְ֙ לְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔ית נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
