Translated: Thus you shall remember and feel shame, and you shall be too abashed to open your mouth again, when I have forgiven you for all that you did—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lemaan tizekheriy vavoshete velo yiheyeh-lakhe vod fitechvon feh mifeney khelimatekhe vekhaferiy-lakhe lekhׇl-asher ashiyt neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם ח֥וּד חִידָ֖ה וּמְשֹׁ֣ל מָשָׁ֑ל אֶל־בֵּ֖ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: O mortal, propound a riddle and relate an allegory to the House of Israel.
Transliteration: ven-adam chud chiydah umeshol mashal el-veyt yisherael

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֞ כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הַנֶּ֤שֶׁר הַגָּדוֹל֙ גְּד֤וֹל הַכְּנָפַ֙יִם֙ אֶ֣רֶךְ הָאֵ֔בֶר מָלֵא֙ הַנּוֹצָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ הָרִקְמָ֑ה בָּ֚א אֶל־הַלְּבָנ֔וֹן וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־צַמֶּ֥רֶת הָאָֽרֶז׃
Translated: Say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: The great eagle with the great wings and the long pinions, with the full plumage and the brilliant colors, came to the Lebanon range and seized the top of the cedar.
Transliteration: veamareta khoh-amar adonay yehovih hanesher hagadvol gedvol hakhenafayiim erekhe haever male hanvotsah asher-lvo harikemah va el-halevanvon vayikach et-tsameret haarez

Hebrew: אֵ֛ת רֹ֥אשׁ יְנִיקוֹתָ֖יו קָטָ֑ף וַיְבִיאֵ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן בְּעִ֥יר רֹכְלִ֖ים שָׂמֽוֹ׃
Translated: He plucked off its topmost bough and carried it off to the land of traders and set it in a city of merchants.
Transliteration: et rosh yeniykvotayv kataf vayeviyehu el-erets khenaan veiyr rokheliym shamvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֙ מִזֶּ֣רַע הָאָ֔רֶץ וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖הוּ בִּשְׂדֵה־זָ֑רַע קָ֚ח עַל־מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֔ים צַפְצָפָ֖ה שָׂמֽוֹ׃
Translated: He then took some of the seed of the land and planted it in a fertile field; he planted and set it like a willow beside abundant waters.
Transliteration: vayikach mizera haarets vayitenehu vishedeh-zara kach al-mayiim raviym tsafetsafah shamvo

Hebrew: וַיִּצְמַ֡ח וַיְהִי֩ לְגֶ֨פֶן סֹרַ֜חַת שִׁפְלַ֣ת קוֹמָ֗ה לִפְנ֤וֹת דָּֽלִיּוֹתָיו֙ אֵלָ֔יו וְשׇׁרָשָׁ֖יו תַּחְתָּ֣יו יִהְי֑וּ וַתְּהִ֣י לְגֶ֔פֶן וַתַּ֣עַשׂ בַּדִּ֔ים וַתְּשַׁלַּ֖ח פֹּרֹֽאות׃
Translated: It grew and became a spreading vine of low stature; it became a vine, produced branches, and sent out boughs. [He had intended] that its twigs should turn to him, and that its roots should stay under him.
Transliteration: vayitsemach vayehiy legefen sorachat shifelat kvomah lifenvot daliyyvotayv elayv veshׇrashayv tachetayv yiheyu vatehiy legefen vataash vadiym vateshalach forovt

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י נֶֽשֶׁר־אֶחָד֙ גָּד֔וֹל גְּד֥וֹל כְּנָפַ֖יִם וְרַב־נוֹצָ֑ה וְהִנֵּה֩ הַגֶּ֨פֶן הַזֹּ֜את כָּפְנָ֧ה שׇׁרָשֶׁ֣יהָ עָלָ֗יו וְדָֽלִיּוֹתָיו֙ שִׁלְחָה־לּ֔וֹ לְהַשְׁק֣וֹת אוֹתָ֔הּ מֵעֲרֻג֖וֹת מַטָּעָֽהּ׃
Translated: But there was another great eagle with great wings and full plumage; and this vine now bent its roots in his direction and sent out its twigs toward him, that he might water it more than the bed where it was planted—
Transliteration: vayehiy nesher-echad gadvol gedvol khenafayiim verav-nvotsah vehineh hagefen hazot khafenah shׇrasheyha alayv vedaliyyvotayv shilechah-lvo lehashekvot votah mearugvot mataah

Hebrew: אֶל־שָׂ֥דֶה טּ֛וֹב אֶל־מַ֥יִם רַבִּ֖ים הִ֣יא שְׁתוּלָ֑ה לַעֲשׂ֤וֹת עָנָף֙ וְלָשֵׂ֣את פֶּ֔רִי לִהְי֖וֹת לְגֶ֥פֶן אַדָּֽרֶת׃
Translated: though it was planted in rich soil beside abundant water—so that it might grow branches and produce boughs and be a noble vine.
Transliteration: el-shadeh tvov el-mayiim raviym hiy shetulah laashvot anaf velashet feriy liheyvot legefen adaret

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֗ר כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֛ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה תִּצְלָ֑ח הֲלוֹא֩ אֶת־שׇׁרָשֶׁ֨יהָ יְנַתֵּ֜ק וְאֶת־פִּרְיָ֣הּ ׀ יְקוֹסֵ֣ס וְיָבֵ֗שׁ כׇּל־טַרְפֵּ֤י צִמְחָהּ֙ תִּיבָ֔שׁ וְלֹֽא־בִזְרֹ֤עַ גְּדוֹלָה֙ וּבְעַם־רָ֔ב לְמַשְׂא֥וֹת אוֹתָ֖הּ מִשׇּׁרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: Say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Will it thrive? Will he not tear out its roots and rip off its crown, so that its entire foliage withers? It shall wither, despite any strong arm or mighty army [that may come] to remove it from its roots.
Transliteration: emor khoh amar adonay yehovih titselach halvo et-shׇrasheyha yenatek veet-fireyah yekvoses veyavesh khׇl-tarefey tsimechah tiyvash velo-vizeroa gedvolah uveam-rav lemashevot votah mishׇrasheyha

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֥ה שְׁתוּלָ֖ה הֲתִצְלָ֑ח הֲלֹא֩ כְגַ֨עַת בָּ֜הּ ר֤וּחַ הַקָּדִים֙ תִּיבַ֣שׁ יָבֹ֔שׁ עַל־עֲרֻגֹ֥ת צִמְחָ֖הּ תִּיבָֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: And suppose it is transplanted, will it thrive? When the east wind strikes it, it shall wither—wither upon the bed where it is growing.
Transliteration: vehineh shetulah hatitselach halo khegaat vah rucha hakadiym tiyvash yavosh al-arugot tsimechah tiyvash {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: אֱמׇר־נָא֙ לְבֵ֣ית הַמֶּ֔רִי הֲלֹ֥א יְדַעְתֶּ֖ם מָה־אֵ֑לֶּה אֱמֹ֗ר הִנֵּה־בָ֨א מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֤ל יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־מַלְכָּהּ֙ וְאֶת־שָׂרֶ֔יהָ וַיָּבֵ֥א אוֹתָ֛ם אֵלָ֖יו בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: Say to the rebellious breed: Do you not know what these things mean? Say: The king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and carried away its king and its officers and brought them back with him to Babylon.
Transliteration: emׇr-na leveyt hameriy halo yedaetem mah-eleh emor hineh-va melekhe-vavel yerushala͏im vayikach et-malekhah veet-shareyha vayave votam elayv vavelah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֙ מִזֶּ֣רַע הַמְּלוּכָ֔ה וַיִּכְרֹ֥ת אִתּ֖וֹ בְּרִ֑ית וַיָּבֵ֤א אֹתוֹ֙ בְּאָלָ֔ה וְאֶת־אֵילֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ לָקָֽח׃
Translated: He took one of the seed royal and made a covenant with him and imposed an oath on him, and he carried away the nobles of the land—
Transliteration: vayikach mizera hamelukhah vayikherot itvo veriyt vayave otvo vealah veet-eyley haarets lakach

Hebrew: לִֽהְיוֹת֙ מַמְלָכָ֣ה שְׁפָלָ֔ה לְבִלְתִּ֖י הִתְנַשֵּׂ֑א לִשְׁמֹ֥ר אֶת־בְּרִית֖וֹ לְעׇמְדָֽהּ׃
Translated: so that it might be a humble kingdom and not exalt itself, but keep his covenant and so endure.
Transliteration: liheyvot mamelakhah shefalah leviletiy hitenashe lishemor et-veriytvo leׇmedah

Hebrew: וַיִּמְרׇד־בּ֗וֹ לִשְׁלֹ֤חַ מַלְאָכָיו֙ מִצְרַ֔יִם לָתֶת־ל֥וֹ סוּסִ֖ים וְעַם־רָ֑ב הֲיִצְלָ֤ח הֲיִמָּלֵט֙ הָעֹשֵׂ֣ה אֵ֔לֶּה וְהֵפֵ֥ר בְּרִ֖ית וְנִמְלָֽט׃
Translated: But [that prince] rebelled against him and sent his envoys to Egypt to get horses and a large army. Will he succeed? Will he who does such things escape? Shall he break a covenant and escape?
Transliteration: vayimerׇd-vvo lishelocha maleakhayv mitserayiim latet-lvo susiym veam-rav hayitselach hayimalet haosheh eleh vehefer veriyt venimelat

Hebrew: חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ אִם־לֹ֗א בִּמְקוֹם֙ הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַמַּמְלִ֣יךְ אֹת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּזָה֙ אֶת־אָ֣לָת֔וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵפֵ֖ר אֶת־בְּרִית֑וֹ אִתּ֥וֹ בְתוֹךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: As I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—in the very homeland of the king who made him king, whose oath he flouted and whose covenant he broke—right there, in Babylon, he shall die.
Transliteration: chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-lo vimekvom hamelekhe hamameliykhe otvo asher vazah et-alatvo vaasher hefer et-veriytvo itvo vetvokhe-vavel yamut

Hebrew: וְלֹא֩ בְחַ֨יִל גָּד֜וֹל וּבְקָהָ֣ל רָ֗ב יַעֲשֶׂ֨ה אוֹת֤וֹ פַרְעֹה֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה בִּשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ סֹלְלָ֖ה וּבִבְנ֣וֹת דָּיֵ֑ק לְהַכְרִ֖ית נְפָשׁ֥וֹת רַבּֽוֹת׃
Translated: Pharaoh will not fight at his side with a great army and with numerous troops in the war, when mounds are thrown up and siege towers erected to destroy many lives.
Transliteration: velo vechayiil gadvol uvekahal rav yaasheh votvo fareoh vamilechamah vishefokhe solelah uvivenvot daeik lehakheriyt nefashvot ravvot

Hebrew: וּבָזָ֥ה אָלָ֖ה לְהָפֵ֣ר בְּרִ֑ית וְהִנֵּ֨ה נָתַ֥ן יָד֛וֹ וְכׇל־אֵ֥לֶּה עָשָׂ֖ה לֹ֥א יִמָּלֵֽט׃ {ס}
Translated: He flouted a pact and broke a covenant; he gave his promise and did all these things—he shall not escape.
Transliteration: uvazah alah lehafer veriyt vehineh natan yadvo vekhׇl-eleh ashah lo yimalet {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֮ חַי־אָ֒נִי֒ אִם־לֹ֗א אָֽלָתִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּזָ֔ה וּבְרִיתִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵפִ֑יר וּנְתַתִּ֖יו בְּרֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: As I live, I will pay him back for flouting My pact and breaking My covenant.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih chay-aniy im-lo alatiy asher vazah uveriytiy asher hefiyr unetatiyv veroshvo

Hebrew: וּפָרַשְׂתִּ֤י עָלָיו֙ רִשְׁתִּ֔י וְנִתְפַּ֖שׂ בִּמְצוּדָתִ֑י וַהֲבִיאוֹתִ֣יהוּ בָבֶ֗לָה וְנִשְׁפַּטְתִּ֤י אִתּוֹ֙ שָׁ֔ם מַעֲל֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָעַל־בִּֽי׃
Translated: I will spread My net over him and he shall be caught in My snare; I will carry him to Babylon and enter with him into judgment there for the trespass that he committed against Me.
Transliteration: ufarashetiy alayv rishetiy venitefash vimetsudatiy vahaviyvotiyhu vavelah venishefatetiy itvo sham maalvo asher maal-viy

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־מִבְרָחָ֤ו בְּכׇל־אֲגַפָּיו֙ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפֹּ֔לוּ וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֖ים לְכׇל־ר֣וּחַ יִפָּרֵ֑שׂוּ וִידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּֽרְתִּי׃ {פ}
Translated: And all the fugitives of all his battalions shall fall by the sword, and those who remain shall scatter in every direction; then you will know that I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-miverachav vekhׇl-agafayv vacherev yifolu vehanisheariym lekhׇl-rucha yifareshu viydaetem khiy aniy yehovah divaretiy {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וְלָקַ֣חְתִּי אָ֗נִי מִצַּמֶּ֧רֶת הָאֶ֛רֶז הָרָמָ֖ה וְנָתָ֑תִּי מֵרֹ֤אשׁ יֹֽנְקוֹתָיו֙ רַ֣ךְ אֶקְטֹ֔ף וְשָׁתַ֣לְתִּי אָ֔נִי עַ֥ל הַר־גָּבֹ֖הַּ וְתָלֽוּל׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Then I in turn will take and set [in the ground a slip] from the lofty top of the cedar; I will pluck a tender twig from the tip of its crown, and I will plant it on a tall, towering mountain.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih velakachetiy aniy mitsameret haerez haramah venatatiy merosh yonekvotayv rakhe eketof veshataletiy aniy al har-gavoha vetalul

Hebrew: בְּהַ֨ר מְר֤וֹם יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶשְׁתֳּלֶ֔נּוּ וְנָשָׂ֤א עָנָף֙ וְעָ֣שָׂה פֶ֔רִי וְהָיָ֖ה לְאֶ֣רֶז אַדִּ֑יר וְשָׁכְנ֣וּ תַחְתָּ֗יו כֹּ֚ל צִפּ֣וֹר כׇּל־כָּנָ֔ף בְּצֵ֥ל דָּלִיּוֹתָ֖יו תִּשְׁכֹּֽנָּה׃
Translated: I will plant it in Israel’s lofty highlands, and it shall bring forth boughs and produce branches and grow into a noble cedar. Every bird of every feather shall take shelter under it, shelter in the shade of its boughs.
Transliteration: vehar mervom yisherael eshetolenu venasha anaf veashah feriy vehayah leerez adiyr veshakhenu tachetayv khol tsifvor khׇl-khanaf vetsel daliyyvotayv tishekhonah

Hebrew: וְֽיָדְע֞וּ כׇּל־עֲצֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ הִשְׁפַּ֣לְתִּי ׀ עֵ֣ץ גָּבֹ֗הַּ הִגְבַּ֙הְתִּי֙ עֵ֣ץ שָׁפָ֔ל הוֹבַ֙שְׁתִּי֙ עֵ֣ץ לָ֔ח וְהִפְרַ֖חְתִּי עֵ֣ץ יָבֵ֑שׁ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי וְעָשִֽׂיתִי׃ {פ}
Translated: Then shall all the trees of the field know that it is I, G<small>OD</small>, who have abased the lofty tree and exalted the lowly tree, who have dried up the green tree and made the withered tree bud. I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken, and I will act.
Transliteration: veyadeu khׇl-atsey hashadeh khiy aniy yehovah hishefaletiy ets gavoha higevahetiy ets shafal hvovashetiy ets lach vehiferachetiy ets yavesh aniy yehovah divaretiy veashiytiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: מַה־לָּכֶ֗ם אַתֶּם֙ מֹֽשְׁלִים֙ אֶת־הַמָּשָׁ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה עַל־אַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר אָבוֹת֙ יֹ֣אכְלוּ בֹ֔סֶר וְשִׁנֵּ֥י הַבָּנִ֖ים תִּקְהֶֽינָה׃
Translated: What do you mean by quoting this proverb upon the soil of Israel, “Parents eat sour grapes and their children’s teeth are blunted”?
Transliteration: mah-lakhem atem mosheliym et-hamashal hazeh al-ademat yisherael lemor avvot yokhelu voser veshiney havaniym tikeheynah

Hebrew: חַי־אָ֕נִי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה אִם־יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֜ם ע֗וֹד מְשֹׁ֛ל הַמָּשָׁ֥ל הַזֶּ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: As I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—this proverb shall no longer be current among you in Israel.
Transliteration: chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-yiheyeh lakhem vod meshol hamashal hazeh veyisherael

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן כׇּל־הַנְּפָשׁוֹת֙ לִ֣י הֵ֔נָּה כְּנֶ֧פֶשׁ הָאָ֛ב וּכְנֶ֥פֶשׁ הַבֵּ֖ן לִי־הֵ֑נָּה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַחֹטֵ֖את הִ֥יא תָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Consider, all lives are Mine; the life of the parent and the life of the child are both Mine. Only the person who sins shall die.
Transliteration: hen khׇl-hanefashvot liy henah khenefesh haav ukhenefesh haven liy-henah hanefesh hachotet hiy tamut

Hebrew: וְאִ֖ישׁ כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֣ה צַדִּ֑יק וְעָשָׂ֥ה מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated: Thus, if a certain man is righteous and does what is just and right:
Transliteration: veiysh khiy-yiheyeh tsadiyk veashah mishefat utsedakah

Hebrew: אֶל־הֶֽהָרִים֙ לֹ֣א אָכָ֔ל וְעֵינָיו֙ לֹ֣א נָשָׂ֔א אֶל־גִּלּוּלֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאֶת־אֵ֤שֶׁת רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ לֹ֣א טִמֵּ֔א וְאֶל־אִשָּׁ֥ה נִדָּ֖ה לֹ֥א יִקְרָֽב׃
Translated: If he has not eaten on the mountains or raised his eyes to the fetishes of the House of Israel; if he has not defiled another man’s wife or approached a menstruous woman;
Transliteration: el-hehariym lo akhal veeynayv lo nasha el-giluley veyt yisherael veet-eshet reehu lo time veel-ishah nidah lo yikerav

Hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ לֹ֣א יוֹנֶ֔ה חֲבֹלָת֥וֹ חוֹב֙ יָשִׁ֔יב גְּזֵלָ֖ה לֹ֣א יִגְזֹ֑ל לַחְמוֹ֙ לְרָעֵ֣ב יִתֵּ֔ן וְעֵירֹ֖ם יְכַסֶּה־בָּֽגֶד׃
Translated: if he has wronged no one at all; if he has returned the debtor’s pledge to him and has taken nothing by robbery; if he has given bread to the hungry and clothed the naked;
Transliteration: veiysh lo yvoneh chavolatvo chvov yashiyv gezelah lo yigezol lachemvo leraev yiten veeyrom yekhaseh-vaged

Hebrew: בַּנֶּ֣שֶׁךְ לֹֽא־יִתֵּ֗ן וְתַרְבִּית֙ לֹ֣א יִקָּ֔ח מֵעָ֖וֶל יָשִׁ֣יב יָד֑וֹ מִשְׁפַּ֤ט אֱמֶת֙ יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה בֵּ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ לְאִֽישׁ׃
Translated: if he has not lent at advance interest or exacted accrued interest; if he has abstained from wrongdoing and executed true justice between one party and the other;
Transliteration: vaneshekhe lo-yiten vetareviyt lo yikach meavel yashiyv yadvo mishefat emet yaasheh veyn iysh leiysh

Hebrew: בְּחֻקּוֹתַ֧י יְהַלֵּ֛ךְ וּמִשְׁפָּטַ֥י שָׁמַ֖ר לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אֱמֶ֑ת צַדִּ֥יק הוּא֙ חָיֹ֣ה יִֽחְיֶ֔ה נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: if he has followed My laws and kept My rules and acted honestly—he is righteous. Such a person shall live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vechukvotay yehalekhe umishefatay shamar laashvot emet tsadiyk hu chayoh yicheyeh neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְהוֹלִ֥יד בֵּן־פָּרִ֖יץ שֹׁפֵ֣ךְ דָּ֑ם וְעָ֣שָׂה אָ֔ח מֵאַחַ֖ד מֵאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Suppose, now, that he has begotten a son who is a ruffian, a shedder of blood, who does any of these things,
Transliteration: vehvoliyd ven-fariyts shofekhe dam veashah ach meachad meeleh

Hebrew: וְה֕וּא אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה לֹ֣א עָשָׂ֑ה כִּ֣י גַ֤ם אֶל־הֶהָרִים֙ אָכַ֔ל וְאֶת־אֵ֥שֶׁת רֵעֵ֖הוּ טִמֵּֽא׃
Translated: whereas he himself did none of these things. That is, [the son] has eaten on the mountains, has defiled another man’s wife,
Transliteration: vehu et-khׇl-eleh lo ashah khiy gam el-hehariym akhal veet-eshet reehu time

Hebrew: עָנִ֤י וְאֶבְיוֹן֙ הוֹנָ֔ה גְּזֵל֣וֹת גָּזָ֔ל חֲבֹ֖ל לֹ֣א יָשִׁ֑יב וְאֶל־הַגִּלּוּלִים֙ נָשָׂ֣א עֵינָ֔יו תּוֹעֵבָ֖ה עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: has wronged the poor and the needy, has taken by robbery, has not returned a pledge, has raised his eyes to the fetishes, has committed abomination,
Transliteration: aniy veeveyvon hvonah gezelvot gazal chavol lo yashiyv veel-hagiluliym nasha eynayv tvoevah ashah

Hebrew: בַּנֶּ֧שֶׁךְ נָתַ֛ן וְתַרְבִּ֥ית לָקַ֖ח וָחָ֑י לֹ֣א יִֽחְיֶ֗ה אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַתּוֹעֵב֤וֹת הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ עָשָׂ֔ה מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֔ת דָּמָ֖יו בּ֥וֹ יִֽהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: has lent at advance interest, or exacted accrued interest—shall he live? He shall not live! If he has committed any of these abominations, he shall die; he has forfeited his life.
Transliteration: vaneshekhe natan vetareviyt lakach vachay lo yicheyeh et khׇl-hatvoevvot haeleh ashah mvot yumat damayv vvo yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֙ הוֹלִ֣יד בֵּ֔ן וַיַּ֕רְא אֶת־כׇּל־חַטֹּ֥את אָבִ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה וַיִּרְאֶ֕ה וְלֹ֥א יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה כָּהֵֽן׃
Translated: Now suppose that he, in turn, has begotten a son who has seen all the sins that his father committed, but has taken heed and has not imitated them:
Transliteration: vehineh hvoliyd ven vayare et-khׇl-chatot aviyv asher ashah vayireeh velo yaasheh khahen

Hebrew: עַל־הֶהָרִים֙ לֹ֣א אָכָ֔ל וְעֵינָיו֙ לֹ֣א נָשָׂ֔א אֶל־גִּלּוּלֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֶת־אֵ֥שֶׁת רֵעֵ֖הוּ לֹ֥א טִמֵּֽא׃
Translated: He has not eaten upon the mountains or raised his eyes to the fetishes of the House of Israel; he has not defiled another man’s wife;
Transliteration: al-hehariym lo akhal veeynayv lo nasha el-giluley veyt yisherael et-eshet reehu lo time

Hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ לֹ֣א הוֹנָ֔ה חֲבֹל֙ לֹ֣א חָבָ֔ל וּגְזֵלָ֖ה לֹ֣א גָזָ֑ל לַחְמוֹ֙ לְרָעֵ֣ב נָתָ֔ן וְעֵר֖וֹם כִּסָּה־בָֽגֶד׃
Translated: he has wronged no one at all; he has not seized a pledge or taken anything by robbery; he has given his bread to the hungry and clothed the naked;
Transliteration: veiysh lo hvonah chavol lo chaval ugezelah lo gazal lachemvo leraev natan veervom khisah-vaged

Hebrew: מֵעָנִ֞י הֵשִׁ֣יב יָד֗וֹ נֶ֤שֶׁךְ וְתַרְבִּית֙ לֹ֣א לָקָ֔ח מִשְׁפָּטַ֣י עָשָׂ֔ה בְּחֻקּוֹתַ֖י הָלָ֑ךְ ה֗וּא לֹ֥א יָמ֛וּת בַּעֲוֺ֥ן אָבִ֖יו חָיֹ֥ה יִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: he has refrained from oppressing the poor; he has not exacted advance or accrued interest; he has obeyed My rules and followed My laws—he shall not die for the iniquity of his father, but shall live.
Transliteration: meaniy heshiyv yadvo neshekhe vetareviyt lo lakach mishefatay ashah vechukvotay halakhe hu lo yamut vaavon aviyv chayoh yicheyeh

Hebrew: אָבִ֞יו כִּֽי־עָ֣שַׁק עֹ֗שֶׁק גָּזַל֙ גֵּ֣זֶל אָ֔ח וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־ט֛וֹב עָשָׂ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ עַמָּ֑יו וְהִנֵּה־מֵ֖ת בַּעֲוֺנֽוֹ׃
Translated: To be sure, his father, because he practiced fraud, robbed his kin, and acted wickedly among his people, did die for his iniquity;
Transliteration: aviyv khiy-ashak oshek gazal gezel ach vaasher lo-tvov ashah vetvokhe amayv vehineh-met vaavonvo

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם מַדֻּ֛עַ לֹא־נָשָׂ֥א הַבֵּ֖ן בַּעֲוֺ֣ן הָאָ֑ב וְהַבֵּ֞ן מִשְׁפָּ֧ט וּצְדָקָ֣ה עָשָׂ֗ה אֵ֣ת כׇּל־חֻקּוֹתַ֥י שָׁמַ֛ר וַיַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם חָיֹ֥ה יִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: and now you ask, “Why has not the son shared the burden of his father’s guilt?” But the son has done what is right and just, and has carefully kept all My laws: he shall live!
Transliteration: vaamaretem madua lo-nasha haven vaavon haav vehaven mishefat utsedakah ashah et khׇl-chukvotay shamar vayaasheh otam chayoh yicheyeh

Hebrew: הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַחֹטֵ֖את הִ֣יא תָמ֑וּת בֵּ֞ן לֹא־יִשָּׂ֣א ׀ בַּעֲוֺ֣ן הָאָ֗ב וְאָב֙ לֹ֤א יִשָּׂא֙ בַּעֲוֺ֣ן הַבֵּ֔ן צִדְקַ֤ת הַצַּדִּיק֙ עָלָ֣יו תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה וְרִשְׁעַ֥ת (רשע) [הָרָשָׁ֖ע] עָלָ֥יו תִּֽהְיֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Only the person who sins shall die. A child shall not share the burden of a parent’s guilt, nor shall a parent share the burden of a child’s guilt; the righteousness of the righteous shall be accounted to them alone, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be accounted to them alone.
Transliteration: hanefesh hachotet hiy tamut ven lo-yisha vaavon haav veav lo yisha vaavon haven tsidekat hatsadiyk alayv tiheyeh verisheat (rsh) [harasha] alayv tiheyeh {s}

Hebrew: וְהָרָשָׁ֗ע כִּ֤י יָשׁוּב֙ מִכׇּל־חַטֹּאתָו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וְשָׁמַר֙ אֶת־כׇּל־חֻקּוֹתַ֔י וְעָשָׂ֥ה מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּצְדָקָ֑ה חָיֹ֥ה יִֽחְיֶ֖ה לֹ֥א יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Moreover, if someone wicked repents of all the sins that were committed and keeps all My laws and does what is just and right, they shall live; they shall not die.
Transliteration: veharasha khiy yashuv mikhׇl-chatotav asher ashah veshamar et-khׇl-chukvotay veashah mishefat utsedakah chayoh yicheyeh lo yamut

Hebrew: כׇּל־פְּשָׁעָיו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה לֹ֥א יִזָּכְר֖וּ ל֑וֹ בְּצִדְקָת֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה יִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: None of the transgressions they committed shall be remembered against them; because of the righteousness they have practiced, they shall live.
Transliteration: khׇl-feshaayv asher ashah lo yizakheru lvo vetsidekatvo asher-ashah yicheyeh

Hebrew: הֶחָפֹ֤ץ אֶחְפֹּץ֙ מ֣וֹת רָשָׁ֔ע נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הֲל֛וֹא בְּשׁוּב֥וֹ מִדְּרָכָ֖יו וְחָיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Is it my desire that the wicked shall die?—says the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>. It is rather that they shall turn back from their ways and live.
Transliteration: hechafots echefots mvot rasha neum adonay yehovih halvo veshuvvo miderakhayv vechayah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְשׁ֨וּב צַדִּ֤יק מִצִּדְקָתוֹ֙ וְעָ֣שָׂה עָ֔וֶל כְּכֹ֨ל הַתּוֹעֵב֜וֹת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֧ה הָרָשָׁ֛ע יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה וָחָ֑י כׇּל־צִדְקֹתָ֤ו אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂה֙ לֹ֣א תִזָּכַ֔רְנָה בְּמַעֲל֧וֹ אֲשֶׁר־מָעַ֛ל וּבְחַטָּאת֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־חָטָ֖א בָּ֥ם יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: So, too, if someone righteous turns away from righteousness and does wrong, practicing the very abominations that the wicked person practiced, shall they live? None of the righteous deeds that they did shall be remembered; because of the treachery they have practiced and the sins they have committed—because of these, they shall die.
Transliteration: uveshuv tsadiyk mitsidekatvo veashah avel khekhol hatvoevvot asher-ashah harasha yaasheh vachay khׇl-tsidekotav asher-ashah lo tizakharenah vemaalvo asher-maal uvechatatvo asher-chata vam yamut

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם לֹ֥א יִתָּכֵ֖ן דֶּ֣רֶךְ אֲדֹנָ֑י שִׁמְעוּ־נָא֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הֲדַרְכִּי֙ לֹ֣א יִתָּכֵ֔ן הֲלֹ֥א דַרְכֵיכֶ֖ם לֹ֥א יִתָּכֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: Yet you say, “The Sovereign’s way is unfair.” Listen, O House of Israel: Is My way unfair? It is your ways that are unfair!
Transliteration: vaamaretem lo yitakhen derekhe adonay shimeu-na veyt yisherael hadarekhiy lo yitakhen halo darekheykhem lo yitakhenu

Hebrew: בְּשׁוּב־צַדִּ֧יק מִצִּדְקָת֛וֹ וְעָ֥שָׂה עָ֖וֶל וּמֵ֣ת עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם בְּעַוְל֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה יָמֽוּת׃ {ס}
Translated: When someone righteous turns away from righteousness and does wrong, they shall die for it; they shall die for the wrong that was done.
Transliteration: veshuv-tsadiyk mitsidekatvo veashah avel umet aleyhem veavelvo asher-ashah yamut {s}

Hebrew: וּבְשׁ֣וּב רָשָׁ֗ע מֵֽרִשְׁעָתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּצְדָקָ֑ה ה֖וּא אֶת־נַפְשׁ֥וֹ יְחַיֶּֽה׃
Translated: And if someone wicked turns back from the wickedness that is practiced and does what is just and right, they shall save their life.
Transliteration: uveshuv rasha merisheatvo asher ashah vayaash mishefat utsedakah hu et-nafeshvo yechayeh

Hebrew: וַיִּרְאֶ֣ה (וישוב) [וַיָּ֔שׇׁב] מִכׇּל־פְּשָׁעָ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה חָי֥וֹ יִֽחְיֶ֖ה לֹ֥א יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Because they took heed and turned back from all the transgressions that they committed, they shall live; they shall not die.
Transliteration: vayireeh (vyshvv) [vayashׇv] mikhׇl-feshaayv asher ashah chayvo yicheyeh lo yamut

Hebrew: וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א יִתָּכֵ֖ן דֶּ֣רֶךְ אֲדֹנָ֑י הַדְּרָכַ֞י לֹ֤א יִתָּֽכְנוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הֲלֹ֥א דַרְכֵיכֶ֖ם לֹ֥א יִתָּכֵֽן׃
Translated: Yet the House of Israel say, “The Sovereign’s way is unfair.” Are My ways unfair, O House of Israel? It is your ways that are unfair!
Transliteration: veameru veyt yisherael lo yitakhen derekhe adonay haderakhay lo yitakhenu veyt yisherael halo darekheykhem lo yitakhen

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ אִ֨ישׁ כִּדְרָכָ֜יו אֶשְׁפֹּ֤ט אֶתְכֶם֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה שׁ֤וּבוּ וְהָשִׁ֙יבוּ֙ מִכׇּל־פִּשְׁעֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם לְמִכְשׁ֖וֹל עָוֺֽן׃
Translated: Be assured, O House of Israel, I will judge each one of you according to your own ways—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>. Repent and turn back from all your transgressions; let them not be a stumbling block of guilt for you.
Transliteration: lakhen iysh khiderakhayv eshefot etekhem veyt yisherael neum adonay yehovih shuvu vehashiyvu mikhׇl-fisheeykhem velo-yiheyeh lakhem lemikheshvol avon

Hebrew: הַשְׁלִ֣יכוּ מֵעֲלֵיכֶ֗ם אֶת־כׇּל־פִּשְׁעֵיכֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פְּשַׁעְתֶּ֣ם בָּ֔ם וַעֲשׂ֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם לֵ֥ב חָדָ֖שׁ וְר֣וּחַ חֲדָשָׁ֑ה וְלָ֥מָּה תָמֻ֖תוּ בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Cast away all the transgressions by which you have offended, and get yourselves a new heart and a new spirit, that you may not die, O House of Israel.
Transliteration: hasheliykhu mealeykhem et-khׇl-fisheeykhem asher feshaetem vam vaashu lakhem lev chadash verucha chadashah velamah tamutu veyt yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א אֶחְפֹּץ֙ בְּמ֣וֹת הַמֵּ֔ת נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה וְהָשִׁ֖יבוּ וִֽחְיֽוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: For it is not My desire that anyone shall die—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>. Repent, therefore, and live!
Transliteration: khiy lo echefots vemvot hamet neum adonay yehovih vehashiyvu vicheyu {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ שָׂ֣א קִינָ֔ה אֶל־נְשִׂיאֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And you are to intone a dirge over the princes of Israel,
Transliteration: veatah sha kiynah el-neshiyey yisherael

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ מָ֤ה אִמְּךָ֙ לְבִיָּ֔א בֵּ֥ין אֲרָי֖וֹת רָבָ֑צָה בְּת֥וֹךְ כְּפִרִ֖ים רִבְּתָ֥ה גוּרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
and say:
What a lioness was your mother
Among the lions!
Crouching among the great beasts,
She reared her cubs.
Transliteration: veamareta mah imekha leviya veyn arayvot ravatsah vetvokhe khefiriym rivetah gureyha

Hebrew: וַתַּ֛עַל אֶחָ֥ד מִגֻּרֶ֖יהָ כְּפִ֣יר הָיָ֑ה וַיִּלְמַ֥ד לִטְרׇף־טֶ֖רֶף אָדָ֥ם אָכָֽל׃
Translated:
She raised up one of her cubs,
He became a great beast;
He learned to hunt prey—
He devoured people.
Transliteration: vataal echad migureyha khefiyr hayah vayilemad literׇf-teref adam akhal

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֥וּ אֵלָ֛יו גּוֹיִ֖ם בְּשַׁחְתָּ֣ם נִתְפָּ֑שׂ וַיְבִאֻ֥הוּ בַחַחִ֖ים אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Nations heeded [the call] against him;
He was caught in their snare.
They dragged him off with hooks
To the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayishemeu elayv gvoyim veshachetam nitefash vayeviuhu vachachiym el-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ כִּ֣י נֽוֹחֲלָ֔ה אָבְדָ֖ה תִּקְוָתָ֑הּ וַתִּקַּ֛ח אֶחָ֥ד מִגֻּרֶ֖יהָ כְּפִ֥יר שָׂמָֽתְהוּ׃
Translated:
When she saw herself frustrated,
Her hope defeated,
She took another of her cubs
And set him up as a great beast.
Transliteration: vatere khiy nvochalah avedah tikevatah vatikach echad migureyha khefiyr shamatehu

Hebrew: וַיִּתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בְּתוֹךְ־אֲרָי֖וֹת כְּפִ֣יר הָיָ֑ה וַיִּלְמַ֥ד לִטְרׇף־טֶ֖רֶף אָדָ֥ם אָכָֽל׃
Translated:
He stalked among the lions,
He was a great beast;
He learned to hunt prey—
He devoured people.
Transliteration: vayitehalekhe vetvokhe-arayvot khefiyr hayah vayilemad literׇf-teref adam akhal

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙דַע֙ אַלְמְנוֹתָ֔יו וְעָרֵיהֶ֖ם הֶחֱרִ֑יב וַתֵּ֤שַׁם אֶ֙רֶץ֙ וּמְלֹאָ֔הּ מִקּ֖וֹל שַׁאֲגָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He raped their widows,
Laid waste their cities;
The land and all in it were appalled
At the sound of his roaring.
Transliteration: vayeda alemenvotayv veareyhem hecheriyv vatesham erets umeloah mikvol shaagatvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ עָלָ֥יו גּוֹיִ֛ם סָבִ֖יב מִמְּדִינ֑וֹת וַֽיִּפְרְשׂ֥וּ עָלָ֛יו רִשְׁתָּ֖ם בְּשַׁחְתָּ֥ם נִתְפָּֽשׂ׃
Translated:
Nations from the countries round about
Arrayed themselves against him.
They spread their net over him,
He was caught in their snare.
Transliteration: vayitenu alayv gvoyim saviyv mimediynvot vayifereshu alayv rishetam veshachetam nitefash

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנֻ֤הוּ בַסּ֙וּגַר֙ בַּחַחִ֔ים וַיְבִאֻ֖הוּ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֑ל יְבִאֻ֙הוּ֙ בַּמְּצֹד֔וֹת לְמַ֗עַן לֹא־יִשָּׁמַ֥ע קוֹל֛וֹ ע֖וֹד אֶל־הָרֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
With hooks he was put in a cage,
They carried him off to the king of Babylon
And confined him in a fortress,
So that never again should his roar be heard
On the hills of Israel.
Transliteration: vayitenuhu vasugar vachachiym vayeviuhu el-melekhe vavel yeviuhu vametsodvot lemaan lo-yishama kvolvo vod el-harey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: אִמְּךָ֥ כַגֶּ֛פֶן בְּדָמְךָ֖ עַל־מַ֣יִם שְׁתוּלָ֑ה פֹּֽרִיָּה֙ וַעֲנֵפָ֔ה הָיְתָ֖ה מִמַּ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
Your mother was like a vine in your blood,
Planted beside streams,
With luxuriant boughs and branches
Thanks to abundant waters.
Transliteration: imekha khagefen vedamekha al-mayiim shetulah foriyah vaanefah hayetah mimayiim raviym

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ־לָ֞הּ מַטּ֣וֹת עֹ֗ז אֶל־שִׁבְטֵי֙ מֹֽשְׁלִ֔ים וַתִּגְבַּ֥הּ קוֹמָת֖וֹ עַל־בֵּ֣ין עֲבֹתִ֑ים וַיֵּרָ֣א בְגׇבְה֔וֹ בְּרֹ֖ב דָּלִיֹּתָֽיו׃
Translated:
And she had a mighty rod
Fit for a ruler’s scepter.
It towered highest among the leafy trees,
It was conspicuous by its height,
By the abundance of its boughs.
Transliteration: vayiheyu-lah matvot oz el-shivetey mosheliym vatigevah kvomatvo al-veyn avotiym vayera vegׇvehvo verov daliyotayv

Hebrew: וַתֻּתַּ֤שׁ בְּחֵמָה֙ לָאָ֣רֶץ הֻשְׁלָ֔כָה וְר֥וּחַ הַקָּדִ֖ים הוֹבִ֣ישׁ פִּרְיָ֑הּ הִתְפָּרְק֧וּ וְיָבֵ֛שׁוּ מַטֵּ֥ה עֻזָּ֖הּ אֵ֥שׁ אֲכָלָֽתְהוּ׃
Translated:
But plucked up in a fury,
She was hurled to the ground.
The east wind withered her branches,
They broke apart and dried up;
And her mighty rod was consumed by fire.
Transliteration: vatutash vechemah laarets hushelakhah verucha hakadiym hvoviysh fireyah hitefareku veyaveshu mateh uzah esh akhalatehu

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה שְׁתוּלָ֣ה בַמִּדְבָּ֑ר בְּאֶ֖רֶץ צִיָּ֥ה וְצָמָֽא׃
Translated:
Now she is planted in the desert,
In ground that is arid and parched.
Transliteration: veatah shetulah vamidevar veerets tsiyah vetsama

Hebrew: וַתֵּצֵ֨א אֵ֜שׁ מִמַּטֵּ֤ה בַדֶּ֙יהָ֙ פִּרְיָ֣הּ אָכָ֔לָה וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה בָ֛הּ מַטֵּה־עֹ֖ז שֵׁ֣בֶט לִמְשׁ֑וֹל קִ֥ינָה הִ֖יא וַתְּהִ֥י לְקִינָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Fire has issued from her twig-laden branch
And has consumed her boughs,
She is left without a mighty rod,
A scepter to rule with.
This is a dirge, and it has become a [familiar] dirge.
Transliteration: vatetse esh mimateh vadeyha fireyah akhalah velo-hayah vah mateh-oz shevet limeshvol kiynah hiy vatehiy lekiynah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗ית בַּחֲמִשִׁי֙ בֶּעָשׂ֣וֹר לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ בָּ֧אוּ אֲנָשִׁ֛ים מִזִּקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לִדְרֹ֣שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ לְפָנָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: In the seventh year, on the tenth day of the fifth month, certain elders of Israel came to inquire of G<small>OD</small>, and sat down before me.
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hasheviyiyt vachamishiy veashvor lachodesh vau anashiym mizikeney yisherael liderosh et-yehovah vayeshevu lefanay {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶת־זִקְנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֗ם כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הֲלִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֹתִ֖י אַתֶּ֣ם בָּאִ֑ים חַי־אָ֙נִי֙ אִם־אִדָּרֵ֣שׁ לָכֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: O mortal, speak to the elders of Israel and say to them: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Have you come to inquire of Me? As I live, I will not respond to your inquiry—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: ven-adam daver et-zikeney yisherael veamareta alehem khoh amar adonay yehovih haliderosh otiy atem vaiym chay-aniy im-idaresh lakhem neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: הֲתִשְׁפֹּ֣ט אֹתָ֔ם הֲתִשְׁפּ֖וֹט בֶּן־אָדָ֑ם אֶת־תּוֹעֲבֹ֥ת אֲבוֹתָ֖ם הוֹדִיעֵֽם׃
Translated: Arraign, arraign them, O mortal! Declare to them the abhorrent deeds of their ancestors.
Transliteration: hatishefot otam hatishefvot ven-adam et-tvoavot avvotam hvodiyem

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ בְּיוֹם֙ בׇּחֳרִ֣י בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וָאֶשָּׂ֣א יָדִ֗י לְזֶ֙רַע֙ בֵּ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב וָאִוָּדַ֥ע לָהֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וָאֶשָּׂ֨א יָדִ֤י לָהֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Say to them: Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
On the day that I chose Israel, I gave My oath to the stock of the House of Jacob; when I made Myself known to them in the land of Egypt, I gave my oath to them. When I said, “I the ETERNAL am your God,”
Transliteration: veamareta aleyhem khoh-amar adonay yehovih veyvom vׇchoriy veyisherael vaesha yadiy lezera veyt yaakov vaivada lahem veerets mitserayiim vaesha yadiy lahem lemor aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא נָשָׂ֤אתִי יָדִי֙ לָהֶ֔ם לְהוֹצִיאָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֶל־אֶ֜רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־תַּ֣רְתִּי לָהֶ֗ם זָבַ֤ת חָלָב֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ צְבִ֥י הִ֖יא לְכׇל־הָאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: that same day I swore to them to take them out of the land of Egypt into a land flowing with milk and honey, a land that I had sought out for them, the fairest of all lands.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu nashatiy yadiy lahem lehvotsiyam meerets mitserayiim el-erets asher-taretiy lahem zavat chalav udevash tseviy hiy lekhׇl-haaratsvot

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם אִ֣ישׁ שִׁקּוּצֵ֤י עֵינָיו֙ הַשְׁלִ֔יכוּ וּבְגִלּוּלֵ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם אַל־תִּטַּמָּ֑אוּ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I also said to them: Cast away, every one of you, the detestable things that you are drawn to, and do not defile yourselves with the fetishes of Egypt—I the E<small>TERNAL</small> am your God.
Transliteration: vaomar alehem iysh shikutsey eynayv hasheliykhu uvegiluley mitserayiim al-titamau aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַיַּמְרוּ־בִ֗י וְלֹ֤א אָבוּ֙ לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ אֵלַ֔י אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־שִׁקּוּצֵ֤י עֵֽינֵיהֶם֙ לֹ֣א הִשְׁלִ֔יכוּ וְאֶת־גִּלּוּלֵ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם לֹ֣א עָזָ֑בוּ וָאֹמַ֞ר לִשְׁפֹּ֧ךְ חֲמָתִ֣י עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לְכַלּ֤וֹת אַפִּי֙ בָּהֶ֔ם בְּת֖וֹךְ אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: But they defied Me and refused to listen to Me. Not one of them cast away the detestable things they were drawn to, nor did they give up the fetishes of Egypt. Then I resolved to pour out My fury upon them, to vent all My anger upon them there, in the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayameru-viy velo avu lishemoa elay iysh et-shikutsey eyneyhem lo hisheliykhu veet-giluley mitserayiim lo azavu vaomar lishefokhe chamatiy aleyhem lekhalvot afiy vahem vetvokhe erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וָאַ֙עַשׂ֙ לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמִ֔י לְבִלְתִּ֥י הֵחֵ֛ל לְעֵינֵ֥י הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֣מָּה בְתוֹכָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נוֹדַ֤עְתִּי אֲלֵיהֶם֙ לְעֵ֣ינֵיהֶ֔ם לְהוֹצִיאָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: But I acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations among whom they were. For it was before their eyes that I had made Myself known to Israel to bring them out of the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vaaash lemaan shemiy leviletiy hechel leeyney hagvoyim asher-hemah vetvokham asher nvodaetiy aleyhem leeyneyhem lehvotsiyam meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וָאוֹצִיאֵ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וָאֲבִאֵ֖ם אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: I brought them out of the land of Egypt and I led them into the wilderness.
Transliteration: vavotsiyem meerets mitserayiim vaaviem el-hamidevar

Hebrew: וָאֶתֵּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ אֶת־חֻקּוֹתַ֔י וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֖י הוֹדַ֣עְתִּי אוֹתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אוֹתָ֛ם הָאָדָ֖ם וָחַ֥י בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: I gave them My laws and taught them My rules, by the pursuit of which humans shall live.
Transliteration: vaeten lahem et-chukvotay veet-mishefatay hvodaetiy votam asher yaasheh votam haadam vachay vahem

Hebrew: וְגַ֤ם אֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתַי֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לָהֶ֔ם לִהְי֣וֹת לְא֔וֹת בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵינֵיהֶ֑ם לָדַ֕עַת כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃
Translated: Moreover, I gave them My sabbaths to serve as a sign between Me and them, that they might know that it is I, G<small>OD</small>, who sanctify them.
Transliteration: vegam et-shavetvotay natatiy lahem liheyvot levot veyniy uveyneyhem ladaat khiy aniy yehovah mekadesham

Hebrew: וַיַּמְרוּ־בִ֨י בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר בְּחֻקּוֹתַ֨י לֹא־הָלָ֜כוּ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֣י מָאָ֗סוּ אֲשֶׁר֩ יַעֲשֶׂ֨ה אֹתָ֤ם הָֽאָדָם֙ וָחַ֣י בָּהֶ֔ם וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֖י חִלְּל֣וּ מְאֹ֑ד וָאֹמַ֞ר לִשְׁפֹּ֨ךְ חֲמָתִ֧י עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר לְכַלּוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: But the House of Israel rebelled against Me in the wilderness; they did not follow My laws and they rejected My rules—by the pursuit of which humans shall live—and they grossly desecrated My sabbaths. Then I thought to pour out My fury upon them in the wilderness and to make an end of them;
Transliteration: vayameru-viy veyt-yisherael vamidevar vechukvotay lo-halakhu veet-mishefatay maasu asher yaasheh otam haadam vachay vahem veet-shavetotay chilelu meod vaomar lishefokhe chamatiy aleyhem vamidevar lekhalvotam

Hebrew: וָאֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמִ֑י לְבִלְתִּ֤י הֵחֵל֙ לְעֵינֵ֣י הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹצֵאתִ֖ים לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: but I acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations before whose eyes I had led them out.
Transliteration: vaeesheh lemaan shemiy leviletiy hechel leeyney hagvoyim asher hvotsetiym leeyneyhem

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִ֗י נָשָׂ֧אתִי יָדִ֛י לָהֶ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר לְבִלְתִּי֩ הָבִ֨יא אוֹתָ֜ם אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֗תִּי זָבַ֤ת חָלָב֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ צְבִ֥י הִ֖יא לְכׇל־הָאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: However, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land flowing with milk and honey, the fairest of all lands, that I had assigned [to them],
Transliteration: vegam-aniy nashatiy yadiy lahem vamidevar leviletiy haviy votam el-haarets asher-natatiy zavat chalav udevash tseviy hiy lekhׇl-haaratsvot

Hebrew: יַ֜עַן בְּמִשְׁפָּטַ֣י מָאָ֗סוּ וְאֶת־חֻקּוֹתַי֙ לֹא־הָלְכ֣וּ בָהֶ֔ם וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתַ֖י חִלֵּ֑לוּ כִּ֛י אַחֲרֵ֥י גִלּוּלֵיהֶ֖ם לִבָּ֥ם הֹלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: for they had rejected My rules, disobeyed My laws, and desecrated My sabbaths; their hearts followed after their fetishes.
Transliteration: yaan vemishefatay maasu veet-chukvotay lo-halekhu vahem veet-shavetvotay chilelu khiy acharey giluleyhem livam holekhe

Hebrew: וַתָּ֧חׇס עֵינִ֛י עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מִֽשַּׁחֲתָ֑ם וְלֹא־עָשִׂ֧יתִי אוֹתָ֛ם כָּלָ֖ה בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: But I had pity on them and did not destroy them; I did not make an end of them in the wilderness.
Transliteration: vatachׇs eyniy aleyhem mishachatam velo-ashiytiy votam khalah vamidevar

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֤ר אֶל־בְּנֵיהֶם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר בְּחוּקֵּ֤י אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ אַל־תֵּלֵ֔כוּ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפְּטֵיהֶ֖ם אַל־תִּשְׁמֹ֑רוּ וּבְגִלּוּלֵיהֶ֖ם אַל־תִּטַּמָּֽאוּ׃
Translated: I warned their children in the wilderness: Do not follow the practices of your ancestors, do not keep their ways, and do not defile yourselves with their fetishes.
Transliteration: vaomar el-veneyhem vamidevar vechukey avvoteykhem al-telekhu veet-mishefeteyhem al-tishemoru uvegiluleyhem al-titamau

Hebrew: אֲנִי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם בְּחֻקּוֹתַ֖י לֵ֑כוּ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֥י שִׁמְר֖וּ וַעֲשׂ֥וּ אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: I the E<small>TERNAL</small> One am your God: Follow My laws and be careful to observe My rules.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah eloheykhem vechukvotay lekhu veet-mishefatay shimeru vaashu votam

Hebrew: וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתַ֖י קַדֵּ֑שׁוּ וְהָי֤וּ לְאוֹת֙ בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֵיכֶ֔ם לָדַ֕עַת כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And hallow My sabbaths, that they may be a sign between Me and you, that you may know that I the E<small>TERNAL</small> One am your God.
Transliteration: veet-shavetvotay kadeshu vehayu levot veyniy uveyneykhem ladaat khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַיַּמְרוּ־בִ֣י הַבָּנִ֗ים בְּחֻקּוֹתַ֣י לֹֽא־הָ֠לָ֠כוּ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֨י לֹֽא־שָׁמְר֜וּ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אוֹתָ֗ם אֲשֶׁר֩ יַעֲשֶׂ֨ה אוֹתָ֤ם הָאָדָם֙ וָחַ֣י בָּהֶ֔ם אֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתַ֖י חִלֵּ֑לוּ וָאֹמַ֞ר לִשְׁפֹּ֧ךְ חֲמָתִ֣י עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לְכַלּ֥וֹת אַפִּ֛י בָּ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: But the children rebelled against Me: they did not follow My laws and did not faithfully observe My rules, by the pursuit of which humans shall live; they profaned My sabbaths. Then I resolved to pour out My fury upon them, to vent all My anger upon them, in the wilderness.
Transliteration: vayameru-viy havaniym vechukvotay lo-halakhu veet-mishefatay lo-shameru laashvot votam asher yaasheh votam haadam vachay vahem et-shavetvotay chilelu vaomar lishefokhe chamatiy aleyhem lekhalvot afiy vam vamidevar

Hebrew: וַהֲשִׁבֹ֙תִי֙ אֶת־יָדִ֔י וָאַ֖עַשׂ לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמִ֑י לְבִלְתִּ֤י הֵחֵל֙ לְעֵינֵ֣י הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אוֹתָ֖ם לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But I held back My hand and acted for the sake of My name, that it might not be profaned in the sight of the nations before whose eyes I had led them out.
Transliteration: vahashivotiy et-yadiy vaaash lemaan shemiy leviletiy hechel leeyney hagvoyim asher-hvotsetiy votam leeyneyhem

Hebrew: גַּם־אֲנִ֗י נָשָׂ֧אתִי אֶת־יָדִ֛י לָהֶ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר לְהָפִ֤יץ אֹתָם֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם וּלְזָר֥וֹת אוֹתָ֖ם בָּאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: However, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would scatter them among the nations and disperse them through the lands,
Transliteration: gam-aniy nashatiy et-yadiy lahem vamidevar lehafiyts otam vagvoyim ulezarvot votam vaaratsvot

Hebrew: יַ֜עַן מִשְׁפָּטַ֤י לֹֽא־עָשׂוּ֙ וְחֻקּוֹתַ֣י מָאָ֔סוּ וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתַ֖י חִלֵּ֑לוּ וְאַֽחֲרֵי֙ גִּלּוּלֵ֣י אֲבוֹתָ֔ם הָי֖וּ עֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: because they did not obey My rules, but rejected My laws, profaned My sabbaths, and looked with longing to the fetishes of their ancestors.
Transliteration: yaan mishefatay lo-ashu vechukvotay maasu veet-shavetvotay chilelu veacharey giluley avvotam hayu eyneyhem

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִי֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לָהֶ֔ם חֻקִּ֖ים לֹ֣א טוֹבִ֑ים וּמִ֨שְׁפָּטִ֔ים לֹ֥א יִֽחְי֖וּ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: Moreover, I gave them laws that were not good and rules by which they could not live:
Transliteration: vegam-aniy natatiy lahem chukiym lo tvoviym umishefatiym lo yicheyu vahem

Hebrew: וָאֲטַמֵּ֤א אוֹתָם֙ בְּמַתְּנוֹתָ֔ם בְּהַעֲבִ֖יר כׇּל־פֶּ֣טֶר רָ֑חַם לְמַ֣עַן אֲשִׁמֵּ֔ם לְמַ֙עַן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵדְע֔וּ אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: When they set aside every first issue of the womb, I defiled them by their very gifts—that I might render them desolate, that they might know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vaatame votam vematenvotam vehaaviyr khׇl-feter racham lemaan ashimem lemaan asher eideu asher aniy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶל־בֵּ֤ית יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בֶּן־אָדָ֔ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה ע֗וֹד זֹ֚את גִּדְּפ֤וּ אוֹתִי֙ אֲב֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם בְּמַעֲלָ֥ם בִּ֖י מָֽעַל׃
Translated: Now, O mortal, speak to the House of Israel and say to them: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: By this too your ancestors affronted Me and committed trespass against Me:
Transliteration: lakhen daver el-veyt yisherael ven-adam veamareta aleyhem khoh amar adonay yehovih vod zot gidefu votiy avvoteykhem vemaalam viy maal

Hebrew: וָאֲבִיאֵם֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־יָדִ֔י לָתֵ֥ת אוֹתָ֖הּ לָהֶ֑ם וַיִּרְאוּ֩ כׇל־גִּבְעָ֨ה רָמָ֜ה וְכׇל־עֵ֣ץ עָבֹ֗ת וַיִּזְבְּחוּ־שָׁ֤ם אֶת־זִבְחֵיהֶם֙ וַיִּתְּנוּ־שָׁם֙ כַּ֣עַס קׇרְבָּנָ֔ם וַיָּשִׂ֣ימוּ שָׁ֗ם רֵ֚יחַ נִיח֣וֹחֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּסִּ֥יכוּ שָׁ֖ם אֶת־נִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When I brought them to the land that I had sworn to give them, and they saw any high hill or any leafy tree, they slaughtered their sacrifices there and presented their offensive offerings there; there they produced their pleasing odors and poured out their libations.
Transliteration: vaaviyem el-haarets asher nashatiy et-yadiy latet votah lahem vayireu khׇl-giveah ramah vekhׇl-ets avot vayizevechu-sham et-zivecheyhem vayitenu-sham khaas kׇrevanam vayashiymu sham reycha niychvocheyhem vayasiykhu sham et-nisekheyhem

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם מָ֣ה הַבָּמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם הַבָּאִ֖ים שָׁ֑ם וַיִּקָּרֵ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ בָּמָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Then I said to them, “What is this shrine that you visit?” (Therefore such [a shrine] is called bamah to this day.)
Transliteration: vaomar alehem mah havamah asher-atem havaiym sham vayikare shemah vamah ad hayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן אֱמֹ֣ר ׀ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הַבְּדֶ֥רֶךְ אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם אַתֶּ֣ם נִטְמְאִ֑ים וְאַחֲרֵ֥י שִׁקּֽוּצֵיהֶ֖ם אַתֶּ֥ם זֹנִֽים׃
Translated: Now say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: If you defile yourselves as your ancestors did and go astray after their detestable things,
Transliteration: lakhen emor el-veyt yisherael khoh amar adonay yehovih havederekhe avvoteykhem atem nitemeiym veacharey shikutseyhem atem zoniym

Hebrew: וּבִשְׂאֵ֣ת מַתְּנֹתֵיכֶ֡ם בְּֽהַעֲבִיר֩ בְּנֵיכֶ֨ם בָּאֵ֜שׁ אַתֶּם֩ נִטְמְאִ֤֨ים לְכׇל־גִּלּֽוּלֵיכֶם֙ עַד־הַיּ֔וֹם {ס} וַאֲנִ֛י אִדָּרֵ֥שׁ לָכֶ֖ם בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה אִם־אִדָּרֵ֖שׁ לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: and if to this very day you defile yourselves in the presentation of your gifts by making your children pass through the fire to all your fetishes, shall I respond to your inquiry, O House of Israel? As I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—I will not respond to you.
Transliteration: uvisheet matenoteykhem vehaaviyr veneykhem vaesh atem nitemeiym lekhׇl-giluleykhem ad-hayyvom {s} vaaniy idaresh lakhem veyt yisherael chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-idaresh lakhem

Hebrew: וְהָֽעֹלָה֙ עַל־ר֣וּחֲכֶ֔ם הָי֖וֹ לֹ֣א תִֽהְיֶ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹמְרִ֗ים נִֽהְיֶ֤ה כַגּוֹיִם֙ כְּמִשְׁפְּח֣וֹת הָאֲרָצ֔וֹת לְשָׁרֵ֖ת עֵ֥ץ וָאָֽבֶן׃
Translated: And what you have in mind shall never come to pass—when you say, “We will be like the nations, like the families of the lands, worshiping wood and stone.”
Transliteration: vehaolah al-ruchakhem hayvo lo tiheyeh asher atem omeriym niheyeh khagvoyim khemishefechvot haaratsvot lesharet ets vaaven

Hebrew: חַי־אָ֕נִי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה אִם־לֹ֠א בְּיָ֨ד חֲזָקָ֜ה וּבִזְר֧וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֛ה וּבְחֵמָ֥ה שְׁפוּכָ֖ה אֶמְל֥וֹךְ עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: As I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—I will reign over you with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with overflowing fury.
Transliteration: chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-lo veyad chazakah uvizervoa netuyah uvechemah shefukhah emelvokhe aleykhem

Hebrew: וְהוֹצֵאתִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ מִן־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים וְקִבַּצְתִּ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם מִן־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר נְפוֹצֹתֶ֖ם בָּ֑ם בְּיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ וּבִזְר֣וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֔ה וּבְחֵמָ֖ה שְׁפוּכָֽה׃
Translated: With a strong hand and an outstretched arm and overflowing fury I will bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands where you are scattered,
Transliteration: vehvotsetiy etekhem min-haamiym vekivatsetiy etekhem min-haaratsvot asher nefvotsotem vam veyad chazakah uvizervoa netuyah uvechemah shefukhah

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶל־מִדְבַּ֖ר הָעַמִּ֑ים וְנִשְׁפַּטְתִּ֤י אִתְּכֶם֙ שָׁ֔ם פָּנִ֖ים אֶל־פָּנִֽים׃
Translated: and I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples; and there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.
Transliteration: vehevetiy etekhem el-midevar haamiym venishefatetiy itekhem sham faniym el-faniym

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁפַּ֙טְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֲב֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם בְּמִדְבַּ֖ר אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם כֵּ֚ן אִשָּׁפֵ֣ט אִתְּכֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: As I entered into judgment with your ancestors in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so will I enter into judgment with you—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khaasher nishefatetiy et-avvoteykhem vemidevar erets mitserayiim khen ishafet itekhem neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְהַעֲבַרְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑בֶט וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּמָסֹ֥רֶת הַבְּרִֽית׃
Translated: I will make you pass under the shepherd’s staff, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant.
Transliteration: vehaavaretiy etekhem tachat hashavet vehevetiy etekhem vemasoret haveriyt

Hebrew: וּבָרוֹתִ֣י מִכֶּ֗ם הַמֹּרְדִ֤ים וְהַפּֽוֹשְׁעִים֙ בִּ֔י מֵאֶ֤רֶץ מְגֽוּרֵיהֶם֙ אוֹצִ֣יא אוֹתָ֔ם וְאֶל־אַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֣א יָב֑וֹא וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will remove from you those who rebel and transgress against Me; I will take them out of the countries where they sojourn, but they shall not enter the land of Israel. Then you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: uvarvotiy mikhem hamorediym vehafvosheiym viy meerets megureyhem votsiy votam veel-ademat yisherael lo yavvo viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֨ם בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אִ֤ישׁ גִּלּוּלָיו֙ לְכ֣וּ עֲבֹ֔דוּ וְאַחַ֕ר אִם־אֵינְכֶ֖ם שֹׁמְעִ֣ים אֵלָ֑י וְאֶת־שֵׁ֤ם קׇדְשִׁי֙ לֹ֣א תְחַלְּלוּ־ע֔וֹד בְּמַתְּנוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם וּבְגִלּוּלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: As for you, O House of Israel, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Go—every last one of you—and worship your fetishes and continue, if you will not obey Me; but do not profane My holy name anymore with your idolatrous gifts.
Transliteration: veatem veyt-yisherael khoh-amar adonay yehovih iysh gilulayv lekhu avodu veachar im-eynekhem shomeiym elay veet-shem kׇdeshiy lo techalelu-vod vematenvoteykhem uvegiluleykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בְהַר־קׇדְשִׁ֞י בְּהַ֣ר ׀ מְר֣וֹם יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה שָׁ֣ם יַעַבְדֻ֜נִי כׇּל־בֵּ֧ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל כֻּלֹּ֖ה בָּאָ֑רֶץ שָׁ֣ם אֶרְצֵ֔ם וְשָׁ֞ם אֶדְר֣וֹשׁ אֶת־תְּרוּמֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם וְאֶת־רֵאשִׁ֛ית מַשְׂאוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם בְּכׇל־קׇדְשֵׁיכֶֽם׃
Translated: For only on My holy mountain, on the lofty mount of Israel—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—there, in the land, the entire House of Israel, all of it, must worship Me. There I will accept them, and there I will take note of your contributions and the choicest offerings of all your sacred things.
Transliteration: khiy vehar-kׇdeshiy vehar mervom yisherael neum adonay yehovih sham yaaveduniy khׇl-veyt yisherael khuloh vaarets sham eretsem vesham edervosh et-terumoteykhem veet-reshiyt mashevoteykhem vekhׇl-kׇdesheykhem

Hebrew: בְּרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֘חַ֮ אֶרְצֶ֣ה אֶתְכֶם֒ בְּהוֹצִיאִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ מִן־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים וְקִבַּצְתִּ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם מִן־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר נְפֹצֹתֶ֖ם בָּ֑ם וְנִקְדַּשְׁתִּ֥י בָכֶ֖ם לְעֵינֵ֥י הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: When I bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands in which you are scattered, I will accept you as a pleasing odor; and I will be sanctified through you in the sight of the nations.
Transliteration: vereycha niychocha eretseh etekhem vehvotsiyiy etekhem min-haamiym vekivatsetiy etekhem min-haaratsvot asher nefotsotem vam venikedashetiy vakhem leeyney hagvoyim

Hebrew: וִֽידַעְתֶּם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה בַּהֲבִיאִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֶל־אַדְמַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־יָדִ֔י לָתֵ֥ת אוֹתָ֖הּ לַאֲבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Then, when I have brought you to the land of Israel, to the country that I swore to give to your fathers, you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah vahaviyiy etekhem el-ademat yisherael el-haarets asher nashatiy et-yadiy latet votah laavvoteykhem

Hebrew: וּזְכַרְתֶּם־שָׁ֗ם אֶת־דַּרְכֵיכֶם֙ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־עֲלִיל֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִטְמֵאתֶ֖ם בָּ֑ם וּנְקֹֽטֹתֶם֙ בִּפְנֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכׇל־רָעוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
Translated: There you will recall your ways and all the acts by which you defiled yourselves; and you will loathe yourselves for all the evils that you committed.
Transliteration: uzekharetem-sham et-darekheykhem veet khׇl-aliylvoteykhem asher nitemetem vam unekototem vifeneykhem vekhׇl-ravoteykhem asher ashiytem

Hebrew: וִֽידַעְתֶּם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה בַּעֲשׂוֹתִ֥י אִתְּכֶ֖ם לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמִ֑י לֹא֩ כְדַרְכֵיכֶ֨ם הָרָעִ֜ים וְכַעֲלִילוֹתֵיכֶ֤ם הַנִּשְׁחָתוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Then, O House of Israel, you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>, when I deal with you for My name’s sake—not in accordance with your evil ways and corrupt acts—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah vaashvotiy itekhem lemaan shemiy lo khedarekheykhem haraiym vekhaaliylvoteykhem hanishechatvot veyt yisherael neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם שִׂ֤ים פָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ תֵּימָ֔נָה וְהַטֵּ֖ף אֶל־דָּר֑וֹם וְהִנָּבֵ֛א אֶל־יַ֥עַר הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה נֶֽגֶב׃
Translated: O mortal, set your face toward Teman, and proclaim to Darom, and prophesy against the brushland of the Negeb.
Transliteration: ven-adam shiym faneykha derekhe teymanah vehatef el-darvom vehinave el-yaar hashadeh negev

Hebrew: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ לְיַ֣עַר הַנֶּ֔גֶב שְׁמַ֖ע דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֡ה הִנְנִ֣י מַֽצִּית־בְּךָ֣ <small>׀</small> אֵ֡שׁ וְאָכְלָ֣ה בְךָ֣ כׇל־עֵֽץ־לַח֩ וְכׇל־עֵ֨ץ יָבֵ֤שׁ לֹֽא־תִכְבֶּה֙ לַהֶ֣בֶת שַׁלְהֶ֔בֶת וְנִצְרְבוּ־בָ֥הּ כׇּל־פָּנִ֖ים מִנֶּ֥גֶב צָפֽוֹנָה׃
Translated: Say to the brushland of the Negeb: Hear the word of G<small>OD</small>. Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to kindle a fire in you, which shall devour every tree of yours, both green and withered. Its leaping flame shall not go out, and every face from south to north shall be scorched by it.
Transliteration: veamareta leyaar hanegev shema devar-yehovah khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineniy matsiyt-vekha <small></small> esh veakhelah vekha khׇl-ets-lach vekhׇl-ets yavesh lo-tikheveh lahevet shalehevet venitserevu-vah khׇl-faniym minegev tsafvonah

Hebrew: וְרָאוּ֙ כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֔ר כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּֽעַרְתִּ֑יהָ לֹ֖א תִּכְבֶּֽה׃
Translated: Then all flesh shall recognize that I, G<small>OD</small>, have kindled it; it shall not go out.
Transliteration: verau khׇl-vashar khiy aniy yehovah viaretiyha lo tikheveh

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֕ר אֲהָ֖הּ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הֵ֚מָּה אֹמְרִ֣ים לִ֔י הֲלֹ֛א מְמַשֵּׁ֥ל מְשָׁלִ֖ים הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated: And I said, “Ah, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! They say of me: He is just a riddlemonger.”
Transliteration: vaomar ahah adonay yehovih hemah omeriym liy halo memashel meshaliym hu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם שִׂ֤ים פָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְהַטֵּ֖ף אֶל־מִקְדָּשִׁ֑ים וְהִנָּבֵ֖א אֶל־אַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: O mortal, set your face toward Jerusalem and proclaim against her sanctuaries and prophesy against the land of Israel.
Transliteration: ven-adam shiym faneykha el-yerushala͏im vehatef el-mikedashiym vehinave el-ademat yisherael

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֞ לְאַדְמַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֣י אֵלַ֔יִךְ וְהוֹצֵאתִ֥י חַרְבִּ֖י מִתַּעְרָ֑הּ וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י מִמֵּ֖ךְ צַדִּ֥יק וְרָשָֽׁע׃
Translated: Say to the land of Israel: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deal with you! I will draw My sword from its sheath, and I will wipe out from you both the righteous and the wicked.
Transliteration: veamareta leademat yisherael khoh amar yehovah hineniy elayiikhe vehvotsetiy chareviy mitaerah vehikheratiy mimekhe tsadiyk verasha

Hebrew: יַ֛עַן אֲשֶׁר־הִכְרַ֥תִּי מִמֵּ֖ךְ צַדִּ֣יק וְרָשָׁ֑ע לָ֠כֵ֠ן תֵּצֵ֨א חַרְבִּ֧י מִתַּעְרָ֛הּ אֶל־כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֖ר מִנֶּ֥גֶב צָפֽוֹן׃
Translated: In order to wipe out from you both the righteous and the wicked, My sword shall assuredly be unsheathed against all flesh from south to north;
Transliteration: yaan asher-hikheratiy mimekhe tsadiyk verasha lakhen tetse chareviy mitaerah el-khׇl-vashar minegev tsafvon

Hebrew: וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֔ר כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה הוֹצֵ֥אתִי חַרְבִּ֖י מִתַּעְרָ֑הּ לֹ֥א תָשׁ֖וּב עֽוֹד׃ {ס}
Translated: and all flesh shall know that I, G<small>OD</small>, have drawn My sword from its sheath, not to be sheathed again.
Transliteration: veyadeu khׇl-vashar khiy aniy yehovah hvotsetiy chareviy mitaerah lo tashuv vod {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֥ה בֶן־אָדָ֖ם הֵאָנַ֑ח בְּשִׁבְר֤וֹן מׇתְנַ֙יִם֙ וּבִמְרִיר֔וּת תֵּאָנַ֖ח לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And you, O mortal, sigh; with tottering limbs and bitter grief, sigh before their eyes.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam heanach veshivervon mׇtenayiim uvimeriyrut teanach leeyneyhem

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּי־יֹאמְר֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ עַל־מָ֖ה אַתָּ֣ה נֶאֱנָ֑ח וְאָמַרְתָּ֡ אֶל־שְׁמוּעָ֣ה כִֽי־בָאָ֡ה וְנָמֵ֣ס כׇּל־לֵב֩ וְרָפ֨וּ כׇל־יָדַ֜יִם וְכִהֲתָ֣ה כׇל־ר֗וּחַ וְכׇל־בִּרְכַּ֙יִם֙ תֵּלַ֣כְנָה מַּ֔יִם הִנֵּ֤ה בָאָה֙ וְנִֽהְיָ֔תָה נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And when they ask you, “Why do you sigh?” answer, “Because of the tidings that have come.” Every heart shall sink and all hands hang nerveless; every spirit shall grow faint and all knees turn to water because of the tidings that have come. It is approaching, it shall come to pass—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yomeru eleykha al-mah atah neenach veamareta el-shemuah khiy-vaah venames khׇl-lev verafu khׇl-yadayiim vekhihatah khׇl-rucha vekhׇl-virekhayiim telakhenah mayiim hineh vaah veniheyatah neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הִנָּבֵא֙ וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר אֲדֹנָ֑י אֱמֹ֕ר חֶ֥רֶב חֶ֛רֶב הוּחַ֖דָּה וְגַם־מְרוּטָֽה׃
Translated: O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Sovereign: A sword! A sword has been whetted and polished.
Transliteration: ven-adam hinave veamareta khoh amar adonay emor cherev cherev huchadah vegam-merutah

Hebrew: לְמַ֨עַן טְבֹ֤חַ טֶ֙בַח֙ הוּחַ֔דָּה לְמַעַן־הֱיֵה־לָ֥הּ בָּרָ֖ק מֹרָ֑טָּה א֣וֹ נָשִׂ֔ישׂ שֵׁ֥בֶט בְּנִ֖י מֹאֶ֥סֶת כׇּל־עֵֽץ׃
Translated: It has been whetted to wreak slaughter; [therefore] it has been ground to a brilliant polish. How can we rejoice? My child, it scorns the rod and every stick.
Transliteration: lemaan tevocha tevach huchadah lemaan-heeih-lah varak moratah vo nashiysh shevet veniy moeset khׇl-ets

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛הּ לְמׇרְטָ֖הֿ לִתְפֹּ֣שׂ בַּכָּ֑ף הִֽיא־הוּחַ֤דָּה חֶ֙רֶב֙ וְהִ֣יא מֹרָ֔טָּה לָתֵ֥ת אוֹתָ֖הּ בְּיַד־הוֹרֵֽג׃
Translated: It has been given to be polished and then grasped in the hand; for this has the sword been whetted, for this polished—to be put into the hand of a slayer.
Transliteration: vayiten otah lemׇretahֿ litefosh vakhaf hiy-huchadah cherev vehiy moratah latet votah veyad-hvoreg

Hebrew: זְעַ֤ק וְהֵילֵל֙ בֶּן־אָדָ֔ם כִּי־הִיא֙ הָיְתָ֣ה בְעַמִּ֔י הִ֖יא בְּכׇל־נְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מְגוּרֵ֤י אֶל־חֶ֙רֶב֙ הָי֣וּ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י לָכֵ֖ן סְפֹ֥ק אֶל־יָרֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Cry and wail, O mortal, for this shall befall My people, this shall befall all the chieftains of Israel: they shall be cast before the sword together with My people; oh, strike the thigh [in grief].
Transliteration: zeak veheylel ven-adam khiy-hiy hayetah veamiy hiy vekhׇl-neshiyey yisherael megurey el-cherev hayu et-amiy lakhen sefok el-yarekhe

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בֹ֔חַן וּמָ֕ה אִם־גַּם־שֵׁ֥בֶט מֹאֶ֖סֶת לֹ֣א יִֽהְיֶ֑ה נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Consider: How shall it fail to happen, seeing that it even scorns the rod?—says the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy vochan umah im-gam-shevet moeset lo yiheyeh neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֔ם הִנָּבֵ֕א וְהַ֖ךְ כַּ֣ף אֶל־כָּ֑ף וְתִכָּפֵ֞ל חֶ֤רֶב שְׁלִישִׁ֙תָה֙ חֶ֣רֶב חֲלָלִ֔ים הִ֗יא חֶ֚רֶב חָלָ֣ל הַגָּד֔וֹל הַחֹדֶ֖רֶת לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: Further, O mortal, prophesy, striking hand against hand. Let the sword strike a second time and yet a third time; it is a sword for massacre, a sword for great carnage, that presses upon them.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam hinave vehakhe khaf el-khaf vetikhafel cherev sheliyshitah cherev chalaliym hiy cherev chalal hagadvol hachoderet lahem

Hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן ׀ לָמ֣וּג לֵ֗ב וְהַרְבֵּה֙ הַמִּכְשֹׁלִ֔ים עַ֚ל כׇּל־שַׁ֣עֲרֵיהֶ֔ם נָתַ֖תִּי אִבְחַת־חָ֑רֶב אָ֛ח עֲשׂוּיָ֥ה לְבָרָ֖ק מְעֻטָּ֥ה לְטָֽבַח׃
Translated: Thus hearts shall lose courage and many shall fall. At all their gates I have appointed slaughter by the sword. Ah! it is made to flash brilliantly, it is honed for slaughter.
Transliteration: lemaan lamug lev vehareveh hamikhesholiym al khׇl-shaareyhem natatiy ivechat-charev ach ashuyah levarak meutah letavach

Hebrew: הִתְאַחֲדִ֥י הֵימִ֖נִי הָשִׂ֣ימִי הַשְׂמִ֑ילִי אָ֖נָה פָּנַ֥יִךְ מֻעָדֽוֹת׃
Translated: Be united, go to the right, turn left; whither are you bound?
Transliteration: hiteachadiy heyminiy hashiymiy hashemiyliy anah fanayiikhe muadvot

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִ֗י אַכֶּ֤ה כַפִּי֙ אֶל־כַּפִּ֔י וַהֲנִיחֹתִ֖י חֲמָתִ֑י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּֽרְתִּי׃ {פ}
Translated: I, too, will strike hand against hand and will satisfy My fury upon you; I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken.
Transliteration: vegam-aniy akheh khafiy el-khafiy vahaniychotiy chamatiy aniy yehovah divaretiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֨ה בֶן־אָדָ֜ם שִׂים־לְךָ֣ ׀ שְׁנַ֣יִם דְּרָכִ֗ים לָבוֹא֙ חֶ֣רֶב מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ אֶחָ֖ד יֵצְא֣וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם וְיָ֣ד בָּרֵ֔א בְּרֹ֥אשׁ דֶּרֶךְ־עִ֖יר בָּרֵֽא׃
Translated: And you, O mortal, choose two roads on which the sword of the king of Babylon may advance, both issuing from the same country; and select a spot, select it where roads branch off to [two] cities.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam shiym-lekha shenayiim derakhiym lavvo cherev melekhe-vavel meerets echad eitseu sheneyhem veyad vare verosh derekhe-iyr vare

Hebrew: דֶּ֣רֶךְ תָּשִׂ֔ים לָב֣וֹא חֶ֔רֶב אֵ֖ת רַבַּ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֑וֹן וְאֶת־יְהוּדָ֥ה בִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בְּצוּרָֽה׃
Translated: Choose a way for the sword to advance on Rabbah of the Ammonites or on fortified Jerusalem in Judah.
Transliteration: derekhe tashiym lavvo cherev et ravat veney-amvon veet-yehudah viyrushala͏im vetsurah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עָמַ֨ד מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֜ל אֶל־אֵ֣ם הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ בְּרֹ֛אשׁ שְׁנֵ֥י הַדְּרָכִ֖ים לִקְסׇם־קָ֑סֶם קִלְקַ֤ל בַּֽחִצִּים֙ שָׁאַ֣ל בַּתְּרָפִ֔ים רָאָ֖ה בַּכָּבֵֽד׃
Translated: For the king of Babylon has stood at the fork of the road, where two roads branch off, to perform divination: He has shaken arrows, consulted oracle idols, and inspected the liver.
Transliteration: khiy-amad melekhe-vavel el-em haderekhe verosh sheney haderakhiym likesׇm-kasem kilekal vachitsiym shaal vaterafiym raah vakhaved

Hebrew: בִּימִינ֞וֹ הָיָ֣ה ׀ הַקֶּ֣סֶם יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם לָשׂ֤וּם כָּרִים֙ לִפְתֹּ֤חַ פֶּה֙ בְּרֶ֔צַח לְהָרִ֥ים ק֖וֹל בִּתְרוּעָ֑ה לָשׂ֤וּם כָּרִים֙ עַל־שְׁעָרִ֔ים לִשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ סֹלְלָ֖ה לִבְנ֥וֹת דָּיֵֽק׃
Translated: In his right hand came up the omen against Jerusalem—to set battering rams, to proclaim murder, to raise battle shouts, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, to erect towers.
Transliteration: viymiynvo hayah hakesem yerushala͏im lashum khariym lifetocha feh veretsach lehariym kvol viteruah lashum khariym al-sheariym lishefokhe solelah livenvot daeik

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה לָהֶ֤ם (כקסום) [כִּקְסׇם־]שָׁוְא֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁבֻעֵ֥י שְׁבֻע֖וֹת לָהֶ֑ם וְהוּא־מַזְכִּ֥יר עָוֺ֖ן לְהִתָּפֵֽשׂ׃ {ס}
Translated: In their eyes, the oaths they had sworn to them were like empty divination; but this shall serve to recall their guilt, for which they shall be taken to task.
Transliteration: vehayah lahem (khksvm) [khikesׇm-]shave veeyneyhem shevuey shevuvot lahem vehu-mazekhiyr avon lehitafesh {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ יַ֗עַן הַזְכַּרְכֶם֙ עֲוֺ֣נְכֶ֔ם בְּהִגָּל֣וֹת פִּשְׁעֵיכֶ֗ם לְהֵֽרָאוֹת֙ חַטֹּ֣אותֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכֹ֖ל עֲלִילֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם יַ֚עַן הִזָּ֣כֶרְכֶ֔ם בַּכַּ֖ף תִּתָּפֵֽשׂוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: For causing your guilt to be recalled, your transgressions to be uncovered, and your sins to be revealed—all your misdeeds—because you have brought yourselves to [My] mind, you shall be taken to task.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih yaan hazekharekhem avonekhem vehigalvot fisheeykhem leheravot chatovteykhem vekhol aliylvoteykhem yaan hizakherekhem vakhaf titafeshu {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ חָלָ֣ל רָשָׁ֔ע נְשִׂ֖יא יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣א יוֹמ֔וֹ בְּעֵ֖ת עֲוֺ֥ן קֵֽץ׃ {ס}
Translated: And to you, O dishonored wicked prince of Israel, whose day has come—the time set for your punishment—
Transliteration: veatah chalal rasha neshiy yisherael asher-va yvomvo veet avon kets {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הָסִיר֙ הַמִּצְנֶ֔פֶת וְהָרִ֖ים הָעֲטָרָ֑ה זֹ֣את לֹא־זֹ֔את הַשָּׁפָ֣לָה הַגְבֵּ֔הַּ וְהַגָּבֹ֖הַּ הַשְׁפִּֽיל׃
Translated: thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Remove the turban and lift off the crown! This shall not remain as it is; exalt the low and abase the high.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih hasiyr hamitsenefet vehariym haatarah zot lo-zot hashafalah hageveha vehagavoha hashefiyl

Hebrew: עַוָּ֥ה עַוָּ֖ה עַוָּ֣ה אֲשִׂימֶ֑נָּה גַּם־זֹאת֙ לֹ֣א הָיָ֔ה עַד־בֹּ֛א אֲשֶׁר־ל֥וֹ הַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט וּנְתַתִּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Ruin, an utter ruin I will make it. It shall be no more until he comes to whom it rightfully belongs; and I will give it to him.
Transliteration: avah avah avah ashiymenah gam-zot lo hayah ad-vo asher-lvo hamishefat unetatiyv {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם הִנָּבֵ֤א וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּ֖וֹן וְאֶל־חֶרְפָּתָ֑ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ חֶ֣רֶב חֶ֤רֶב פְּתוּחָה֙ לְטֶ֣בַח מְרוּטָ֔ה לְהָכִ֖יל לְמַ֥עַן בָּרָֽק׃
Translated: Further, O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> concerning the Ammonites and their blasphemies: Proclaim: O sword! O sword unsheathed for slaughter, polished to the utmost, to a flashing brilliance!
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam hinave veamareta khoh amar adonay yehovih el-veney amvon veel-cherefatam veamareta cherev cherev fetuchah letevach merutah lehakhiyl lemaan varak

Hebrew: בַּחֲז֥וֹת לָךְ֙ שָׁ֔וְא בִּקְסׇם־לָ֖ךְ כָּזָ֑ב לָתֵ֣ת אוֹתָ֗ךְ אֶֽל־צַוְּארֵי֙ חַֽלְלֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣א יוֹמָ֔ם בְּעֵ֖ת עֲוֺ֥ן קֵֽץ׃
Translated: Because they have prophesied falsely about you and have divined deceitfully concerning you, you shall be wielded over the necks of the dishonored wicked ones, for their day has come, the time set for their punishment.
Transliteration: vachazvot lakhe shave vikesׇm-lakhe khazav latet votakhe el-tsaverey chaleley reshaiym asher-va yvomam veet avon kets

Hebrew: הָשַׁ֖ב אֶל־תַּעְרָ֑הּ בִּמְק֧וֹם אֲשֶׁר־נִבְרֵ֛את בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מְכֻרוֹתַ֖יִךְ אֶשְׁפֹּ֥ט אֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: Return it to its sheath! In the place where you were created, in the land of your origin, I will judge you.
Transliteration: hashav el-taerah vimekvom asher-niveret veerets mekhurvotayiikhe eshefot otakhe

Hebrew: וְשָׁפַכְתִּ֤י עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ זַעְמִ֔י בְּאֵ֥שׁ עֶבְרָתִ֖י אָפִ֣יחַ עָלָ֑יִךְ וּנְתַתִּ֗יךְ בְּיַד֙ אֲנָשִׁ֣ים בֹּעֲרִ֔ים חָרָשֵׁ֖י מַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated: I will pour out My indignation upon you, I will blow upon you with the fire of My wrath; and I will deliver you into the hands of barbarians, skilled in destruction.
Transliteration: veshafakhetiy alayiikhe zaemiy veesh everatiy afiycha alayiikhe unetatiykhe veyad anashiym voariym charashey mashechiyt

Hebrew: לָאֵ֤שׁ תִּֽהְיֶה֙ לְאׇכְלָ֔ה דָּמֵ֥ךְ יִהְיֶ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ הָאָ֑רֶץ לֹ֣א תִזָּכֵ֔רִי כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּֽרְתִּי׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall be fuel for the fire, your blood shall sink into the earth, you shall not be remembered, for I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken.
Transliteration: laesh tiheyeh leׇkhelah damekhe yiheyeh vetvokhe haarets lo tizakheriy khiy aniy yehovah divaretiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֔ם הֲתִשְׁפֹּ֥ט הֲתִשְׁפֹּ֖ט אֶת־עִ֣יר הַדָּמִ֑ים וְה֣וֹדַעְתָּ֔הּ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Further, O mortal, arraign, arraign the city of bloodshed; declare to her all her abhorrent deeds!
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam hatishefot hatishefot et-iyr hadamiym vehvodaetah et khׇl-tvoavvoteyha

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה עִ֣יר שֹׁפֶ֥כֶת דָּ֛ם בְּתוֹכָ֖הּ לָב֣וֹא עִתָּ֑הּ וְעָשְׂתָ֧ה גִלּוּלִ֛ים עָלֶ֖יהָ לְטׇמְאָֽה׃
Translated: Say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: O city in whose midst blood is shed, so that your hour is approaching; within which fetishes are made, so that you have become impure!
Transliteration: veamareta khoh amar adonay yehovih iyr shofekhet dam vetvokhah lavvo itah veashetah giluliym aleyha letׇmeah

Hebrew: בְּדָמֵ֨ךְ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁפַ֜כְתְּ אָשַׁ֗מְתְּ וּבְגִלּוּלַ֤יִךְ אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂית֙ טָמֵ֔את וַתַּקְרִ֣יבִי יָמַ֔יִךְ וַתָּב֖וֹא עַד־שְׁנוֹתָ֑יִךְ עַל־כֵּ֗ן נְתַתִּ֤יךְ חֶרְפָּה֙ לַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְקַלָּסָ֖ה לְכׇל־הָאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: You stand guilty of the blood you have shed, defiled by the fetishes you have made. You have brought on your day; you have reached your year. Therefore I will make you the mockery of the nations and the scorn of all the lands.
Transliteration: vedamekhe asher-shafakhete ashamete uvegilulayiikhe asher-ashiyt tamet vatakeriyviy yamayiikhe vatavvo ad-shenvotayiikhe al-khen netatiykhe cherefah lagvoyim vekalasah lekhׇl-haaratsvot

Hebrew: הַקְּרֹב֛וֹת וְהָרְחֹק֥וֹת מִמֵּ֖ךְ יִתְקַלְּסוּ־בָ֑ךְ טְמֵאַ֣ת הַשֵּׁ֔ם רַבַּ֖ת הַמְּהוּמָֽה׃
Translated: Both the near and the far shall scorn you, O besmirched of name, O laden with iniquity!
Transliteration: hakerovvot veharechokvot mimekhe yitekalesu-vakhe temeat hashem ravat hamehumah

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֙ נְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִ֥ישׁ לִזְרֹע֖וֹ הָ֣יוּ בָ֑ךְ לְמַ֖עַן שְׁפׇךְ־דָּֽם׃
Translated: Every one of the princes of Israel in your midst used his strength for the shedding of blood.
Transliteration: hineh neshiyey yisherael iysh lizerovo hayu vakhe lemaan shefׇkhe-dam

Hebrew: אָ֤ב וָאֵם֙ הֵקַ֣לּוּ בָ֔ךְ לַגֵּ֛ר עָשׂ֥וּ בַעֹ֖שֶׁק בְּתוֹכֵ֑ךְ יָת֥וֹם וְאַלְמָנָ֖ה ה֥וֹנוּ בָֽךְ׃
Translated: Fathers and mothers have been humiliated within you; strangers have been cheated in your midst; orphans and widows have been wronged within you.
Transliteration: av vaem hekalu vakhe lager ashu vaoshek vetvokhekhe yatvom vealemanah hvonu vakhe

Hebrew: קׇדָשַׁ֖י בָּזִ֑ית וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֖י חִלָּֽלְתְּ׃
Translated: You have despised My holy things and profaned My sabbaths.
Transliteration: kׇdashay vaziyt veet-shavetotay chilalete

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֥י רָכִ֛יל הָ֥יוּ בָ֖ךְ לְמַ֣עַן שְׁפׇךְ־דָּ֑ם וְאֶל־הֶֽהָרִים֙ אָ֣כְלוּ בָ֔ךְ זִמָּ֖ה עָשׂ֥וּ בְתוֹכֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Base men in your midst were intent on shedding blood; in you they have eaten on the mountains; and they have practiced depravity in your midst.
Transliteration: aneshey rakhiyl hayu vakhe lemaan shefׇkhe-dam veel-hehariym akhelu vakhe zimah ashu vetvokhekhe

Hebrew: עֶרְוַת־אָ֖ב גִּלָּה־בָ֑ךְ טְמֵאַ֥ת הַנִּדָּ֖ה עִנּוּ־בָֽךְ׃
Translated: In you they have uncovered their fathers’ nakedness; in you they have violated women during their menstrual impurity.
Transliteration: erevat-av gilah-vakhe temeat hanidah inu-vakhe

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ ׀ אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֵ֗הוּ עָשָׂה֙ תּוֹעֵבָ֔ה וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־כַּלָּת֖וֹ טִמֵּ֣א בְזִמָּ֑ה וְאִ֛ישׁ אֶת־אֲחֹת֥וֹ בַת־אָבִ֖יו עִנָּה־בָֽךְ׃
Translated: They have committed abhorrent acts with other men’s wives; in their depravity they have defiled their own daughters-in-law; in you they have violated their own sisters, daughters of their fathers.
Transliteration: veiysh et-eshet reehu ashah tvoevah veiysh et-khalatvo time vezimah veiysh et-achotvo vat-aviyv inah-vakhe

Hebrew: שֹׁ֥חַד לָֽקְחוּ־בָ֖ךְ לְמַ֣עַן שְׁפׇךְ־דָּ֑ם נֶ֧שֶׁךְ וְתַרְבִּ֣ית לָקַ֗חַתְּ וַתְּבַצְּעִ֤י רֵעַ֙יִךְ֙ בַּעֹ֔שֶׁק וְאֹתִ֣י שָׁכַ֔חַתְּ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: They have taken bribes within you to shed blood. You have taken advance and accrued interest; you have defrauded your fellow [Israelites] to your profit. You have forgotten Me—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: shochad lakechu-vakhe lemaan shefׇkhe-dam neshekhe vetareviyt lakachate vatevatseiy reayiikhe vaoshek veotiy shakhachate neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֙ הִכֵּ֣יתִי כַפִּ֔י אֶל־בִּצְעֵ֖ךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֑ית וְעַ֨ל־דָּמֵ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֖וּ בְּתוֹכֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Lo, I will strike My hands over the ill-gotten gains that you have amassed, and over the bloodshed that has been committed in your midst.
Transliteration: vehineh hikheytiy khafiy el-vitseekhe asher ashiyt veal-damekhe asher hayu vetvokhekhe

Hebrew: הֲיַעֲמֹ֤ד לִבֵּךְ֙ אִם־תֶּחֱזַ֣קְנָה יָדַ֔יִךְ לַיָּמִ֕ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י עֹשֶׂ֣ה אוֹתָ֑ךְ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי וְעָשִֽׂיתִי׃
Translated: Will your courage endure, will your hands remain firm in the days when I deal with you? I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken and I will act.
Transliteration: hayaamod livekhe im-techezakenah yadayiikhe layamiym asher aniy osheh votakhe aniy yehovah divaretiy veashiytiy

Hebrew: וַהֲפִיצוֹתִ֤י אוֹתָךְ֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם וְזֵרִיתִ֖יךְ בָּאֲרָצ֑וֹת וַהֲתִמֹּתִ֥י טֻמְאָתֵ֖ךְ מִמֵּֽךְ׃
Translated: I will scatter you among the nations and disperse you through the lands; I will consume the impurity out of you.
Transliteration: vahafiytsvotiy votakhe vagvoyim vezeriytiykhe vaaratsvot vahatimotiy tumeatekhe mimekhe

Hebrew: וְנִחַ֥לְתְּ בָּ֖ךְ לְעֵינֵ֣י גוֹיִ֑ם וְיָדַ֖עַתְּ כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall be dishonored in the sight of nations, and you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venichalete vakhe leeyney gvoyim veyadaate khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הָיוּ־לִ֥י בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל (לסוג) [לְסִ֑יג] כֻּלָּ֡ם נְ֠חֹ֠שֶׁת וּבְדִ֨יל וּבַרְזֶ֤ל וְעוֹפֶ֙רֶת֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ כּ֔וּר סִגִ֥ים כֶּ֖סֶף הָיֽוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: O mortal, the House of Israel has become dross to Me; they are all copper, tin, iron, and lead. But in a crucible, the dross shall turn into silver.
Transliteration: ven-adam hayu-liy veyt-yisherael (lsvg) [lesiyg] khulam nechoshet uvediyl uvarezel vevoferet vetvokhe khur sigiym khesef hayu {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֛עַן הֱי֥וֹת כֻּלְּכֶ֖ם לְסִגִ֑ים לָכֵן֙ הִנְנִ֣י קֹבֵ֣ץ אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶל־תּ֖וֹךְ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because you have all become dross, I will gather you into Jerusalem.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan heyvot khulekhem lesigiym lakhen hineniy kovets etekhem el-tvokhe yerushala͏im

Hebrew: קְבֻ֣צַת כֶּ֡סֶף וּ֠נְחֹ֠שֶׁת וּבַרְזֶ֨ל וְעוֹפֶ֤רֶת וּבְדִיל֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ כּ֔וּר לָפַֽחַת־עָלָ֥יו אֵ֖שׁ לְהַנְתִּ֑יךְ כֵּ֤ן אֶקְבֹּץ֙ בְּאַפִּ֣י וּבַחֲמָתִ֔י וְהִנַּחְתִּ֥י וְהִתַּכְתִּ֖י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: As silver, copper, iron, lead, and tin are gathered into a crucible to blow the fire upon them, so as to melt them, so will I gather you in My fierce anger and cast you [into the fire] and melt you.
Transliteration: kevutsat khesef unechoshet uvarezel vevoferet uvediyl el-tvokhe khur lafachat-alayv esh lehanetiykhe khen ekevots veafiy uvachamatiy vehinachetiy vehitakhetiy etekhem

Hebrew: וְכִנַּסְתִּ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְנָפַחְתִּ֥י עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בְּאֵ֣שׁ עֶבְרָתִ֑י וְנִתַּכְתֶּ֖ם בְּתוֹכָֽהּ׃
Translated: I will gather you and I will blow upon you the fire of My fury, and you shall be melted in it.
Transliteration: vekhinasetiy etekhem venafachetiy aleykhem veesh everatiy venitakhetem vetvokhah

Hebrew: כְּהִתּ֥וּךְ כֶּ֙סֶף֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ כּ֔וּר כֵּ֖ן תֻּתְּכ֣וּ בְתוֹכָ֑הּ וִֽידַעְתֶּם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה שָׁפַ֥כְתִּי חֲמָתִ֖י עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: As silver is melted in a crucible, so shall you be melted in it. And you shall know that I, G<small>OD</small>, have poured out My fury upon you.
Transliteration: khehitukhe khesef vetvokhe khur khen tutekhu vetvokhah viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah shafakhetiy chamatiy aleykhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם אֱמׇר־לָ֕הּ אַ֣תְּ אֶ֔רֶץ לֹ֥א מְטֹהָרָ֖ה הִ֑יא לֹ֥א גֻשְׁמָ֖הּ בְּי֥וֹם זָֽעַם׃
Translated: O mortal, say to her: You are an unpurified land, not to be washed with rain on the day of indignation.
Transliteration: ven-adam emׇr-lah ate erets lo metoharah hiy lo gushemah veyvom zaam

Hebrew: קֶ֤שֶׁר נְבִיאֶ֙יהָ֙ בְּתוֹכָ֔הּ כַּאֲרִ֥י שׁוֹאֵ֖ג טֹ֣רֵֽף טָ֑רֶף נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָכָ֗לוּ חֹ֤סֶן וִיקָר֙ יִקָּ֔חוּ אַלְמְנוֹתֶ֖יהָ הִרְבּ֥וּ בְתוֹכָֽהּ׃
Translated: Her gang of prophets are like roaring lions in her midst, rending prey. They devour human beings; they seize treasure and wealth; they have widowed many women in her midst.
Transliteration: kesher neviyeyha vetvokhah khaariy shvoeg toref taref nefesh akhalu chosen viykar yikachu alemenvoteyha hirevu vetvokhah

Hebrew: כֹּהֲנֶ֜יהָ חָמְס֣וּ תוֹרָתִי֮ וַיְחַלְּל֣וּ קׇדָשַׁי֒ בֵּֽין־קֹ֤דֶשׁ לְחֹל֙ לֹ֣א הִבְדִּ֔ילוּ וּבֵין־הַטָּמֵ֥א לְטָה֖וֹר לֹ֣א הוֹדִ֑יעוּ וּמִשַּׁבְּתוֹתַי֙ הֶעְלִ֣ימוּ עֵינֵיהֶ֔ם וָאֵחַ֖ל בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: Her priests have violated My Teaching: they have profaned what is sacred to Me, they have not distinguished between the sacred and the profane, they have not taught the difference between the impure and the pure, and they have closed their eyes to My sabbaths. I am profaned in their midst.
Transliteration: khohaneyha chamesu tvoratiy vayechalelu kׇdashay veyn-kodesh lechol lo hivediylu uveyn-hatame letahvor lo hvodiyu umishavetvotay heeliymu eyneyhem vaechal vetvokham

Hebrew: שָׂרֶ֣יהָ בְקִרְבָּ֔הּ כִּזְאֵבִ֖ים טֹ֣רְפֵי טָ֑רֶף לִשְׁפׇּךְ־דָּם֙ לְאַבֵּ֣ד נְפָשׁ֔וֹת לְמַ֖עַן בְּצֹ֥עַ בָּֽצַע׃
Translated: Her officials are like wolves rending prey in her midst; they shed blood and destroy lives to win ill-gotten gain.
Transliteration: shareyha vekirevah khizeeviym torefey taref lishefׇkhe-dam leaved nefashvot lemaan vetsoa vatsa

Hebrew: וּנְבִיאֶ֗יהָ טָח֤וּ לָהֶם֙ תָּפֵ֔ל חֹזִ֣ים שָׁ֔וְא וְקֹסְמִ֥ים לָהֶ֖ם כָּזָ֑ב אֹמְרִ֗ים כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וַיהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֥א דִבֵּֽר׃
Translated: Her prophets, too, daub the wall for them with plaster: They prophesy falsely and divine deceitfully for them; they say, “Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>,” when G<small>OD</small> has not spoken.
Transliteration: uneviyeyha tachu lahem tafel choziym shave vekosemiym lahem khazav omeriym khoh amar adonay yehovih vayhovah lo diver

Hebrew: עַ֤ם הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ עָ֣שְׁקוּ עֹ֔שֶׁק וְגָזְל֖וּ גָּזֵ֑ל וְעָנִ֤י וְאֶבְיוֹן֙ הוֹנ֔וּ וְאֶת־הַגֵּ֥ר עָשְׁק֖וּ בְּלֹ֥א מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: And the people of the land have practiced fraud and committed robbery; they have wronged the poor and needy, have defrauded the stranger without redress.
Transliteration: am haarets asheku oshek vegazelu gazel veaniy veeveyvon hvonu veet-hager asheku velo mishefat

Hebrew: וָאֲבַקֵּ֣שׁ מֵהֶ֡ם אִ֣ישׁ גֹּֽדֵר־גָּדֵר֩ וְעֹמֵ֨ד בַּפֶּ֧רֶץ לְפָנַ֛י בְּעַ֥ד הָאָ֖רֶץ לְבִלְתִּ֣י שַׁחֲתָ֑הּ וְלֹ֖א מָצָֽאתִי׃
Translated: And I sought someone among them to repair the wall or to stand in the breach before Me in behalf of this land, that I might not destroy it; but I found none.
Transliteration: vaavakesh mehem iysh goder-gader veomed vaferets lefanay vead haarets leviletiy shachatah velo matsatiy

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁפֹּ֤ךְ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ זַעְמִ֔י בְּאֵ֥שׁ עֶבְרָתִ֖י כִּלִּיתִ֑ים דַּרְכָּם֙ בְּרֹאשָׁ֣ם נָתַ֔תִּי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I have therefore poured out My indignation upon them; I will consume them with the fire of My fury. I will repay them for their conduct—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vaeshefokhe aleyhem zaemiy veesh everatiy khiliytiym darekham verosham natatiy neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֑ם שְׁתַּ֣יִם נָשִׁ֔ים בְּנ֥וֹת אֵם־אַחַ֖ת הָיֽוּ׃
Translated: O mortal, once there were two women, daughters of one mother.
Transliteration: ven-adam shetayiim nashiym venvot em-achat hayu

Hebrew: וַתִּזְנֶ֣ינָה בְמִצְרַ֔יִם בִּנְעוּרֵיהֶ֖ן זָנ֑וּ שָׁ֚מָּה מֹעֲכ֣וּ שְׁדֵיהֶ֔ן וְשָׁ֣ם עִשּׂ֔וּ דַּדֵּ֖י בְּתוּלֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: They played the whore in Egypt; they played the whore while still young. There their breasts were squeezed, and there their virgin nipples were handled.
Transliteration: vatizeneynah vemitserayiim vineureyhen zanu shamah moakhu shedeyhen vesham ishu dadey vetuleyhen

Hebrew: וּשְׁמוֹתָ֗ן אׇהֳלָ֤ה הַגְּדוֹלָה֙ וְאׇהֳלִיבָ֣ה אֲחוֹתָ֔הּ וַתִּהְיֶ֣ינָה לִ֔י וַתֵּלַ֖דְנָה בָּנִ֣ים וּבָנ֑וֹת וּשְׁמוֹתָ֕ן שֹׁמְר֣וֹן אׇהֳלָ֔ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אׇהֳלִיבָֽה׃
