Translated: Their names were: the elder one, Oholah; and her sister, Oholibah. They became Mine, and they bore sons and daughters. As for their names, Oholah is Samaria, and Oholibah is Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ushemvotan ׇholah hagedvolah veׇholiyvah achvotah vatiheyeynah liy vateladenah vaniym uvanvot ushemvotan shomervon ׇholah viyrushala͏im ׇholiyvah

Hebrew: וַתִּ֥זֶן אׇהֳלָ֖ה תַּחְתָּ֑י וַתֶּעְגַּב֙ עַֽל־מְאַהֲבֶ֔יהָ אֶל־אַשּׁ֖וּר קְרוֹבִֽים׃
Translated: Oholah whored while she was Mine, and she lusted after her lovers, after the Assyrians, warriors
Transliteration: vatizen ׇholah tachetay vateegav al-meahaveyha el-ashur kervoviym

Hebrew: לְבֻשֵׁ֤י תְכֵ֙לֶת֙ פַּח֣וֹת וּסְגָנִ֔ים בַּח֥וּרֵי חֶ֖מֶד כֻּלָּ֑ם פָּרָשִׁ֕ים רֹכְבֵ֖י סוּסִֽים׃
Translated: clothed in blue, governors and prefects, cavalry troops—all of them handsome young fellows.
Transliteration: levushey tekhelet fachvot useganiym vachurey chemed khulam farashiym rokhevey susiym

Hebrew: וַתִּתֵּ֤ן תַּזְנוּתֶ֙יהָ֙ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם מִבְחַ֥ר בְּנֵֽי־אַשּׁ֖וּר כֻּלָּ֑ם וּבְכֹ֧ל אֲשֶׁר־עָגְבָ֛ה בְּכׇל־גִּלּוּלֵיהֶ֖ם נִטְמָֽאָה׃
Translated: She bestowed her favors upon them—upon all the pick of the Assyrians—and defiled herself with all their fetishes after which she lusted.
Transliteration: vatiten tazenuteyha aleyhem mivechar veney-ashur khulam uvekhol asher-agevah vekhׇl-giluleyhem nitemaah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־תַּזְנוּתֶ֤יהָ מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ לֹ֣א עָזָ֔בָה כִּ֤י אוֹתָהּ֙ שָׁכְב֣וּ בִנְעוּרֶ֔יהָ וְהֵ֥מָּה עִשּׂ֖וּ דַּדֵּ֣י בְתוּלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּשְׁפְּכ֥וּ תַזְנוּתָ֖ם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: She did not give up the whoring she had begun with the Egyptians; for they had lain with her in her youth, and they had handled her virgin nipples and had poured out their lust upon her.
Transliteration: veet-tazenuteyha mimitserayiim lo azavah khiy votah shakhevu vineureyha vehemah ishu dadey vetuleyha vayishefekhu tazenutam aleyha

Hebrew: לָכֵ֥ן נְתַתִּ֖יהָ בְּיַד־מְאַהֲבֶ֑יהָ בְּיַד֙ בְּנֵ֣י אַשּׁ֔וּר אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָגְבָ֖ה עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Therefore I delivered her into the hands of her lovers, into the hands of the Assyrians after whom she lusted.
Transliteration: lakhen netatiyha veyad-meahaveyha veyad veney ashur asher agevah aleyhem

Hebrew: הֵ֘מָּה֮ גִּלּ֣וּ עֶרְוָתָהּ֒ בָּנֶ֤יהָ וּבְנוֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ לָקָ֔חוּ וְאוֹתָ֖הּ בַּחֶ֣רֶב הָרָ֑גוּ וַתְּהִי־שֵׁם֙ לַנָּשִׁ֔ים וּשְׁפוּטִ֖ים עָ֥שׂוּ בָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: They exposed her nakedness; they seized her sons and daughters, and she herself was put to the sword. And because of the punishment inflicted upon her, she became a byword among women.
Transliteration: hemah gilu erevatah vaneyha uvenvoteyha lakachu vevotah vacherev haragu vatehiy-shem lanashiym ushefutiym ashu vah {s}

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ אֲחוֹתָ֣הּ אׇהֳלִיבָ֔ה וַתַּשְׁחֵ֥ת עַגְבָתָ֖הּ מִמֶּ֑נָּה וְאֶ֨ת־תַּזְנוּתֶ֔יהָ מִזְּנוּנֵ֖י אֲחוֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Her sister Oholibah saw this; yet her lusting was more depraved than her sister’s, and her whoring more debased.
Transliteration: vatere achvotah ׇholiyvah vatashechet agevatah mimenah veet-tazenuteyha mizenuney achvotah

Hebrew: אֶל־בְּנֵי֩ אַשּׁ֨וּר עָגָ֜בָה פַּח֨וֹת וּסְגָנִ֤ים קְרֹבִים֙ לְבֻשֵׁ֣י מִכְל֔וֹל פָּרָשִׁ֖ים רֹכְבֵ֣י סוּסִ֑ים בַּח֥וּרֵי חֶ֖מֶד כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: She lusted after the Assyrians, governors and prefects, warriors gorgeously clad, horsemen mounted on steeds—all of them handsome young fellows.
Transliteration: el-veney ashur agavah fachvot useganiym keroviym levushey mikhelvol farashiym rokhevey susiym vachurey chemed khulam

Hebrew: וָאֵ֖רֶא כִּ֣י נִטְמָ֑אָה דֶּ֥רֶךְ אֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁתֵּיהֶֽן׃
Translated: And I saw how she had defiled herself. Both of them followed the same course,
Transliteration: vaere khiy nitemaah derekhe echad lisheteyhen

Hebrew: וַתּ֖וֹסֶף אֶל־תַּזְנוּתֶ֑יהָ וַתֵּ֗רֶא אַנְשֵׁי֙ מְחֻקֶּ֣ה עַל־הַקִּ֔יר צַלְמֵ֣י (כשדיים) [כַשְׂדִּ֔ים] חֲקֻקִ֖ים בַּשָּׁשַֽׁר׃
Translated: but she carried her whoring further. For she saw men sculptured upon the walls, figures of Chaldeans drawn in vermilion,
Transliteration: vatvosef el-tazenuteyha vatere aneshey mechukeh al-hakiyr tsalemey (khshdyym) [khashediym] chakukiym vashashar

Hebrew: חֲגוֹרֵ֨י אֵז֜וֹר בְּמׇתְנֵיהֶ֗ם סְרוּחֵ֤י טְבוּלִים֙ בְּרָ֣אשֵׁיהֶ֔ם מַרְאֵ֥ה שָׁלִשִׁ֖ים כֻּלָּ֑ם דְּמ֤וּת בְּנֵֽי־בָבֶל֙ כַּשְׂדִּ֔ים אֶ֖רֶץ מוֹלַדְתָּֽם׃
Translated: girded with belts round their waists, and with flowing turbans on their heads, all of them looking like officers—a picture of Babylonians whose native land was Chaldea.
Transliteration: chagvorey ezvor vemׇteneyhem seruchey tevuliym verasheyhem mareeh shalishiym khulam demut veney-vavel khashediym erets mvoladetam

Hebrew: (ותעגב) [וַתַּעְגְּבָ֥ה] עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַרְאֵ֣ה עֵינֶ֑יהָ וַתִּשְׁלַ֧ח מַלְאָכִ֛ים אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם כַּשְׂדִּֽימָה׃
Translated: At the very sight of them she lusted after them, and she sent messengers for them to Chaldea.
Transliteration: (vtgv) [vataegevah] aleyhem lemareeh eyneyha vatishelach maleakhiym aleyhem khashediymah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ אֵלֶ֤יהָ בְנֵֽי־בָבֶל֙ לְמִשְׁכַּ֣ב דֹּדִ֔ים וַיְטַמְּא֥וּ אוֹתָ֖הּ בְּתַזְנוּתָ֑ם וַתִּ֨טְמָא־בָ֔ם וַתֵּ֥קַע נַפְשָׁ֖הּ מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: So the Babylonians came to her for lovemaking and defiled her with their whoring; and she defiled herself with them until she turned from them in disgust.
Transliteration: vayavou eleyha veney-vavel lemishekhav dodiym vayetameu votah vetazenutam vatitema-vam vateka nafeshah mehem

Hebrew: וַתְּגַל֙ תַּזְנוּתֶ֔יהָ וַתְּגַ֖ל אֶת־עֶרְוָתָ֑הּ וַתֵּ֤קַע נַפְשִׁי֙ מֵעָלֶ֔יהָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר נָקְעָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י מֵעַ֥ל אֲחוֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: She flaunted her whoring and exposed her nakedness, and I turned from her in disgust, as I had turned disgusted from her sister.
Transliteration: vategal tazenuteyha vategal et-erevatah vateka nafeshiy mealeyha khaasher nakeah nafeshiy meal achvotah

Hebrew: וַתַּרְבֶּ֖ה אֶת־תַּזְנוּתֶ֑יהָ לִזְכֹּר֙ אֶת־יְמֵ֣י נְעוּרֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר זָנְתָ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: But she whored still more, remembering how in her youth she had played the whore in the land of Egypt;
Transliteration: vatareveh et-tazenuteyha lizekhor et-yemey neureyha asher zanetah veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַֽתַּעְגְּבָ֔ה עַ֖ל פִּֽלַגְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּשַׂר־חֲמוֹרִים֙ בְּשָׂרָ֔ם וְזִרְמַ֥ת סוּסִ֖ים זִרְמָתָֽם׃
Translated: she lusted for concubinage with them, whose members were like those of donkeys and whose organs were like those of stallions.
Transliteration: vataegevah al filagesheyhem asher veshar-chamvoriym vesharam veziremat susiym zirematam

Hebrew: וַֽתִּפְקְדִ֔י אֵ֖ת זִמַּ֣ת נְעוּרָ֑יִךְ בַּעְשׂ֤וֹת מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ דַּדַּ֔יִךְ לְמַ֖עַן שְׁדֵ֥י נְעוּרָֽיִךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus you reverted to the wantonness of your youth, remembering your youthful breasts, when the men of Egypt handled your nipples.
Transliteration: vatifekediy et zimat neurayiikhe vaeshvot mimitserayiim dadayiikhe lemaan shedey neurayiikhe {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן אׇהֳלִיבָ֗ה כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ הִנְנִ֨י מֵעִ֤יר אֶת־מְאַהֲבַ֙יִךְ֙ עָלַ֔יִךְ אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־נָקְעָ֥ה נַפְשֵׁ֖ךְ מֵהֶ֑ם וַהֲבֵאתִ֥ים עָלַ֖יִךְ מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated: Assuredly, Oholibah, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to rouse against you the lovers from whom you turned in disgust, and I will bring them upon you from all around—
Transliteration: lakhen ׇholiyvah khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineniy meiyr et-meahavayiikhe alayiikhe et asher-nakeah nafeshekhe mehem vahavetiym alayiikhe misaviyv

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֧י בָבֶ֣ל וְכׇל־כַּשְׂדִּ֗ים פְּק֤וֹד וְשׁ֙וֹעַ֙ וְק֔וֹעַ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י אַשּׁ֖וּר אוֹתָ֑ם בַּח֨וּרֵי חֶ֜מֶד פַּח֤וֹת וּסְגָנִים֙ כֻּלָּ֔ם שָֽׁלִשִׁים֙ וּקְרוּאִ֔ים רֹכְבֵ֥י סוּסִ֖ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, [the people of] Pekod, Shoa, and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them, all of them handsome young fellows, governors and prefects, officers and warriors, all of them riding on horseback.
Transliteration: veney vavel vekhׇl-khashediym fekvod veshvoa vekvoa khׇl-veney ashur votam vachurey chemed fachvot useganiym khulam shalishiym ukeruiym rokhevey susiym khulam

Hebrew: וּבָ֣אוּ עָלַ֡יִךְ הֹ֠צֶן רֶ֤כֶב וְגַלְגַּל֙ וּבִקְהַ֣ל עַמִּ֔ים צִנָּ֤ה וּמָגֵן֙ וְקוֹבַ֔ע יָשִׂ֥ימוּ עָלַ֖יִךְ סָבִ֑יב וְנָתַתִּ֤י לִפְנֵיהֶם֙ מִשְׁפָּ֔ט וּשְׁפָט֖וּךְ בְּמִשְׁפְּטֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They shall attack you with fleets of wheeled chariots and a host of troops; they shall set themselves against you on all sides with bucklers, shields, and helmets. And I will entrust your punishment to them, and they shall inflict their punishments on you.
Transliteration: uvau alayiikhe hotsen rekhev vegalegal uvikehal amiym tsinah umagen vekvova yashiymu alayiikhe saviyv venatatiy lifeneyhem mishefat ushefatukhe vemishefeteyhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֨י קִנְאָתִ֜י בָּ֗ךְ וְעָשׂ֤וּ אוֹתָךְ֙ בְּחֵמָ֔ה אַפֵּ֤ךְ וְאׇזְנַ֙יִךְ֙ יָסִ֔ירוּ וְאַחֲרִיתֵ֖ךְ בַּחֶ֣רֶב תִּפּ֑וֹל הֵ֗מָּה בָּנַ֤יִךְ וּבְנוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ יִקָּ֔חוּ וְאַחֲרִיתֵ֖ךְ תֵּאָכֵ֥ל בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: I will direct My passion against you, and they shall deal with you in fury: They shall cut off your nose and ears; the last of you shall fall by the sword. They shall take away your sons and daughters, and your remnant shall be devoured by fire.
Transliteration: venatatiy kineatiy vakhe veashu votakhe vechemah afekhe veׇzenayiikhe yasiyru veachariytekhe vacherev tifvol hemah vanayiikhe uvenvotayiikhe yikachu veachariytekhe teakhel vaesh

Hebrew: וְהִפְשִׁיט֖וּךְ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֑יִךְ וְלָקְח֖וּ כְּלֵ֥י תִפְאַרְתֵּֽךְ׃
Translated: They shall strip you of your clothing and take away your dazzling jewels.
Transliteration: vehifeshiytukhe et-vegadayiikhe velakechu kheley tifearetekhe

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֤י זִמָּתֵךְ֙ מִמֵּ֔ךְ וְאֶת־זְנוּתֵ֖ךְ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹֽא־תִשְׂאִ֤י עֵינַ֙יִךְ֙ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וּמִצְרַ֖יִם לֹ֥א תִזְכְּרִי־עֽוֹד׃ {פ}
Translated: I will put an end to your wantonness and to your whoring in the land of Egypt, and you shall not long for them or remember Egypt anymore.
Transliteration: vehishevatiy zimatekhe mimekhe veet-zenutekhe meerets mitserayiim velo-tisheiy eynayiikhe aleyhem umitserayiim lo tizekheriy-vod {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִי֙ נֹֽתְנָ֔ךְ בְּיַ֖ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׂנֵ֑את בְּיַ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־נָקְעָ֥ה נַפְשֵׁ֖ךְ מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: For thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deliver you into the hands of those you hate, into the hands of those from whom you turned in disgust.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy notenakhe veyad asher shanet veyad asher-nakeah nafeshekhe mehem

Hebrew: וְעָשׂ֨וּ אוֹתָ֜ךְ בְּשִׂנְאָ֗ה וְלָֽקְחוּ֙ כׇּל־יְגִיעֵ֔ךְ וַעֲזָב֖וּךְ עֵירֹ֣ם וְעֶרְיָ֑ה וְנִגְלָה֙ עֶרְוַ֣ת זְנוּנַ֔יִךְ וְזִמָּתֵ֖ךְ וְתַזְנוּתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: They shall treat you with hate, and they shall take away all you have toiled for, and leave you naked and bare; your naked licentiousness, wantonness, and whoredom will be exposed.
Transliteration: veashu votakhe veshineah velakechu khׇl-yegiyekhe vaazavukhe eyrom veereyah venigelah erevat zenunayiikhe vezimatekhe vetazenutayiikhe

Hebrew: עָשֹׂ֥ה אֵ֖לֶּה לָ֑ךְ בִּזְנוֹתֵךְ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י גוֹיִ֔ם עַ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־נִטְמֵ֖את בְּגִלּוּלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: These things shall be done to you for your whoring with the nations, for defiling yourself with their fetishes.
Transliteration: ashoh eleh lakhe vizenvotekhe acharey gvoyim al asher-nitemet vegiluleyhem

Hebrew: בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ אֲחוֹתֵ֖ךְ הָלָ֑כְתְּ וְנָתַתִּ֥י כוֹסָ֖הּ בְּיָדֵֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: You walked in your sister’s path; therefore I will put her cup into your hand.
Transliteration: vederekhe achvotekhe halakhete venatatiy khvosah veyadekhe {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה כּ֤וֹס אֲחוֹתֵךְ֙ תִּשְׁתִּ֔י הָעֲמֻקָּ֖ה וְהָרְחָבָ֑ה תִּהְיֶ֥ה לִצְחֹ֛ק וּלְלַ֖עַג מִרְבָּ֥ה לְהָכִֽיל׃
Translated:
Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
You shall drink of your sister’s cup,
So deep and wide;
It shall cause derision and scorn,
It holds so much.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih khvos achvotekhe tishetiy haamukah veharechavah tiheyeh litsechok ulelaag mirevah lehakhiyl

Hebrew: שִׁכָּר֥וֹן וְיָג֖וֹן תִּמָּלֵ֑אִי כּ֚וֹס שַׁמָּ֣ה וּשְׁמָמָ֔ה כּ֖וֹס אֲחוֹתֵ֥ךְ שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated:
You shall be filled with drunkenness and woe.
The cup of desolation and horror,
The cup of your sister Samaria—
Transliteration: shikharvon veyagvon timaleiy khvos shamah ushemamah khvos achvotekhe shomervon

Hebrew: וְשָׁתִ֨ית אוֹתָ֜הּ וּמָצִ֗ית וְאֶת־חֲרָשֶׂ֛יהָ תְּגָרֵ֖מִי וְשָׁדַ֣יִךְ תְּנַתֵּ֑קִי כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י דִבַּ֔רְתִּי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
You shall drink it and drain it,
And gnaw its shards;
And you shall tear your breasts.
For I have spoken—declares the Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: veshatiyt votah umatsiyt veet-charasheyha tegaremiy veshadayiikhe tenatekiy khiy aniy divaretiy neum adonay yehovih {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֚עַן שָׁכַ֣חַתְּ אוֹתִ֔י וַתַּשְׁלִ֥יכִי אוֹתִ֖י אַחֲרֵ֣י גַוֵּ֑ךְ וְגַם־אַ֛תְּ שְׂאִ֥י זִמָּתֵ֖ךְ וְאֶת־תַּזְנוּתָֽיִךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because you have forgotten Me and cast Me behind your back, you in turn must suffer for your wanton whoring.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan shakhachate votiy vatasheliykhiy votiy acharey gavekhe vegam-ate sheiy zimatekhe veet-tazenutayiikhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הֲתִשְׁפּ֥וֹט אֶֽת־אׇהֳלָ֖ה וְאֶת־אׇהֳלִיבָ֑ה וְהַגֵּ֣ד לָהֶ֔ן אֵ֖ת תּוֹעֲבוֹתֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small> said to me: O mortal, arraign Oholah and Oholibah, and charge them with their abominations.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay ven-adam hatishefvot et-ׇholah veet-ׇholiyvah vehaged lahen et tvoavvoteyhen

Hebrew: כִּ֣י נִאֵ֗פוּ וְדָם֙ בִּֽידֵיהֶ֔ן וְאֶת־גִּלּוּלֵיהֶ֖ן נִאֵ֑פוּ וְגַ֤ם אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָֽלְדוּ־לִ֔י הֶעֱבִ֥ירוּ לָהֶ֖ם לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
Translated: For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands; truly they have committed adultery with their fetishes, and have even offered to them as food the children they bore to Me.
Transliteration: khiy niefu vedam viydeyhen veet-giluleyhen niefu vegam et-veneyhen asher yaledu-liy heeviyru lahem leׇkhelah

Hebrew: ע֥וֹד זֹ֖את עָ֣שׂוּ לִ֑י טִמְּא֤וּ אֶת־מִקְדָּשִׁי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתַ֖י חִלֵּֽלוּ׃
Translated: At the same time they also did this to Me: they defiled My Sanctuary and profaned My sabbaths.
Transliteration: vod zot ashu liy timeu et-mikedashiy vayyvom hahu veet-shavetvotay chilelu

Hebrew: וּֽבְשַׁחֲטָ֤ם אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶם֙ לְגִלּ֣וּלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ אֶל־מִקְדָּשִׁ֛י בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לְחַלְּל֑וֹ וְהִנֵּה־כֹ֥ה עָשׂ֖וּ בְּת֥וֹךְ בֵּיתִֽי׃
Translated: On the very day that they slaughtered their children to their fetishes, they entered My Sanctuary to desecrate it. That is what they did in My House.
Transliteration: uveshachatam et-veneyhem legiluleyhem vayavou el-mikedashiy vayyvom hahu lechalelvo vehineh-khoh ashu vetvokhe veytiy

Hebrew: וְאַ֗ף כִּ֤י תִשְׁלַ֙חְנָה֙ לַאֲנָשִׁ֔ים בָּאִ֖ים מִמֶּרְחָ֑ק אֲשֶׁ֨ר מַלְאָ֜ךְ שָׁל֤וּחַ אֲלֵיהֶם֙ וְהִנֵּה־בָ֔אוּ לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר רָחַ֛צְתְּ כָּחַ֥לְתְּ עֵינַ֖יִךְ וְעָדִ֥ית עֶֽדִי׃
Translated: Moreover, they sent for men to come from afar, [men] to whom a messenger was sent; and they came. For them, [Oholibah,] you bathed, painted your eyes, and donned your finery;
Transliteration: veaf khiy tishelachenah laanashiym vaiym mimerechak asher maleakhe shalucha aleyhem vehineh-vau laasher rachatsete khachalete eynayiikhe veadiyt ediy

Hebrew: וְיָשַׁבְתְּ֙ עַל־מִטָּ֣ה כְבוּדָּ֔ה וְשֻׁלְחָ֥ן עָר֖וּךְ לְפָנֶ֑יהָ וּקְטׇרְתִּ֥י וְשַׁמְנִ֖י שַׂ֥מְתְּ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: and you sat on a grand couch with a set table in front of it—and it was My incense and My oil you laid upon it.
Transliteration: veyashavete al-mitah khevudah veshulechan arukhe lefaneyha uketׇretiy veshameniy shamete aleyha

Hebrew: וְק֣וֹל הָמוֹן֮ שָׁלֵ֣ו בָֿהּ֒ וְאֶל־אֲנָשִׁים֙ מֵרֹ֣ב אָדָ֔ם מוּבָאִ֥ים (סובאים) [סׇבָאִ֖ים] מִמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַֽיִּתְּנ֤וּ צְמִידִים֙ אֶל־יְדֵיהֶ֔ן וַעֲטֶ֥רֶת תִּפְאֶ֖רֶת עַל־רָאשֵׁיהֶֽן׃
Translated: And the noise of a carefree multitude was there, of numerous men brought drunk from the desert; and they put bracelets on their arms and splendid crowns upon their heads.
Transliteration: vekvol hamvon shalev vֿah veel-anashiym merov adam muvaiym (svvym) [sׇvaiym] mimidevar vayitenu tsemiydiym el-yedeyhen vaateret tifeeret al-rasheyhen

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֕ר לַבָּלָ֖ה נִֽאוּפִ֑ים (עת) [עַתָּ֛ה] (יזנה) [יִזְנ֥וּ] תַזְנוּתֶ֖הָ וָהִֽיא׃
Translated: Then I said, “To destruction with adultery! Look, they are still going on with those same fornications of hers.”
Transliteration: vaomar lavalah niufiym (t) [atah] (yznh) [yizenu] tazenuteha vahiy

Hebrew: וַיָּב֣וֹא אֵלֶ֔יהָ כְּב֖וֹא אֶל־אִשָּׁ֣ה זוֹנָ֑ה כֵּ֣ן בָּ֗אוּ אֶֽל־אׇהֳלָה֙ וְאֶל־אׇ֣הֳלִיבָ֔ה אִשֹּׁ֖ת הַזִּמָּֽה׃
Translated: And they would go to her as one goes to a prostitute; that is how they went to Oholah and Oholibah, wanton women.
Transliteration: vayavvo eleyha khevvo el-ishah zvonah khen vau el-ׇholah veel-ׇholiyvah ishot hazimah

Hebrew: וַאֲנָשִׁ֣ים צַדִּיקִ֗ם הֵ֚מָּה יִשְׁפְּט֣וּ אֽוֹתְהֶ֔ם מִשְׁפַּט֙ נֹֽאֲפ֔וֹת וּמִשְׁפַּ֖ט שֹׁפְכ֣וֹת דָּ֑ם כִּ֤י נֹֽאֲפֹת֙ הֵ֔נָּה וְדָ֖ם בִּידֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: But righteous men shall punish them with the punishments for adultery and for bloodshed, for they are adulteresses and have blood on their hands.
Transliteration: vaanashiym tsadiykim hemah yishefetu votehem mishefat noafvot umishefat shofekhvot dam khiy noafot henah vedam viydeyhen {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֛י כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הַעֲלֵ֤ה עֲלֵיהֶם֙ קָהָ֔ל וְנָתֹ֥ן אֶתְהֶ֖ן לְזַעֲוָ֥ה וְלָבַֽז׃
Translated: For thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Summon an assembly against them, and make them an object of horror and plunder.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih haaleh aleyhem kahal venaton etehen lezaavah velavaz

Hebrew: וְרָגְמ֨וּ עֲלֵיהֶ֥ן אֶ֙בֶן֙ קָהָ֔ל וּבָרֵ֥א אוֹתְהֶ֖ן בְּחַרְבוֹתָ֑ם בְּנֵיהֶ֤ם וּבְנֽוֹתֵיהֶם֙ יַהֲרֹ֔גוּ וּבָתֵּיהֶ֖ן בָּאֵ֥שׁ יִשְׂרֹֽפוּ׃
Translated: Let the assembly pelt them with stones and cut them down with their swords; let them kill their sons and daughters, and burn down their homes.
Transliteration: veragemu aleyhen even kahal uvare votehen vecharevvotam veneyhem uvenvoteyhem yaharogu uvateyhen vaesh yisherofu

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֥י זִמָּ֖ה מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְנִוַּסְּרוּ֙ כׇּל־הַנָּשִׁ֔ים וְלֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂ֖ינָה כְּזִמַּתְכֶֽנָה׃
Translated: I will put an end to wantonness in the land; and all the women shall take warning not to imitate your wantonness.
Transliteration: vehishevatiy zimah min-haarets venivaseru khׇl-hanashiym velo taasheynah khezimatekhenah

Hebrew: וְנָתְנ֤וּ זִמַּתְכֶ֙נָה֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ן וַחֲטָאֵ֥י גִלּוּלֵיכֶ֖ן תִּשֶּׂ֑אינָה וִידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֥י אֲנִ֖י אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: They shall punish you for your wantonness, and you shall suffer the penalty for your sinful idolatry. And you shall know that I am the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venatenu zimatekhenah aleykhen vachataey giluleykhen tisheynah viydaetem khiy aniy adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֨ה אֵלַ֜י בַּשָּׁנָ֤ה הַתְּשִׁיעִית֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִ֔י בֶּעָשׂ֥וֹר לַחֹ֖דֶשׁ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the ninth year, on the tenth day of the tenth month, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay vashanah hateshiyiyt vachodesh haashiyriy veashvor lachodesh lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם (כתוב) [כְּתׇב־]לְךָ֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם הַיּ֔וֹם אֶת־עֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה סָמַ֤ךְ מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ אֶל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: O mortal, record this date, this exact day; for this very day the king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-adam (khtvv) [khetׇv-]lekha et-shem hayyvom et-etsem hayyvom hazeh samakhe melekhe-vavel el-yerushala͏im veetsem hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וּמְשֹׁ֤ל אֶל־בֵּית־הַמֶּ֙רִי֙ מָשָׁ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה שְׁפֹ֤ת הַסִּיר֙ שְׁפֹ֔ת וְגַם־יְצֹ֥ק בּ֖וֹ מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Further, speak in an allegory to the rebellious breed and say to them: Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
Put the cauldron [on the fire], put it on,
And then pour water into it.
Transliteration: umeshol el-veyt-hameriy mashal veamareta aleyhem khoh amar adonay yehovih shefot hasiyr shefot vegam-yetsok vvo mayiim

Hebrew: אֱסֹ֤ף נְתָחֶ֙יהָ֙ אֵלֶ֔יהָ כׇּל־נֵ֥תַח ט֖וֹב יָרֵ֣ךְ וְכָתֵ֑ף מִבְחַ֥ר עֲצָמִ֖ים מַלֵּֽא׃
Translated:
Collect in it the pieces [of meat].
Every choice piece, thigh and shoulder;
Fill it with the best cuts—
Transliteration: esof netacheyha eleyha khׇl-netach tvov yarekhe vekhatef mivechar atsamiym male

Hebrew: מִבְחַ֤ר הַצֹּאן֙ לָק֔וֹחַ וְגַ֛ם דּ֥וּר הָעֲצָמִ֖ים תַּחְתֶּ֑יהָ רַתַּ֣ח רְתָחֶ֔יהָ גַּם־בָּשְׁל֥וּ עֲצָמֶ֖יהָ בְּתוֹכָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Take the best of the flock.
Also pile the cuts under it;
Get it boiling briskly,
And cook the cuts in it.
Transliteration: mivechar hatson lakvocha vegam dur haatsamiym tacheteyha ratach retacheyha gam-vashelu atsameyha vetvokhah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אוֹי֮ עִ֣יר הַדָּמִים֒ סִ֚יר אֲשֶׁ֣ר חֶלְאָתָ֣הֿ בָ֔הּ וְחֶ֨לְאָתָ֔הּ לֹ֥א יָצְאָ֖ה מִמֶּ֑נָּה לִנְתָחֶ֤יהָ לִנְתָחֶ֙יהָ֙ הֽוֹצִיאָ֔הּ לֹא־נָפַ֥ל עָלֶ֖יהָ גּוֹרָֽל׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign GOD:
Woe to the city of blood—
A cauldron whose scum is in it,
Whose scum has not been cleaned out!
Empty it piece by piece;
No lot has fallen upon it.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih voy iyr hadamiym siyr asher cheleatahֿ vah vecheleatah lo yatseah mimenah linetacheyha linetacheyha hvotsiyah lo-nafal aleyha gvoral

Hebrew: כִּ֤י דָמָהּ֙ בְּתוֹכָ֣הּ הָיָ֔ה עַל־צְחִ֥יחַ סֶ֖לַע שָׂמָ֑תְהוּ לֹ֤א שְׁפָכַ֙תְהוּ֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לְכַסּ֥וֹת עָלָ֖יו עָפָֽר׃
Translated:
For the blood she shed is still in her;
She set it upon a bare rock;
She did not pour it out on the ground
To cover it with earth.
Transliteration: khiy damah vetvokhah hayah al-tsechiycha sela shamatehu lo shefakhatehu al-haarets lekhasvot alayv afar

Hebrew: לְהַעֲל֤וֹת חֵמָה֙ לִנְקֹ֣ם נָקָ֔ם נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־דָּמָ֖הּ עַל־צְחִ֣יחַ סָ֑לַע לְבִלְתִּ֖י הִכָּסֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated:
She set her blood upon the bare rock,
So that it was not covered,
So that it may stir up [My] fury
To take vengeance.
Transliteration: lehaalvot chemah linekom nakam natatiy et-damah al-tsechiycha sala leviletiy hikhasvot {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה א֖וֹי עִ֣יר הַדָּמִ֑ים גַּם־אֲנִ֖י אַגְדִּ֥יל הַמְּדוּרָֽה׃
Translated:
Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign GOD:
Woe to the city of blood!
I in turn will make a great blaze.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih voy iyr hadamiym gam-aniy agediyl hamedurah

Hebrew: הַרְבֵּ֤ה הָעֵצִים֙ הַדְלֵ֣ק הָאֵ֔שׁ הָתֵ֖ם הַבָּשָׂ֑ר וְהַרְקַח֙ הַמֶּרְקָחָ֔ה וְהָעֲצָמ֖וֹת יֵחָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Pile on the logs,
Kindle the fire,
Cook the meat through
And stew it completely,
And let the bones be charred.
Transliteration: hareveh haetsiym hadelek haesh hatem havashar veharekach hamerekachah vehaatsamvot eicharu

Hebrew: וְהַעֲמִידֶ֥הָ עַל־גֶּחָלֶ֖יהָ רֵקָ֑ה לְמַ֨עַן תֵּחַ֜ם וְחָ֣רָה נְחֻשְׁתָּ֗הּ וְנִתְּכָ֤ה בְתוֹכָהּ֙ טֻמְאָתָ֔הּ תִּתֻּ֖ם חֶלְאָתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Let it stand empty on the coals,
Until it becomes so hot
That the copper glows.
Then its impurity shall melt away in it,
And its rust be consumed.
Transliteration: vehaamiydeha al-gechaleyha rekah lemaan techam vecharah nechushetah venitekhah vetvokhah tumeatah titum cheleatah

Hebrew: תְּאֻנִ֖ים הֶלְאָ֑ת וְלֹא־תֵצֵ֤א מִמֶּ֙נָּה֙ רַבַּ֣ת חֶלְאָתָ֔הּ בְּאֵ֖שׁ חֶלְאָתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
It has frustrated all effort,
Its thick scum will not leave it—
Into the fire with its scum!
Transliteration: teuniym heleat velo-tetse mimenah ravat cheleatah veesh cheleatah

Hebrew: בְּטֻמְאָתֵ֖ךְ זִמָּ֑ה יַ֤עַן טִֽהַרְתִּיךְ֙ וְלֹ֣א טָהַ֔רְתְּ מִטֻּמְאָתֵךְ֙ לֹ֣א תִטְהֲרִי־ע֔וֹד עַד־הֲנִיחִ֥י אֶת־חֲמָתִ֖י בָּֽךְ׃
Translated: For your vile defilement—because I sought to purify you of your defilement, but you would not be purified—you shall never be pure again until I have satisfied My fury upon you.
Transliteration: vetumeatekhe zimah yaan tiharetiykhe velo taharete mitumeatekhe lo titehariy-vod ad-haniychiy et-chamatiy vakhe

Hebrew: אֲנִ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה דִּבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ בָּאָ֣ה וְעָשִׂ֔יתִי לֹא־אֶפְרַ֥ע וְלֹא־אָח֖וּס וְלֹ֣א אֶנָּחֵ֑ם כִּדְרָכַ֤יִךְ וְכַעֲלִילוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ שְׁפָט֔וּךְ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken: It shall come to pass and I will do it. I will not refrain or spare or relent. You shall be punished according to your ways and your deeds—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah divaretiy vaah veashiytiy lo-efera velo-achus velo enachem khiderakhayiikhe vekhaaliylvotayiikhe shefatukhe neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הִנְנִ֨י לֹקֵ֧חַ מִמְּךָ֛ אֶת־מַחְמַ֥ד עֵינֶ֖יךָ בְּמַגֵּפָ֑ה וְלֹ֤א תִסְפֹּד֙ וְלֹ֣א תִבְכֶּ֔ה וְל֥וֹא תָב֖וֹא דִּמְעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “O mortal, I am about to take away the delight of your eyes from you through pestilence; but you shall not lament or weep or let your tears flow.
Transliteration: ven-adam hineniy lokecha mimekha et-machemad eyneykha vemagefah velo tisefod velo tivekheh velvo tavvo dimeatekha

Hebrew: הֵאָנֵ֣ק ׀ דֹּ֗ם מֵתִים֙ אֵ֣בֶל לֹא־תַֽעֲשֶׂ֔ה פְּאֵֽרְךָ֙ חֲב֣וֹשׁ עָלֶ֔יךָ וּנְעָלֶ֖יךָ תָּשִׂ֣ים בְּרַגְלֶ֑יךָ וְלֹ֤א תַעְטֶה֙ עַל־שָׂפָ֔ם וְלֶ֥חֶם אֲנָשִׁ֖ים לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated: Moan softly; observe no mourning for the dead: Put on your turban and put your sandals on your feet; do not cover over your upper lip, and do not eat the bread of comforters.”
Transliteration: heanek dom metiym evel lo-taasheh feerekha chavvosh aleykha unealeykha tashiym verageleykha velo taeteh al-shafam velechem anashiym lo tokhel

Hebrew: וָאֲדַבֵּ֤ר אֶל־הָעָם֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַתָּ֥מׇת אִשְׁתִּ֖י בָּעָ֑רֶב וָאַ֥עַשׂ בַּבֹּ֖קֶר כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צֻוֵּֽיתִי׃
Translated: In the evening my wife died, and in the morning I did as I had been commanded. And when I spoke to the people that morning,
Transliteration: vaadaver el-haam vavoker vatamׇt ishetiy vaarev vaaash vavoker khaasher tsuveytiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֵלַ֖י הָעָ֑ם הֲלֹֽא־תַגִּ֥יד לָ֙נוּ֙ מָה־אֵ֣לֶּה לָּ֔נוּ כִּ֥י אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: the people asked me, “Will you not tell us what these things portend for us, that you are acting so?”
Transliteration: vayomeru elay haam halo-tagiyd lanu mah-eleh lanu khiy atah osheh

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֖ר אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם דְּבַ֨ר־יְהֹוָ֔ה הָיָ֥ה אֵלַ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: I answered them, “The word of G<small>OD</small> has come to me:
Transliteration: vaomar aleyhem devar-yehovah hayah elay lemor

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֣ר ׀ לְבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ הִנְנִ֨י מְחַלֵּ֤ל אֶת־מִקְדָּשִׁי֙ גְּא֣וֹן עֻזְּכֶ֔ם מַחְמַ֥ד עֵינֵיכֶ֖ם וּמַחְמַ֣ל נַפְשְׁכֶ֑ם וּבְנֵיכֶ֧ם וּבְנוֹתֵיכֶ֛ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲזַבְתֶּ֖ם בַּחֶ֥רֶב יִפֹּֽלוּ׃
Translated: Tell the House of Israel: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: ‘I am going to desecrate My Sanctuary, your pride and glory, the delight of your eyes and the desire of your heart; and the sons and daughters you have left behind shall fall by the sword.
Transliteration: emor leveyt yisherael khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineniy mechalel et-mikedashiy gevon uzekhem machemad eyneykhem umachemal nafeshekhem uveneykhem uvenvoteykhem asher azavetem vacherev yifolu

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֑יתִי עַל־שָׂפָם֙ לֹ֣א תַעְט֔וּ וְלֶ֥חֶם אֲנָשִׁ֖ים לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: (Accordingly, you shall do as I have done: you shall not cover over your upper lips or eat the bread of comforters;
Transliteration: vaashiytem khaasher ashiytiy al-shafam lo taetu velechem anashiym lo tokhelu

Hebrew: וּפְאֵרֵכֶ֣ם עַל־רָאשֵׁיכֶ֗ם וְנַֽעֲלֵיכֶם֙ בְּרַגְלֵיכֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תִסְפְּד֖וּ וְלֹ֣א תִבְכּ֑וּ וּנְמַקֹּתֶם֙ בַּעֲוֺנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וּנְהַמְתֶּ֖ם אִ֥ישׁ אֶל־אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: and your turbans shall remain on your heads, and your sandals upon your feet. You shall not lament or weep, but you shall be heartsick because of your iniquities and shall moan to one another.)
Transliteration: ufeerekhem al-rasheykhem venaaleykhem verageleykhem lo tisefedu velo tivekhu unemakotem vaavonoteykhem unehametem iysh el-achiyv

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה יְחֶזְקֵ֤אל לָכֶם֙ לְמוֹפֵ֔ת כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ בְּבוֹאָ֕הּ וִידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֥י אֲנִ֖י אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And Ezekiel shall become a portent for you: you shall do just as he has done, when the predicted punishment happens; and you shall know that I am the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.’”
Transliteration: vehayah yechezekel lakhem lemvofet khekhol asher-ashah taashu vevvoah viydaetem khiy aniy adonay yehovih {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֔ם הֲל֗וֹא בְּי֨וֹם קַחְתִּ֤י מֵהֶם֙ אֶת־מָ֣עוּזָּ֔ם מְשׂ֖וֹשׂ תִּפְאַרְתָּ֑ם אֶת־מַחְמַ֤ד עֵינֵיהֶם֙ וְאֶת־מַשָּׂ֣א נַפְשָׁ֔ם בְּנֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְנוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: You, O mortal, take note: On the day that I take their stronghold from them, their pride and joy, the delight of their eyes and the longing of their hearts—their sons and daughters—
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam halvo veyvom kachetiy mehem et-mauzam meshvosh tifearetam et-machemad eyneyhem veet-masha nafesham veneyhem uvenvoteyhem

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא יָב֥וֹא הַפָּלִ֖יט אֵלֶ֑יךָ לְהַשְׁמָע֖וּת אׇזְנָֽיִם׃
Translated: on that day a fugitive will come to you, to let you hear it with your own ears.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yavvo hafaliyt eleykha lehashemaut ׇzenayiim

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִפָּ֤תַח פִּ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־הַפָּלִ֔יט וּתְדַבֵּ֕ר וְלֹ֥א תֵאָלֵ֖ם ע֑וֹד וְהָיִ֤יתָ לָהֶם֙ לְמוֹפֵ֔ת וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: On that day your mouth shall be opened to the fugitive, and you shall speak and no longer be dumb. So you shall be a portent for them, and they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yifatach fiykha et-hafaliyt utedaver velo tealem vod vehayiyta lahem lemvofet veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם שִׂ֥ים פָּנֶ֖יךָ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן וְהִנָּבֵ֖א עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: O mortal, set your face toward the Ammonites and prophesy against them.
Transliteration: ven-adam shiym faneykha el-veney amvon vehinave aleyhem

Hebrew: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ לִבְנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֡ה יַ֩עַן֩ אׇמְרֵ֨ךְ הֶאָ֜ח אֶל־מִקְדָּשִׁ֣י כִי־נִחָ֗ל וְאֶל־אַדְמַ֤ת יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כִּ֣י נָשַׁ֔מָּה וְאֶל־בֵּ֣ית יְהוּדָ֔ה כִּ֥י הָלְכ֖וּ בַּגּוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Say to the Ammonites: Hear the word of the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because you cried “Aha!” over My Sanctuary when it was desecrated, and over the land of Israel when it was laid waste, and over the House of Judah when it went into exile—
Transliteration: veamareta liveney amvon shimeu devar-adonay yehovih khoh-amar adonay yehovih yaan ׇmerekhe heach el-mikedashiy khiy-nichal veel-ademat yisherael khiy nashamah veel-veyt yehudah khiy halekhu vagvolah

Hebrew: לָכֵ֡ן הִנְנִי֩ נֹתְנָ֨ךְ לִבְנֵי־קֶ֜דֶם לְמוֹרָשָׁ֗ה וְיִשְּׁב֤וּ טִירֽוֹתֵיהֶם֙ בָּ֔ךְ וְנָ֥תְנוּ בָ֖ךְ מִשְׁכְּנֵיהֶ֑ם הֵ֚מָּה יֹאכְל֣וּ פִרְיֵ֔ךְ וְהֵ֖מָּה יִשְׁתּ֥וּ חֲלָבֵֽךְ׃
Translated: assuredly, I will deliver you to the Kedemites as a possession. They shall set up their encampments among you and pitch their dwellings in your midst; they shall eat your produce and they shall drink your milk.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy notenakhe liveney-kedem lemvorashah veyishevu tiyrvoteyhem vakhe venatenu vakhe mishekheneyhem hemah yokhelu fireeikhe vehemah yishetu chalavekhe

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־רַבָּה֙ לִנְוֵ֣ה גְמַלִּ֔ים וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּ֖וֹן לְמִרְבַּץ־צֹ֑אן וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will make Rabbah a pasture for camels and Ammon a place for sheep to lie down. And you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-ravah lineveh gemaliym veet-veney amvon lemirevats-tson viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֚עַן מַחְאֲךָ֣ יָ֔ד וְרַקְעֲךָ֖ בְּרָ֑גֶל וַתִּשְׂמַ֤ח בְּכׇל־שָֽׁאטְךָ֙ בְּנֶ֔פֶשׁ אֶל־אַדְמַ֖ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because you clapped your hands and stamped your feet and rejoiced over the land of Israel with such utter scorn—
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan macheakha yad verakeakha veragel vatishemach vekhׇl-shatekha venefesh el-ademat yisherael

Hebrew: לָכֵ֡ן הִנְנִי֩ נָטִ֨יתִי אֶת־יָדִ֜י עָלֶ֗יךָ וּנְתַתִּ֤יךָֽ (לבג) [לְבַז֙] לַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְהִכְרַתִּ֙יךָ֙ מִן־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים וְהַאֲבַדְתִּ֖יךָ מִן־הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת אַשְׁמִ֣ידְךָ֔ וְיָדַעְתָּ֖ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: assuredly, I will stretch out My hand against you and give you as booty to the nations; I will cut you off from among the peoples and wipe you out from among the countries and destroy you. And you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy natiytiy et-yadiy aleykha unetatiykha (lvg) [levaz] lagvoyim vehikheratiykha min-haamiym vehaavadetiykha min-haaratsvot ashemiydekha veyadaeta khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה יַ֗עַן אֲמֹ֤ר מוֹאָב֙ וְשֵׂעִ֔יר הִנֵּ֥ה כְּכׇֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because Moab and Seir said, “See, the House of Judah is like all other nations”—
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan amor mvoav vesheiyr hineh khekhׇl-hagvoyim veyt yehudah

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ הִנְנִ֨י פֹתֵ֜חַ אֶת־כֶּ֤תֶף מוֹאָב֙ מֵהֶ֣עָרִ֔ים מֵעָרָ֖יו מִקָּצֵ֑הוּ צְבִ֗י אֶ֚רֶץ בֵּ֣ית הַיְשִׁימֹ֔ת בַּ֥עַל מְע֖וֹן (וקריתמה) [וְקִרְיָתָֽיְמָה]׃
Translated: assuredly, I will lay bare the flank of Moab, all its towns to the last one—Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim, the glory of the country.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy fotecha et-khetef mvoav meheariym mearayv mikatsehu tseviy erets veyt hayeshiymot vaal mevon (vkrytmh) [vekireyatayemah]

Hebrew: לִבְנֵי־קֶ֙דֶם֙ עַל־בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וּנְתַתִּ֖יהָ לְמוֹרָשָׁ֑ה לְמַ֛עַן לֹא־תִזָּכֵ֥ר בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: I will deliver it, together with Ammon, to the Kedemites as their possession. Thus Ammon shall not be remembered among the nations,
Transliteration: liveney-kedem al-veney amvon unetatiyha lemvorashah lemaan lo-tizakher veney-amvon vagvoyim

Hebrew: וּבְמוֹאָ֖ב אֶעֱשֶׂ֣ה שְׁפָטִ֑ים וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and I will mete out punishments to Moab. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: uvemvoav eesheh shefatiym veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֣עַן עֲשׂ֥וֹת אֱד֛וֹם בִּנְקֹ֥ם נָקָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיֶּאְשְׁמ֥וּ אָשׁ֖וֹם וְנִקְּמ֥וּ בָהֶֽם׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because Edom acted vengefully against the House of Judah and incurred guilt by wreaking revenge upon it—
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan ashvot edvom vinekom nakam leveyt yehudah vayeeshemu ashvom venikemu vahem

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וְנָטִ֤תִי יָדִי֙ עַל־אֱד֔וֹם וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י מִמֶּ֖נָּה אָדָ֣ם וּבְהֵמָ֑ה וּנְתַתִּ֤יהָ חׇרְבָּה֙ מִתֵּימָ֔ן וּדְדָ֖נֶה בַּחֶ֥רֶב יִפֹּֽלוּ׃
Translated: assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will stretch out My hand against Edom and cut off from it human and animal, and I will lay it in ruins; from Tema to Dedan they shall fall by the sword.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih venatitiy yadiy al-edvom vehikheratiy mimenah adam uvehemah unetatiyha chׇrevah miteyman udedaneh vacherev yifolu

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֨י אֶת־נִקְמָתִ֜י בֶּאֱד֗וֹם בְּיַד֙ עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעָשׂ֣וּ בֶאֱד֔וֹם כְּאַפִּ֖י וְכַחֲמָתִ֑י וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ אֶת־נִקְמָתִ֔י נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: I will wreak My vengeance on Edom through My people Israel, and they shall take action against Edom in accordance with My blazing anger; and they shall know My vengeance—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-nikematiy veedvom veyad amiy yisherael veashu veedvom kheafiy vekhachamatiy veyadeu et-nikematiy neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֛עַן עֲשׂ֥וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים בִּנְקָמָ֑ה וַיִּנָּקְמ֤וּ נָקָם֙ בִּשְׁאָ֣ט בְּנֶ֔פֶשׁ לְמַשְׁחִ֖ית אֵיבַ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because the Philistines, in their ancient hatred, acted vengefully, and with utter scorn sought revenge and destruction—
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan ashvot felishetiym vinekamah vayinakemu nakam visheat venefesh lemashechiyt eyvat volam

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י נוֹטֶ֤ה יָדִי֙ עַל־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְהִכְרַתִּ֖י אֶת־כְּרֵתִ֑ים וְהַ֣אֲבַדְתִּ֔י אֶת־שְׁאֵרִ֖ית ח֥וֹף הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will stretch out My hand against the Philistines and cut off the Cherethites and wipe out the last survivors of the seacoast.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy nvoteh yadiy al-felishetiym vehikheratiy et-kheretiym vehaavadetiy et-sheeriyt chvof hayam

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתִי בָם֙ נְקָמ֣וֹת גְּדֹל֔וֹת בְּתוֹכְח֖וֹת חֵמָ֑ה וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּתִתִּ֥י אֶת־נִקְמָתִ֖י בָּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: I will wreak frightful vengeance upon them by furious punishment; and when I inflict My vengeance upon them, they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veashiytiy vam nekamvot gedolvot vetvokhechvot chemah veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah vetitiy et-nikematiy vam {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י בְּעַשְׁתֵּֽי־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the eleventh year, on the first of the month, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy veashetey-eshereh shanah veechad lachodesh hayah devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם יַ֠עַן אֲשֶׁר־אָ֨מְרָה צֹּ֤ר עַל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ הֶאָ֔ח נִשְׁבְּרָ֛ה דַּלְת֥וֹת הָעַמִּ֖ים נָסֵ֣בָּה אֵלָ֑י אִמָּלְאָ֖ה הׇחֳרָֽבָה׃
Translated: O mortal, because Tyre gloated over Jerusalem, “Aha! The gateway of the peoples is broken, it has become mine; I shall be filled, now that it is laid in ruins”—
Transliteration: ven-adam yaan asher-amerah tsor al-yerushala͏im heach nisheverah daletvot haamiym nasevah elay imaleah hׇchoravah

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י עָלַ֖יִךְ צֹ֑ר וְהַעֲלֵיתִ֤י עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים כְּהַעֲל֥וֹת הַיָּ֖ם לְגַלָּֽיו׃
Translated:
assuredly, thus said the Sovereign GOD:
I am going to deal with you, O Tyre!
I will hurl many nations against you,
As the sea hurls its waves.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy alayiikhe tsor vehaaleytiy alayiikhe gvoyim raviym khehaalvot hayam legalayv

Hebrew: וְשִׁחֲת֞וּ חֹמ֣וֹת צֹ֗ר וְהָֽרְסוּ֙ מִגְדָּלֶ֔יהָ וְסִחֵיתִ֥י עֲפָרָ֖הּ מִמֶּ֑נָּה וְנָתַתִּ֥י אוֹתָ֖הּ לִצְחִ֥יחַ סָֽלַע׃
Translated:
They shall destroy the walls of Tyre
And demolish her towers;
And I will scrape her soil off her
And leave her a naked rock.
Transliteration: veshichatu chomvot tsor veharesu migedaleyha vesicheytiy afarah mimenah venatatiy votah litsechiycha sala

Hebrew: מִשְׁטַ֨ח חֲרָמִ֤ים תִּֽהְיֶה֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַיָּ֔ם כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י דִבַּ֔רְתִּי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה וְהָיְתָ֥ה לְבַ֖ז לַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
She shall be in the heart of the sea
A place for drying nets;
For I have spoken it
—declares the Sovereign GOD.
She shall become spoil for the nations,
Transliteration: mishetach charamiym tiheyeh vetvokhe hayam khiy aniy divaretiy neum adonay yehovih vehayetah levaz lagvoyim

Hebrew: וּבְנוֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה בַּחֶ֖רֶב תֵּהָרַ֑גְנָה וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
And her daughter-towns in the country
Shall be put to the sword.
And they shall know that I am GOD.
Transliteration: uvenvoteyha asher vashadeh vacherev teharagenah veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֧י מֵבִ֣יא אֶל־צֹ֗ר נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֧ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֛ל מִצָּפ֖וֹן מֶ֣לֶךְ מְלָכִ֑ים בְּס֛וּס וּבְרֶ֥כֶב וּבְפָרָשִׁ֖ים וְקָהָ֥ל וְעַם־רָֽב׃
Translated: For thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will bring from the north, against Tyre, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, a king of kings, with horses, chariots, and riders—a great mass of troops.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy meviy el-tsor nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel mitsafvon melekhe melakhiym vesus uverekhev uvefarashiym vekahal veam-rav

Hebrew: בְּנוֹתַ֥יִךְ בַּשָּׂדֶ֖ה בַּחֶ֣רֶב יַהֲרֹ֑ג וְנָתַ֨ן עָלַ֜יִךְ דָּיֵ֗ק וְשָׁפַ֤ךְ עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ סֹֽלְלָ֔ה וְהֵקִ֥ים עָלַ֖יִךְ צִנָּֽה׃
Translated:
Your daughter-towns in the country
He shall put to the sword;
He shall erect towers against you,
And cast up mounds against you,
And raise [a wall of] bucklers against you.
Transliteration: venvotayiikhe vashadeh vacherev yaharog venatan alayiikhe daeik veshafakhe alayiikhe solelah vehekiym alayiikhe tsinah

Hebrew: וּמְחִ֣י קׇֽבׇלּ֔וֹ יִתֵּ֖ן בְּחֹמוֹתָ֑יִךְ וּמִ֨גְדְּלֹתַ֔יִךְ יִתֹּ֖ץ בְּחַרְבוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
He shall turn the force of his battering rams
Against your walls
And smash your towers with his axes.
Transliteration: umechiy kׇvׇlvo yiten vechomvotayiikhe umigedelotayiikhe yitots vecharevvotayv

Hebrew: מִשִּׁפְעַ֥ת סוּסָ֖יו יְכַסֵּ֣ךְ אֲבָקָ֑ם מִקּוֹל֩ פָּרַ֨שׁ וְגַלְגַּ֜ל וָרֶ֗כֶב תִּרְעַ֙שְׁנָה֙ חוֹמוֹתַ֔יִךְ בְּבֹאוֹ֙ בִּשְׁעָרַ֔יִךְ כִּמְבוֹאֵ֖י עִ֥יר מְבֻקָּעָֽה׃
Translated:
From the cloud raised by his horses
Dust shall cover you;
From the clatter of riders
And wheels and chariots,
Your walls shall shake—
When he enters your gates
As those who enter a breached city.
Transliteration: mishifeat susayv yekhasekhe avakam mikvol farash vegalegal varekhev tireashenah chvomvotayiikhe vevovo vishearayiikhe khimevvoey iyr mevukaah

Hebrew: בְּפַרְס֣וֹת סוּסָ֔יו יִרְמֹ֖ס אֶת־כׇּל־חוּצוֹתָ֑יִךְ עַמֵּךְ֙ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יַהֲרֹ֔ג וּמַצְּב֥וֹת עֻזֵּ֖ךְ לָאָ֥רֶץ תֵּרֵֽד׃
Translated:
With the hoofs of his steeds
He shall trample all your streets.
He shall put your people to the sword,
And your mighty pillars shall crash to the ground.
Transliteration: vefaresvot susayv yiremos et-khׇl-chutsvotayiikhe amekhe vacherev yaharog umatsevvot uzekhe laarets tered

Hebrew: וְשָׁלְל֣וּ חֵילֵ֗ךְ וּבָֽזְזוּ֙ רְכֻלָּתֵ֔ךְ וְהָֽרְסוּ֙ חוֹמוֹתַ֔יִךְ וּבָתֵּ֥י חֶמְדָּתֵ֖ךְ יִתֹּ֑צוּ וַאֲבָנַ֤יִךְ וְעֵצַ֙יִךְ֙ וַעֲפָרֵ֔ךְ בְּת֥וֹךְ מַ֖יִם יָשִֽׂימוּ׃
Translated:
They shall plunder your wealth
And loot your merchandise.
They shall raze your walls
And tear down your splendid houses,
And they shall cast into the water
Your stones and timber and soil.
Transliteration: veshalelu cheylekhe uvazezu rekhulatekhe veharesu chvomvotayiikhe uvatey chemedatekhe yitotsu vaavanayiikhe veetsayiikhe vaafarekhe vetvokhe mayiim yashiymu

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֖י הֲמ֣וֹן שִׁירָ֑יִךְ וְק֣וֹל כִּנּוֹרַ֔יִךְ לֹ֥א יִשָּׁמַ֖ע עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
I will put an end to the murmur of your songs,
And the sound of your lyres shall be heard no more.
Transliteration: vehishevatiy hamvon shiyrayiikhe vekvol khinvorayiikhe lo yishama vod

Hebrew: וּנְתַתִּ֞יךְ לִצְחִ֣יחַ סֶ֗לַע מִשְׁטַ֤ח חֲרָמִים֙ תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה לֹ֥א תִבָּנֶ֖ה ע֑וֹד כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ דִּבַּ֔רְתִּי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will make you a naked rock,
You shall be a place for drying nets;
You shall never be rebuilt.
For I have spoken
—declares the Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: unetatiykhe litsechiycha sela mishetach charamiym tiheyeh lo tivaneh vod khiy aniy yehovah divaretiy neum adonay yehovih {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֛ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה לְצ֑וֹר הֲלֹ֣א ׀ מִקּ֣וֹל מַפַּלְתֵּ֗ךְ בֶּאֱנֹ֨ק חָלָ֜ל בֵּהָ֤רֵֽג הֶ֙רֶג֙ בְּתוֹכֵ֔ךְ יִרְעֲשׁ֖וּ הָאִיִּֽים׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> to Tyre: The coastlands shall quake at the sound of your downfall, when the wounded groan, when slaughter is rife within you.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih letsvor halo mikvol mafaletekhe veenok chalal vehareg hereg vetvokhekhe yireashu haiyiym

Hebrew: וְֽיָרְד֞וּ מֵעַ֣ל כִּסְאוֹתָ֗ם כֹּ֚ל נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הַיָּ֔ם וְהֵסִ֙ירוּ֙ אֶת־מְעִ֣ילֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י רִקְמָתָ֖ם יִפְשֹׁ֑טוּ חֲרָד֤וֹת <small>׀</small> יִלְבָּ֙שׁוּ֙ עַל־הָאָ֣רֶץ יֵשֵׁ֔בוּ וְחָֽרְדוּ֙ לִרְגָעִ֔ים וְשָׁמְמ֖וּ עָלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: All the rulers of the sea shall descend from their thrones; they shall remove their robes and strip off their embroidered garments. They shall clothe themselves with trembling, and shall sit on the ground; they shall tremble every moment, and they shall be aghast at you.
Transliteration: veyaredu meal khisevotam khol neshiyey hayam vehesiyru et-meiyleyhem veet-vigedey rikematam yifeshotu charadvot <small></small> yilevashu al-haarets eishevu vecharedu liregaiym veshamemu alayiikhe

Hebrew: וְנָשְׂא֨וּ עָלַ֤יִךְ קִינָה֙ וְאָ֣מְרוּ לָ֔ךְ אֵ֣יךְ אָבַ֔דְתְּ נוֹשֶׁ֖בֶת מִיַּמִּ֑ים הָעִ֣יר הַהֻלָּ֗לָה אֲשֶׁר֩ הָיְתָ֨ה חֲזָקָ֤ה בַיָּם֙ הִ֣יא וְיֹשְׁבֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁר־נָתְנ֥וּ חִתִּיתָ֖ם לְכׇל־יוֹשְׁבֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
And they shall intone a dirge over you, and they shall say to you:
How you have perished, you who were peopled from the seas,
O renowned city!
Mighty on the sea were she and her inhabitants,
Who cast their terror on all its inhabitants.
Transliteration: venasheu alayiikhe kiynah veameru lakhe eykhe avadete nvoshevet miyamiym haiyr hahulalah asher hayetah chazakah vayam hiy veyosheveyha asher-natenu chitiytam lekhׇl-yvosheveyha

Hebrew: עַתָּה֙ יֶחְרְד֣וּ הָאִיִּ֔ן י֖וֹם מַפַּלְתֵּ֑ךְ וְנִבְהֲל֛וּ הָאִיִּ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־בַּיָּ֖ם מִצֵּאתֵֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Now shall the coastlands tremble
On the day of your downfall,
And the coastlands by the sea
Be terrified at your end.
Transliteration: atah yecheredu haiyin yvom mafaletekhe venivehalu haiyiym asher-vayam mitsetekhe {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה בְּתִתִּ֤י אֹתָךְ֙ עִ֣יר נֶחֱרֶ֔בֶת כֶּעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־נוֹשָׁ֑בוּ בְּהַעֲל֤וֹת עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ אֶת־תְּה֔וֹם וְכִסּ֖וּךְ הַמַּ֥יִם הָרַבִּֽים׃
Translated: For thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: When I make you a ruined city, like cities empty of inhabitants; when I bring the deep over you, and its mighty waters cover you,
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih vetitiy otakhe iyr necherevet kheariym asher lo-nvoshavu vehaalvot alayiikhe et-tehvom vekhisukhe hamayiim haraviym

Hebrew: וְהוֹרַדְתִּיךְ֩ אֶת־י֨וֹרְדֵי ב֜וֹר אֶל־עַ֣ם עוֹלָ֗ם וְ֠הוֹשַׁבְתִּ֠יךְ בְּאֶ֨רֶץ תַּחְתִּיּ֜וֹת כׇּחֳרָב֤וֹת מֵעוֹלָם֙ אֶת־י֣וֹרְדֵי ב֔וֹר לְמַ֖עַן לֹ֣א תֵשֵׁ֑בִי וְנָתַתִּ֥י צְבִ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: then I will bring you down, with those who go down to the Pit, to the people of old. I will install you in the netherworld, with those that go down to the Pit, like the ruins of old, so that you shall not be inhabited and shall not radiate splendor in the land of the living.
Transliteration: vehvoradetiykhe et-yvoredey vvor el-am volam vehvoshavetiykhe veerets tachetiyyvot khׇchoravvot mevolam et-yvoredey vvor lemaan lo tesheviy venatatiy tseviy veerets chayiym

Hebrew: בַּלָּה֥וֹת אֶתְּנֵ֖ךְ וְאֵינֵ֑ךְ וּֽתְבֻקְשִׁ֗י וְלֹא־תִמָּֽצְאִ֥י עוֹד֙ לְעוֹלָ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will make you a horror, and you shall cease to be; you shall be sought, but shall never be found again—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: valahvot etenekhe veeynekhe utevukeshiy velo-timatseiy vod levolam neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֔ם שָׂ֥א עַל־צֹ֖ר קִינָֽה׃
Translated: Now you, O mortal, intone a dirge over Tyre.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam sha al-tsor kiynah

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ לְצ֗וֹר (הישבתי) [הַיֹּשֶׁ֙בֶת֙] עַל־מְבוֹאֹ֣ת יָ֔ם רֹכֶ֙לֶת֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֶל־אִיִּ֖ים רַבִּ֑ים {ס} כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה צ֕וֹר אַ֣תְּ אָמַ֔רְתְּ אֲנִ֖י כְּלִ֥ילַת יֹֽפִי׃
Translated:
Say to Tyre:
O you who dwell at the gateway of the sea,
Who trade with the peoples on many coastlands:
Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
O Tyre, you boasted,
I am perfect in beauty.
Transliteration: veamareta letsvor (hyshvty) [hayoshevet] al-mevvoot yam rokhelet haamiym el-iyiym raviym {s} khoh amar adonay yehovih tsvor ate amarete aniy kheliylat yofiy

Hebrew: בְּלֵ֥ב יַמִּ֖ים גְּבוּלָ֑יִךְ בֹּנַ֕יִךְ כָּלְל֖וּ יׇפְיֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Your frontiers were on the high seas,
Your builders perfected your beauty.
Transliteration: velev yamiym gevulayiikhe vonayiikhe khalelu yׇfeeikhe

Hebrew: בְּרוֹשִׁ֤ים מִשְּׂנִיר֙ בָּ֣נוּ לָ֔ךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־לֻחֹתָ֑יִם אֶ֤רֶז מִלְּבָנוֹן֙ לָקָ֔חוּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת תֹּ֖רֶן עָלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
From cypress trees of Senir
They fashioned your planks;
They took a cedar from Lebanon
To make a mast for you.
Transliteration: vervoshiym misheniyr vanu lakhe et khׇl-luchotayiim erez milevanvon lakachu laashvot toren alayiikhe

Hebrew: אַלּוֹנִים֙ מִבָּשָׁ֔ן עָשׂ֖וּ מִשּׁוֹטָ֑יִךְ קַרְשֵׁ֤ךְ עָֽשׂוּ־שֵׁן֙ בַּת־אֲשֻׁרִ֔ים מֵאִיֵּ֖י כִּתִּיִּֽם׃
Translated:
From oak trees of Bashan
They made your oars;
Of boxwood from the isles of Kittim,
Inlaid with ivory,
They made your decks.
Transliteration: alvoniym mivashan ashu mishvotayiikhe kareshekhe ashu-shen vat-ashuriym meiyey khitiyim

Hebrew: שֵׁשׁ־בְּרִקְמָ֤ה מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ הָיָ֣ה מִפְרָשֵׂ֔ךְ לִֽהְי֥וֹת לָ֖ךְ לְנֵ֑ס תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן מֵאִיֵּ֥י אֱלִישָׁ֖ה הָיָ֥ה מְכַסֵּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Embroidered linen from Egypt
Was the cloth
That served you for sails;
Of blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah
Were your awnings.
Transliteration: shesh-verikemah mimitserayiim hayah miferashekhe liheyvot lakhe lenes tekhelet vearegaman meiyey eliyshah hayah mekhasekhe

Hebrew: יֹשְׁבֵ֤י צִידוֹן֙ וְאַרְוַ֔ד הָי֥וּ שָׁטִ֖ים לָ֑ךְ חֲכָמַ֤יִךְ צוֹר֙ הָ֣יוּ בָ֔ךְ הֵ֖מָּה חֹבְלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad
Were your rowers;
Your skilled men, O Tyre, were within you,
They were your pilots.
Transliteration: yoshevey tsiydvon vearevad hayu shatiym lakhe chakhamayiikhe tsvor hayu vakhe hemah chovelayiikhe

Hebrew: זִקְנֵ֨י גְבַ֤ל וַחֲכָמֶ֙יהָ֙ הָ֣יוּ בָ֔ךְ מַחֲזִיקֵ֖י בִּדְקֵ֑ךְ כׇּל־אֳנִיּ֨וֹת הַיָּ֤ם וּמַלָּֽחֵיהֶם֙ הָ֣יוּ בָ֔ךְ לַעֲרֹ֖ב מַעֲרָבֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Gebal’s elders and artisans were within you,
Making your repairs.
All the ships of the sea, with their crews,
Were in your harbor
To traffic in your wares.
Transliteration: zikeney geval vachakhameyha hayu vakhe machaziykey videkekhe khׇl-oniyyvot hayam umalacheyhem hayu vakhe laarov maaravekhe

Hebrew: פָּרַ֨ס וְל֤וּד וּפוּט֙ הָי֣וּ בְחֵילֵ֔ךְ אַנְשֵׁ֖י מִלְחַמְתֵּ֑ךְ מָגֵ֤ן וְכוֹבַע֙ תִּלּוּ־בָ֔ךְ הֵ֖מָּה נָתְנ֥וּ הֲדָרֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Men of Paras, Lud, and Put
Were in your army,
Your warriors;
They hung shields and helmets in your midst,
They lent splendor to you.
Transliteration: faras velud ufut hayu vecheylekhe aneshey milechametekhe magen vekhvova tilu-vakhe hemah natenu hadarekhe

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֧י אַרְוַ֣ד וְחֵילֵ֗ךְ עַל־חוֹמוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ סָבִ֔יב וְגַ֨מָּדִ֔ים בְּמִגְדְּלוֹתַ֖יִךְ הָי֑וּ שִׁלְטֵיהֶ֞ם תִּלּ֤וּ עַל־חוֹמוֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ סָבִ֔יב הֵ֖מָּה כָּלְל֥וּ יׇפְיֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Men of Arvad and Helech
Were upon your walls all around,
And men of Gammad were stationed in your towers;
They hung their quivers all about your walls;
They perfected your beauty.
Transliteration: veney arevad vecheylekhe al-chvomvotayiikhe saviyv vegamadiym vemigedelvotayiikhe hayu shileteyhem tilu al-chvomvotayiikhe saviyv hemah khalelu yׇfeeikhe

Hebrew: תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ סֹחַרְתֵּ֖ךְ מֵרֹ֣ב כׇּל־ה֑וֹן בְּכֶ֤סֶף בַּרְזֶל֙ בְּדִ֣יל וְעוֹפֶ֔רֶת נָתְנ֖וּ עִזְבוֹנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Tarshish traded with you because of your wealth of all kinds of goods; they bartered silver, iron, tin, and lead for your wares.
Transliteration: tareshiysh socharetekhe merov khׇl-hvon vekhesef varezel vediyl vevoferet natenu izevvonayiikhe

Hebrew: יָוָ֤ן תֻּבַל֙ וָמֶ֔שֶׁךְ הֵ֖מָּה רֹכְלָ֑יִךְ בְּנֶ֤פֶשׁ אָדָם֙ וּכְלֵ֣י נְחֹ֔שֶׁת נָתְנ֖וּ מַעֲרָבֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Javan, Tubal, and Meshech—they were your merchants; they trafficked with you in human beings and copper utensils.
Transliteration: yavan tuval vameshekhe hemah rokhelayiikhe venefesh adam ukheley nechoshet natenu maaravekhe

Hebrew: מִבֵּ֖ית תּוֹגַרְמָ֑ה סוּסִ֤ים וּפָרָשִׁים֙ וּפְרָדִ֔ים נָתְנ֖וּ עִזְבוֹנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: From Beth-togarmah they bartered horses, riders, and mules for your wares.
Transliteration: miveyt tvogaremah susiym ufarashiym uferadiym natenu izevvonayiikhe

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י דְדָן֙ רֹכְלַ֔יִךְ אִיִּ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים סְחֹרַ֣ת יָדֵ֑ךְ קַרְנ֥וֹת שֵׁן֙ (והובנים) [וְהׇבְנִ֔ים] הֵשִׁ֖יבוּ אֶשְׁכָּרֵֽךְ׃
Translated: The people of Dedan were your merchants; many coastlands traded under your rule and rendered you tribute in ivory tusks and ebony.
Transliteration: veney dedan rokhelayiikhe iyiym raviym sechorat yadekhe karenvot shen (vhvvnym) [vehׇveniym] heshiyvu eshekharekhe

Hebrew: אֲרָ֥ם סֹחַרְתֵּ֖ךְ מֵרֹ֣ב מַעֲשָׂ֑יִךְ בְּ֠נֹ֠פֶךְ אַרְגָּמָ֨ן וְרִקְמָ֤ה וּבוּץ֙ וְרָאמֹ֣ת וְכַדְכֹּ֔ד נָתְנ֖וּ בְּעִזְבוֹנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Aram traded with you because of your wealth of merchandise, dealing with you in turquoise, purple stuff, embroidery, fine linen, coral, and agate.
Transliteration: aram socharetekhe merov maashayiikhe venofekhe aregaman verikemah uvuts veramot vekhadekhod natenu veizevvonayiikhe

Hebrew: יְהוּדָה֙ וְאֶ֣רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הֵ֖מָּה רֹכְלָ֑יִךְ בְּחִטֵּ֣י מִ֠נִּ֠ית וּפַנַּ֨ג וּדְבַ֤שׁ וָשֶׁ֙מֶן֙ וָצֹ֔רִי נָתְנ֖וּ מַעֲרָבֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Judah and the land of Israel were your merchants; they trafficked with you in wheat of Minnith and Pannag, honey, oil, and balm.
Transliteration: yehudah veerets yisherael hemah rokhelayiikhe vechitey miniyt ufanag udevash vashemen vatsoriy natenu maaravekhe

Hebrew: דַּמֶּ֧שֶׂק סֹחַרְתֵּ֛ךְ בְּרֹ֥ב מַעֲשַׂ֖יִךְ מֵרֹ֣ב כׇּל־ה֑וֹן בְּיֵ֥ין חֶלְבּ֖וֹן וְצֶ֥מֶר צָֽחַר׃
Translated: Because of your wealth of merchandise, because of your great wealth, Damascus traded with you in Helbon wine and white wool.
Transliteration: dameshek socharetekhe verov maashayiikhe merov khׇl-hvon veeiyn chelevvon vetsemer tsachar

Hebrew: וְדָ֤ן וְיָוָן֙ מְאוּזָּ֔ל בְּעִזְבוֹנַ֖יִךְ נָתָ֑נּוּ בַּרְזֶ֤ל עָשׁוֹת֙ קִדָּ֣ה וְקָנֶ֔ה בְּמַעֲרָבֵ֖ךְ הָיָֽה׃
Translated: Vedan and Javan from Uzal traded for your wares; they trafficked with you in polished iron, cassia, and calamus.
Transliteration: vedan veyavan meuzal veizevvonayiikhe natanu varezel ashvot kidah vekaneh vemaaravekhe hayah

Hebrew: דְּדָן֙ רֹֽכַלְתֵּ֔ךְ בְּבִגְדֵי־חֹ֖פֶשׁ לְרִכְבָּֽהֿ׃
Translated: Dedan was your merchant in saddlecloths for riding.
Transliteration: dedan rokhaletekhe vevigedey-chofesh lerikhevahֿ

Hebrew: עֲרַב֙ וְכׇל־נְשִׂיאֵ֣י קֵדָ֔ר הֵ֖מָּה סֹחֲרֵ֣י יָדֵ֑ךְ בְּכָרִ֤ים וְאֵילִם֙ וְעַתּוּדִ֔ים בָּ֖ם סֹחֲרָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Arabia and all Kedar’s chiefs were traders under your rule; they traded with you in lambs, rams, and goats.
Transliteration: arav vekhׇl-neshiyey kedar hemah socharey yadekhe vekhariym veeylim veatudiym vam socharayiikhe

Hebrew: רֹכְלֵ֤י שְׁבָא֙ וְרַעְמָ֔ה הֵ֖מָּה רֹכְלָ֑יִךְ בְּרֹ֨אשׁ כׇּל־בֹּ֜שֶׂם וּבְכׇל־אֶ֤בֶן יְקָרָה֙ וְזָהָ֔ב נָתְנ֖וּ עִזְבוֹנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: The merchants of Sheba and Raamah were your merchants; they bartered for your wares all the finest spices, all kinds of precious stones, and gold.
Transliteration: rokheley sheva veraemah hemah rokhelayiikhe verosh khׇl-voshem uvekhׇl-even yekarah vezahav natenu izevvonayiikhe

Hebrew: חָרָ֤ן וְכַנֵּה֙ וָעֶ֔דֶן רֹכְלֵ֖י שְׁבָ֑א אַשּׁ֖וּר כִּלְמַ֥ד רֹכַלְתֵּֽךְ׃
Translated: Haran, Canneh, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Assyria, and Chilmad traded with you.
Transliteration: charan vekhaneh vaeden rokheley sheva ashur khilemad rokhaletekhe

Hebrew: הֵ֤מָּה רֹכְלַ֙יִךְ֙ בְּמַכְלֻלִ֔ים בִּגְלוֹמֵי֙ תְּכֵ֣לֶת וְרִקְמָ֔ה וּבְגִנְזֵ֖י בְּרֹמִ֑ים בַּחֲבָלִ֧ים חֲבֻשִׁ֛ים וַאֲרֻזִ֖ים בְּמַרְכֻלְתֵּֽךְ׃
Translated: These were your merchants in choice fabrics, embroidered cloaks of blue, and many-colored carpets tied up with cords and preserved with cedar—among your wares.
Transliteration: hemah rokhelayiikhe vemakheluliym vigelvomey tekhelet verikemah uveginezey veromiym vachavaliym chavushiym vaaruziym vemarekhuletekhe

Hebrew: אֳנִיּ֣וֹת תַּרְשִׁ֔ישׁ שָׁרוֹתַ֖יִךְ מַעֲרָבֵ֑ךְ וַתִּמָּלְאִ֧י וַֽתִּכְבְּדִ֛י מְאֹ֖ד בְּלֵ֥ב יַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
The ships of Tarshish were in the service of your trade.
So you were full and richly laden
On the high seas.
Transliteration: oniyyvot tareshiysh sharvotayiikhe maaravekhe vatimaleiy vatikhevediy meod velev yamiym

Hebrew: בְּמַ֤יִם רַבִּים֙ הֱבִא֔וּךְ הַשָּׁטִ֖ים אֹתָ֑ךְ ר֚וּחַ הַקָּדִ֔ים שְׁבָרֵ֖ךְ בְּלֵ֥ב יַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
Your oarsmen brought you out
Into the mighty waters;
The tempest wrecked you
On the high seas.
Transliteration: vemayiim raviym heviukhe hashatiym otakhe rucha hakadiym shevarekhe velev yamiym

Hebrew: הוֹנֵךְ֙ וְעִזְבוֹנַ֔יִךְ מַעֲרָבֵ֕ךְ מַלָּחַ֖יִךְ וְחֹבְלָ֑יִךְ מַחֲזִיקֵ֣י בִדְקֵ֣ךְ וְֽעֹרְבֵ֣י מַ֠עֲרָבֵ֠ךְ וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֨י מִלְחַמְתֵּ֜ךְ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֗ךְ וּבְכׇל־קְהָלֵךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּתוֹכֵ֔ךְ יִפְּלוּ֙ בְּלֵ֣ב יַמִּ֔ים בְּי֖וֹם מַפַּלְתֵּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Your wealth, your wares, your merchandise,
Your sailors and your pilots,
Those who made your repairs,
Those who carried on your traffic,
And all the warriors within you—
All the multitude within you—
Shall go down into the depths of the sea
On the day of your downfall.
Transliteration: hvonekhe veizevvonayiikhe maaravekhe malachayiikhe vechovelayiikhe machaziykey videkekhe veorevey maaravekhe vekhׇl-aneshey milechametekhe asher-vakhe uvekhׇl-kehalekhe asher vetvokhekhe yifelu velev yamiym veyvom mafaletekhe

Hebrew: לְק֖וֹל זַעֲקַ֣ת חֹבְלָ֑יִךְ יִרְעֲשׁ֖וּ מִגְרֹשֽׁוֹת׃
Translated:
At the outcry of your pilots
The billows shall heave;
Transliteration: lekvol zaakat chovelayiikhe yireashu migeroshvot

Hebrew: וְֽיָרְד֞וּ מֵאֳנִיּֽוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם כֹּ֚ל תֹּפְשֵׂ֣י מָשׁ֔וֹט מַלָּחִ֕ים כֹּ֖ל חֹבְלֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ יַעֲמֹֽדוּ׃
Translated:
And all the oarsmen and mariners,
All the pilots of the sea,
Shall come down from their ships
And stand on the ground.
Transliteration: veyaredu meoniyyvoteyhem khol tofeshey mashvot malachiym khol choveley hayam el-haarets yaamodu

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁמִ֤יעוּ עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ בְּקוֹלָ֔ם וְיִזְעֲק֖וּ מָרָ֑ה וְיַעֲל֤וּ עָפָר֙ עַל־רָ֣אשֵׁיהֶ֔ם בָּאֵ֖פֶר יִתְפַּלָּֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
They shall raise their voices over you
And cry out bitterly;
They shall cast dust on their heads
And strew ashes on themselves.
Transliteration: vehishemiyu alayiikhe vekvolam veyizeaku marah veyaalu afar al-rasheyhem vaefer yitefalashu

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֤יחוּ אֵלַ֙יִךְ֙ קׇרְחָ֔ה וְחָגְר֖וּ שַׂקִּ֑ים וּבָכ֥וּ אֵלַ֛יִךְ בְּמַר־נֶ֖פֶשׁ מִסְפֵּ֥ד מָֽר׃
Translated:
On your account, they shall make
Bald patches on their heads,
And shall gird themselves with sackcloth.
They shall weep over you, brokenhearted,
With bitter lamenting;
Transliteration: vehikeriychu elayiikhe kׇrechah vechageru shakiym uvakhu elayiikhe vemar-nefesh misefed mar

Hebrew: וְנָשְׂא֨וּ אֵלַ֤יִךְ בְּנִיהֶם֙ קִינָ֔ה וְקוֹנְנ֖וּ עָלָ֑יִךְ מִ֣י כְצ֔וֹר כְּדֻמָ֖ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
Translated:
They shall intone a dirge over you as they wail,
And lament for you thus:
Who was like Tyre when she was silenced
In the midst of the sea?
Transliteration: venasheu elayiikhe veniyhem kiynah vekvonenu alayiikhe miy khetsvor khedumah vetvokhe hayam

Hebrew: בְּצֵ֤את עִזְבוֹנַ֙יִךְ֙ מִיַּמִּ֔ים הִשְׂבַּ֖עַתְּ עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים בְּרֹ֤ב הוֹנַ֙יִךְ֙ וּמַ֣עֲרָבַ֔יִךְ הֶעֱשַׁ֖רְתְּ מַלְכֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
When your wares were unloaded from the seas,
You satisfied many peoples;
With your great wealth and merchandise
You enriched the kings of the earth.
Transliteration: vetset izevvonayiikhe miyamiym hishevaate amiym raviym verov hvonayiikhe umaaravayiikhe heesharete malekhey-arets

Hebrew: עֵ֛ת נִשְׁבֶּ֥רֶת מִיַּמִּ֖ים בְּמַֽעֲמַקֵּי־מָ֑יִם מַעֲרָבֵ֥ךְ וְכׇל־קְהָלֵ֖ךְ בְּתוֹכֵ֥ךְ נָפָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
But when you were wrecked on the seas,
In the deep waters sank your merchandise
And all the crew aboard you.
Transliteration: et nisheveret miyamiym vemaamakey-mayiim maaravekhe vekhׇl-kehalekhe vetvokhekhe nafalu

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ל יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאִיִּ֔ים שָׁמְמ֖וּ עָלָ֑יִךְ וּמַלְכֵיהֶם֙ שָׂ֣עֲרוּ שַׂ֔עַר רָעֲמ֖וּ פָּנִֽים׃
Translated:
All the inhabitants of the coastlands
Are appalled over you;
Their kings are aghast,
Their faces contorted.
Transliteration: khol yoshevey haiyiym shamemu alayiikhe umalekheyhem shaaru shaar raamu faniym

Hebrew: סֹֽחֲרִים֙ בָּֽעַמִּ֔ים שָׁרְק֖וּ עָלָ֑יִךְ בַּלָּה֣וֹת הָיִ֔ית וְאֵינֵ֖ךְ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
The merchants among the peoples hissed at you;
You have become a horror,
And have ceased to be forever.
Transliteration: sochariym vaamiym shareku alayiikhe valahvot hayiyt veeynekhe ad-volam {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֡ם אֱמֹר֩ לִנְגִ֨יד צֹ֜ר כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה יַ֣עַן גָּבַ֤הּ לִבְּךָ֙ וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵ֣ל אָ֔נִי מוֹשַׁ֧ב אֱלֹהִ֛ים יָשַׁ֖בְתִּי בְּלֵ֣ב יַמִּ֑ים וְאַתָּ֤ה אָדָם֙ וְֽלֹא־אֵ֔ל וַתִּתֵּ֥ן לִבְּךָ֖ כְּלֵ֥ב אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
O mortal, say to the prince of Tyre: Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
Because you have been so haughty and have said, “I am a god; I sit enthroned like a god in the heart of the seas,” whereas you are not a god but a human, though you deemed your mind equal to a god’s—
Transliteration: ven-adam emor linegiyd tsor khoh-amar adonay yehovih yaan gavah livekha vatomer el aniy mvoshav Elohim yashavetiy velev yamiym veatah adam velo-el vatiten livekha khelev Elohim

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה חָכָ֛ם אַתָּ֖ה (מדנאל) [מִדָּֽנִיֵּ֑אל] כׇּל־סָת֖וּם לֹ֥א עֲמָמֽוּךָ׃
Translated:
Yes, you are wiser than Daniel;
In no hidden matter can anyone
Compare to you.
Transliteration: hineh chakham atah (mdnl) [midaniyel] khׇl-satum lo amamukha

Hebrew: בְּחׇכְמָֽתְךָ֙ וּבִתְבוּנָ֣תְךָ֔ עָשִׂ֥יתָ לְּךָ֖ חָ֑יִל וַתַּ֛עַשׂ זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף בְּאוֹצְרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
By your shrewd understanding
You have gained riches,
And have amassed gold and silver
In your treasuries.
Transliteration: vechׇkhematekha uvitevunatekha ashiyta lekha chayiil vataash zahav vakhesef vevotservoteykha

Hebrew: בְּרֹ֧ב חׇכְמָתְךָ֛ בִּרְכֻלָּתְךָ֖ הִרְבִּ֣יתָ חֵילֶ֑ךָ וַיִּגְבַּ֥הּ לְבָבְךָ֖ בְּחֵילֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
By your great shrewdness in trade
You have increased your wealth,
And you have grown haughty
Because of your wealth.
Transliteration: verov chׇkhematekha virekhulatekha hireviyta cheylekha vayigevah levavekha vecheylekha {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֕ן כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה יַ֛עַן תִּתְּךָ֥ אֶת־לְבָבְךָ֖ כְּלֵ֥ב אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because you have deemed your mind equal to a god’s,
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan titekha et-levavekha khelev Elohim

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֤יא עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ זָרִ֔ים עָרִיצֵ֖י גּוֹיִ֑ם וְהֵרִ֤יקוּ חַרְבוֹתָם֙ עַל־יְפִ֣י חׇכְמָתֶ֔ךָ וְחִלְּל֖וּ יִפְעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I swear I will bring against you
Strangers, the most ruthless of nations.
They shall unsheathe their swords
Against your prized shrewdness,
And they shall strike down your splendor.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy meviy aleykha zariym ariytsey gvoyim veheriyku charevvotam al-yefiy chׇkhematekha vechilelu yifeatekha

Hebrew: לַשַּׁ֖חַת יוֹרִד֑וּךָ וָמַ֛תָּה מְמוֹתֵ֥י חָלָ֖ל בְּלֵ֥ב יַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
They shall bring you down to the Pit;
In the heart of the sea you shall die
The death of the slain.
Transliteration: lashachat yvoridukha vamatah memvotey chalal velev yamiym

Hebrew: הֶאָמֹ֤ר תֹּאמַר֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אָ֔נִי לִפְנֵ֖י הֹרְגֶ֑ךָ וְאַתָּ֥ה אָדָ֛ם וְלֹא־אֵ֖ל בְּיַ֥ד מְחַלְלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Will you still say, “I am a god”
Before your slayers,
When you are proved a human, not a god,
At the hands of those who strike you down?
Transliteration: heamor tomar Elohim aniy lifeney horegekha veatah adam velo-el veyad mechaleleykha

Hebrew: מוֹתֵ֧י עֲרֵלִ֛ים תָּמ֖וּת בְּיַד־זָרִ֑ים כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י דִבַּ֔רְתִּי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
By the hands of strangers you shall die
The death of the uncircumcised;
For I have spoken
—declares the Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: mvotey areliym tamut veyad-zariym khiy aniy divaretiy neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם שָׂ֥א קִינָ֖ה עַל־מֶ֣לֶךְ צ֑וֹר וְאָמַ֣רְתָּ לּ֗וֹ כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה אַתָּה֙ חוֹתֵ֣ם תׇּכְנִ֔ית מָלֵ֥א חׇכְמָ֖ה וּכְלִ֥יל יֹֽפִי׃
Translated:
O mortal, intone a dirge over the king of Tyre and say to him: Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
You were the seal of perfection,
Full of wisdom and flawless in beauty.
Transliteration: ven-adam sha kiynah al-melekhe tsvor veamareta lvo khoh amar adonay yehovih atah chvotem tׇkheniyt male chׇkhemah ukheliyl yofiy

Hebrew: בְּעֵ֨דֶן גַּן־אֱלֹהִ֜ים הָיִ֗יתָ כׇּל־אֶ֨בֶן יְקָרָ֤ה מְסֻכָתֶ֙ךָ֙ אֹ֣דֶם פִּטְדָ֞ה וְיָהֲלֹ֗ם תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ שֹׁ֙הַם֙ וְיָ֣שְׁפֵ֔ה סַפִּ֣יר נֹ֔פֶךְ וּבָרְקַ֖ת וְזָהָ֑ב מְלֶ֨אכֶת תֻּפֶּ֤יךָ וּנְקָבֶ֙יךָ֙ בָּ֔ךְ בְּי֥וֹם הִבָּרַאֲךָ֖ כּוֹנָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
You were in Eden, the garden of God;
Every precious stone was your adornment:
Carnelian, chrysolite, and amethyst;
Beryl, lapis lazuli, and jasper;
Sapphire, turquoise, and emerald;
And gold beautifully wrought for you,
Mined for you, prepared the day you were created.
Transliteration: veeden gan-Elohim hayiyta khׇl-even yekarah mesukhatekha odem fitedah veyahalom tareshiysh shoham veyashefeh safiyr nofekhe uvarekat vezahav melekhet tufeykha unekaveykha vakhe veyvom hivaraakha khvonanu

Hebrew: אַ֨תְּ־כְּר֔וּב מִמְשַׁ֖ח הַסּוֹכֵ֑ךְ וּנְתַתִּ֗יךָ בְּהַ֨ר קֹ֤דֶשׁ אֱלֹהִים֙ הָיִ֔יתָ בְּת֥וֹךְ אַבְנֵי־אֵ֖שׁ הִתְהַלָּֽכְתָּ׃
Translated:
I created you as a cherub
With outstretched shielding wings;
And you resided on God’s holy mountain;
You walked among stones of fire.
Transliteration: ate-kheruv mimeshach hasvokhekhe unetatiykha vehar kodesh Elohim hayiyta vetvokhe aveney-esh hitehalakheta

Hebrew: תָּמִ֤ים אַתָּה֙ בִּדְרָכֶ֔יךָ מִיּ֖וֹם הִבָּֽרְאָ֑ךְ עַד־נִמְצָ֥א עַוְלָ֖תָה בָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
You were blameless in your ways,
From the day you were created
Until wrongdoing was found in you.
Transliteration: tamiym atah viderakheykha miyyvom hivareakhe ad-nimetsa avelatah vakhe

Hebrew: בְּרֹ֣ב רְכֻלָּתְךָ֗ מָל֧וּ תוֹכְךָ֛ חָמָ֖ס וַֽתֶּחֱטָ֑א וָאֲחַלֶּלְךָ֩ מֵהַ֨ר אֱלֹהִ֤ים וָֽאַבֶּדְךָ֙ כְּר֣וּב הַסֹּכֵ֔ךְ מִתּ֖וֹךְ אַבְנֵי־אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
By your far-flung commerce
You were filled with lawlessness
And you sinned.
So I have struck you down
From the mountain of God,
And I have destroyed you, O shielding cherub,
From among the stones of fire.
Transliteration: verov rekhulatekha malu tvokhekha chamas vatecheta vaachalelekha mehar Elohim vaavedekha kheruv hasokhekhe mitvokhe aveney-esh

Hebrew: גָּבַ֤הּ לִבְּךָ֙ בְּיׇפְיֶ֔ךָ שִׁחַ֥תָּ חׇכְמָתְךָ֖ עַל־יִפְעָתֶ֑ךָ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ הִשְׁלַכְתִּ֗יךָ לִפְנֵ֧י מְלָכִ֛ים נְתַתִּ֖יךָ לְרַ֥אֲוָה בָֽךְ׃
Translated:
You grew haughty because of your beauty,
You debased your wisdom for the sake of your splendor;
I have cast you to the ground,
I have made you an object for kings to stare at.
Transliteration: gavah livekha veyׇfeyekha shichata chׇkhematekha al-yifeatekha al-erets hishelakhetiykha lifeney melakhiym netatiykha leraavah vakhe

Hebrew: מֵרֹ֣ב עֲוֺנֶ֗יךָ בְּעֶ֙וֶל֙ רְכֻלָּ֣תְךָ֔ חִלַּ֖לְתָּ מִקְדָּשֶׁ֑יךָ וָאוֹצִא־אֵ֤שׁ מִתּֽוֹכְךָ֙ הִ֣יא אֲכָלַ֔תְךָ וָאֶתֶּנְךָ֤ לְאֵ֙פֶר֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־רֹאֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
By the greatness of your guilt,
Through the dishonesty of your trading,
You desecrated your sanctuaries.
So I made a fire issue from you,
And it has devoured you;
I have reduced you to ashes on the ground,
In the sight of all who behold you.
Transliteration: merov avoneykha veevel rekhulatekha chilaleta mikedasheykha vavotsi-esh mitvokhekha hiy akhalatekha vaetenekha leefer al-haarets leeyney khׇl-roeykha

Hebrew: כׇּל־יֽוֹדְעֶ֙יךָ֙ בָּֽעַמִּ֔ים שָׁמְמ֖וּ עָלֶ֑יךָ בַּלָּה֣וֹת הָיִ֔יתָ וְאֵינְךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
All who knew you among the peoples
Are appalled at your doom.
You have become a horror
And have ceased to be, forever.
Transliteration: khׇl-yvodeeykha vaamiym shamemu aleykha valahvot hayiyta veeynekha ad-volam {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם שִׂ֥ים פָּנֶ֖יךָ אֶל־צִיד֑וֹן וְהִנָּבֵ֖א עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: O mortal, set your face toward Sidon and prophesy against her.
Transliteration: ven-adam shiym faneykha el-tsiydvon vehinave aleyha

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֤י עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ צִיד֔וֹן וְנִכְבַּדְתִּ֖י בְּתוֹכֵ֑ךְ וְֽיָדְע֞וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה בַּעֲשׂ֥וֹתִי בָ֛הּ שְׁפָטִ֖ים וְנִקְדַּ֥שְׁתִּי בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Say: Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
I am going to deal with you, O Sidon.
I will gain glory in your midst;
And they shall know that I am GOD,
When I wreak punishment upon her
And show Myself holy through her.
Transliteration: veamareta khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy alayiikhe tsiydvon venikhevadetiy vetvokhekhe veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah vaashvotiy vah shefatiym venikedashetiy vah

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי־בָ֞הּ דֶּ֤בֶר וָדָם֙ בְּח֣וּצוֹתֶ֔יהָ וְנִפְלַ֤ל חָלָל֙ בְּתוֹכָ֔הּ בְּחֶ֥רֶב עָלֶ֖יהָ מִסָּבִ֑יב וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
I will let pestilence loose against her
And bloodshed into her streets.
And the slain shall fall in her midst
When the sword comes upon her from all sides.
And they shall know that I am GOD.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy-vah dever vadam vechutsvoteyha venifelal chalal vetvokhah vecherev aleyha misaviyv veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֨ה ע֜וֹד לְבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל סִלּ֤וֹן מַמְאִיר֙ וְק֣וֹץ מַכְאִ֔ב מִכֹּל֙ סְבִ֣יבֹתָ֔ם הַשָּׁאטִ֖ים אוֹתָ֑ם וְיָ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֥י אֲנִ֖י אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Then shall the House of Israel no longer be afflicted with prickling briers and lacerating thorns from all the neighbors who despise them; and they shall know that I am the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velo-yiheyeh vod leveyt yisherael silvon mameiyr vekvots makheiv mikhol seviyvotam hashatiym votam veyadeu khiy aniy adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ בְּקַבְּצִ֣י ׀ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מִן־הָֽעַמִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָפֹ֣צוּ בָ֔ם וְנִקְדַּ֥שְׁתִּי בָ֖ם לְעֵינֵ֣י הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וְיָֽשְׁבוּ֙ עַל־אַדְמָתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לְעַבְדִּ֥י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: When I have gathered the House of Israel from the peoples among which they have been dispersed, and have shown Myself holy through them in the sight of the nations, they shall settle on their own soil, which I gave to My servant Jacob,
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih vekavetsiy et-veyt yisherael min-haamiym asher nafotsu vam venikedashetiy vam leeyney hagvoyim veyashevu al-adematam asher natatiy leavediy leyaakov

Hebrew: וְיָשְׁב֣וּ עָלֶ֘יהָ֮ לָבֶ֒טַח֒ וּבָנ֤וּ בָתִּים֙ וְנָטְע֣וּ כְרָמִ֔ים וְיָשְׁב֖וּ לָבֶ֑טַח בַּעֲשׂוֹתִ֣י שְׁפָטִ֗ים בְּכֹ֨ל הַשָּׁאטִ֤ים אֹתָם֙ מִסְּבִ֣יבוֹתָ֔ם וְיָ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: and they shall dwell on it in security. They shall build houses and plant vineyards, and shall dwell on it in security, when I have meted out punishment to all those about them who despise them. And they shall know that I the E<small>TERNAL</small> One am their God.
Transliteration: veyashevu aleyha lavetach uvanu vatiym venateu kheramiym veyashevu lavetach vaashvotiy shefatiym vekhol hashatiym otam miseviyvvotam veyadeu khiy aniy yehovah eloheyhem {f}

Hebrew: בַּשָּׁנָה֙ הָעֲשִׂרִ֔ית בָּעֲשִׂרִ֕י בִּשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the tenth year, on the twelfth day of the tenth month, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vashanah haashiriyt vaashiriy visheneym ashar lachodesh hayah devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם שִׂ֣ים פָּנֶ֔יךָ עַל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהִנָּבֵ֣א עָלָ֔יו וְעַל־מִצְרַ֖יִם כֻּלָּֽהּ׃
Translated: O mortal, turn your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.
Transliteration: ven-adam shiym faneykha al-fareoh melekhe mitserayiim vehinave alayv veal-mitserayiim khulah

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֨ר וְאָמַרְתָּ֜ כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנְנִ֤י עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם הַתַּנִּים֙ הַגָּד֔וֹל הָרֹבֵ֖ץ בְּת֣וֹךְ יְאֹרָ֑יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָמַ֛ר לִ֥י יְאֹרִ֖י וַאֲנִ֥י עֲשִׂיתִֽנִי׃
Translated:
Speak these words:
Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
I am going to deal with you, O Pharaoh king of Egypt,
Mighty monster, sprawling in your channels,
Who said,
My Nile is my own;
I made it for myself.
Transliteration: daver veamareta khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineniy aleykha fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim hataniym hagadvol harovets vetvokhe yeorayv asher amar liy yeoriy vaaniy ashiytiniy

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י (חחיים) [חַחִים֙] בִּלְחָיֶ֔יךָ וְהִדְבַּקְתִּ֥י דְגַת־יְאֹרֶ֖יךָ בְּקַשְׂקְשֹׂתֶ֑יךָ וְהַעֲלִיתִ֙יךָ֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ יְאֹרֶ֔יךָ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־דְּגַ֣ת יְאֹרֶ֔יךָ בְּקַשְׂקְשֹׂתֶ֖יךָ תִּדְבָּֽק׃
Translated:
I will put hooks in your jaws,
And make the fish of your channels
Cling to your scales;
I will haul you up from your channels,
With all the fish of your channels
Clinging to your scales.
Transliteration: venatatiy (chchyym) [chachiym] vilechayeykha vehidevaketiy degat-yeoreykha vekashekeshoteykha vehaaliytiykha mitvokhe yeoreykha veet khׇl-degat yeoreykha vekashekeshoteykha tidevak

Hebrew: וּנְטַשְׁתִּ֣יךָ הַמִּדְבָּ֗רָה אוֹתְךָ֙ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־דְּגַ֣ת יְאֹרֶ֔יךָ עַל־פְּנֵ֤י הַשָּׂדֶה֙ תִּפּ֔וֹל לֹ֥א תֵאָסֵ֖ף וְלֹ֣א תִקָּבֵ֑ץ לְחַיַּ֥ת הָאָ֛רֶץ וּלְע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם נְתַתִּ֥יךָ לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
Translated:
And I will fling you into the desert,
With all the fish of your channels.
You shall be left lying in the open,
Ungathered and unburied:
I have given you as food
To the beasts of the earth
And the birds of the sky.
Transliteration: unetashetiykha hamidevarah votekha veet khׇl-degat yeoreykha al-feney hashadeh tifvol lo teasef velo tikavets lechayat haarets ulevof hashamayiim netatiykha leׇkhelah

Hebrew: וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּ֖י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה יַ֧עַן הֱיוֹתָ֛ם מִשְׁעֶ֥נֶת קָנֶ֖ה לְבֵ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Then all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know
That I am GOD.
Because you were a staff of reed
To the House of Israel:
Transliteration: veyadeu khׇl-yoshevey mitserayiim khiy aniy yehovah yaan heyvotam misheenet kaneh leveyt yisherael

Hebrew: בְּתׇפְשָׂ֨ם בְּךָ֤ (בכפך) [בַכַּף֙] תֵּר֔וֹץ וּבָקַעְתָּ֥ לָהֶ֖ם כׇּל־כָּתֵ֑ף וּבְהִֽשָּׁעֲנָ֤ם עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ תִּשָּׁבֵ֔ר וְהַעֲמַדְתָּ֥ לָהֶ֖ם כׇּל־מׇתְנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated:
When they grasped you with the hand, you would splinter,
And wound all their shoulders,
And when they leaned on you, you would break,
And make all their loins unsteady.
Transliteration: vetׇfesham vekha (vkhfkh) [vakhaf] tervots uvakaeta lahem khׇl-khatef uvehishaanam aleykha tishaver vehaamadeta lahem khׇl-mׇtenayiim {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֛י מֵבִ֥יא עָלַ֖יִךְ חָ֑רֶב וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י מִמֵּ֖ךְ אָדָ֥ם וּבְהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Lo, I will bring a sword against you, and will cut off human and animal from you,
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy meviy alayiikhe charev vehikheratiy mimekhe adam uvehemah

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֤ה אֶרֶץ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לִשְׁמָמָ֣ה וְחׇרְבָּ֔ה וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה יַ֧עַן אָמַ֛ר יְאֹ֥ר לִ֖י וַאֲנִ֥י עָשִֽׂיתִי׃
Translated: so that the land of Egypt shall fall into desolation and ruin. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>—because he boasted, “The Nile is mine, and I made it.”
Transliteration: vehayetah erets-mitserayiim lishemamah vechׇrevah veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah yaan amar yeor liy vaaniy ashiytiy

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן הִנְנִ֥י אֵלֶ֖יךָ וְאֶל־יְאֹרֶ֑יךָ וְנָתַתִּ֞י אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם לְחׇרְבוֹת֙ חֹ֣רֶב שְׁמָמָ֔ה מִמִּגְדֹּ֥ל סְוֵנֵ֖ה וְעַד־גְּב֥וּל כּֽוּשׁ׃
Translated: Assuredly, I am going to deal with you and your channels, and I will reduce the land of Egypt to utter ruin and desolation, from Migdol to Syene, all the way to the border of Cush.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy eleykha veel-yeoreykha venatatiy et-erets mitserayiim lechׇrevvot chorev shemamah mimigedol seveneh vead-gevul khush

Hebrew: לֹ֤א תַֽעֲבׇר־בָּהּ֙ רֶ֣גֶל אָדָ֔ם וְרֶ֥גֶל בְּהֵמָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַֽעֲבׇר־בָּ֑הּ וְלֹ֥א תֵשֵׁ֖ב אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: No human foot shall traverse it, and no animal foot shall traverse it; and it shall remain uninhabited for forty years.
Transliteration: lo taavׇr-vah regel adam veregel vehemah lo taavׇr-vah velo teshev arevaiym shanah

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֣י אֶת־אֶ֩רֶץ֩ מִצְרַ֨יִם שְׁמָמָ֜ה בְּת֣וֹךְ ׀ אֲרָצ֣וֹת נְשַׁמּ֗וֹת וְעָרֶ֙יהָ֙ בְּת֨וֹךְ עָרִ֤ים מׇֽחֳרָבוֹת֙ תִּהְיֶ֣יןָ שְׁמָמָ֔ה אַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַהֲפִצֹתִ֤י אֶת־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם וְזֵרִיתִ֖ים בָּאֲרָצֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: For forty years I will make the land of Egypt the most desolate of desolate lands, and its cities shall be the most desolate of ruined cities. And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-erets mitserayiim shemamah vetvokhe aratsvot neshamvot veareyha vetvokhe ariym mׇchoravvot tiheyeyna shemamah arevaiym shanah vahafitsotiy et-mitserayiim vagvoyim vezeriytiym vaaratsvot {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֛י כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה מִקֵּ֞ץ אַרְבָּעִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ אֲקַבֵּ֣ץ אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מִן־הָעַמִּ֖ים אֲשֶׁר־נָפֹ֥צוּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: Further, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: After a period of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were dispersed.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih mikets arevaiym shanah akavets et-mitserayiim min-haamiym asher-nafotsu shamah

Hebrew: וְשַׁבְתִּי֙ אֶת־שְׁב֣וּת מִצְרַ֔יִם וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֤י אֹתָם֙ אֶ֣רֶץ פַּתְר֔וֹס עַל־אֶ֖רֶץ מְכוּרָתָ֑ם וְהָ֥יוּ שָׁ֖ם מַמְלָכָ֥ה שְׁפָלָֽה׃
Translated: I will restore the fortunes of the Egyptians and bring them back to the land of their origin, the land of Pathros, and there they shall be a lowly kingdom.
Transliteration: veshavetiy et-shevut mitserayiim vahashivotiy otam erets fatervos al-erets mekhuratam vehayu sham mamelakhah shefalah

Hebrew: מִן־הַמַּמְלָכוֹת֙ תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה שְׁפָלָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־תִתְנַשֵּׂ֥א ע֖וֹד עַל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וְהִ֨מְעַטְתִּ֔ים לְבִלְתִּ֖י רְד֥וֹת בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: It shall be the lowliest of all the kingdoms, and shall not lord it over the nations again. I will reduce the Egyptians, so that they shall have no dominion over the nations.
Transliteration: min-hamamelakhvot tiheyeh shefalah velo-titenashe vod al-hagvoyim vehimeatetiym leviletiy redvot vagvoyim

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א יִֽהְיֶה־עוֹד֩ לְבֵ֨ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל לְמִבְטָח֙ מַזְכִּ֣יר עָוֺ֔ן בִּפְנוֹתָ֖ם אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וְיָ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֥י אֲנִ֖י אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Never again shall they be the trust of the House of Israel, recalling its guilt in having turned to them. And they shall know that I am the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velo yiheyeh-vod leveyt yisherael lemivetach mazekhiyr avon vifenvotam achareyhem veyadeu khiy aniy adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּעֶשְׂרִ֤ים וָשֶׁ֙בַע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה בָּרִאשׁ֖וֹן בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the twenty-seventh year, on the first day of the first month, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy veesheriym vasheva shanah varishvon veechad lachodesh hayah devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּ֠בֶ֠ל הֶעֱבִ֨יד אֶת־חֵיל֜וֹ עֲבֹדָ֤ה גְדוֹלָה֙ אֶל־צֹ֔ר כׇּל־רֹ֣אשׁ מֻקְרָ֔ח וְכׇל־כָּתֵ֖ף מְרוּטָ֑ה וְ֠שָׂכָ֠ר לֹא־הָ֨יָה ל֤וֹ וּלְחֵילוֹ֙ מִצֹּ֔ר עַל־הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־עָבַ֥ד עָלֶֽיהָ׃ {ס}
