Translated: O mortal, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon has made his army expend vast labor on Tyre; every head is rubbed bald and every shoulder scraped. But he and his army have had no return for the labor he expended on Tyre.
Transliteration: ven-adam nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel heeviyd et-cheylvo avodah gedvolah el-tsor khׇl-rosh mukerach vekhׇl-khatef merutah veshakhar lo-hayah lvo ulecheylvo mitsor al-haavodah asher-avad aleyha {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י נֹתֵ֛ן לִנְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְנָשָׂ֨א הֲמֹנָ֜הּ וְשָׁלַ֤ל שְׁלָלָהּ֙ וּבָזַ֣ז בִּזָּ֔הּ וְהָיְתָ֥ה שָׂכָ֖ר לְחֵילֽוֹ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon. He shall carry off her wealth and take her spoil and seize her booty; and she shall be the recompense of his army.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy noten linevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel et-erets mitserayiim venasha hamonah veshalal shelalah uvazaz vizah vehayetah shakhar lecheylvo

Hebrew: פְּעֻלָּתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁר־עָ֣בַד בָּ֔הּ נָתַ֥תִּי ל֖וֹ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁר֙ עָ֣שׂוּ לִ֔י נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: As the wage for which he labored, for what they did for Me, I give him the land of Egypt—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: feulatvo asher-avad vah natatiy lvo et-erets mitserayiim asher ashu liy neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא אַצְמִ֤יחַ קֶ֙רֶן֙ לְבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּלְךָ֛ אֶתֵּ֥ן פִּתְחֽוֹן־פֶּ֖ה בְּתוֹכָ֑ם וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: On that day I will endow the House of Israel with strength, and you shall be vindicated among them. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu atsemiycha keren leveyt yisherael ulekha eten fitechvon-feh vetvokham veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הִנָּבֵא֙ וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הֵילִ֖ילוּ הָ֥הּ לַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
O mortal, prophesy and say: Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
Wail, alas for the day!
Transliteration: ven-adam hinave veamareta khoh amar adonay yehovih heyliylu hah layyvom

Hebrew: כִּֽי־קָר֣וֹב י֔וֹם וְקָר֥וֹב י֖וֹם לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה י֣וֹם עָנָ֔ן עֵ֥ת גּוֹיִ֖ם יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated:
For a day is near;
A day of GOD is near.
It will be a day of cloud,
An hour of [invading] nations.
Transliteration: khiy-karvov yvom vekarvov yvom layhovah yvom anan et gvoyim yiheyeh

Hebrew: וּבָאָ֥ה חֶ֙רֶב֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְהָיְתָ֤ה חַלְחָלָה֙ בְּכ֔וּשׁ בִּנְפֹ֥ל חָלָ֖ל בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְלָקְח֣וּ הֲמוֹנָ֔הּ וְנֶהֶרְס֖וּ יְסֹדוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
A sword shall pierce Egypt,
And Cush shall be seized with trembling,
When the slain fall in Egypt
And her wealth is seized
And her foundations are overthrown.
Transliteration: uvaah cherev vemitserayiim vehayetah chalechalah vekhush vinefol chalal vemitserayiim velakechu hamvonah veneheresu yesodvoteyha

Hebrew: כּ֣וּשׁ וּפ֤וּט וְלוּד֙ וְכׇל־הָעֶ֣רֶב וְכ֔וּב וּבְנֵ֖י אֶ֣רֶץ הַבְּרִ֑ית אִתָּ֖ם בַּחֶ֥רֶב יִפֹּֽלוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Cush, Put, and Lud, and all the mixed populations, and Cub, and the inhabitants of the allied countries shall fall by the sword with them.
Transliteration: khush ufut velud vekhׇl-haerev vekhuv uveney erets haveriyt itam vacherev yifolu {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנָֽפְלוּ֙ סֹמְכֵ֣י מִצְרַ֔יִם וְיָרַ֖ד גְּא֣וֹן עֻזָּ֑הּ מִמִּגְדֹּ֣ל סְוֵנֵ֗ה בַּחֶ֙רֶב֙ יִפְּלוּ־בָ֔הּ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
Those who support Egypt shall fall,
And her proud strength shall sink;
There they shall fall by the sword,
From Migdol to Syene
—declares the Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah venafelu somekhey mitserayiim veyarad gevon uzah mimigedol seveneh vacherev yifelu-vah neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְנָשַׁ֕מּוּ בְּת֖וֹךְ אֲרָצ֣וֹת נְשַׁמּ֑וֹת וְעָרָ֕יו בְּתוֹךְ־עָרִ֥ים נַחֲרָב֖וֹת תִּֽהְיֶֽינָה׃
Translated: They shall be the most desolate of desolate lands, and her cities shall be the most ruined of cities,
Transliteration: venashamu vetvokhe aratsvot neshamvot vearayv vetvokhe-ariym nacharavvot tiheyeynah

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּתִתִּי־אֵ֣שׁ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְנִשְׁבְּר֖וּ כׇּל־עֹזְרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: when I set fire to Egypt and all who help her are broken. Thus they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah vetitiy-esh vemitserayiim venisheveru khׇl-ozereyha

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יֵצְא֨וּ מַלְאָכִ֤ים מִלְּפָנַי֙ בַּצִּ֔ים לְהַחֲרִ֖יד אֶת־כּ֣וּשׁ בֶּ֑טַח וְהָיְתָ֨ה חַלְחָלָ֤ה בָהֶם֙ בְּי֣וֹם מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּ֥י הִנֵּ֖ה בָּאָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: On that day, messengers shall set out at My bidding to strike terror into confident Cush. And they shall be seized with trembling on Egypt’s day [of doom]—for it is at hand.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu eitseu maleakhiym milefanay vatsiym lehachariyd et-khush vetach vehayetah chalechalah vahem veyvom mitserayiim khiy hineh vaah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה וְהִשְׁבַּתִּי֙ אֶת־הֲמ֣וֹן מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּיַ֖ד נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֥ר מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶֽל׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will put an end to the wealth of Egypt through King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih vehishevatiy et-hamvon mitserayiim veyad nevukhaderetsar melekhe-vavel

Hebrew: ה֠וּא וְעַמּ֤וֹ אִתּוֹ֙ עָרִיצֵ֣י גוֹיִ֔ם מוּבָאִ֖ים לְשַׁחֵ֣ת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהֵרִ֤יקוּ חַרְבוֹתָם֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם וּמָלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ חָלָֽל׃
Translated: He, together with his troops, the most ruthless of the nations, shall be brought to ravage the land. And they shall unsheathe the sword against Egypt and fill the land with the slain.
Transliteration: hu veamvo itvo ariytsey gvoyim muvaiym leshachet haarets veheriyku charevvotam al-mitserayiim umaleu et-haarets chalal

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י יְאֹרִים֙ חׇֽרָבָ֔ה וּמָכַרְתִּ֥י אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ בְּיַד־רָעִ֑ים וַהֲשִׁמֹּתִ֞י אֶ֤רֶץ וּמְלֹאָהּ֙ בְּיַד־זָרִ֔ים אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּֽרְתִּי׃ {ס}
Translated: I will turn the channels into dry ground, and I will deliver the land into the hands of evildoers. I will lay waste the land and everything in it by the hands of strangers. I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken.
Transliteration: venatatiy yeoriym chׇravah umakharetiy et-haarets veyad-raiym vahashimotiy erets umeloah veyad-zariym aniy yehovah divaretiy {s}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה וְהַאֲבַדְתִּ֨י גִלּוּלִ֜ים וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֤י אֱלִילִים֙ מִנֹּ֔ף וְנָשִׂ֥יא מֵאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֖יִם לֹ֣א יִֽהְיֶה־ע֑וֹד וְנָתַתִּ֥י יִרְאָ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will destroy the fetishes and make an end of the idols in Noph; and no longer shall there be a prince in the land of Egypt; and I will strike the land of Egypt with fear.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih vehaavadetiy giluliym vehishevatiy eliyliym minof venashiy meerets-mitserayiim lo yiheyeh-vod venatatiy yireah veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַֽהֲשִׁמֹּתִי֙ אֶת־פַּתְר֔וֹס וְנָתַ֥תִּי אֵ֖שׁ בְּצֹ֑עַן וְעָשִׂ֥יתִי שְׁפָטִ֖ים בְּנֹֽא׃
Translated: I will lay Pathros waste, I will set fire to Zoan, and I will execute judgment on No.
Transliteration: vahashimotiy et-fatervos venatatiy esh vetsoan veashiytiy shefatiym veno

Hebrew: וְשָׁפַכְתִּ֣י חֲמָתִ֔י עַל־סִ֖ין מָע֣וֹז מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהִכְרַתִּ֖י אֶת־הֲמ֥וֹן נֹֽא׃
Translated: I will pour out my anger upon Sin, the stronghold of Egypt, and I will destroy the wealth of No.
Transliteration: veshafakhetiy chamatiy al-siyn mavoz mitserayiim vehikheratiy et-hamvon no

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֤תִּי אֵשׁ֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם ח֤וּל (תחיל) [תָּחוּל֙] סִ֔ין וְנֹ֖א תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה לְהִבָּקֵ֑עַ וְנֹ֖ף צָרֵ֥י יוֹמָֽם׃
Translated: I will set fire to Egypt; Sin shall writhe in anguish and No shall be torn apart; and Noph [shall face] adversaries in broad daylight.
Transliteration: venatatiy esh vemitserayiim chul (tchyl) [tachul] siyn veno tiheyeh lehivakea venof tsarey yvomam

Hebrew: בַּח֥וּרֵי אָ֛וֶן וּפִי־בֶ֖סֶת בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפֹּ֑לוּ וְהֵ֖נָּה בַּשְּׁבִ֥י תֵלַֽכְנָה׃
Translated: The young men of Aven and Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword, and those [towns] shall go into captivity.
Transliteration: vachurey aven ufiy-veset vacherev yifolu vehenah vasheviy telakhenah

Hebrew: וּבִֽתְחַפְנְחֵס֙ חָשַׂ֣ךְ הַיּ֔וֹם בְּשִׁבְרִי־שָׁם֙ אֶת־מֹט֣וֹת מִצְרַ֔יִם וְנִשְׁבַּת־בָּ֖הּ גְּא֣וֹן עֻזָּ֑הּ הִ֚יא עָנָ֣ן יְכַסֶּ֔נָּה וּבְנוֹתֶ֖יהָ בַּשְּׁבִ֥י תֵלַֽכְנָה׃
Translated: In Tehaphnehes daylight shall be withheld, when I break there the power of Egypt, and there her proud strength comes to an end. [The city] itself shall be covered with cloud, and its daughter towns shall go into captivity.
Transliteration: uvitechafeneches chashakhe hayyvom veshiveriy-sham et-motvot mitserayiim venishevat-vah gevon uzah hiy anan yekhasenah uvenvoteyha vasheviy telakhenah

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתִי שְׁפָטִ֖ים בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Thus I will execute judgment on Egypt;
And they shall know that I am GOD.
Transliteration: veashiytiy shefatiym vemitserayiim veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּאַחַ֤ת עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה בָּרִאשׁ֖וֹן בְּשִׁבְעָ֣ה לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the eleventh year, on the seventh day of the first month, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy veachat eshereh shanah varishvon veshiveah lachodesh hayah devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם אֶת־זְר֛וֹעַ פַּרְעֹ֥ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם שָׁבָ֑רְתִּי וְהִנֵּ֣ה לֹֽא־חֻ֠בְּשָׁ֠ה לָתֵ֨ת רְפֻא֜וֹת לָשׂ֥וּם חִתּ֛וּל לְחׇבְשָׁ֥הּ לְחׇזְקָ֖הּ לִתְפֹּ֥שׂ בֶּחָֽרֶב׃ {ס}
Translated: O mortal, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; it has not been bound up to be healed nor firmly bandaged to make it strong enough to grasp the sword.
Transliteration: ven-adam et-zervoa fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim shavaretiy vehineh lo-chuveshah latet refuvot lashum chitul lechׇveshah lechׇzekah litefosh vecharev {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנְנִי֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם וְשָֽׁבַרְתִּי֙ אֶת־זְרֹ֣עֹתָ֔יו אֶת־הַחֲזָקָ֖ה וְאֶת־הַנִּשְׁבָּ֑רֶת וְהִפַּלְתִּ֥י אֶת־הַחֶ֖רֶב מִיָּדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deal with Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break his arms, both the sound one and the injured, and make the sword drop from his hand.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineniy el-fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim veshavaretiy et-zerootayv et-hachazakah veet-hanishevaret vehifaletiy et-hacherev miyadvo

Hebrew: וַהֲפִצוֹתִ֥י אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם וְזֵרִיתִ֖ם בָּאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.
Transliteration: vahafitsvotiy et-mitserayiim vagvoyim vezeriytim vaaratsvot

Hebrew: וְחִזַּקְתִּ֗י אֶת־זְרֹעוֹת֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל וְנָתַתִּ֥י אֶת־חַרְבִּ֖י בְּיָד֑וֹ וְשָֽׁבַרְתִּי֙ אֶת־זְרֹע֣וֹת פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְנָאַ֛ק נַאֲק֥וֹת חָלָ֖ל לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put My sword in his hand; and I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he shall groan before him with the groans of one struck down.
Transliteration: vechizaketiy et-zerovot melekhe vavel venatatiy et-chareviy veyadvo veshavaretiy et-zerovot fareoh venaak naakvot chalal lefanayv

Hebrew: וְהַחֲזַקְתִּ֗י אֶת־זְרֹעוֹת֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֔ל וּזְרֹע֥וֹת פַּרְעֹ֖ה תִּפֹּ֑לְנָה וְֽיָדְע֞וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּתִתִּ֤י חַרְבִּי֙ בְּיַ֣ד מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֔ל וְנָטָ֥ה אוֹתָ֖הּ אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: I will make firm the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fail. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>, when I put My sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he lifts it against the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vehachazaketiy et-zerovot melekhe vavel uzerovot fareoh tifolenah veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah vetitiy chareviy veyad melekhe-vavel venatah votah el-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַהֲפִצוֹתִ֤י אֶת־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם וְזֵרִיתִ֥י אוֹתָ֖ם בָּאֲרָצ֑וֹת וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries. Thus they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vahafitsvotiy et-mitserayiim vagvoyim vezeriytiy votam vaaratsvot veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּאַחַ֤ת עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה בַּשְּׁלִישִׁ֖י בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the eleventh year, on the first day of the third month, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy veachat eshereh shanah vasheliyshiy veechad lachodesh hayah devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם אֱמֹ֛ר אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֥ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְאֶל־הֲמוֹנ֑וֹ אֶל־מִ֖י דָּמִ֥יתָ בְגׇדְלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
O mortal, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and his hordes:
Who was comparable to you in greatness?
Transliteration: ven-adam emor el-fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim veel-hamvonvo el-miy damiyta vegׇdelekha

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה אַשּׁ֜וּר אֶ֣רֶז בַּלְּבָנ֗וֹן יְפֵ֥ה עָנָ֛ף וְחֹ֥רֶשׁ מֵצַ֖ל וּגְבַ֣הּ קוֹמָ֑ה וּבֵ֣ין עֲבֹתִ֔ים הָיְתָ֖ה צַמַּרְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon
With beautiful branches and shady thickets,
Of lofty stature,
With its top among leafy trees.
Transliteration: hineh ashur erez valevanvon yefeh anaf vechoresh metsal ugevah kvomah uveyn avotiym hayetah tsamaretvo

Hebrew: מַ֣יִם גִּדְּל֔וּהוּ תְּה֖וֹם רֹמְמָ֑תְהוּ אֶת־נַהֲרֹתֶ֗יהָ הֹלֵךְ֙ סְבִיב֣וֹת מַטָּעָ֔הּ וְאֶת־תְּעָלֹתֶ֣יהָ שִׁלְחָ֔ה אֶ֖ל כׇּל־עֲצֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated:
Waters nourished it,
The deep made it grow tall,
Washing with its streams
The place where it was planted,
Making its channels well up
To all the trees of the field.
Transliteration: mayiim gideluhu tehvom romematehu et-naharoteyha holekhe seviyvvot mataah veet-tealoteyha shilechah el khׇl-atsey hashadeh

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ גָּבְהָ֣א קֹמָת֔וֹ מִכֹּ֖ל עֲצֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַתִּרְבֶּ֨ינָה סַֽרְעַפֹּתָ֜יו וַתֶּאֱרַ֧כְנָה פֹארֹתָ֛ו מִמַּ֥יִם רַבִּ֖ים בְּשַׁלְּחֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Therefore it exceeded in stature
All the trees of the field;
Its branches multiplied and its boughs grew long
Because of the abundant water
That welled up for it.
Transliteration: al-khen gaveha komatvo mikhol atsey hashadeh vatireveynah sareafotayv vateerakhenah forotav mimayiim raviym veshalechvo

Hebrew: בִּסְעַפֹּתָ֤יו קִֽנְנוּ֙ כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְתַ֤חַת פֹּֽארֹתָיו֙ יָֽלְד֔וּ כֹּ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּבְצִלּוֹ֙ יֵֽשְׁב֔וּ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיִ֥ם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
In its branches nested
All the birds of the sky;
All the beasts of the field
Bore their young under its boughs,
And in its shadow lived
All the great nations.
Transliteration: viseafotayv kinenu khׇl-vof hashamayiim vetachat forotayv yaledu khol chayat hashadeh uvetsilvo eishevu khol gvoyim raviym

Hebrew: וַיְּיִ֣ף בְּגׇדְל֔וֹ בְּאֹ֖רֶךְ דָּלִיּוֹתָ֑יו כִּֽי־הָיָ֥ה שׇׁרְשׁ֖וֹ אֶל־מַ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
It was beautiful in its height,
In the length of its branches,
Because its stock stood
By abundant waters.
Transliteration: vayeyif vegׇdelvo veorekhe daliyyvotayv khiy-hayah shׇreshvo el-mayiim raviym

Hebrew: אֲרָזִ֣ים לֹֽא־עֲמָמֻ֘הוּ֮ בְּגַן־אֱלֹהִים֒ בְּרוֹשִׁ֗ים לֹ֤א דָמוּ֙ אֶל־סְעַפֹּתָ֔יו וְעַרְמֹנִ֥ים לֹא־הָי֖וּ כְּפֹרֹאתָ֑יו כׇּל־עֵץ֙ בְּגַן־אֱלֹהִ֔ים לֹא־דָמָ֥ה אֵלָ֖יו בְּיׇפְיֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Cedars in the garden of God
Could not compare with it;
Cypresses could not match its boughs,
And plane trees could not vie with its branches;
No tree in the garden of God
Was its peer in beauty.
Transliteration: araziym lo-amamuhu vegan-Elohim vervoshiym lo damu el-seafotayv vearemoniym lo-hayu kheforotayv khׇl-ets vegan-Elohim lo-damah elayv veyׇfeyvo

Hebrew: יָפֶ֣ה עֲשִׂיתִ֔יו בְּרֹ֖ב דָּלִיּוֹתָ֑יו וַיְקַנְאֻ֙הוּ֙ כׇּל־עֲצֵי־עֵ֔דֶן אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּגַ֥ן הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
I made it beautiful
In the profusion of its branches;
And all the trees of Eden envied it
In the garden of God.
Transliteration: yafeh ashiytiyv verov daliyyvotayv vayekaneuhu khׇl-atsey-eden asher vegan haElohim {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֕עַן אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּבַ֖הְתָּ בְּקוֹמָ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֤ן צַמַּרְתּוֹ֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ין עֲבוֹתִ֔ים וְרָ֥ם לְבָב֖וֹ בְּגׇבְהֽוֹ׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because it towered high in stature, and thrust its top up among the leafy trees, and it was arrogant in its height,
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan asher gavaheta vekvomah vayiten tsamaretvo el-veyn avvotiym veram levavvo vegׇvehvo

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨תְּנֵ֔הוּ בְּיַ֖ד אֵ֣יל גּוֹיִ֑ם עָשׂ֤וֹ יַֽעֲשֶׂה֙ ל֔וֹ כְּרִשְׁע֖וֹ גֵּרַשְׁתִּֽהוּ׃
Translated: I delivered it into the hands of the mightiest of nations. They treated it as befitted its wickedness. I banished it.
Transliteration: veetenehu veyad eyl gvoyim ashvo yaasheh lvo kherishevo gerashetihu

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרְתֻ֧הוּ זָרִ֛ים עָרִיצֵ֥י גוֹיִ֖ם וַֽיִּטְּשֻׁ֑הוּ אֶל־הֶ֠הָרִ֠ים וּבְכׇל־גֵּ֨אָי֜וֹת נָפְל֣וּ דָלִיּוֹתָ֗יו וַתִּשָּׁבַ֤רְנָה פֹֽרֹאתָיו֙ בְּכֹל֙ אֲפִיקֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיֵּרְד֧וּ מִצִּלּ֛וֹ כׇּל־עַמֵּ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ וַֽיִּטְּשֻֽׁהוּ׃
Translated: Strangers, the most ruthless of nations, cut it down and abandoned it; its branches fell on the mountains and in every valley; its boughs were splintered in every watercourse of the earth; and all the peoples of the earth departed from its shade and abandoned it.
Transliteration: vayikheretuhu zariym ariytsey gvoyim vayiteshuhu el-hehariym uvekhׇl-geayvot nafelu daliyyvotayv vatishavarenah forotayv vekhol afiykey haarets vayeredu mitsilvo khׇl-amey haarets vayiteshuhu

Hebrew: עַל־מַפַּלְתּ֥וֹ יִשְׁכְּנ֖וּ כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְאֶל־פֹּרֹאתָ֣יו הָי֔וּ כֹּ֖ל חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: Upon its fallen trunk all the birds of the sky nest, and all the beasts of the field lodge among its boughs—
Transliteration: al-mafaletvo yishekhenu khׇl-vof hashamayiim veel-forotayv hayu khol chayat hashadeh

Hebrew: לְמַ֡עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ לֹא־יִגְבְּה֨וּ בְקוֹמָתָ֜ם כׇּל־עֲצֵי־מַ֗יִם וְלֹֽא־יִתְּנ֤וּ אֶת־צַמַּרְתָּם֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ין עֲבֹתִ֔ים וְלֹֽא־יַעַמְד֧וּ אֵלֵיהֶ֛ם בְּגׇבְהָ֖ם כׇּל־שֹׁ֣תֵי מָ֑יִם כִּֽי־כֻלָּם֩ נִתְּנ֨וּ לַמָּ֜וֶת אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ תַּחְתִּ֗ית בְּת֛וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י אָדָ֖ם אֶל־י֥וֹרְדֵי בֽוֹר׃ {פ}
Translated: so that no trees by water should exalt themselves in stature or set their tops among the leafy trees, and that no well-watered tree may reach up to them in height. For they are all consigned to death, to the lowest part of the netherworld, together with human beings who descend into the Pit.
Transliteration: lemaan asher lo-yigevehu vekvomatam khׇl-atsey-mayiim velo-yitenu et-tsamaretam el-veyn avotiym velo-yaamedu eleyhem vegׇveham khׇl-shotey mayiim khiy-khulam nitenu lamavet el-erets tachetiyt vetvokhe veney adam el-yvoredey vvor {f}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה בְּי֨וֹם רִדְתּ֤וֹ שְׁא֙וֹלָה֙ הֶאֱבַ֜לְתִּי כִּסֵּ֤תִי עָלָיו֙ אֶת־תְּה֔וֹם וָֽאֶמְנַע֙ נַהֲרוֹתֶ֔יהָ וַיִּכָּלְא֖וּ מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים וָאַקְדִּ֤ר עָלָיו֙ לְבָנ֔וֹן וְכׇל־עֲצֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה עָלָ֥יו עֻלְפֶּֽה׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: On the day it went down to Sheol, I closed the deep over it and covered it; I held back its streams, and the great waters were checked. I made Lebanon mourn deeply for it, and all the trees of the field languished on its account.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih veyvom ridetvo shevolah heevaletiy khisetiy alayv et-tehvom vaemena naharvoteyha vayikhaleu mayiim raviym vaakedir alayv levanvon vekhׇl-atsey hashadeh alayv ulefeh

Hebrew: מִקּ֤וֹל מַפַּלְתּוֹ֙ הִרְעַ֣שְׁתִּי גוֹיִ֔ם בְּהוֹרִדִ֥י אֹת֛וֹ שְׁא֖וֹלָה אֶת־י֣וֹרְדֵי ב֑וֹר וַיִּנָּ֨חֲמ֜וּ בְּאֶ֤רֶץ תַּחְתִּית֙ כׇּל־עֲצֵי־עֵ֔דֶן מִבְחַ֥ר וְטוֹב־לְבָנ֖וֹן כׇּל־שֹׁ֥תֵי מָֽיִם׃
Translated: I made nations quake at the crash of its fall, when I cast it down to Sheol with those who descend into the Pit; and all the trees of Eden, the choicest and best of Lebanon, all that were well watered, were consoled in the lowest part of the netherworld.
Transliteration: mikvol mafaletvo hireashetiy gvoyim vehvoridiy otvo shevolah et-yvoredey vvor vayinachamu veerets tachetiyt khׇl-atsey-eden mivechar vetvov-levanvon khׇl-shotey mayiim

Hebrew: גַּם־הֵ֗ם אִתּ֛וֹ יָרְד֥וּ שְׁא֖וֹלָה אֶל־חַלְלֵי־חָ֑רֶב וּזְרֹע֛וֹ יָשְׁב֥וּ בְצִלּ֖וֹ בְּת֥וֹךְ גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: They also descended with it into Sheol, to those slain by the sword, together with its supporters, they who had lived under its shadow among the nations.
Transliteration: gam-hem itvo yaredu shevolah el-chaleley-charev uzerovo yashevu vetsilvo vetvokhe gvoyim

Hebrew: אֶל־מִ֨י דָמִ֥יתָ כָּ֛כָה בְּכָב֥וֹד וּבְגֹ֖דֶל בַּעֲצֵי־עֵ֑דֶן וְהוּרַדְתָּ֨ אֶת־עֲצֵי־עֵ֜דֶן אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ תַּחְתִּ֗ית בְּת֨וֹךְ עֲרֵלִ֤ים תִּשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־חַלְלֵי־חֶ֔רֶב ה֤וּא פַרְעֹה֙ וְכׇל־הֲמוֹנֹ֔ה נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: [Now you know] who is comparable to you in glory and greatness among the trees of Eden. And you too shall be brought down with the trees of Eden to the lowest part of the netherworld; you shall lie among the uncircumcised and those slain by the sword. Such shall be [the fate of] Pharaoh and all his hordes—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: el-miy damiyta khakhah vekhavvod uvegodel vaatsey-eden vehuradeta et-atsey-eden el-erets tachetiyt vetvokhe areliym tishekhav et-chaleley-cherev hu fareoh vekhׇl-hamvonoh neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בִּשְׁתֵּ֣י עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה בִּשְׁנֵֽי־עָשָׂ֥ר חֹ֖דֶשׁ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the twelfth year, on the first day of the twelfth month, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy vishetey eshereh shanah visheney-ashar chodesh veechad lachodesh hayah devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם שָׂ֤א קִינָה֙ עַל־פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו כְּפִ֥יר גּוֹיִ֖ם נִדְמֵ֑יתָ וְאַתָּה֙ כַּתַּנִּ֣ים בַּיַּמִּ֔ים וַתָּ֣גַח בְּנַהֲרוֹתֶ֗יךָ וַתִּדְלַח־מַ֙יִם֙ בְּרַגְלֶ֔יךָ וַתִּרְפֹּ֖ס נַהֲרוֹתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
O mortal, intone a dirge over Pharaoh king of Egypt. Say to him:
O great beast among the nations, you are doomed!
You are like the dragon in the seas,
Thrusting through their streams,
Stirring up the water with your feet
And muddying their streams!
Transliteration: ven-adam sha kiynah al-fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim veamareta elayv khefiyr gvoyim nidemeyta veatah khataniym vayamiym vatagach venaharvoteykha vatidelach-mayiim verageleykha vatirefos naharvotam {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וּפָרַשְׂתִּ֤י עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־רִשְׁתִּ֔י בִּקְהַ֖ל עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְהֶעֱל֖וּךָ בְּחֶרְמִֽי׃
Translated:
Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
I will cast My net over you
In an assembly of many peoples,
And you shall be hauled up in My toils.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih ufarashetiy aleykha et-rishetiy vikehal amiym raviym veheelukha vecheremiy

Hebrew: וּנְטַשְׁתִּ֣יךָ בָאָ֔רֶץ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה אֲטִילֶ֑ךָ וְהִשְׁכַּנְתִּ֤י עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְהִשְׂבַּעְתִּ֥י מִמְּךָ֖ חַיַּ֥ת כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
And I will fling you to the ground,
Hurl you upon the open field.
I will cause all the birds of the sky
To settle upon you.
I will cause the beasts of all the earth
To batten on you.
Transliteration: unetashetiykha vaarets al-feney hashadeh atiylekha vehishekhanetiy aleykha khׇl-vof hashamayiim vehishevaetiy mimekha chayat khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י אֶת־בְּשָׂרְךָ֖ עַל־הֶהָרִ֑ים וּמִלֵּאתִ֥י הַגֵּאָי֖וֹת רָמוּתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I will cast your carcass upon the hills
And fill the valleys with your rotting flesh.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-vesharekha al-hehariym umiletiy hageayvot ramutekha

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁקֵיתִ֨י אֶ֧רֶץ צָפָֽתְךָ֛ מִדָּמְךָ֖ אֶל־הֶהָרִ֑ים וַאֲפִקִ֖ים יִמָּלְא֥וּן מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
I will drench the earth
With your oozing blood upon the hills,
And the watercourses shall be filled with your [gore].
Transliteration: vehishekeytiy erets tsafatekha midamekha el-hehariym vaafikiym yimaleun mimekha

Hebrew: וְכִסֵּיתִ֤י בְכַבּֽוֹתְךָ֙ שָׁמַ֔יִם וְהִקְדַּרְתִּ֖י אֶת־כֹּֽכְבֵיהֶ֑ם שֶׁ֚מֶשׁ בֶּעָנָ֣ן אֲכַסֶּ֔נּוּ וְיָרֵ֖חַ לֹא־יָאִ֥יר אוֹרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
When you are snuffed out,
I will cover the sky
And darken its stars;
I will cover the sun with clouds
And the moon shall not give its light.
Transliteration: vekhiseytiy vekhavvotekha shamayiim vehikedaretiy et-khokheveyhem shemesh veanan akhasenu veyarecha lo-yaiyr vorvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־מְא֤וֹרֵי אוֹר֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֔יִם אַקְדִּירֵ֖ם עָלֶ֑יךָ וְנָתַ֤תִּֽי חֹ֙שֶׁךְ֙ עַֽל־אַרְצְךָ֔ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated:
All the lights that shine in the sky
I will darken above you;
And I will bring darkness upon your land
—declares the Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: khׇl-mevorey vor vashamayiim akediyrem aleykha venatatiy choshekhe al-aretsekha neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְהִ֨כְעַסְתִּ֔י לֵ֖ב עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים בַּהֲבִיאִ֤י שִׁבְרְךָ֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם עַל־אֲרָצ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יְדַעְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
I will vex the hearts of many peoples
When I bring your shattered remnants among the nations,
To countries that you never knew.
Transliteration: vehikheasetiy lev amiym raviym vahaviyiy shiverekha vagvoyim al-aratsvot asher lo-yedaetam

Hebrew: וַהֲשִׁמּוֹתִ֨י עָלֶ֜יךָ עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֗ים וּמַלְכֵיהֶם֙ יִשְׂעֲר֤וּ עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ שַׂ֔עַר בְּעוֹפְפִ֥י חַרְבִּ֖י עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְחָרְד֤וּ לִרְגָעִים֙ אִ֣ישׁ לְנַפְשׁ֔וֹ בְּי֖וֹם מַפַּלְתֶּֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will strike many peoples with horror over your fate;
And their kings shall be aghast over you,
When I brandish My sword before them.
Everyone shall tremble continually
For their own life,
On the day of your downfall.
Transliteration: vahashimvotiy aleykha amiym raviym umalekheyhem yishearu aleykha shaar vevofefiy chareviy al-feneyhem vecharedu liregaiym iysh lenafeshvo veyvom mafaletekha {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֛י כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה חֶ֥רֶב מֶלֶךְ־בָּבֶ֖ל תְּבוֹאֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
For thus said the Sovereign GOD:
The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon you.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih cherev melekhe-vavel tevvoekha

Hebrew: בְּחַרְב֤וֹת גִּבּוֹרִים֙ אַפִּ֣יל הֲמוֹנֶ֔ךָ עָרִיצֵ֥י גוֹיִ֖ם כֻּלָּ֑ם וְשָֽׁדְדוּ֙ אֶת־גְּא֣וֹן מִצְרַ֔יִם וְנִשְׁמַ֖ד כׇּל־הֲמוֹנָֽהּ׃
Translated:
I will cause your multitude to fall
By the swords of warriors,
All the most ruthless among the nations.
They shall ravage the splendor of Egypt,
And all her masses shall be wiped out.
Transliteration: vecharevvot givvoriym afiyl hamvonekha ariytsey gvoyim khulam veshadedu et-gevon mitserayiim venishemad khׇl-hamvonah

Hebrew: וְהַֽאֲבַדְתִּי֙ אֶת־כׇּל־בְּהֶמְתָּ֔הּ מֵעַ֖ל מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים וְלֹ֨א תִדְלָחֵ֤ם רֶֽגֶל־אָדָם֙ ע֔וֹד וּפַרְס֥וֹת בְּהֵמָ֖ה לֹ֥א תִדְלָחֵֽם׃
Translated:
I will make all her cattle vanish from beside abundant waters;
The feet of humans shall not muddy them anymore,
Nor shall the hoofs of cattle muddy them.
Transliteration: vehaavadetiy et-khׇl-vehemetah meal mayiim raviym velo tidelachem regel-adam vod ufaresvot vehemah lo tidelachem

Hebrew: אָ֚ז אַשְׁקִ֣יעַ מֵימֵיהֶ֔ם וְנַהֲרוֹתָ֖ם כַּשֶּׁ֣מֶן אוֹלִ֑יךְ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated:
Then I will let their waters settle,
And make their rivers flow like oil
—declares the Sovereign GOD:
Transliteration: az ashekiya meymeyhem venaharvotam khashemen voliykhe neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: בְּתִתִּי֩ אֶת־אֶ֨רֶץ מִצְרַ֜יִם שְׁמָמָ֣ה וּנְשַׁמָּ֗ה אֶ֚רֶץ מִמְּלֹאָ֔הּ בְּהַכּוֹתִ֖י אֶת־כׇּל־י֣וֹשְׁבֵי בָ֑הּ וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
When I lay the land of Egypt waste,
When the land is emptied of [the life] that filled it,
When I strike down all its inhabitants.
And they shall know that I am GOD.
Transliteration: vetitiy et-erets mitserayiim shemamah uneshamah erets mimeloah vehakhvotiy et-khׇl-yvoshevey vah veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: קִינָ֥ה הִיא֙ וְק֣וֹנְנ֔וּהָ בְּנ֥וֹת הַגּוֹיִ֖ם תְּקוֹנֵ֣נָּה אוֹתָ֑הּ עַל־מִצְרַ֤יִם וְעַל־כׇּל־הֲמוֹנָהּ֙ תְּקוֹנֵ֣נָּה אוֹתָ֔הּ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
This is a dirge, and it shall be intoned;
The women of the nations shall intone it,
They shall intone it over Egypt and all her multitude
—declares the Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: kiynah hiy vekvonenuha venvot hagvoyim tekvonenah votah al-mitserayiim veal-khׇl-hamvonah tekvonenah votah neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בִּשְׁתֵּ֣י עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy vishetey eshereh shanah vachamishah ashar lachodesh hayah devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם נְהֵ֛ה עַל־הֲמ֥וֹן מִצְרַ֖יִם וְהוֹרִדֵ֑הוּ א֠וֹתָ֠הּ וּבְנ֨וֹת גּוֹיִ֧ם אַדִּרִ֛ם אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ תַּחְתִּיּ֖וֹת אֶת־י֥וֹרְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
Translated: O mortal, wail [the dirge]—along with the women of the mighty nations—over the masses of Egypt, accompanying their descent to the lowest part of the netherworld, among those who have gone down into the Pit.
Transliteration: ven-adam neheh al-hamvon mitserayiim vehvoridehu votah uvenvot gvoyim adirim el-erets tachetiyyvot et-yvoredey vvor

Hebrew: מִמִּ֖י נָעָ֑מְתָּ רְדָ֥ה וְהׇשְׁכְּבָ֖ה אֶת־עֲרֵלִֽים׃
Translated: Whom do you surpass in beauty? Down with you, and be laid to rest with the uncircumcised!
Transliteration: mimiy naameta redah vehׇshekhevah et-areliym

Hebrew: בְּת֥וֹךְ חַלְלֵי־חֶ֖רֶב יִפֹּ֑לוּ חֶ֣רֶב נִתָּ֔נָה מׇשְׁכ֥וּ אוֹתָ֖הּ וְכׇל־הֲמוֹנֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: They shall lie amid those slain by the sword, [amid those slain by] the sword [Egypt] has been dragged and left with all her masses.
Transliteration: vetvokhe chaleley-cherev yifolu cherev nitanah mׇshekhu votah vekhׇl-hamvoneyha

Hebrew: יְדַבְּרוּ־ל֞וֹ אֵלֵ֧י גִבּוֹרִ֛ים מִתּ֥וֹךְ שְׁא֖וֹל אֶת־עֹֽזְרָ֑יו יָ֥רְד֛וּ שָׁכְב֥וּ הָעֲרֵלִ֖ים חַלְלֵי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: From the depths of Sheol the mightiest of warriors speak to Pharaoh and his allies; the uncircumcised, the slain by the sword, have gone down and lie [there].
Transliteration: yedaveru-lvo eley givvoriym mitvokhe shevol et-ozerayv yaredu shakhevu haareliym chaleley-charev

Hebrew: שָׁ֤ם אַשּׁוּר֙ וְכׇל־קְהָלָ֔הּ סְבִיבוֹתָ֖יו קִבְרֹתָ֑יו כֻּלָּ֣ם חֲלָלִ֔ים הַנֹּפְלִ֖ים בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Assyria is there with all her company, their graves round about, all of them slain, fallen by the sword.
Transliteration: sham ashur vekhׇl-kehalah seviyvvotayv kiverotayv khulam chalaliym hanofeliym vecharev

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִתְּנ֤וּ קִבְרֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ בְּיַרְכְּתֵי־ב֔וֹר וַיְהִ֣י קְהָלָ֔הּ סְבִיב֖וֹת קְבֻרָתָ֑הּ כֻּלָּ֤ם חֲלָלִים֙ נֹפְלִ֣ים בַּחֶ֔רֶב אֲשֶׁר־נָתְנ֥וּ חִתִּ֖ית בְּאֶ֥רֶץ חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: Their graves set in the farthest recesses of the Pit, all her company are round about her tomb, all of them slain, fallen by the sword—they who struck terror in the land of the living.
Transliteration: asher nitenu kiveroteyha veyarekhetey-vvor vayehiy kehalah seviyvvot kevuratah khulam chalaliym nofeliym vacherev asher-natenu chitiyt veerets chayiym

Hebrew: שָׁ֤ם עֵילָם֙ וְכׇל־הֲמוֹנָ֔הּ סְבִיב֖וֹת קְבֻרָתָ֑הּ כֻּלָּ֣ם חֲלָלִים֩ הַנֹּפְלִ֨ים בַּחֶ֜רֶב אֲֽשֶׁר־יָרְד֥וּ עֲרֵלִ֣ים ׀ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ תַּחְתִּיּ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתְנ֤וּ חִתִּיתָם֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חַיִּ֔ים וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ כְלִמָּתָ֖ם אֶת־י֥וֹרְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
Translated: There too is Elam and all her masses round about her tomb, all of them slain, fallen by the sword—they who descended uncircumcised to the lowest part of the netherworld, who struck terror in the land of the living—now they bear their shame with those who have gone down to the Pit.
Transliteration: sham eylam vekhׇl-hamvonah seviyvvot kevuratah khulam chalaliym hanofeliym vacherev asher-yaredu areliym el-erets tachetiyyvot asher natenu chitiytam veerets chayiym vayisheu khelimatam et-yvoredey vvor

Hebrew: בְּת֣וֹךְ חֲ֠לָלִ֠ים נָתְנ֨וּ מִשְׁכָּ֥ב לָהּ֙ בְּכׇל־הֲמוֹנָ֔הּ סְבִיבוֹתָ֖יו קִבְרֹתֶ֑הָ כֻּלָּ֣ם עֲרֵלִ֣ים חַלְלֵי־חֶ֡רֶב כִּֽי־נִתַּ֨ן חִתִּיתָ֜ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חַיִּ֗ים וַיִּשְׂא֤וּ כְלִמָּתָם֙ אֶת־י֣וֹרְדֵי ב֔וֹר בְּת֥וֹךְ חֲלָלִ֖ים נִתָּֽן׃
Translated: They made a bed for her among the slain, with all her masses; their graves are round about her. They are all uncircumcised, slain by the sword. Though their terror was once spread over the land of the living, they bear their shame with those who have gone into the Pit; they are placed among the slain.
Transliteration: vetvokhe chalaliym natenu mishekhav lah vekhׇl-hamvonah seviyvvotayv kiveroteha khulam areliym chaleley-cherev khiy-nitan chitiytam veerets chayiym vayisheu khelimatam et-yvoredey vvor vetvokhe chalaliym nitan

Hebrew: שָׁ֣ם מֶ֤שֶׁךְ תֻּבַל֙ וְכׇל־הֲמוֹנָ֔הּ סְבִיבוֹתָ֖יו קִבְרוֹתֶ֑יהָ כֻּלָּ֤ם עֲרֵלִים֙ מְחֻ֣לְלֵי חֶ֔רֶב כִּי־נָתְנ֥וּ חִתִּיתָ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: Meshech and Tubal and all their masses are there; their graves are round about. They are all uncircumcised, pierced through by the sword—they who once struck terror in the land of the living.
Transliteration: sham meshekhe tuval vekhׇl-hamvonah seviyvvotayv kivervoteyha khulam areliym mechuleley cherev khiy-natenu chitiytam veerets chayiym

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יִשְׁכְּבוּ֙ אֶת־גִּבּוֹרִ֔ים נֹפְלִ֖ים מֵעֲרֵלִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָרְדֽוּ־שְׁא֣וֹל בִּכְלֵֽי־מִלְחַמְתָּם֩ וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ אֶת־חַרְבוֹתָ֜ם תַּ֣חַת רָאשֵׁיהֶ֗ם וַתְּהִ֤י עֲוֺֽנֹתָם֙ עַל־עַצְמוֹתָ֔ם כִּֽי־חִתִּ֥ית גִּבּוֹרִ֖ים בְּאֶ֥רֶץ חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: And they do not lie with the fallen uncircumcised warriors, who went down to Sheol with their battle gear, who put their swords beneath their heads and their iniquities upon their bones—for the terror of the warriors was upon the land of the living.
Transliteration: velo yishekhevu et-givvoriym nofeliym meareliym asher yaredu-shevol vikheley-milechametam vayitenu et-charevvotam tachat rasheyhem vatehiy avonotam al-atsemvotam khiy-chitiyt givvoriym veerets chayiym

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה בְּת֧וֹךְ עֲרֵלִ֛ים תִּשָּׁבַ֥ר וְתִשְׁכַּ֖ב אֶת־חַלְלֵי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: And you too shall be shattered amid the uncircumcised, and lie among those slain by the sword.
Transliteration: veatah vetvokhe areliym tishavar vetishekhav et-chaleley-charev

Hebrew: שָׁ֣מָּה אֱד֗וֹם מְלָכֶ֙יהָ֙ וְכׇל־נְשִׂיאֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁר־נִתְּנ֥וּ בִגְבוּרָתָ֖ם אֶת־חַלְלֵי־חָ֑רֶב הֵ֛מָּה אֶת־עֲרֵלִ֥ים יִשְׁכָּ֖בוּ וְאֶת־יֹ֥רְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
Translated: Edom is there, her kings and all her chieftains, who, for all their might, are laid among those who are slain by the sword; they too lie with the uncircumcised and with those who have gone down to the Pit.
Transliteration: shamah edvom melakheyha vekhׇl-neshiyeyha asher-nitenu vigevuratam et-chaleley-charev hemah et-areliym yishekhavu veet-yoredey vvor

Hebrew: שָׁ֣מָּה נְסִיכֵ֥י צָפ֛וֹן כֻּלָּ֖ם וְכׇל־צִדֹנִ֑י אֲשֶׁר־יָרְד֣וּ אֶת־חֲלָלִ֗ים בְּחִתִּיתָ֤ם מִגְֿבֽוּרָתָם֙ בּוֹשִׁ֔ים וַיִּשְׁכְּב֤וּ עֲרֵלִים֙ אֶת־חַלְלֵי־חֶ֔רֶב וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ כְלִמָּתָ֖ם אֶת־י֥וֹרְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
Translated: All the princes of the north and all the Sidonians are there, who went down in disgrace with the slain, despite the terror that their might inspired; and they lie, uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword, and bear their shame with those who have gone down to the Pit.
Transliteration: shamah nesiykhey tsafvon khulam vekhׇl-tsidoniy asher-yaredu et-chalaliym vechitiytam migֿevuratam vvoshiym vayishekhevu areliym et-chaleley-cherev vayisheu khelimatam et-yvoredey vvor

Hebrew: אוֹתָם֙ יִרְאֶ֣ה פַרְעֹ֔ה וְנִחַ֖ם עַל־כׇּל־הֲמוֹנֹ֑ה חַלְלֵי־חֶ֙רֶב֙ פַּרְעֹ֣ה וְכׇל־חֵיל֔וֹ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: These Pharaoh shall see, and he shall be consoled for all his masses, those of Pharaoh’s men slain by the sword and all his army—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: votam yireeh fareoh venicham al-khׇl-hamvonoh chaleley-cherev fareoh vekhׇl-cheylvo neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־[חִתִּיתִ֖י] (חתיתו) בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חַיִּ֑ים וְהֻשְׁכַּב֩ בְּת֨וֹךְ עֲרֵלִ֜ים אֶת־חַלְלֵי־חֶ֗רֶב פַּרְעֹה֙ וְכׇל־הֲמוֹנֹ֔ה נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I strike terror into the land of the living; Pharaoh and all his masses are laid among the uncircumcised, along with those who were slain by the sword—said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy-natatiy et-[chitiytiy] (chtytv) veerets chayiym vehushekhav vetvokhe areliym et-chaleley-cherev fareoh vekhׇl-hamvonoh neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם דַּבֵּ֤ר אֶל־בְּנֵֽי־עַמְּךָ֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֶ֕רֶץ כִּֽי־אָבִ֥יא עָלֶ֖יהָ חָ֑רֶב וְלָקְח֨וּ עַם־הָאָ֜רֶץ אִ֤ישׁ אֶחָד֙ מִקְצֵיהֶ֔ם וְנָתְנ֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ לָהֶ֖ם לְצֹפֶֽה׃
Translated: O mortal, speak to your people and say to them: When I bring the sword against a country, the citizens of that country take one of their number and appoint him their lookout.
Transliteration: ven-adam daver el-veney-amekha veamareta aleyhem erets khiy-aviy aleyha charev velakechu am-haarets iysh echad miketseyhem venatenu otvo lahem letsofeh

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֥ה אֶת־הַחֶ֖רֶב בָּאָ֣ה עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְתָקַ֥ע בַּשּׁוֹפָ֖ר וְהִזְהִ֥יר אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Suppose he sees the sword advancing against the country, and he blows the horn and warns the people.
Transliteration: veraah et-hacherev vaah al-haarets vetaka vashvofar vehizehiyr et-haam

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַ֨ע הַשֹּׁמֵ֜עַ אֶת־ק֤וֹל הַשּׁוֹפָר֙ וְלֹ֣א נִזְהָ֔ר וַתָּ֥בוֹא חֶ֖רֶב וַתִּקָּחֵ֑הוּ דָּמ֖וֹ בְּרֹאשׁ֥וֹ יִֽהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: If anybody hears the sound of the horn but ignores the warning, and the sword comes and dispatches them, their blood shall be on their own head.
Transliteration: veshama hashomea et-kvol hashvofar velo nizehar vatavvo cherev vatikachehu damvo veroshvo yiheyeh

Hebrew: אֵת֩ ק֨וֹל הַשּׁוֹפָ֤ר שָׁמַע֙ וְלֹ֣א נִזְהָ֔ר דָּמ֖וֹ בּ֣וֹ יִֽהְיֶ֑ה וְה֥וּא נִזְהָ֖ר נַפְשׁ֥וֹ מִלֵּֽט׃
Translated: Since they heard the sound of the horn but ignored the warning, their bloodguilt shall be upon themselves; had they taken the warning, they would have saved their life.
Transliteration: et kvol hashvofar shama velo nizehar damvo vvo yiheyeh vehu nizehar nafeshvo milet

Hebrew: וְ֠הַצֹּפֶ֠ה כִּי־יִרְאֶ֨ה אֶת־הַחֶ֜רֶב בָּאָ֗ה וְלֹֽא־תָקַ֤ע בַּשּׁוֹפָר֙ וְהָעָ֣ם לֹֽא־נִזְהָ֔ר וַתָּב֣וֹא חֶ֔רֶב וַתִּקַּ֥ח מֵהֶ֖ם נָ֑פֶשׁ ה֚וּא בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ נִלְקָ֔ח וְדָמ֖וֹ מִיַּֽד־הַצֹּפֶ֥ה אֶדְרֹֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: But if the lookout sees the sword advancing and does not blow the horn, so that the people are not warned, and the sword comes and destroys one of them, that person was destroyed for their own sins; however, I will demand a reckoning for their blood from the lookout.
Transliteration: vehatsofeh khiy-yireeh et-hacherev vaah velo-taka vashvofar vehaam lo-nizehar vatavvo cherev vatikach mehem nafesh hu vaavonvo nilekach vedamvo miyad-hatsofeh ederosh {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֔ם צֹפֶ֥ה נְתַתִּ֖יךָ לְבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֤ מִפִּי֙ דָּבָ֔ר וְהִזְהַרְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated: Now, O mortal, I have appointed you a lookout for the House of Israel; and whenever you hear a message from My mouth, you must transmit My warning to them.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam tsofeh netatiykha leveyt yisherael veshamaeta mifiy davar vehizehareta otam mimeniy

Hebrew: בְּאׇמְרִ֣י לָרָשָׁ֗ע רָשָׁע֙ מ֣וֹת תָּמ֔וּת וְלֹ֣א דִבַּ֔רְתָּ לְהַזְהִ֥יר רָשָׁ֖ע מִדַּרְכּ֑וֹ ה֤וּא רָשָׁע֙ בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ יָמ֔וּת וְדָמ֖וֹ מִיָּדְךָ֥ אֲבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
Translated: When I say to someone wicked, “Wicked one, you shall die,” but you have not spoken to warn them against their ways, then that wicked one shall die for their own iniquity, while from you I will demand a reckoning for their blood.
Transliteration: veׇmeriy larasha rasha mvot tamut velo divareta lehazehiyr rasha midarekhvo hu rasha vaavonvo yamut vedamvo miyadekha avakesh

Hebrew: וְ֠אַתָּ֠ה כִּי־הִזְהַ֨רְתָּ רָשָׁ֤ע מִדַּרְכּוֹ֙ לָשׁ֣וּב מִמֶּ֔נָּה וְלֹא־שָׁ֖ב מִדַּרְכּ֑וֹ ה֚וּא בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ יָמ֔וּת וְאַתָּ֖ה נַפְשְׁךָ֥ הִצַּֽלְתָּ׃ {פ}
Translated: But if you have warned someone wicked to turn back from their ways, and they have not turned from their ways, they shall die for their own iniquity, while you will have saved your life.
Transliteration: veatah khiy-hizehareta rasha midarekhvo lashuv mimenah velo-shav midarekhvo hu vaavonvo yamut veatah nafeshekha hitsaleta {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם אֱמֹר֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כֵּ֤ן אֲמַרְתֶּם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כִּֽי־פְשָׁעֵ֥ינוּ וְחַטֹּאתֵ֖ינוּ עָלֵ֑ינוּ וּבָ֛ם אֲנַ֥חְנוּ נְמַקִּ֖ים וְאֵ֥יךְ נִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Now, O mortal, say to the House of Israel: This is what you have been saying: “Our transgressions and our sins weigh heavily upon us; we are sick at heart about them. How can we survive?”
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam emor el-veyt yisherael khen amaretem lemor khiy-feshaeynu vechatoteynu aleynu uvam anachenu nemakiym veeykhe nicheyeh

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֨ר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם חַי־אָ֣נִי ׀ נְאֻ֣ם ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אִם־אֶחְפֹּץ֙ בְּמ֣וֹת הָרָשָׁ֔ע כִּ֣י אִם־בְּשׁ֥וּב רָשָׁ֛ע מִדַּרְכּ֖וֹ וְחָיָ֑ה שׁ֣וּבוּ שׁ֜וּבוּ מִדַּרְכֵיכֶ֧ם הָרָעִ֛ים וְלָ֥מָּה תָמ֖וּתוּ בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Say to them: As I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—it is not My desire that the wicked shall die, but that the wicked turn from their [evil] ways and live. Turn back, turn back from your evil ways, that you may not die, O House of Israel!
Transliteration: emor aleyhem chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-echefots vemvot harasha khiy im-veshuv rasha midarekhvo vechayah shuvu shuvu midarekheykhem haraiym velamah tamutu veyt yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם אֱמֹ֤ר אֶל־בְּנֵֽי־עַמְּךָ֙ צִדְקַ֣ת הַצַּדִּ֗יק לֹ֤א תַצִּילֶ֙נּוּ֙ בְּי֣וֹם פִּשְׁע֔וֹ וְרִשְׁעַ֤ת הָֽרָשָׁע֙ לֹא־יִכָּ֣שֶׁל בָּ֔הּ בְּי֖וֹם שׁוּב֣וֹ מֵֽרִשְׁע֑וֹ וְצַדִּ֗יק לֹ֥א יוּכַ֛ל לִֽחְי֥וֹת בָּ֖הּ בְּי֥וֹם חֲטֹאתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now, O mortal, say to your people: The righteousness of the righteous shall not save them when they transgress, nor shall the wickedness of the wicked cause them to stumble when they turn back from their wickedness. The righteous shall not survive through their righteousness when they sin.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam emor el-veney-amekha tsidekat hatsadiyk lo tatsiylenu veyvom fishevo verisheat harasha lo-yikhashel vah veyvom shuvvo merishevo vetsadiyk lo yukhal licheyvot vah veyvom chatotvo

Hebrew: בְּאׇמְרִ֤י לַצַּדִּיק֙ חָיֹ֣ה יִֽחְיֶ֔ה וְהוּא־בָטַ֥ח עַל־צִדְקָת֖וֹ וְעָ֣שָׂה עָ֑וֶל כׇּל־צִדְקֹתָו֙ לֹ֣א תִזָּכַ֔רְנָה וּבְעַוְל֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה בּ֥וֹ יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: When I say of the righteous “They shall surely live,” and, relying on their righteousness, they commit iniquity, none of their righteous deeds shall be remembered; but for the iniquity that they have committed they shall die.
Transliteration: veׇmeriy latsadiyk chayoh yicheyeh vehu-vatach al-tsidekatvo veashah avel khׇl-tsidekotav lo tizakharenah uveavelvo asher-ashah vvo yamut

Hebrew: וּבְאׇמְרִ֥י לָרָשָׁ֖ע מ֣וֹת תָּמ֑וּת וְשָׁב֙ מֵֽחַטָּאת֔וֹ וְעָשָׂ֥ה מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated: So, too, when I say to the wicked, “You shall die,” and they turn back from their sinfulness and do what is just and right—
Transliteration: uveׇmeriy larasha mvot tamut veshav mechatatvo veashah mishefat utsedakah

Hebrew: חֲבֹ֨ל יָשִׁ֤יב רָשָׁע֙ גְּזֵלָ֣ה יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם בְּחֻקּ֤וֹת הַֽחַיִּים֙ הָלַ֔ךְ לְבִלְתִּ֖י עֲשׂ֣וֹת עָ֑וֶל חָי֥וֹ יִֽחְיֶ֖ה לֹ֥א יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: if the wicked restore a pledge, make good what they have taken by robbery, follow the laws of life, and do not commit iniquity—they shall live, they shall not die.
Transliteration: chavol yashiyv rasha gezelah yeshalem vechukvot hachayiym halakhe leviletiy ashvot avel chayvo yicheyeh lo yamut

Hebrew: כׇּל־חַטֹּאתָו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֔א לֹ֥א תִזָּכַ֖רְנָה ל֑וֹ מִשְׁפָּ֧ט וּצְדָקָ֛ה עָשָׂ֖ה חָי֥וֹ יִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: None of the sins that they committed shall be remembered against them; since they do what is just and right, they shall live.
Transliteration: khׇl-chatotav asher chata lo tizakharenah lvo mishefat utsedakah ashah chayvo yicheyeh

Hebrew: וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמְּךָ֔ לֹ֥א יִתָּכֵ֖ן דֶּ֣רֶךְ אֲדֹנָ֑י וְהֵ֖מָּה דַּרְכָּ֥ם לֹא־יִתָּכֵֽן׃
Translated: Your people say, “The Sovereign’s way is unfair.” But it is their way that is unfair!
Transliteration: veameru veney amekha lo yitakhen derekhe adonay vehemah darekham lo-yitakhen

Hebrew: בְּשׁוּב־צַדִּ֥יק מִצִּדְקָת֖וֹ וְעָ֣שָׂה עָ֑וֶל וּמֵ֖ת בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: When someone righteous turns away from their righteous deeds to commit iniquity, they shall die for it.
Transliteration: veshuv-tsadiyk mitsidekatvo veashah avel umet vahem

Hebrew: וּבְשׁ֤וּב רָשָׁע֙ מֵֽרִשְׁעָת֔וֹ וְעָשָׂ֥ה מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּצְדָקָ֑ה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם ה֥וּא יִֽחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: And when someone wicked turns back from wickedness and does what is just and right, it is they who shall live by virtue of these things.
Transliteration: uveshuv rasha merisheatvo veashah mishefat utsedakah aleyhem hu yicheyeh

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם לֹ֥א יִתָּכֵ֖ן דֶּ֣רֶךְ אֲדֹנָ֑י אִ֧ישׁ כִּדְרָכָ֛יו אֶשְׁפּ֥וֹט אֶתְכֶ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: And will you say, “The Sovereign’s way is unfair”? I will judge each one of you according to your own ways, O House of Israel!
Transliteration: vaamaretem lo yitakhen derekhe adonay iysh khiderakhayv eshefvot etekhem veyt yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בִּשְׁתֵּ֧י עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֗ה בָּעֲשִׂרִ֛י בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֥ה לַחֹ֖דֶשׁ לְגָלוּתֵ֑נוּ בָּא־אֵלַ֨י הַפָּלִ֧יט מִירוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם לֵאמֹ֖ר הֻכְּתָ֥ה הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: In the twelfth year of our exile, on the fifth day of the tenth month, a fugitive came to me from Jerusalem and reported, “The city has fallen.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vishetey eshereh shanah vaashiriy vachamishah lachodesh legalutenu va-elay hafaliyt miyrushala͏im lemor hukhetah haiyr

Hebrew: וְיַד־יְהֹוָה֩ הָיְתָ֨ה אֵלַ֜י בָּעֶ֗רֶב לִפְנֵי֙ בּ֣וֹא הַפָּלִ֔יט וַיִּפְתַּ֣ח אֶת־פִּ֔י עַד־בּ֥וֹא אֵלַ֖י בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וַיִּפָּ֣תַח פִּ֔י וְלֹ֥א נֶאֱלַ֖מְתִּי עֽוֹד׃ {פ}
Translated: Now G<small>OD</small>’s hand had come upon me the evening before the fugitive arrived, opening my mouth before he came to me in the morning; thus my mouth was opened and I was no longer speechless.
Transliteration: veyad-yehovah hayetah elay vaerev lifeney vvo hafaliyt vayifetach et-fiy ad-vvo elay vavoker vayifatach fiy velo neelametiy vod {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם יֹ֠שְׁבֵ֠י הֶחֳרָב֨וֹת הָאֵ֜לֶּה עַל־אַדְמַ֤ת יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֹמְרִ֣ים לֵאמֹ֔ר אֶחָד֙ הָיָ֣ה אַבְרָהָ֔ם וַיִּירַ֖שׁ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ רַבִּ֔ים לָ֛נוּ נִתְּנָ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ לְמוֹרָשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: O mortal, those who live in these ruins in the land of Israel argue, “Abraham was but one man, yet he was granted possession of the land. We are many; surely, the land has been given as a possession to us.”
Transliteration: ven-adam yoshevey hechoravvot haeleh al-ademat yisherael omeriym lemor echad hayah averaham vayiyrash et-haarets vaanachenu raviym lanu nitenah haarets lemvorashah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ אֱמֹ֨ר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה עַל־הַדָּ֧ם ׀ תֹּאכֵ֛לוּ וְעֵינֵכֶ֛ם תִּשְׂא֥וּ אֶל־גִּלּוּלֵיכֶ֖ם וְדָ֣ם תִּשְׁפֹּ֑כוּ וְהָאָ֖רֶץ תִּירָֽשׁוּ׃
Translated: Therefore say to them: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: You eat with the blood, you raise your eyes to your fetishes, and you shed blood—yet you expect to possess the land!
Transliteration: lakhen emor alehem khoh-amar adonay yehovih al-hadam tokhelu veeynekhem tisheu el-giluleykhem vedam tishefokhu vehaarets tiyrashu

Hebrew: עֲמַדְתֶּ֤ם עַֽל־חַרְבְּכֶם֙ עֲשִׂיתֶ֣ן תּוֹעֵבָ֔ה וְאִ֛ישׁ אֶת־אֵ֥שֶׁת רֵעֵ֖הוּ טִמֵּאתֶ֑ם וְהָאָ֖רֶץ תִּירָֽשׁוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: You men have relied on your sword, you have committed abominations, you have defiled one another’s wives—yet you expect to possess the land!
Transliteration: amadetem al-charevekhem ashiyten tvoevah veiysh et-eshet reehu timetem vehaarets tiyrashu {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־תֹאמַ֨ר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֮ חַי־אָ֒נִי֒ אִם־לֹ֞א אֲשֶׁ֤ר בֶּֽחֳרָבוֹת֙ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפֹּ֔לוּ וַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לַחַיָּ֥ה נְתַתִּ֖יו לְאׇכְל֑וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֛ר בַּמְּצָד֥וֹת וּבַמְּעָר֖וֹת בַּדֶּ֥בֶר יָמֽוּתוּ׃
Translated: Thus shall you speak to them: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: As I live, those who are in the ruins shall fall by the sword, and those who are in the open I have allotted as food to the beasts, and those who are in the strongholds and caves shall die by pestilence.
Transliteration: khoh-tomar alehem khoh-amar adonay yehovih chay-aniy im-lo asher vechoravvot vacherev yifolu vaasher al-feney hashadeh lachayah netatiyv leׇkhelvo vaasher vametsadvot uvamearvot vadever yamutu

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שְׁמָמָ֣ה וּמְשַׁמָּ֔ה וְנִשְׁבַּ֖ת גְּא֣וֹן עֻזָּ֑הּ וְשָׁ֥מְמ֛וּ הָרֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֵ֥ין עוֹבֵֽר׃
Translated: I will make the land a desolate waste, and its proud glory shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, with none passing through.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-haarets shemamah umeshamah venishevat gevon uzah veshamemu harey yisherael meeyn vover

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּתִתִּ֤י אֶת־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שְׁמָמָ֣ה וּמְשַׁמָּ֔ה עַ֥ל כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבֹתָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשֽׂוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>, when I make the land a desolate waste on account of all the abominations that they have committed.
Transliteration: veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah vetitiy et-haarets shemamah umeshamah al khׇl-tvoavotam asher ashu {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֔ם בְּנֵ֣י עַמְּךָ֗ הַנִּדְבָּרִ֤ים בְּךָ֙ אֵ֣צֶל הַקִּיר֔וֹת וּבְפִתְחֵ֖י הַבָּתִּ֑ים וְדִבֶּר־חַ֣ד אֶת־אַחַ֗ד אִ֤ישׁ אֶת־אָחִיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בֹּאוּ־נָ֣א וְשִׁמְע֔וּ מָ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר הַיּוֹצֵ֖א מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Note well, O mortal: your people who converse about you by the walls and in the doorways of their houses and say to each other and propose to one another, “Come and hear what word has issued from G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam veney amekha hanidevariym vekha etsel hakiyrvot uvefitechey havatiym vediver-chad et-achad iysh et-achiyv lemor vou-na veshimeu mah hadavar hayyvotse meet yehovah

Hebrew: וְיָב֣וֹאוּ אֵ֠לֶ֠יךָ כִּמְבוֹא־עָ֞ם וְיֵשְׁב֤וּ לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ עַמִּ֔י וְשָֽׁמְעוּ֙ אֶת־דְּבָרֶ֔יךָ וְאוֹתָ֖ם לֹ֣א יַעֲשׂ֑וּ כִּֽי־עֲגָבִ֤ים בְּפִיהֶם֙ הֵ֣מָּה עֹשִׂ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֥י בִצְעָ֖ם לִבָּ֥ם הֹלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: They will come to you in crowds and sit before you in throngs and will hear your words, but they will not obey them. For they produce nothing but lust with their mouths; and their hearts pursue nothing but gain.
Transliteration: veyavvou eleykha khimevvo-am veeishevu lefaneykha amiy veshameu et-devareykha vevotam lo yaashu khiy-agaviym vefiyhem hemah oshiym acharey vitseam livam holekhe

Hebrew: וְהִנְּךָ֤ לָהֶם֙ כְּשִׁ֣יר עֲגָבִ֔ים יְפֵ֥ה ק֖וֹל וּמֵטִ֣ב נַגֵּ֑ן וְשָֽׁמְעוּ֙ אֶת־דְּבָרֶ֔יךָ וְעֹשִׂ֥ים אֵינָ֖ם אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: To them you are just a singer of bawdy songs, who has a sweet voice and plays skillfully; they hear your words, but will not obey them.
Transliteration: vehinekha lahem kheshiyr agaviym yefeh kvol umetiv nagen veshameu et-devareykha veoshiym eynam votam

Hebrew: וּבְבֹאָ֑הּ הִנֵּ֣ה בָאָ֔ה וְיָ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֥י נָבִ֖יא הָיָ֥ה בְתוֹכָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: But when the predicted punishment comes—and come it will—they shall know that a prophet has been among them.
Transliteration: uvevoah hineh vaah veyadeu khiy naviy hayah vetvokham {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הִנָּבֵ֖א עַל־רוֹעֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הִנָּבֵ֣א וְאָמַרְתָּ֩ אֲלֵיהֶ֨ם לָרֹעִ֜ים כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה ה֤וֹי רֹעֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָיוּ֙ רֹעִ֣ים אוֹתָ֔ם הֲל֣וֹא הַצֹּ֔אן יִרְע֖וּ הָרֹעִֽים׃
Translated:
O mortal, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel. Prophesy, and say to them:
To the shepherds: Thus said the Sovereign GOD: Ah, you shepherds of Israel, who have been tending yourselves! Is it not the flock that the shepherds ought to tend?
Transliteration: ven-adam hinave al-rvoey yisherael hinave veamareta aleyhem laroiym khoh-amar adonay yehovih hvoy roey-yisherael asher hayu roiym votam halvo hatson yireu haroiym

Hebrew: אֶת־הַחֵ֤לֶב תֹּאכֵ֙לוּ֙ וְאֶת־הַצֶּ֣מֶר תִּלְבָּ֔שׁוּ הַבְּרִיאָ֖ה תִּזְבָּ֑חוּ הַצֹּ֖אן לֹ֥א תִרְעֽוּ׃
Translated: You partake of the fat, you clothe yourselves with the wool, and you slaughter the fatlings; but you do not tend the flock.
Transliteration: et-hachelev tokhelu veet-hatsemer tilevashu haveriyah tizevachu hatson lo tireu

Hebrew: אֶֽת־הַנַּחְלוֹת֩ לֹ֨א חִזַּקְתֶּ֜ם וְאֶת־הַחוֹלָ֣ה לֹֽא־רִפֵּאתֶ֗ם וְלַנִּשְׁבֶּ֙רֶת֙ לֹ֣א חֲבַשְׁתֶּ֔ם וְאֶת־הַנִּדַּ֙חַת֙ לֹ֣א הֲשֵׁבֹתֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הָאֹבֶ֖דֶת לֹ֣א בִקַּשְׁתֶּ֑ם וּבְחׇזְקָ֛ה רְדִיתֶ֥ם אֹתָ֖ם וּבְפָֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: You have not sustained the weak, healed the sick, or bandaged the injured; you have not brought back the strayed, or looked for the lost; but you have driven them with harsh rigor,
Transliteration: et-hanachelvot lo chizaketem veet-hachvolah lo-rifetem velanisheveret lo chavashetem veet-hanidachat lo hashevotem veet-haovedet lo vikashetem uvechׇzekah rediytem otam uvefarekhe

Hebrew: וַתְּפוּצֶ֖ינָה מִבְּלִ֣י רֹעֶ֑ה וַתִּהְיֶ֧ינָה לְאׇכְלָ֛ה לְכׇל־חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וַתְּפוּצֶֽינָה׃
Translated: and they have been scattered for want of anyone to tend them; scattered, they have become prey for every wild beast.
Transliteration: vatefutseynah miveliy roeh vatiheyeynah leׇkhelah lekhׇl-chayat hashadeh vatefutseynah

Hebrew: יִשְׁגּ֤וּ צֹאנִי֙ בְּכׇל־הֶ֣הָרִ֔ים וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־גִּבְעָ֣ה רָמָ֑ה וְעַ֨ל כׇּל־פְּנֵ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ נָפֹ֣צוּ צֹאנִ֔י וְאֵ֥ין דּוֹרֵ֖שׁ וְאֵ֥ין מְבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
Translated: My sheep stray through all the mountains and over every lofty hill; My flock is scattered all over the face of the earth, with none to take thought of them and none to seek them.
Transliteration: yishegu tsoniy vekhׇl-hehariym veal khׇl-giveah ramah veal khׇl-feney haarets nafotsu tsoniy veeyn dvoresh veeyn mevakesh

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן רֹעִ֔ים שִׁמְע֖וּ אֶת־דְּבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Hear then, O shepherds, the word of G<small>OD</small>!
Transliteration: lakhen roiym shimeu et-devar yehovah

Hebrew: חַי־אָ֜נִי נְאֻ֣ם ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אִם־לֹ֣א יַ֣עַן הֱיֽוֹת־צֹאנִ֣י ׀ לָבַ֡ז וַתִּהְיֶ֩ינָה֩ צֹאנִ֨י לְאׇכְלָ֜ה לְכׇל־חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ מֵאֵ֣ין רֹעֶ֔ה וְלֹא־דָרְשׁ֥וּ רֹעַ֖י אֶת־צֹאנִ֑י וַיִּרְע֤וּ הָרֹעִים֙ אוֹתָ֔ם וְאֶת־צֹאנִ֖י לֹ֥א רָעֽוּ׃
Translated: As I live—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because My flock has been a spoil—My flock has been a prey for all the wild beasts, for want of anyone to tend them since My shepherds have not taken thought of My flock, for the shepherds tended themselves instead of tending the flock—
Transliteration: chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih im-lo yaan heyvot-tsoniy lavaz vatiheyeynah tsoniy leׇkhelah lekhׇl-chayat hashadeh meeyn roeh velo-dareshu roay et-tsoniy vayireu haroiym votam veet-tsoniy lo rau

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ הָרֹעִ֔ים שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: hear indeed, O shepherds, the word of G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: lakhen haroiym shimeu devar-yehovah

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנְנִ֨י אֶֽל־הָרֹעִ֜ים וְֽדָרַשְׁתִּ֧י אֶת־צֹאנִ֣י מִיָּדָ֗ם וְהִשְׁבַּתִּים֙ מֵרְע֣וֹת צֹ֔אן וְלֹא־יִרְע֥וּ ע֛וֹד הָרֹעִ֖ים אוֹתָ֑ם וְהִצַּלְתִּ֤י צֹאנִי֙ מִפִּיהֶ֔ם וְלֹא־תִֽהְיֶ֥יןָ לָהֶ֖ם לְאׇכְלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deal with the shepherds! I will demand a reckoning of them for My flock, and I will dismiss them from tending the flock. The shepherds shall not tend themselves anymore; for I will rescue My flock from their mouths, and it shall not be their prey.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineniy el-haroiym vedarashetiy et-tsoniy miyadam vehishevatiym merevot tson velo-yireu vod haroiym votam vehitsaletiy tsoniy mifiyhem velo-tiheyeyna lahem leׇkhelah {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֛י כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הִנְנִי־אָ֕נִי וְדָרַשְׁתִּ֥י אֶת־צֹאנִ֖י וּבִקַּרְתִּֽים׃
Translated: For thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Here am I! I am going to take thought for My flock and I will seek them out.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy-aniy vedarashetiy et-tsoniy uvikaretiym

Hebrew: כְּבַקָּרַת֩ רֹעֶ֨ה עֶדְר֜וֹ בְּיוֹם־הֱיוֹת֤וֹ בְתוֹךְ־צֹאנוֹ֙ נִפְרָשׁ֔וֹת כֵּ֖ן אֲבַקֵּ֣ר אֶת־צֹאנִ֑י וְהִצַּלְתִּ֣י אֶתְהֶ֗ם מִכׇּל־הַמְּקוֹמֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָפֹ֣צוּ שָׁ֔ם בְּי֥וֹם עָנָ֖ן וַעֲרָפֶֽל׃
Translated: As shepherds seek out their flock when some [animals] in their flock have gotten separated, so I will seek out My flock, I will rescue them from all the places to which they were scattered on a day of cloud and gloom.
Transliteration: khevakarat roeh edervo veyvom-heyvotvo vetvokhe-tsonvo niferashvot khen avaker et-tsoniy vehitsaletiy etehem mikhׇl-hamekvomot asher nafotsu sham veyvom anan vaarafel

Hebrew: וְהוֹצֵאתִ֣ים מִן־הָעַמִּ֗ים וְקִבַּצְתִּים֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת וַהֲבִיאוֹתִ֖ים אֶל־אַדְמָתָ֑ם וּרְעִיתִים֙ אֶל־הָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּאֲפִיקִ֕ים וּבְכֹ֖ל מוֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: I will take them out from the peoples and gather them from the countries, and I will bring them to their own land, and will pasture them on the mountains of Israel, by the watercourses and in all the settled portions of the land.
Transliteration: vehvotsetiym min-haamiym vekivatsetiym min-haaratsvot vahaviyvotiym el-adematam ureiytiym el-harey yisherael vaafiykiym uvekhol mvoshevey haarets

Hebrew: בְּמִרְעֶה־טּוֹב֙ אֶרְעֶ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם וּבְהָרֵ֥י מְרֽוֹם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִהְיֶ֣ה נְוֵהֶ֑ם שָׁ֤ם תִּרְבַּ֙צְנָה֙ בְּנָ֣וֶה טּ֔וֹב וּמִרְעֶ֥ה שָׁמֵ֛ן תִּרְעֶ֖ינָה אֶל־הָרֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: I will feed them in good grazing land, and the lofty hills of Israel shall be their pasture. There, in the hills of Israel, they shall lie down in a good pasture and shall feed on rich grazing land.
Transliteration: vemireeh-tvov ereeh otam uveharey mervom-yisherael yiheyeh nevehem sham tirevatsenah venaveh tvov umireeh shamen tireeynah el-harey yisherael

Hebrew: אֲנִ֨י אֶרְעֶ֤ה צֹאנִי֙ וַאֲנִ֣י אַרְבִּיצֵ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: I Myself will graze My flock, and I Myself will let them lie down—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: aniy ereeh tsoniy vaaniy areviytsem neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: אֶת־הָאֹבֶ֤דֶת אֲבַקֵּשׁ֙ וְאֶת־הַנִּדַּ֣חַת אָשִׁ֔יב וְלַנִּשְׁבֶּ֣רֶת אֶֽחֱבֹ֔שׁ וְאֶת־הַחוֹלָ֖ה אֲחַזֵּ֑ק וְאֶת־הַשְּׁמֵנָ֧ה וְאֶת־הַחֲזָקָ֛ה אַשְׁמִ֖יד אֶרְעֶ֥נָּה בְמִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: I will look for the lost, and I will bring back the strayed; I will bandage the injured, and I will sustain the weak; and the fat and healthy ones I will destroy. I will tend them rightly.
Transliteration: et-haovedet avakesh veet-hanidachat ashiyv velanisheveret echevosh veet-hachvolah achazek veet-hashemenah veet-hachazakah ashemiyd ereenah vemishefat

Hebrew: וְאַתֵּ֣נָה צֹאנִ֔י כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הִנְנִ֤י שֹׁפֵט֙ בֵּֽין־שֶׂ֣ה לָשֶׂ֔ה לָאֵילִ֖ים וְלָעַתּוּדִֽים׃
Translated:
And as for you, My flock, thus said the Sovereign GOD: I am going to judge between one animal and another.
To the rams and the bucks:
Transliteration: veatenah tsoniy khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy shofet veyn-sheh lasheh laeyliym velaatudiym

Hebrew: הַמְעַ֣ט מִכֶּ֗ם הַמִּרְעֶ֤ה הַטּוֹב֙ תִּרְע֔וּ וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ מִרְעֵיכֶ֔ם תִּרְמְס֖וּ בְּרַגְלֵיכֶ֑ם וּמִשְׁקַע־מַ֣יִם תִּשְׁתּ֔וּ וְאֵת֙ הַנּ֣וֹתָרִ֔ים בְּרַגְלֵיכֶ֖ם תִּרְפֹּשֽׂוּן׃
Translated: Is it not enough for you to graze on choice grazing ground, but you must also trample with your feet what is left from your grazing? And is it not enough for you to drink clear water, but you must also muddy with your feet what is left?
Transliteration: hameat mikhem hamireeh hatvov tireu veyeter mireeykhem tiremesu verageleykhem umisheka-mayiim tishetu veet hanvotariym verageleykhem tirefoshun

Hebrew: וְצֹאנִ֑י מִרְמַ֤ס רַגְלֵיכֶם֙ תִּרְעֶ֔ינָה וּמִרְפַּ֥שׂ רַגְלֵיכֶ֖ם תִּשְׁתֶּֽינָה׃ {פ}
Translated: And must My flock graze on what your feet have trampled and drink what your feet have muddied?
Transliteration: vetsoniy miremas rageleykhem tireeynah umirefash rageleykhem tisheteynah {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֛ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם הִנְנִי־אָ֕נִי וְשָֽׁפַטְתִּי֙ בֵּֽין־שֶׂ֣ה בִרְיָ֔ה וּבֵ֥ין שֶׂ֖ה רָזָֽה׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> to them: Here am I, I am going to decide between the stout animals and the lean.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih aleyhem hineniy-aniy veshafatetiy veyn-sheh vireyah uveyn sheh razah

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן בְּצַ֤ד וּבְכָתֵף֙ תֶּהְדֹּ֔פוּ וּבְקַרְנֵיכֶ֥ם תְּנַגְּח֖וּ כׇּל־הַנַּחְל֑וֹת עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁ֧ר הֲפִיצוֹתֶ֛ם אוֹתָ֖נָה אֶל־הַחֽוּצָה׃
Translated: Because you pushed with flank and shoulder against the feeble ones and butted them with your horns until you scattered them abroad,
Transliteration: yaan vetsad uvekhatef tehedofu uvekareneykhem tenagechu khׇl-hanachelvot ad asher hafiytsvotem votanah el-hachutsah

Hebrew: וְהוֹשַׁעְתִּ֣י לְצֹאנִ֔י וְלֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ינָה ע֖וֹד לָבַ֑ז וְשָׁ֣פַטְתִּ֔י בֵּ֥ין שֶׂ֖ה לָשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: I will rescue My flock and they shall no longer be a spoil. I will decide between one animal and another.
Transliteration: vehvoshaetiy letsoniy velo-tiheyeynah vod lavaz veshafatetiy veyn sheh lasheh

Hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֨י עֲלֵיהֶ֜ם רֹעֶ֤ה אֶחָד֙ וְרָעָ֣ה אֶתְהֶ֔ן אֵ֖ת עַבְדִּ֣י דָוִ֑יד ה֚וּא יִרְעֶ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם וְהֽוּא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶ֖ן לְרֹעֶֽה׃
Translated: Then I will appoint a single shepherd over them to tend them—My servant David. He shall tend them, he shall be a shepherd to them.
Transliteration: vahakimotiy aleyhem roeh echad veraah etehen et avediy daviyd hu yireeh otam vehu-yiheyeh lahen leroeh

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶֽהְיֶ֤ה לָהֶם֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים וְעַבְדִּ֥י דָוִ֖ד נָשִׂ֣יא בְתוֹכָ֑ם אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּֽרְתִּי׃
Translated: I the E<small>TERNAL</small> One will be their God, and My servant David shall be a ruler among them—I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken.
Transliteration: vaaniy yehovah eheyeh lahem lelohiym veavediy david nashiy vetvokham aniy yehovah divaretiy

Hebrew: וְכָרַתִּ֤י לָהֶם֙ בְּרִ֣ית שָׁל֔וֹם וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֥י חַיָּֽה־רָעָ֖ה מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְיָשְׁב֤וּ בַמִּדְבָּר֙ לָבֶ֔טַח וְיָשְׁנ֖וּ בַּיְּעָרִֽים׃
Translated: And I will grant them a covenant of friendship. I will banish vicious beasts from their land, and they shall live secure in the wasteland, they shall even sleep in the woodland.
Transliteration: vekharatiy lahem veriyt shalvom vehishevatiy chayah-raah min-haarets veyashevu vamidevar lavetach veyashenu vayeariym

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י אוֹתָ֛ם וּסְבִיב֥וֹת גִּבְעָתִ֖י בְּרָכָ֑ה וְהוֹרַדְתִּ֤י הַגֶּ֙שֶׁם֙ בְּעִתּ֔וֹ גִּשְׁמֵ֥י בְרָכָ֖ה יִֽהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: I will make these and the environs of My hill a blessing: I will send down the rain in its season, rains that bring blessing.
Transliteration: venatatiy votam useviyvvot giveatiy verakhah vehvoradetiy hageshem veitvo gishemey verakhah yiheyu

Hebrew: וְנָתַן֩ עֵ֨ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה אֶת־פִּרְי֗וֹ וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ תִּתֵּ֣ן יְבוּלָ֔הּ וְהָי֥וּ עַל־אַדְמָתָ֖ם לָבֶ֑טַח וְֽיָדְע֞וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּשִׁבְרִי֙ אֶת־מֹט֣וֹת עֻלָּ֔ם וְהִ֨צַּלְתִּ֔ים מִיַּ֖ד הָעֹבְדִ֥ים בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: The trees of the field shall yield their fruit and the land shall yield its produce. [My people] shall continue secure on its own soil. They shall know that I am G<small>OD</small> when I break the bars of their yoke and rescue them from those who enslave them.
Transliteration: venatan ets hashadeh et-fireyvo vehaarets titen yevulah vehayu al-adematam lavetach veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah veshiveriy et-motvot ulam vehitsaletiym miyad haovediym vahem

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִהְי֨וּ ע֥וֹד בַּז֙ לַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְחַיַּ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ לֹ֣א תֹאכְלֵ֑ם וְיָשְׁב֥וּ לָבֶ֖טַח וְאֵ֥ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃
Translated: They shall no longer be a spoil for the nations, and the beasts of the earth shall not devour them; they shall dwell secure and untroubled.
Transliteration: velo-yiheyu vod vaz lagvoyim vechayat haarets lo tokhelem veyashevu lavetach veeyn machariyd

Hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֥י לָהֶ֛ם מַטָּ֖ע לְשֵׁ֑ם וְלֹא־יִהְי֨וּ ע֜וֹד אֲסֻפֵ֤י רָעָב֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וְלֹא־יִשְׂא֥וּ ע֖וֹד כְּלִמַּ֥ת הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: I shall establish for them a planting of renown; they shall no more be carried off by famine, and they shall not have to bear again the taunts of the nations.
Transliteration: vahakimotiy lahem mata leshem velo-yiheyu vod asufey raav vaarets velo-yisheu vod khelimat hagvoyim

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֗וּ כִּ֣י אֲנִ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם אִתָּ֑ם וְהֵ֗מָּה עַמִּי֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: They shall know that I the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God am with them and they, the House of Israel, are My people—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veyadeu khiy aniy yehovah eloheyhem itam vehemah amiy veyt yisherael neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְאַתֵּ֥ן צֹאנִ֛י צֹ֥אן מַרְעִיתִ֖י אָדָ֣ם אַתֶּ֑ם אֲנִי֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: For you—My flock, the flock that I tend—are human; and I am your God—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veaten tsoniy tson mareiytiy adam atem aniy eloheykhem neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם שִׂ֥ים פָּנֶ֖יךָ עַל־הַ֣ר שֵׂעִ֑יר וְהִנָּבֵ֖א עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: O mortal, set your face against Mount Seir and prophesy against it.
Transliteration: ven-adam shiym faneykha al-har sheiyr vehinave alayv

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֣רְתָּ לּ֗וֹ כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַר־שֵׂעִ֑יר וְנָטִ֤יתִי יָדִי֙ עָלֶ֔יךָ וּנְתַתִּ֖יךָ שְׁמָמָ֥ה וּמְשַׁמָּֽה׃
Translated: Say to it: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deal with you, Mount Seir: I will stretch out My hand against you and make you an utter waste.
Transliteration: veamareta lvo khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy eleykha har-sheiyr venatiytiy yadiy aleykha unetatiykha shemamah umeshamah

Hebrew: עָרֶ֙יךָ֙ חׇרְבָּ֣ה אָשִׂ֔ים וְאַתָּ֖ה שְׁמָמָ֣ה תִֽהְיֶ֑ה וְיָדַעְתָּ֖ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will turn your towns into ruins, and you shall be a desolation; then you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: areykha chׇrevah ashiym veatah shemamah tiheyeh veyadaeta khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן הֱי֤וֹת לְךָ֙ אֵיבַ֣ת עוֹלָ֔ם וַתַּגֵּ֥ר אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַל־יְדֵי־חָ֑רֶב בְּעֵ֣ת אֵידָ֔ם בְּעֵ֖ת עֲוֺ֥ן קֵֽץ׃
Translated: Because you harbored an ancient hatred and handed the people of Israel over to the sword in their time of calamity, the time set for their punishment—
Transliteration: yaan heyvot lekha eyvat volam vatager et-veney-yisherael al-yedey-charev veet eydam veet avon kets

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה כִּֽי־לְדָ֥ם אֶעֶשְׂךָ֖ וְדָ֣ם יִרְדְּפֶ֑ךָ אִם־לֹ֥א דָ֛ם שָׂנֵ֖אתָ וְדָ֥ם יִרְדְּפֶֽךָ׃
Translated: assuredly, as I live, declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, I will doom you with blood; blood shall pursue you; I swear that, for your bloodthirsty hatred, blood shall pursue you.
Transliteration: lakhen chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih khiy-ledam eeshekha vedam yiredefekha im-lo dam shaneta vedam yiredefekha

Hebrew: וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ אֶת־הַ֣ר שֵׂעִ֔יר לְשִֽׁמְמָ֖ה וּשְׁמָמָ֑ה וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עֹבֵ֥ר וָשָֽׁב׃
Translated: I will make Mount Seir an utter waste, and I will keep all passersby away from it.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-har sheiyr leshimemah ushemamah vehikheratiy mimenu over vashav

Hebrew: וּמִלֵּאתִ֥י אֶת־הָרָ֖יו חֲלָלָ֑יו גִּבְעוֹתֶ֤יךָ וְגֵיאוֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ וְכׇל־אֲפִיקֶ֔יךָ חַלְלֵי־חֶ֖רֶב יִפְּל֥וּ בָהֶֽם׃
Translated: I will cover its mountains with the slain; those slain by the sword shall lie on your hills, in your valleys, and in all your watercourses.
Transliteration: umiletiy et-harayv chalalayv givevoteykha vegeyvoteykha vekhׇl-afiykeykha chaleley-cherev yifelu vahem

Hebrew: שִֽׁמְמ֤וֹת עוֹלָם֙ אֶתֶּנְךָ֔ וְעָרֶ֖יךָ לֹ֣א (תישבנה) [תָשֹׁ֑בְנָה] וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will make you a desolation for all time; your towns shall never be inhabited. And you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: shimemvot volam etenekha veareykha lo (tyshvnh) [tashovenah] viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: יַ֣עַן אֲ֠מׇרְךָ֠ אֶת־שְׁנֵ֨י הַגּוֹיִ֜ם וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֧י הָאֲרָצ֛וֹת לִ֥י תִהְיֶ֖ינָה וִֽירַשְׁנ֑וּהָ וַיהֹוָ֖ה שָׁ֥ם הָיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Because you thought “The two nations and the two lands shall be mine and we shall possess them”—although G<small>OD</small> was there—
Transliteration: yaan amׇrekha et-sheney hagvoyim veet-shetey haaratsvot liy tiheyeynah viyrashenuha vayhovah sham hayah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן חַי־אָ֗נִי נְאֻם֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ וְעָשִׂ֗יתִי כְּאַפְּךָ֙ וּכְקִנְאָ֣תְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתָה מִשִּׂנְאָתֶ֖יךָ בָּ֑ם וְנוֹדַ֥עְתִּי בָ֖ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶשְׁפְּטֶֽךָ׃
Translated: assuredly, as I live, declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, I will act with the same anger and passion that you acted with in your hatred of them. And I will make Myself known through them when I judge you.
Transliteration: lakhen chay-aniy neum adonay yehovih veashiytiy kheafekha ukhekineatekha asher ashiytah mishineateykha vam venvodaetiy vam khaasher eshefetekha

Hebrew: וְֽיָדַעְתָּ֮ כִּ֣י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָה֒ שָׁמַ֣עְתִּי ׀ אֶת־כׇּל־נָאָֽצוֹתֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָמַ֛רְתָּ עַל־הָרֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֣ר ׀ [שָׁמֵ֑מוּ] (שממה) לָ֥נוּ נִתְּנ֖וּ לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
Translated: You shall know that I, G<small>OD</small>, have heard all the taunts you uttered against the hills of Israel: “They have been laid waste; they have been given to us as prey.”
Transliteration: veyadaeta khiy aniy yehovah shamaetiy et-khׇl-naatsvoteykha asher amareta al-harey yisherael lemor [shamemu] (shmmh) lanu nitenu leׇkhelah

Hebrew: וַתַּגְדִּ֤ילוּ עָלַי֙ בְּפִיכֶ֔ם וְהַעְתַּרְתֶּ֥ם עָלַ֖י דִּבְרֵיכֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י שָׁמָֽעְתִּי׃ {ס}
Translated: And you spoke arrogantly against Me and multiplied your words against Me: I have heard it.
Transliteration: vatagediylu alay vefiykhem vehaetaretem alay divereykhem aniy shamaetiy {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה כִּשְׂמֹ֙חַ֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ שְׁמָמָ֖ה אֶעֱשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small> God: When the whole earth rejoices, I will make you a desolation.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih khishemocha khׇl-haarets shemamah eesheh-lakhe

Hebrew: כְּשִׂמְחָ֨תְךָ֜ לְנַחֲלַ֧ת בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עַ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמֵ֖מָה כֵּ֣ן אֶעֱשֶׂה־לָּ֑ךְ שְׁמָמָ֨ה תִהְיֶ֤ה הַר־שֵׂעִיר֙ וְכׇל־אֱד֣וֹם כֻּלָּ֔הּ וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: As you rejoiced when the heritage of the House of Israel was laid waste, so will I treat you: the hill country of Seir and the whole of Edom, all of it, shall be laid waste. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: kheshimechatekha lenachalat veyt-yisherael al asher-shamemah khen eesheh-lakhe shemamah tiheyeh har-sheiyr vekhׇl-edvom khulah veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֔ם הִנָּבֵ֖א אֶל־הָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ הָרֵי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And you, O mortal, prophesy to the mountains of Israel and say: O mountains of Israel, hear the word of G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam hinave el-harey yisherael veamareta harey yisherael shimeu devar-yehovah

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֣עַן אָמַ֧ר הָאוֹיֵ֛ב עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם הֶאָ֑ח וּבָמ֣וֹת עוֹלָ֔ם לְמוֹרָשָׁ֖ה הָ֥יְתָה לָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because the enemy gloated over you, “Aha! Those ancient heights have become our possession!”
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan amar havoeiv aleykhem heach uvamvot volam lemvorashah hayetah lanu

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ הִנָּבֵ֣א וְאָמַרְתָּ֔ כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה יַ֣עַן בְּיַ֡עַן שַׁמּוֹת֩ וְשָׁאֹ֨ף אֶתְכֶ֜ם מִסָּבִ֗יב לִֽהְיֽוֹתְכֶ֤ם מֽוֹרָשָׁה֙ לִשְׁאֵרִ֣ית הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וַתֵּ֥עֲל֛וּ עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת לָשׁ֖וֹן וְדִבַּת־עָֽם׃
Translated: therefore prophesy, and say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Just because they eagerly lusted to see you become a possession of the other nations round about, so that you have become the butt of gossip in every language and of the jibes from every people—
Transliteration: lakhen hinave veamareta khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan veyaan shamvot veshaof etekhem misaviyv liheyvotekhem mvorashah lisheeriyt hagvoyim vatealu al-shefat lashvon vedivat-am

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ הָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱ֠הֹוִ֠ה לֶהָרִ֨ים וְלַגְּבָע֜וֹת לָאֲפִיקִ֣ים וְלַגֵּאָי֗וֹת וְלֶחֳרָב֤וֹת הַשֹּֽׁמְמוֹת֙ וְלֶעָרִ֣ים הַנֶּעֱזָב֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָי֤וּ לְבַז֙ וּלְלַ֔עַג לִשְׁאֵרִ֥ית הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated: truly, you mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> to the mountains and the hills, to the watercourses and the valleys, and to the desolate wastes and deserted cities that have become a prey and a laughingstock to the other nations round about:
Transliteration: lakhen harey yisherael shimeu devar-adonay yehovih khoh-amar adonay yehovih lehariym velagevavot laafiykiym velageayvot velechoravvot hashomemvot veleariym haneezavvot asher hayu levaz ulelaag lisheeriyt hagvoyim asher misaviyv

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ אִם־לֹ֠א בְּאֵ֨שׁ קִנְאָתִ֥י דִבַּ֛רְתִּי עַל־שְׁאֵרִ֥ית הַגּוֹיִ֖ם וְעַל־אֱד֣וֹם כֻּלָּ֑א אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתְנֽוּ־אֶת־אַרְצִ֣י <small>׀</small> לָ֠הֶ֠ם לְמ֨וֹרָשָׁ֜ה בְּשִׂמְחַ֤ת כׇּל־לֵבָב֙ בִּשְׁאָ֣ט נֶ֔פֶשׁ לְמַ֥עַן מִגְרָשָׁ֖הּ לָבַֽז׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I have indeed spoken in My blazing wrath against the other nations and against all of Edom that, with wholehearted glee and with contempt, have made My land a possession for themselves for pasture and for prey.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar adonay yehovih im-lo veesh kineatiy divaretiy al-sheeriyt hagvoyim veal-edvom khula asher natenu-et-aretsiy <small></small> lahem lemvorashah veshimechat khׇl-levav visheat nefesh lemaan migerashah lavaz

Hebrew: לָכֵ֕ן הִנָּבֵ֖א עַל־אַדְמַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֡ לֶהָרִ֣ים וְ֠לַגְּבָע֠וֹת לָאֲפִיקִ֨ים וְלַגֵּאָי֜וֹת כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הִנְנִ֨י בְקִנְאָתִ֤י וּבַֽחֲמָתִי֙ דִּבַּ֔רְתִּי יַ֛עַן כְּלִמַּ֥ת גּוֹיִ֖ם נְשָׂאתֶֽם׃
Translated: Yes, prophesy about the land of Israel, and say to the mountains and the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys, Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Behold, I declare in My blazing wrath: Because you have suffered the taunting of the nations,
Transliteration: lakhen hinave al-ademat yisherael veamareta lehariym velagevavot laafiykiym velageayvot khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineniy vekineatiy uvachamatiy divaretiy yaan khelimat gvoyim neshatem

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה אֲנִ֖י נָשָׂ֣אתִי אֶת־יָדִ֑י אִם־לֹ֤א הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָכֶ֣ם מִסָּבִ֔יב הֵ֖מָּה כְּלִמָּתָ֥ם יִשָּֽׂאוּ׃
Translated: thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I hereby swear that the nations that surround you shall, in their turn, suffer disgrace.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih aniy nashatiy et-yadiy im-lo hagvoyim asher lakhem misaviyv hemah khelimatam yishau

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֞ם הָרֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ עַנְפְּכֶ֣ם תִּתֵּ֔נוּ וּפֶרְיְכֶ֥ם תִּשְׂא֖וּ לְעַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֥י קֵרְב֖וּ לָבֽוֹא׃
Translated: But you, O mountains of Israel, shall yield your produce and bear your fruit for My people Israel, for their return is near.
Transliteration: veatem harey yisherael anefekhem titenu ufereyekhem tisheu leamiy yisherael khiy kerevu lavvo

Hebrew: כִּ֖י הִנְנִ֣י אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וּפָנִ֣יתִי אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְנֶעֱבַדְתֶּ֖ם וְנִזְרַעְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: For I will care for you: I will turn to you, and you shall be tilled and sown.
Transliteration: khiy hineniy aleykhem ufaniytiy aleykhem veneevadetem venizeraetem

Hebrew: וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֤י עֲלֵיכֶם֙ אָדָ֔ם כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כֻּלֹּ֑ה וְנֹֽשְׁבוּ֙ הֶעָרִ֔ים וְהֶחֳרָב֖וֹת תִּבָּנֶֽינָה׃
Translated: I will settle a large population on you, the whole House of Israel; the towns shall be resettled, and the ruined sites rebuilt.
Transliteration: vehireveytiy aleykhem adam khׇl-veyt yisherael khuloh venoshevu heariym vehechoravvot tivaneynah

Hebrew: וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֧י עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם אָדָ֥ם וּבְהֵמָ֖ה וְרָב֣וּ וּפָר֑וּ וְהוֹשַׁבְתִּ֨י אֶתְכֶ֜ם כְּקַדְמֽוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם וְהֵיטִֽבֹתִי֙ מֵרִאשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will multiply human and animal upon you, and they shall increase and be fertile, and I will resettle you as you were formerly, and will make you more prosperous than you were at first. And you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehireveytiy aleykhem adam uvehemah veravu ufaru vehvoshavetiy etekhem khekademvoteykhem veheytivotiy merishoteykhem viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְהוֹלַכְתִּי֩ עֲלֵיכֶ֨ם אָדָ֜ם אֶת־עַמִּ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וִירֵשׁ֔וּךָ וְהָיִ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם לְנַחֲלָ֑ה וְלֹא־תוֹסִ֥ף ע֖וֹד לְשַׁכְּלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: I will lead a multitude—My people Israel—to you, and they shall possess you. You shall be their heritage, and you shall not again cause them to be bereaved.
Transliteration: vehvolakhetiy aleykhem adam et-amiy yisherael viyreshukha vehayiyta lahem lenachalah velo-tvosif vod leshakhelam {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יַ֚עַן אֹמְרִ֣ים לָכֶ֔ם אֹכֶ֥לֶת אָדָ֖ם (אתי) [אָ֑תְּ] וּמְשַׁכֶּ֥לֶת (גויך) [גּוֹיַ֖יִךְ] הָיִֽית׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Because they say to you, “You are [a land] that devours humans, you have been a bereaver of your nations,”
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih yaan omeriym lakhem okhelet adam (ty) [ate] umeshakhelet (gvykh) [gvoyayiikhe] hayiyt

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן אָדָם֙ לֹא־תֹ֣אכְלִי ע֔וֹד (וגויך) [וְגוֹיַ֖יִךְ] לֹ֣א (תכשלי) [תְשַׁכְּלִי־]ע֑וֹד נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: assuredly, you shall devour humans no more, you shall never again bereave your nations—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: lakhen adam lo-tokheliy vod (vgvykh) [vegvoyayiikhe] lo (tkhshly) [teshakheliy-]vod neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְלֹא־אַשְׁמִ֨יעַ אֵלַ֤יִךְ עוֹד֙ כְּלִמַּ֣ת הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְחֶרְפַּ֥ת עַמִּ֖ים לֹ֣א תִשְׂאִי־ע֑וֹד (וגויך) [וְגוֹיַ֙יִךְ֙] לֹא־תַכְשִׁ֣לִי ע֔וֹד נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: No more will I allow the jibes of the nations to be heard against you, no longer shall you suffer the taunting of the peoples; and never again shall you cause your nations to stumble—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velo-ashemiya elayiikhe vod khelimat hagvoyim vecherefat amiym lo tisheiy-vod (vgvykh) [vegvoyayiikhe] lo-takheshiliy vod neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם בֵּ֤ית יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יֹשְׁבִ֣ים עַל־אַדְמָתָ֔ם וַיְטַמְּא֣וּ אוֹתָ֔הּ בְּדַרְכָּ֖ם וּבַעֲלִֽילוֹתָ֑ם כְּטֻמְאַת֙ הַנִּדָּ֔ה הָיְתָ֥ה דַרְכָּ֖ם לְפָנָֽי׃
Translated: O mortal, when the House of Israel dwelt on their own soil, they defiled it with their ways and their deeds; their ways were in My sight like the impurity of a menstruous woman.
Transliteration: ven-adam veyt yisherael yosheviym al-adematam vayetameu votah vedarekham uvaaliylvotam khetumeat hanidah hayetah darekham lefanay

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁפֹּ֤ךְ חֲמָתִי֙ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם עַל־הַדָּ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־שָׁפְכ֣וּ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וּבְגִלּוּלֵיהֶ֖ם טִמְּאֽוּהָ׃
Translated: So I poured out My wrath on them for the blood that they shed upon their land, and for the fetishes with which they defiled it.
Transliteration: vaeshefokhe chamatiy aleyhem al-hadam asher-shafekhu al-haarets uvegiluleyhem timeuha

Hebrew: וָאָפִ֤יץ אֹתָם֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם וַיִּזָּר֖וּ בָּאֲרָצ֑וֹת כְּדַרְכָּ֥ם וְכַעֲלִילוֹתָ֖ם שְׁפַטְתִּֽים׃
