Translated: I scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed through the countries: I punished them in accordance with their ways and their deeds.
Transliteration: vaafiyts otam vagvoyim vayizaru vaaratsvot khedarekham vekhaaliylvotam shefatetiym

Hebrew: וַיָּב֗וֹא אֶל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣אוּ שָׁ֔ם וַֽיְחַלְּל֖וּ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשִׁ֑י בֶּאֱמֹ֤ר לָהֶם֙ עַם־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֵ֔לֶּה וּמֵאַרְצ֖וֹ יָצָֽאוּ׃
Translated: But when they came to those nations, they caused My holy name to be profaned, in that it was said of them, “These are G<small>OD</small>’s people, yet they had to leave their land.”
Transliteration: vayavvo el-hagvoyim asher-vau sham vayechalelu et-shem kׇdeshiy veemor lahem am-yehovah eleh umearetsvo yatsau

Hebrew: וָאֶחְמֹ֖ל עַל־שֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשִׁ֑י אֲשֶׁ֤ר חִלְּלֻ֙הוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בַּגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אוּ שָֽׁמָּה׃ {פ}
Translated: Therefore I am concerned for My holy name, which the House of Israel have caused to be profaned among the nations to which they have come.
Transliteration: vaechemol al-shem kׇdeshiy asher chileluhu veyt yisherael vagvoyim asher-vau shamah {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן אֱמֹ֣ר לְבֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה לֹ֧א לְמַעַנְכֶ֛ם אֲנִ֥י עֹשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֤י אִם־לְשֵׁם־קׇדְשִׁי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חִלַּלְתֶּ֔ם בַּגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אתֶם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Say to the House of Israel: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Not for your sake will I act, O House of Israel, but for My holy name, which you have caused to be profaned among the nations to which you have come.
Transliteration: lakhen emor leveyt-yisherael khoh amar adonay yehovih lo lemaanekhem aniy osheh veyt yisherael khiy im-leshem-kׇdeshiy asher chilaletem vagvoyim asher-vatem sham

Hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתִּ֞י אֶת־שְׁמִ֣י הַגָּד֗וֹל הַֽמְחֻלָּל֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר חִלַּלְתֶּ֖ם בְּתוֹכָ֑ם וְיָדְע֨וּ הַגּוֹיִ֜ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה בְּהִקָּדְשִׁ֥י בָכֶ֖ם לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: I will sanctify My great name that has been profaned among the nations—among whom you have caused it to be profaned. And the nations shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—when I manifest My holiness before their eyes through you.
Transliteration: vekidashetiy et-shemiy hagadvol hamechulal vagvoyim asher chilaletem vetvokham veyadeu hagvoyim khiy-aniy yehovah neum adonay yehovih vehikadeshiy vakhem leeyneyhem

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתִּ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ מִן־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְקִבַּצְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִכׇּל־הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֶל־אַדְמַתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will take you from among the nations and gather you from all the countries, and I will bring you back to your own land.
Transliteration: velakachetiy etekhem min-hagvoyim vekivatsetiy etekhem mikhׇl-haaratsvot vehevetiy etekhem el-adematekhem

Hebrew: וְזָרַקְתִּ֧י עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם מַ֥יִם טְהוֹרִ֖ים וּטְהַרְתֶּ֑ם מִכֹּ֧ל טֻמְאוֹתֵיכֶ֛ם וּמִכׇּל־גִּלּ֥וּלֵיכֶ֖ם אֲטַהֵ֥ר אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will sprinkle pure water upon you, and you shall be purified: I will purify you from all your defilement and from all your fetishes.
Transliteration: vezaraketiy aleykhem mayiim tehvoriym uteharetem mikhol tumevoteykhem umikhׇl-giluleykhem ataher etekhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י לָכֶם֙ לֵ֣ב חָדָ֔שׁ וְר֥וּחַ חֲדָשָׁ֖ה אֶתֵּ֣ן בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וַהֲסִ֨רֹתִ֜י אֶת־לֵ֤ב הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ מִבְּשַׂרְכֶ֔ם וְנָתַתִּ֥י לָכֶ֖ם לֵ֥ב בָּשָֽׂר׃
Translated: And I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit into you: I will remove the heart of stone from your body and give you a heart of flesh;
Transliteration: venatatiy lakhem lev chadash verucha chadashah eten vekirevekhem vahasirotiy et-lev haeven mivesharekhem venatatiy lakhem lev vashar

Hebrew: וְאֶת־רוּחִ֖י אֶתֵּ֣ן בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וְעָשִׂ֗יתִי אֵ֤ת אֲשֶׁר־בְּחֻקַּי֙ תֵּלֵ֔כוּ וּמִשְׁפָּטַ֥י תִּשְׁמְר֖וּ וַעֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
Translated: and I will put My spirit into you. Thus I will cause you to follow My laws and faithfully to observe My rules.
Transliteration: veet-ruchiy eten vekirevekhem veashiytiy et asher-vechukay telekhu umishefatay tishemeru vaashiytem

Hebrew: וִישַׁבְתֶּ֣ם בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לַאֲבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם וִהְיִ֤יתֶם לִי֙ לְעָ֔ם וְאָ֣נֹכִ֔י אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Then you shall dwell in the land that I gave to your ancestors, and you shall be My people and I will be your God.
Transliteration: viyshavetem vaarets asher natatiy laavoteykhem viheyiytem liy leam veanokhiy eheyeh lakhem lelohiym

Hebrew: וְהוֹשַׁעְתִּ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם מִכֹּ֖ל טֻמְאֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְקָרָ֤אתִי אֶל־הַדָּגָן֙ וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֣י אֹת֔וֹ וְלֹא־אֶתֵּ֥ן עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם רָעָֽב׃
Translated: And when I have delivered you from all your impurity, I will summon the grain and make it abundant, and I will not bring famine upon you.
Transliteration: vehvoshaetiy etekhem mikhol tumevoteykhem vekaratiy el-hadagan vehireveytiy otvo velo-eten aleykhem raav

Hebrew: וְהִרְבֵּיתִי֙ אֶת־פְּרִ֣י הָעֵ֔ץ וּתְנוּבַ֖ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה לְמַ֗עַן אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹ֣א תִקְח֥וּ ע֛וֹד חֶרְפַּ֥ת רָעָ֖ב בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: I will make the fruit of your trees and the crops of your fields abundant, so that you shall never again be humiliated before the nations because of famine.
Transliteration: vehireveytiy et-feriy haets utenuvat hashadeh lemaan asher lo tikechu vod cherefat raav vagvoyim

Hebrew: וּזְכַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־דַּרְכֵיכֶ֣ם הָרָעִ֔ים וּמַעַלְלֵיכֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־טוֹבִ֑ים וּנְקֹֽטֹתֶם֙ בִּפְנֵיכֶ֔ם עַ֚ל עֲוֺנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעַ֖ל תּוֹעֲבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Then you shall recall your evil ways and your base conduct, and you shall loathe yourselves for your iniquities and your abhorrent practices.
Transliteration: uzekharetem et-darekheykhem haraiym umaaleleykhem asher lo-tvoviym unekototem vifeneykhem al avonoteykhem veal tvoavvoteykhem

Hebrew: לֹ֧א לְמַעַנְכֶ֣ם אֲנִֽי־עֹשֶׂ֗ה נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה יִוָּדַ֖ע לָכֶ֑ם בּ֧וֹשׁוּ וְהִכָּֽלְמ֛וּ מִדַּרְכֵיכֶ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Not for your sake will I act—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—take good note! Be ashamed and humiliated because of your ways, O House of Israel!
Transliteration: lo lemaanekhem aniy-osheh neum adonay yehovih yivada lakhem vvoshu vehikhalemu midarekheykhem veyt yisherael {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה בְּיוֹם֙ טַהֲרִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם מִכֹּ֖ל עֲוֺנֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהֽוֹשַׁבְתִּי֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים וְנִבְנ֖וּ הֶחֳרָבֽוֹת׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: When I have purified you of all your iniquities, I will people your settlements, and the ruined places shall be rebuilt;
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih veyvom tahariy etekhem mikhol avonvoteykhem vehvoshavetiy et-heariym venivenu hechoravvot

Hebrew: וְהָאָ֥רֶץ הַנְּשַׁמָּ֖ה תֵּעָבֵ֑ד תַּ֚חַת אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיְתָ֣ה שְׁמָמָ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־עוֹבֵֽר׃
Translated: and the desolate land, after lying waste in the sight of every passerby, shall again be tilled.
Transliteration: vehaarets haneshamah teaved tachat asher hayetah shemamah leeyney khׇl-vover

Hebrew: וְאָמְר֗וּ הָאָ֤רֶץ הַלֵּ֙זוּ֙ הַנְּשַׁמָּ֔ה הָיְתָ֖ה כְּגַן־עֵ֑דֶן וְהֶעָרִ֧ים הֶחֳרֵב֛וֹת וְהַֽנְשַׁמּ֥וֹת וְהַנֶּהֱרָס֖וֹת בְּצוּר֥וֹת יָשָֽׁבוּ׃
Translated: And it shall be said, “That land, once desolate, has become like the garden of Eden; and the cities, once ruined, desolate, and ravaged, are now populated and fortified.”
Transliteration: veameru haarets halezu haneshamah hayetah khegan-eden veheariym hechorevvot vehaneshamvot vehaneherasvot vetsurvot yashavu

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֣וּ הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִֽשָּׁאֲרוּ֮ סְבִיבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֒ כִּ֣י ׀ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה בָּנִ֙יתִי֙ הַנֶּ֣הֱרָס֔וֹת נָטַ֖עְתִּי הַנְּשַׁמָּ֑ה אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי וְעָשִֽׂיתִי׃ {ס}
Translated: And the nations that are left around you shall know that I, G<small>OD</small>, have rebuilt the ravaged places and replanted the desolate land. I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken and will act.
Transliteration: veyadeu hagvoyim asher yishaaru seviyvvoteykhem khiy aniy yehovah vaniytiy haneherasvot nataetiy haneshamah aniy yehovah divaretiy veashiytiy {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה ע֗וֹד זֹ֛את אִדָּרֵ֥שׁ לְבֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לָהֶ֑ם אַרְבֶּ֥ה אֹתָ֛ם כַּצֹּ֖אן אָדָֽם׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Moreover, in this I will respond to the House of Israel and act for their sake: I will multiply their people like sheep.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih vod zot idaresh leveyt-yisherael laashvot lahem areveh otam khatson adam

Hebrew: כְּצֹ֣אן קׇדָשִׁ֗ים כְּצֹ֤אן יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ בְּמ֣וֹעֲדֶ֔יהָ כֵּ֤ן תִּֽהְיֶ֙ינָה֙ הֶעָרִ֣ים הֶחֳרֵב֔וֹת מְלֵא֖וֹת צֹ֣אן אָדָ֑ם וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: As Jerusalem is filled with sacrificial sheep during her festivals, so shall the ruined cities be filled with flocks of people. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khetson kׇdashiym khetson yerushala͏im vemvoadeyha khen tiheyeynah heariym hechorevvot melevot tson adam veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: הָיְתָ֣ה עָלַי֮ יַד־יְהֹוָה֒ וַיּוֹצִאֵ֤נִֽי בְר֙וּחַ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיְנִיחֵ֖נִי בְּת֣וֹךְ הַבִּקְעָ֑ה וְהִ֖יא מְלֵאָ֥ה עֲצָמֽוֹת׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small>’s hand came upon me. I was taken out by the spirit of G<small>OD</small> and set down in the valley. It was full of bones.
Transliteration: hayetah alay yad-yehovah vayyvotsieniy verucha yehovah vayeniycheniy vetvokhe havikeah vehiy meleah atsamvot

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱבִירַ֥נִי עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב וְהִנֵּ֨ה רַבּ֤וֹת מְאֹד֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַבִּקְעָ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֖ה יְבֵשׁ֥וֹת מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: [God] led me all around them; there were very many of them spread over the valley, and they were very dry.
Transliteration: veheeviyraniy aleyhem saviyv <small></small> saviyv vehineh ravvot meod al-feney havikeah vehineh yeveshvot meod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הֲתִֽחְיֶ֖ינָה הָעֲצָמ֣וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה וָאֹמַ֕ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה אַתָּ֥ה יָדָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated: I was asked, “O mortal, can these bones live again?” I replied, “O my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, only You know.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam haticheyeynah haatsamvot haeleh vaomar adonay yehovih atah yadaeta

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י הִנָּבֵ֖א עַל־הָעֲצָמ֣וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם הָֽעֲצָמוֹת֙ הַיְבֵשׁ֔וֹת שִׁמְע֖וּ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And I was told, “Prophesy over these bones and say to them: O dry bones, hear the word of G<small>OD</small>!
Transliteration: vayomer elay hinave al-haatsamvot haeleh veamareta aleyhem haatsamvot hayeveshvot shimeu devar-yehovah

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה לָעֲצָמ֖וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה הִנֵּ֨ה אֲנִ֜י מֵבִ֥יא בָכֶ֛ם ר֖וּחַ וִחְיִיתֶֽם׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small> to these bones: I will cause breath to enter you and you shall live again.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih laatsamvot haeleh hineh aniy meviy vakhem rucha vicheyiytem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּי֩ עֲלֵיכֶ֨ם גִּידִ֜ים וְֽהַעֲלֵתִ֧י עֲלֵיכֶ֣ם בָּשָׂ֗ר וְקָרַמְתִּ֤י עֲלֵיכֶם֙ ע֔וֹר וְנָתַתִּ֥י בָכֶ֛ם ר֖וּחַ וִחְיִיתֶ֑ם וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will lay sinews upon you, and cover you with flesh, and form skin over you. And I will put breath into you, and you shall live again. And you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>!”
Transliteration: venatatiy aleykhem giydiym vehaaletiy aleykhem vashar vekarametiy aleykhem vor venatatiy vakhem rucha vicheyiytem viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְנִבֵּ֖אתִי כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צֻוֵּ֑יתִי וַֽיְהִי־ק֤וֹל כְּהִנָּֽבְאִי֙ וְהִנֵּה־רַ֔עַשׁ וַתִּקְרְב֣וּ עֲצָמ֔וֹת עֶ֖צֶם אֶל־עַצְמֽוֹ׃
Translated: I prophesied as I had been commanded. And while I was prophesying, suddenly there was a sound of rattling, and the bones came together, bone to matching bone.
Transliteration: venivetiy khaasher tsuveytiy vayehiy-kvol khehinaveiy vehineh-raash vatikerevu atsamvot etsem el-atsemvo

Hebrew: וְרָאִ֜יתִי וְהִנֵּֽה־עֲלֵיהֶ֤ם גִּדִים֙ וּבָשָׂ֣ר עָלָ֔ה וַיִּקְרַ֧ם עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם ע֖וֹר מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְר֖וּחַ אֵ֥ין בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: I looked, and there were sinews on them, and flesh had grown, and skin had formed over them; but there was no breath in them.
Transliteration: veraiytiy vehineh-aleyhem gidiym uvashar alah vayikeram aleyhem vor milemaelah verucha eyn vahem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י הִנָּבֵ֖א אֶל־הָר֑וּחַ הִנָּבֵ֣א בֶן־אָ֠דָ֠ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֨ אֶל־הָר֜וּחַ {ס} כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה מֵאַרְבַּ֤ע רוּחוֹת֙ בֹּ֣אִי הָר֔וּחַ וּפְחִ֛י בַּהֲרוּגִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְיִֽחְיֽוּ׃
Translated: Then [God] said to me, “Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, O mortal! Say to the breath: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Come, O breath, from the four winds, and breathe into these slain, that they may live again.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay hinave el-harucha hinave ven-adam veamareta el-harucha {s} khoh-amar adonay yehovih meareva ruchvot voiy harucha ufechiy vaharugiym haeleh veyicheyu

Hebrew: וְהִנַּבֵּ֖אתִי כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֑נִי וַתָּבוֹא֩ בָהֶ֨ם הָר֜וּחַ וַיִּֽחְי֗וּ וַיַּֽעַמְדוּ֙ עַל־רַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם חַ֖יִל גָּד֥וֹל מְאֹד־מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: I prophesied as I was commanded. The breath entered them, and they came to life and stood up on their feet, a vast multitude.
Transliteration: vehinavetiy khaasher tsivaniy vatavvo vahem harucha vayicheyu vayaamedu al-rageleyhem chayiil gadvol meod-meod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ אֵלַי֒ בֶּן־אָדָ֕ם הָעֲצָמ֣וֹת הָאֵ֔לֶּה כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵ֑מָּה הִנֵּ֣ה אֹמְרִ֗ים יָבְשׁ֧וּ עַצְמוֹתֵ֛ינוּ וְאָבְדָ֥ה תִקְוָתֵ֖נוּ נִגְזַ֥רְנוּ לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: And I was told, “O mortal, these bones are the whole House of Israel. They say, ‘Our bones are dried up, our hope is gone; we are doomed.’
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam haatsamvot haeleh khׇl-veyt yisherael hemah hineh omeriym yaveshu atsemvoteynu veavedah tikevatenu nigezarenu lanu

Hebrew: לָכֵן֩ הִנָּבֵ֨א וְאָמַרְתָּ֜ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ הִנֵּה֩ אֲנִ֨י פֹתֵ֜חַ אֶת־קִבְרֽוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם וְהַעֲלֵיתִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִקִּבְרוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם עַמִּ֑י וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֶל־אַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Prophesy, therefore, and say to them: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to open your graves and lift you out of the graves, O My people, and bring you to the land of Israel.
Transliteration: lakhen hinave veamareta aleyhem khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineh aniy fotecha et-kivervoteykhem vehaaleytiy etekhem mikivervoteykhem amiy vehevetiy etekhem el-ademat yisherael

Hebrew: וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּפִתְחִ֣י אֶת־קִבְרֽוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם וּבְהַעֲלוֹתִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִקִּבְרוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם עַמִּֽי׃
Translated: You shall know, O My people, that I am G<small>OD</small>, when I have opened your graves and lifted you out of your graves.
Transliteration: viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah vefitechiy et-kivervoteykhem uvehaalvotiy etekhem mikivervoteykhem amiy

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֨י רוּחִ֤י בָכֶם֙ וִחְיִיתֶ֔ם וְהִנַּחְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם עַל־אַדְמַתְכֶ֑ם וִידַעְתֶּ֞ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי וְעָשִׂ֖יתִי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will put My breath into you and you shall live again, and I will set you upon your own soil. Then you shall know that I, G<small>OD</small>, have spoken and have acted”—declares G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: venatatiy ruchiy vakhem vicheyiytem vehinachetiy etekhem al-adematekhem viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah divaretiy veashiytiy neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם קַח־לְךָ֙ עֵ֣ץ אֶחָ֔ד וּכְתֹ֤ב עָלָיו֙ לִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וְלִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל חֲבֵרָ֑ו וּלְקַח֙ עֵ֣ץ אֶחָ֔ד וּכְת֣וֹב עָלָ֗יו לְיוֹסֵף֙ עֵ֣ץ אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְכׇל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל חֲבֵרָֽו׃
Translated: And you, O mortal, take a stick and write on it, “Of Judah and the Israelites associated with him”; and take another stick and write on it, “Of Joseph—the stick of Ephraim—and all the House of Israel associated with him.”
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam kach-lekha ets echad ukhetov alayv liyhudah veliveney yisherael chaverav ulekach ets echad ukhetvov alayv leyvosef ets eferayiim vekhׇl-veyt yisherael chaverav

Hebrew: וְקָרַ֨ב אֹתָ֜ם אֶחָ֧ד אֶל־אֶחָ֛ד לְךָ֖ לְעֵ֣ץ אֶחָ֑ד וְהָי֥וּ לַאֲחָדִ֖ים בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Bring them close to each other, so that they become one stick, joined together in your hand.
Transliteration: vekarav otam echad el-echad lekha leets echad vehayu laachadiym veyadekha

Hebrew: וְכַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ יֹאמְר֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ בְּנֵ֥י עַמְּךָ֖ לֵאמֹ֑ר הֲלֽוֹא־תַגִּ֥יד לָ֖נוּ מָה־אֵ֥לֶּה לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And when any of your people ask you, “Won’t you tell us what these actions of yours mean?”
Transliteration: vekhaasher yomeru eleykha veney amekha lemor halvo-tagiyd lanu mah-eleh lakhe

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ הִנֵּה֩ אֲנִ֨י לֹקֵ֜חַ אֶת־עֵ֤ץ יוֹסֵף֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיַד־אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְשִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל חֲבֵרָ֑ו וְנָתַתִּי֩ אוֹתָ֨ם עָלָ֜יו אֶת־עֵ֣ץ יְהוּדָ֗ה וַֽעֲשִׂיתִם֙ לְעֵ֣ץ אֶחָ֔ד וְהָי֥וּ אֶחָ֖ד בְּיָדִֽי׃
Translated: answer them, “Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to take the stick of Joseph—which is in the hand of Ephraim—and of the tribes of Israel associated with him, and I will place the stick of Judah upon it and make them into one stick; they shall be joined in My hand.”
Transliteration: daver alehem khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineh aniy lokecha et-ets yvosef asher veyad-eferayiim veshivetey yisherael chaverav venatatiy votam alayv et-ets yehudah vaashiytim leets echad vehayu echad veyadiy

Hebrew: וְהָי֨וּ הָעֵצִ֜ים אֲֽשֶׁר־תִּכְתֹּ֧ב עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם בְּיָדְךָ֖ לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall hold up before their eyes the sticks that you have inscribed,
Transliteration: vehayu haetsiym asher-tikhetov aleyhem veyadekha leeyneyhem

Hebrew: וְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ הִנֵּ֨ה אֲנִ֤י לֹקֵ֙חַ֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִבֵּ֥ין הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָֽלְכוּ־שָׁ֑ם וְקִבַּצְתִּ֤י אֹתָם֙ מִסָּבִ֔יב וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י אוֹתָ֖ם אֶל־אַדְמָתָֽם׃
Translated: and you shall declare to them: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to take the Israelite people from among the nations they have gone to, and gather them from every quarter, and bring them to their own land.
Transliteration: vedaver aleyhem khoh-amar adonay yehovih hineh aniy lokecha et-veney yisherael miveyn hagvoyim asher halekhu-sham vekivatsetiy otam misaviyv vehevetiy votam el-adematam

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתִי אֹ֠תָ֠ם לְג֨וֹי אֶחָ֤ד בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ בְּהָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמֶ֧לֶךְ אֶחָ֛ד יִהְיֶ֥ה לְכֻלָּ֖ם לְמֶ֑לֶךְ וְלֹ֤א (יהיה) [יִֽהְיוּ־]עוֹד֙ לִשְׁנֵ֣י גוֹיִ֔ם וְלֹ֨א יֵחָ֥צוּ ע֛וֹד לִשְׁתֵּ֥י מַמְלָכ֖וֹת עֽוֹד׃
Translated: I will make them a single nation in the land, on the hills of Israel, and one king shall be king of them all. Never again shall they be two nations, and never again shall they be divided into two kingdoms.
Transliteration: veashiytiy otam legvoy echad vaarets veharey yisherael umelekhe echad yiheyeh lekhulam lemelekhe velo (yhyh) [yiheyu-]vod lisheney gvoyim velo eichatsu vod lishetey mamelakhvot vod

Hebrew: וְלֹ֧א יִֽטַּמְּא֣וּ ע֗וֹד בְּגִלּֽוּלֵיהֶם֙ וּבְשִׁקּ֣וּצֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְכֹ֖ל פִּשְׁעֵיהֶ֑ם וְהוֹשַׁעְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֗ם מִכֹּ֤ל מוֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטְא֣וּ בָהֶ֔ם וְטִהַרְתִּ֤י אוֹתָם֙ וְהָיוּ־לִ֣י לְעָ֔ם וַאֲנִ֕י אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Nor shall they ever again defile themselves by their fetishes and their abhorrent things, and by their other transgressions. I will save them in all their settlements where they sinned, and I will purify them. Then they shall be My people, and I will be their God.
Transliteration: velo yitameu vod vegiluleyhem uveshikutseyhem uvekhol fisheeyhem vehvoshaetiy otam mikhol mvoshevoteyhem asher chateu vahem vetiharetiy votam vehayu-liy leam vaaniy eheyeh lahem lelohiym

Hebrew: וְעַבְדִּ֤י דָוִד֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וְרוֹעֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד יִהְיֶ֣ה לְכֻלָּ֑ם וּבְמִשְׁפָּטַ֣י יֵלֵ֔כוּ וְחֻקּוֹתַ֥י יִשְׁמְר֖וּ וְעָשׂ֥וּ אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: My servant David shall be king over them; there shall be one shepherd for all of them. They shall follow My rules and faithfully obey My laws.
Transliteration: veavediy david melekhe aleyhem vervoeh echad yiheyeh lekhulam uvemishefatay eilekhu vechukvotay yishemeru veashu votam

Hebrew: וְיָשְׁב֣וּ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָתַ֙תִּי֙ לְעַבְדִּ֣י לְיַֽעֲקֹ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָֽשְׁבוּ־בָ֖הּ אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְיָשְׁב֣וּ עָלֶ֡יהָ הֵ֠מָּה וּבְנֵיהֶ֞ם וּבְנֵ֤י בְנֵיהֶם֙ עַד־עוֹלָ֔ם וְדָוִ֣ד עַבְדִּ֔י נָשִׂ֥יא לָהֶ֖ם לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Thus they shall remain in the land that I gave to My servant Jacob and in which your ancestors dwelt; they and their children and their children’s children shall dwell there forever, with My servant David as their prince for all time.
Transliteration: veyashevu al-haarets asher natatiy leavediy leyaakov asher yashevu-vah avvoteykhem veyashevu aleyha hemah uveneyhem uveney veneyhem ad-volam vedavid avediy nashiy lahem levolam

Hebrew: וְכָרַתִּ֤י לָהֶם֙ בְּרִ֣ית שָׁל֔וֹם בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָ֖ם יִהְיֶ֣ה אוֹתָ֑ם וּנְתַתִּים֙ וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֣י אוֹתָ֔ם וְנָתַתִּ֧י אֶת־מִקְדָּשִׁ֛י בְּתוֹכָ֖ם לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: I will make a covenant of friendship with them—it shall be an everlasting covenant with them—I will establish them and multiply them, and I will place My Sanctuary among them forever.
Transliteration: vekharatiy lahem veriyt shalvom veriyt volam yiheyeh votam unetatiym vehireveytiy votam venatatiy et-mikedashiy vetvokham levolam

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה מִשְׁכָּנִי֙ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים וְהֵ֖מָּה יִהְיוּ־לִ֥י לְעָֽם׃
Translated: My Presence shall rest over them; I will be their God and they shall be My people.
Transliteration: vehayah mishekhaniy aleyhem vehayiytiy lahem lelohiym vehemah yiheyu-liy leam

Hebrew: וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה מְקַדֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בִּהְי֧וֹת מִקְדָּשִׁ֛י בְּתוֹכָ֖ם לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: And when My Sanctuary abides among them forever, the nations shall know that I, G<small>OD</small>, do sanctify Israel.
Transliteration: veyadeu hagvoyim khiy aniy yehovah mekadesh et-yisherael viheyvot mikedashiy vetvokham levolam {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to me:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אָדָ֗ם שִׂ֤ים פָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־גּוֹג֙ אֶ֣רֶץ הַמָּג֔וֹג נְשִׂ֕יא רֹ֖אשׁ מֶ֣שֶׁךְ וְתֻבָ֑ל וְהִנָּבֵ֖א עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: O mortal, turn your face toward Gog of the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal. Prophesy against him
Transliteration: ven-adam shiym faneykha el-gvog erets hamagvog neshiy rosh meshekhe vetuval vehinave alayv

Hebrew: וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הִנְנִ֤י אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ גּ֔וֹג נְשִׂ֕יא רֹ֖אשׁ מֶ֥שֶׁךְ וְתֻבָֽל׃
Translated: and say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Lo, I am coming to deal with you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal!
Transliteration: veamareta khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy eleykha gvog neshiy rosh meshekhe vetuval

Hebrew: וְשׁ֣וֹבַבְתִּ֔יךָ וְנָתַתִּ֥י חַחִ֖ים בִּלְחָיֶ֑יךָ וְהוֹצֵאתִי֩ אוֹתְךָ֨ וְאֶת־כׇּל־חֵילֶ֜ךָ סוּסִ֣ים וּפָרָשִׁ֗ים לְבֻשֵׁ֤י מִכְלוֹל֙ כֻּלָּ֔ם קָהָ֥ל רָב֙ צִנָּ֣ה וּמָגֵ֔ן תֹּפְשֵׂ֥י חֲרָב֖וֹת כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: I will turn you around and put hooks in your jaws, and lead you out with all your army, horses, and riders, all of them clothed in splendor, a vast assembly, all of them with bucklers and shields, wielding swords.
Transliteration: veshvovavetiykha venatatiy chachiym vilechayeykha vehvotsetiy votekha veet-khׇl-cheylekha susiym ufarashiym levushey mikhelvol khulam kahal rav tsinah umagen tofeshey charavvot khulam

Hebrew: פָּרַ֛ס כּ֥וּשׁ וּפ֖וּט אִתָּ֑ם כֻּלָּ֖ם מָגֵ֥ן וְכוֹבָֽע׃
Translated: Among them shall be Persia, Cush, and Put, everyone with shield and helmet;
Transliteration: faras khush ufut itam khulam magen vekhvova

Hebrew: גֹּ֚מֶר וְכׇל־אֲגַפֶּ֔יהָ בֵּ֚ית תּֽוֹגַרְמָ֔ה יַרְכְּתֵ֥י צָפ֖וֹן וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲגַפָּ֑יו עַמִּ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Gomer and all its cohorts, Beth-togarmah [in] the remotest parts of the north and all its cohorts—the many peoples with you.
Transliteration: gomer vekhׇl-agafeyha veyt tvogaremah yarekhetey tsafvon veet-khׇl-agafayv amiym raviym itakhe

Hebrew: הִכֹּן֙ וְהָכֵ֣ן לְךָ֔ אַתָּ֕ה וְכׇל־קְהָלֶ֖ךָ הַנִּקְהָלִ֣ים עָלֶ֑יךָ וְהָיִ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם לְמִשְׁמָֽר׃
Translated: Be ready, prepare yourselves, you and all the battalions mustered about you, and hold yourself in reserve for them.
Transliteration: hikhon vehakhen lekha atah vekhׇl-kehalekha hanikehaliym aleykha vehayiyta lahem lemishemar

Hebrew: מִיָּמִ֣ים רַבִּים֮ תִּפָּקֵד֒ בְּאַחֲרִ֨ית הַשָּׁנִ֜ים תָּב֣וֹא ׀ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ ׀ מְשׁוֹבֶ֣בֶת מֵחֶ֗רֶב מְקֻבֶּ֙צֶת֙ מֵעַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים עַ֚ל הָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־הָי֥וּ לְחׇרְבָּ֖ה תָּמִ֑יד וְהִיא֙ מֵעַמִּ֣ים הוּצָ֔אָה וְיָשְׁב֥וּ לָבֶ֖טַח כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: After a long time you shall be summoned; in the distant future you shall march against the land [of a people] restored from the sword, gathered from the midst of many peoples—against the mountains of Israel, which have long lain desolate—[a people] liberated from the nations, and now all dwelling secure.
Transliteration: miyamiym raviym tifaked veachariyt hashaniym tavvo el-erets meshvovevet mecherev mekuvetset meamiym raviym al harey yisherael asher-hayu lechׇrevah tamiyd vehiy meamiym hutsaah veyashevu lavetach khulam

Hebrew: וְעָלִ֙יתָ֙ כַּשֹּׁאָ֣ה תָב֔וֹא כֶּעָנָ֛ן לְכַסּ֥וֹת הָאָ֖רֶץ תִּֽהְיֶ֑ה אַתָּה֙ וְכׇל־אֲגַפֶּ֔יךָ וְעַמִּ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים אוֹתָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall advance, coming like a storm; you shall be like a cloud covering the earth, you and all your cohorts, and the many peoples with you.
Transliteration: vealiyta khashoah tavvo kheanan lekhasvot haarets tiheyeh atah vekhׇl-agafeykha veamiym raviym votakhe {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יַעֲל֤וּ דְבָרִים֙ עַל־לְבָבֶ֔ךָ וְחָשַׁבְתָּ֖ מַחֲשֶׁ֥בֶת רָעָֽה׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: On that day, a thought will occur to you, and you will conceive a wicked design.
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih vehayah vayyvom hahu yaalu devariym al-levavekha vechashaveta machashevet raah

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ אֶֽעֱלֶה֙ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ פְּרָז֔וֹת אָבוֹא֙ הַשֹּׁ֣קְטִ֔ים יֹשְׁבֵ֖י לָבֶ֑טַח כֻּלָּ֗ם יֹֽשְׁבִים֙ בְּאֵ֣ין חוֹמָ֔ה וּבְרִ֥יחַ וּדְלָתַ֖יִם אֵ֥ין לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: You will say, “I will invade a land of open towns, I will fall upon a tranquil people living secure, all of them living in unwalled towns and lacking bars and gates,
Transliteration: veamareta eeleh al-erets ferazvot avvo hashoketiym yoshevey lavetach khulam yosheviym veeyn chvomah uveriycha udelatayiim eyn lahem

Hebrew: לִשְׁלֹ֥ל שָׁלָ֖ל וְלָבֹ֣ז בַּ֑ז לְהָשִׁ֨יב יָדְךָ֜ עַל־חֳרָב֣וֹת נוֹשָׁב֗וֹת וְאֶל־עַם֙ מְאֻסָּ֣ף מִגּוֹיִ֔ם עֹשֶׂה֙ מִקְנֶ֣ה וְקִנְיָ֔ן יֹשְׁבֵ֖י עַל־טַבּ֥וּר הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: in order to take spoil and seize plunder”—to turn your hand against repopulated wastes, and against a people gathered from among nations, acquiring livestock and possessions, living at the center of the earth.
Transliteration: lishelol shalal velavoz vaz lehashiyv yadekha al-choravvot nvoshavvot veel-am meusaf migvoyim osheh mikeneh vekineyan yoshevey al-tavur haarets

Hebrew: שְׁבָ֡א וּ֠דְדָ֠ן וְסֹחֲרֵ֨י תַרְשִׁ֤ישׁ וְכׇל־כְּפִירֶ֙יהָ֙ יֹאמְר֣וּ לְךָ֔ הֲלִשְׁלֹ֤ל שָׁלָל֙ אַתָּ֣ה בָ֔א הֲלָבֹ֥ז בַּ֖ז הִקְהַ֣לְתָּ קְהָלֶ֑ךָ לָשֵׂ֣את ׀ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֗ב לָקַ֙חַת֙ מִקְנֶ֣ה וְקִנְיָ֔ן לִשְׁלֹ֖ל שָׁלָ֥ל גָּדֽוֹל׃ {ס}
Translated: Sheba and Dedan, and the merchants and all the magnates of Tarshish will say to you, “Have you come to take spoil? Is it to seize plunder that you assembled your hordes—to carry off silver and gold, to make off with livestock and goods, to gather an immense booty?”
Transliteration: sheva udedan vesocharey tareshiysh vekhׇl-khefiyreyha yomeru lekha halishelol shalal atah va halavoz vaz hikehaleta kehalekha lashet khesef vezahav lakachat mikeneh vekineyan lishelol shalal gadvol {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ הִנָּבֵ֣א בֶן־אָדָ֔ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ לְג֔וֹג כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הֲל֣וֹא ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא בְּשֶׁ֨בֶת עַמִּ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לָבֶ֖טַח תֵּדָֽע׃
Translated: Therefore prophesy, O mortal, and say to Gog: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Surely, on that day, when My people Israel are living secure, you will take note,
Transliteration: lakhen hinave ven-adam veamareta legvog khoh amar adonay yehovih halvo vayyvom hahu veshevet amiy yisherael lavetach teda

Hebrew: וּבָ֤אתָ מִמְּקֽוֹמְךָ֙ מִיַּרְכְּתֵ֣י צָפ֔וֹן אַתָּ֕ה וְעַמִּ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים אִתָּ֑ךְ רֹכְבֵ֤י סוּסִים֙ כֻּלָּ֔ם קָהָ֥ל גָּד֖וֹל וְחַ֥יִל רָֽב׃
Translated: and you will come from your home in the farthest north, you and many peoples with you—all of them mounted on horses, a vast horde, a mighty army—
Transliteration: uvata mimekvomekha miyarekhetey tsafvon atah veamiym raviym itakhe rokhevey susiym khulam kahal gadvol vechayiil rav

Hebrew: וְעָלִ֙יתָ֙ עַל־עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כֶּעָנָ֖ן לְכַסּ֣וֹת הָאָ֑רֶץ בְּאַחֲרִ֨ית הַיָּמִ֜ים תִּהְיֶ֗ה וַהֲבִאוֹתִ֙יךָ֙ עַל־אַרְצִ֔י לְמַ֩עַן֩ דַּ֨עַת הַגּוֹיִ֜ם אֹתִ֗י בְּהִקָּדְשִׁ֥י בְךָ֛ לְעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם גּֽוֹג׃ {ס}
Translated: and you will advance upon My people Israel, like a cloud covering the earth. This shall happen on that distant day: I will bring you to My land, that the nations may know Me when, before their eyes, I manifest My holiness through you, O Gog!
Transliteration: vealiyta al-amiy yisherael kheanan lekhasvot haarets veachariyt hayamiym tiheyeh vahavivotiykha al-aretsiy lemaan daat hagvoyim otiy vehikadeshiy vekha leeyneyhem gvog {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה הַאַתָּה־ה֨וּא אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֜רְתִּי בְּיָמִ֣ים קַדְמוֹנִ֗ים בְּיַד֙ עֲבָדַי֙ נְבִיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַֽנִּבְּאִ֛ים בַּיָּמִ֥ים הָהֵ֖ם שָׁנִ֑ים לְהָבִ֥יא אֹתְךָ֖ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Why, you are the one I spoke of in ancient days through My servants, the prophets of Israel, who prophesied for years in those days that I would bring you against them!
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih haatah-hu asher-divaretiy veyamiym kademvoniym veyad avaday neviyey yisherael haniveiym vayamiym hahem shaniym lehaviy otekha aleyhem {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא בְּי֨וֹם בּ֥וֹא גוֹג֙ עַל־אַדְמַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה תַּעֲלֶ֥ה חֲמָתִ֖י בְּאַפִּֽי׃
Translated: On that day, when Gog sets foot on the soil of Israel—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—My raging anger shall flare up.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu veyvom vvo gvog al-ademat yisherael neum adonay yehovih taaleh chamatiy veafiy

Hebrew: וּבְקִנְאָתִ֥י בְאֵשׁ־עֶבְרָתִ֖י דִּבַּ֑רְתִּי אִם־לֹ֣א ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִֽהְיֶה֙ רַ֣עַשׁ גָּד֔וֹל עַ֖ל אַדְמַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For I have decreed in My indignation and in My blazing wrath: On that day, a terrible earthquake shall befall the land of Israel.
Transliteration: uvekineatiy veesh-everatiy divaretiy im-lo vayyvom hahu yiheyeh raash gadvol al ademat yisherael

Hebrew: וְרָעֲשׁ֣וּ מִפָּנַ֡י דְּגֵ֣י הַיָּם֩ וְע֨וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם וְחַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה וְכׇל־הָרֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ הָרֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאֲדָמָ֔ה וְכֹל֙ הָאָדָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה וְנֶהֶרְס֣וּ הֶהָרִ֗ים וְנָֽפְלוּ֙ הַמַּדְרֵג֔וֹת וְכׇל־חוֹמָ֖ה לָאָ֥רֶץ תִּפּֽוֹל׃
Translated: The fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the beasts of the field, all creeping things that move on the ground, and every human being on earth shall quake before Me. Mountains shall be overthrown, cliffs shall topple, and every wall shall crumble to the ground.
Transliteration: veraashu mifanay degey hayam vevof hashamayiim vechayat hashadeh vekhׇl-haremesh haromesh al-haadamah vekhol haadam asher al-feney haadamah veneheresu hehariym venafelu hamaderegvot vekhׇl-chvomah laarets tifvol

Hebrew: וְקָרָ֨אתִי עָלָ֤יו לְכׇל־הָרַי֙ חֶ֔רֶב נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה חֶ֥רֶב אִ֖ישׁ בְּאָחִ֥יו תִּהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: I will then summon the sword against him throughout My mountains—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—and every man’s sword shall be turned against his kin.
Transliteration: vekaratiy alayv lekhׇl-haray cherev neum adonay yehovih cherev iysh veachiyv tiheyeh

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁפַּטְתִּ֥י אִתּ֖וֹ בְּדֶ֣בֶר וּבְדָ֑ם וְגֶ֣שֶׁם שׁוֹטֵף֩ וְאַבְנֵ֨י אֶלְגָּבִ֜ישׁ אֵ֣שׁ וְגׇפְרִ֗ית אַמְטִ֤יר עָלָיו֙ וְעַל־אֲגַפָּ֔יו וְעַל־עַמִּ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: I will punish him with pestilence and with bloodshed; and I will pour torrential rain, hailstones, and sulfurous fire upon him and his hordes and the many peoples with him.
Transliteration: venishefatetiy itvo vedever uvedam vegeshem shvotef veaveney elegaviysh esh vegׇferiyt ametiyr alayv veal-agafayv veal-amiym raviym asher itvo

Hebrew: וְהִתְגַּדִּלְתִּי֙ וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתִּ֔י וְנ֣וֹדַעְתִּ֔י לְעֵינֵ֖י גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֑ים וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus will I manifest My greatness and My holiness, and make Myself known in the sight of many nations. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehitegadiletiy vehitekadishetiy venvodaetiy leeyney gvoyim raviym veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה בֶן־אָדָם֙ הִנָּבֵ֣א עַל־גּ֔וֹג וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה הִנְנִ֤י אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ גּ֔וֹג נְשִׂ֕יא רֹ֖אשׁ מֶ֥שֶׁךְ וְתֻבָֽל׃
Translated: And you, O mortal, prophesy against Gog and say: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I am going to deal with you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal!
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam hinave al-gvog veamareta khoh amar adonay yehovih hineniy eleykha gvog neshiy rosh meshekhe vetuval

Hebrew: וְשֹׁבַבְתִּ֙יךָ֙ וְשִׁשֵּׁאתִ֔יךָ וְהַעֲלִיתִ֖יךָ מִיַּרְכְּתֵ֣י צָפ֑וֹן וַהֲבִאוֹתִ֖ךָ עַל־הָרֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: I will turn you around and drive you on, and I will take you from the far north and lead you toward the mountains of Israel.
Transliteration: veshovavetiykha veshishetiykha vehaaliytiykha miyarekhetey tsafvon vahavivotikha al-harey yisherael

Hebrew: וְהִכֵּיתִ֥י קַשְׁתְּךָ֖ מִיַּ֣ד שְׂמֹאולֶ֑ךָ וְחִצֶּ֕יךָ מִיַּ֥ד יְמִינְךָ֖ אַפִּֽיל׃
Translated: I will strike your bow from your left hand and I will loosen the arrows from your right hand.
Transliteration: vehikheytiy kashetekha miyad shemovlekha vechitseykha miyad yemiynekha afiyl

Hebrew: עַל־הָרֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל תִּפּ֗וֹל אַתָּה֙ וְכׇל־אֲגַפֶּ֔יךָ וְעַמִּ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתָּ֑ךְ לְעֵ֨יט צִפּ֧וֹר כׇּל־כָּנָ֛ף וְחַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה נְתַתִּ֥יךָ לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
Translated: You shall fall on the mountains of Israel, you and all your battalions and the peoples who are with you; and I will give you as food to carrion birds of every sort and to the beasts of the field,
Transliteration: al-harey yisherael tifvol atah vekhׇl-agafeykha veamiym asher itakhe leeyt tsifvor khׇl-khanaf vechayat hashadeh netatiykha leׇkhelah

Hebrew: עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה תִּפּ֑וֹל כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י דִבַּ֔רְתִּי נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: as you lie in the open field. For I have spoken—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: al-feney hashadeh tifvol khiy aniy divaretiy neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי־אֵ֣שׁ בְּמָג֔וֹג וּבְיֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאִיִּ֖ים לָבֶ֑טַח וְיָדְע֖וּ כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And I will send a fire against Magog and against those who dwell secure in the coastlands. And they shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy-esh vemagvog uveyoshevey haiyiym lavetach veyadeu khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־שֵׁ֨ם קׇדְשִׁ֜י אוֹדִ֗יעַ בְּתוֹךְ֙ עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלֹא־אַחֵ֥ל אֶת־שֵׁם־קׇדְשִׁ֖י ע֑וֹד וְיָדְע֤וּ הַגּוֹיִם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה קָד֖וֹשׁ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: I will make My holy name known among My people Israel, and never again will I let My holy name be profaned. And the nations shall know that I, G<small>OD</small>, am holy in Israel.
Transliteration: veet-shem kׇdeshiy vodiya vetvokhe amiy yisherael velo-achel et-shem-kׇdeshiy vod veyadeu hagvoyim khiy-aniy yehovah kadvosh veyisherael

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה בָאָה֙ וְנִֽהְיָ֔תָה נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה ה֥וּא הַיּ֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתִּי׃
Translated: Ah! it has come, it has happened—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: this is that day that I decreed.
Transliteration: hineh vaah veniheyatah neum adonay yehovih hu hayyvom asher divaretiy

Hebrew: וְֽיָצְא֞וּ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י ׀ עָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּבִעֲר֡וּ וְ֠הִשִּׂ֠יקוּ בְּנֶ֨שֶׁק וּמָגֵ֤ן וְצִנָּה֙ בְּקֶ֣שֶׁת וּבְחִצִּ֔ים וּבְמַקֵּ֥ל יָ֖ד וּבְרֹ֑מַח וּבִעֲר֥וּ בָהֶ֛ם אֵ֖שׁ שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: Then the inhabitants of the cities of Israel will go out and make fires and feed them with the weapons—shields and bucklers, bows and arrows, clubs and spears; they shall use them as fuel for seven years.
Transliteration: veyatseu yoshevey arey yisherael uviaru vehishiyku veneshek umagen vetsinah vekeshet uvechitsiym uvemakel yad uveromach uviaru vahem esh sheva shaniym

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִשְׂא֨וּ עֵצִ֜ים מִן־הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה וְלֹ֤א יַחְטְבוּ֙ מִן־הַיְּעָרִ֔ים כִּ֥י בַנֶּ֖שֶׁק יְבַעֲרוּ־אֵ֑שׁ וְשָׁלְל֣וּ אֶת־שֹׁלְלֵיהֶ֗ם וּבָֽזְזוּ֙ אֶת־בֹּ֣זְזֵיהֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: They will not gather firewood in the fields or cut any in the forests, but will use the weapons as fuel for their fires. They will despoil those who despoiled them and plunder those who plundered them—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velo-yisheu etsiym min-hashadeh velo yachetevu min-hayeariym khiy vaneshek yevaaru-esh veshalelu et-sholeleyhem uvazezu et-vozezeyhem neum adonay yehovih {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה בַיּ֣וֹם הַה֡וּא אֶתֵּ֣ן לְגוֹג֩ <small>׀</small> מְקֽוֹם־שָׁ֨ם קֶ֜בֶר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל גֵּ֤י הָעֹֽבְרִים֙ קִדְמַ֣ת הַיָּ֔ם וְחֹסֶ֥מֶת הִ֖יא אֶת־הָעֹֽבְרִ֑ים וְקָ֣בְרוּ שָׁ֗ם אֶת־גּוֹג֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הֲמוֹנֹ֔ה וְקָ֣רְא֔וּ גֵּ֖יא הֲמ֥וֹן גּֽוֹג׃
Translated: On that day I will assign to Gog a burial site there in Israel—the Valley of the Travelers, east of the Sea. It shall block the path of travelers, for there Gog and all his multitude will be buried. It shall be called the Valley of Gog’s Multitude.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu eten legvog <small></small> mekvom-sham kever veyisherael gey haoveriym kidemat hayam vechosemet hiy et-haoveriym vekaveru sham et-gvog veet-khׇl-hamvonoh vekareu gey hamvon gvog

Hebrew: וּקְבָרוּם֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְמַ֖עַן טַהֵ֣ר אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ שִׁבְעָ֖ה חֳדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: The House of Israel shall spend seven months burying them, in order to purify the land;
Transliteration: ukevarum veyt yisherael lemaan taher et-haarets shiveah chodashiym

Hebrew: וְקָֽבְרוּ֙ כׇּל־עַ֣ם הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהָיָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לְשֵׁ֑ם י֚וֹם הִכָּ֣בְדִ֔י נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: all the people of the land shall bury them. The day I manifest My glory shall bring renown to them—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vekaveru khׇl-am haarets vehayah lahem leshem yvom hikhavediy neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְאַנְשֵׁ֨י תָמִ֤יד יַבְדִּ֙ילוּ֙ עֹבְרִ֣ים בָּאָ֔רֶץ מְקַבְּרִ֣ים אֶת־הָעֹבְרִ֗ים אֶת־הַנּוֹתָרִ֛ים עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ לְטַהֲרָ֑הּ מִקְצֵ֥ה שִׁבְעָה־חֳדָשִׁ֖ים יַחְקֹֽרוּ׃
Translated: And they shall appoint members of a corps to traverse the land and bury any invaders who remain above ground, in order to purify it. The search shall go on for a period of seven months.
Transliteration: veaneshey tamiyd yavediylu overiym vaarets mekaveriym et-haoveriym et-hanvotariym al-feney haarets letaharah miketseh shiveah-chodashiym yachekoru

Hebrew: וְעָבְר֤וּ הָעֹֽבְרִים֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וְרָאָה֙ עֶ֣צֶם אָדָ֔ם וּבָנָ֥ה אֶצְל֖וֹ צִיּ֑וּן עַ֣ד קָבְר֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ הַֽמְקַבְּרִ֔ים אֶל־גֵּ֖יא הֲמ֥וֹן גּֽוֹג׃
Translated: As those who traverse the country make their rounds, any one of them who sees a human bone shall erect a marker beside it, until the buriers have interred them in the Valley of Gog’s Multitude.
Transliteration: veaveru haoveriym vaarets veraah etsem adam uvanah etselvo tsiyyun ad kaveru otvo hamekaveriym el-gey hamvon gvog

Hebrew: וְגַ֥ם שֶׁם־עִ֛יר הֲמוֹנָ֖הֿ וְטִהֲר֥וּ הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: There shall also be a city named Multitude. And thus the land shall be purified.
Transliteration: vegam shem-iyr hamvonahֿ vetiharu haarets {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֨ה בֶן־אָדָ֜ם כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אֱמֹר֩ לְצִפּ֨וֹר כׇּל־כָּנָ֜ף וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה הִקָּבְצ֤וּ וָבֹ֙אוּ֙ הֵאָסְפ֣וּ מִסָּבִ֔יב עַל־זִבְחִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנִ֜י זֹבֵ֤חַ לָכֶם֙ זֶ֣בַח גָּד֔וֹל עַ֖ל הָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֥ם בָּשָׂ֖ר וּשְׁתִ֥יתֶם דָּֽם׃
Translated: And you, O mortal, say to every winged bird and to all the wild beasts: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Assemble, come and gather from all around for the sacrificial feast that I am preparing for you—a great sacrificial feast—upon the mountains of Israel, and eat flesh and drink blood.
Transliteration: veatah ven-adam khoh-amar adonay yehovih emor letsifvor khׇl-khanaf ulekhol chayat hashadeh hikavetsu vavou heasefu misaviyv al-zivechiy asher aniy zovecha lakhem zevach gadvol al harey yisherael vaakhaletem vashar ushetiytem dam

Hebrew: בְּשַׂ֤ר גִּבּוֹרִים֙ תֹּאכֵ֔לוּ וְדַם־נְשִׂיאֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ תִּשְׁתּ֑וּ אֵילִ֨ים כָּרִ֤ים וְעַתּוּדִים֙ פָּרִ֔ים מְרִיאֵ֥י בָשָׁ֖ן כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: You shall eat the flesh of warriors and drink the blood of the princes of the earth: rams, lambs, he-goats, and bulls—fatlings of Bashan all of them.
Transliteration: veshar givvoriym tokhelu vedam-neshiyey haarets tishetu eyliym khariym veatudiym fariym meriyey vashan khulam

Hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּם־חֵ֣לֶב לְשׇׂבְעָ֔ה וּשְׁתִ֥יתֶם דָּ֖ם לְשִׁכָּר֑וֹן מִזִּבְחִ֖י אֲשֶׁר־זָבַ֥חְתִּי לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall eat fat to satiety and drink your fill of blood from the sacrificial feast that I have prepared for you.
Transliteration: vaakhaletem-chelev leshׇveah ushetiytem dam leshikharvon mizivechiy asher-zavachetiy lakhem

Hebrew: וּשְׂבַעְתֶּ֤ם עַל־שֻׁלְחָנִי֙ ס֣וּס וָרֶ֔כֶב גִּבּ֖וֹר וְכׇל־אִ֣ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֑ה נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: And you shall sate yourselves at My table with horses, charioteers, warriors, and all soldiers—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: ushevaetem al-shulechaniy sus varekhev givvor vekhׇl-iysh milechamah neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י אֶת־כְּבוֹדִ֖י בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם וְרָא֣וּ כׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֶת־מִשְׁפָּטִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתִי וְאֶת־יָדִ֖י אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֥מְתִּי בָהֶֽם׃
Translated: Thus will I manifest My glory among the nations, and all the nations shall see the judgment that I executed and the power that I wielded against them.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-khevvodiy vagvoyim verau khׇl-hagvoyim et-mishefatiy asher ashiytiy veet-yadiy asher-shametiy vahem

Hebrew: וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם מִן־הַיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וָהָֽלְאָה׃
Translated: From that time on, the House of Israel shall know that I the E<small>TERNAL</small> am their God.
Transliteration: veyadeu veyt yisherael khiy aniy yehovah eloheyhem min-hayyvom hahu vahaleah

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֣וּ הַ֠גּוֹיִ֠ם כִּ֣י בַעֲוֺנָ֞ם גָּל֣וּ בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָעֲלוּ־בִ֔י וָאַסְתִּ֥ר פָּנַ֖י מֵהֶ֑ם וָֽאֶתְּנֵם֙ בְּיַ֣ד צָרֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּפְּל֥וּ בַחֶ֖רֶב כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: And the nations shall know that the House of Israel were exiled only for their iniquity, because they trespassed against Me, so that I hid My face from them and delivered them into the hands of their adversaries, and they all fell by the sword.
Transliteration: veyadeu hagvoyim khiy vaavonam galu veyt-yisherael al asher maalu-viy vaasetir fanay mehem vaetenem veyad tsareyhem vayifelu vacherev khulam

Hebrew: כְּטֻמְאָתָ֥ם וּכְפִשְׁעֵיהֶ֖ם עָשִׂ֣יתִי אֹתָ֑ם וָאַסְתִּ֥ר פָּנַ֖י מֵהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: When I hid My face from them, I dealt with them according to their impurity and their transgressions.
Transliteration: khetumeatam ukhefisheeyhem ashiytiy otam vaasetir fanay mehem {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה עַתָּ֗ה אָשִׁיב֙ אֶת־(שבית) [שְׁב֣וּת] יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְרִחַמְתִּ֖י כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְקִנֵּאתִ֖י לְשֵׁ֥ם קׇדְשִֽׁי׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: I will now restore the fortunes of Jacob and take the whole House of Israel back in love; and I will be zealous for My holy name.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih atah ashiyv et-(shvyt) [shevut] yaakov verichametiy khׇl-veyt yisherael vekinetiy leshem kׇdeshiy

Hebrew: וְנָשׂוּ֙ אֶת־כְּלִמָּתָ֔ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־מַעֲלָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָעֲלוּ־בִ֑י בְּשִׁבְתָּ֧ם עַל־אַדְמָתָ֛ם לָבֶ֖טַח וְאֵ֥ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃
Translated: They will bear their shame and all their trespasses that they committed against Me, when they dwell in their land secure and untroubled,
Transliteration: venashu et-khelimatam veet-khׇl-maalam asher maalu-viy veshivetam al-adematam lavetach veeyn machariyd

Hebrew: בְּשׁוֹבְבִ֤י אוֹתָם֙ מִן־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים וְקִבַּצְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֔ם מֵאַרְצ֖וֹת אֹיְבֵיהֶ֑ם וְנִקְדַּ֣שְׁתִּי בָ֔ם לְעֵינֵ֖י הַגּוֹיִ֥ם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated: when I have brought them back from among the peoples and gathered them out of the lands of their enemies and have manifested My holiness through them in the sight of many nations.
Transliteration: veshvoveviy votam min-haamiym vekivatsetiy otam mearetsvot oyeveyhem venikedashetiy vam leeyney hagvoyim raviym

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֗וּ כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם בְּהַגְלוֹתִ֤י אֹתָם֙ אֶל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וְכִנַּסְתִּ֖ים עַל־אַדְמָתָ֑ם וְלֹא־אוֹתִ֥יר ע֛וֹד מֵהֶ֖ם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: They shall know that I the E<small>TERNAL</small> am their G<small>OD</small> when, having exiled them among the nations, I gather them back into their land and leave none of them behind.
Transliteration: veyadeu khiy aniy yehovah eloheyhem vehagelvotiy otam el-hagvoyim vekhinasetiym al-adematam velo-votiyr vod mehem sham

Hebrew: וְלֹא־אַסְתִּ֥יר ע֛וֹד פָּנַ֖י מֵהֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁפַ֤כְתִּי אֶת־רוּחִי֙ עַל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I will never again hide My face from them, for I will pour out My spirit upon the House of Israel—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velo-asetiyr vod fanay mehem asher shafakhetiy et-ruchiy al-veyt yisherael neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: בְּעֶשְׂרִ֣ים וְחָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנָ֣ה לְ֠גָלוּתֵ֠נוּ בְּרֹ֨אשׁ הַשָּׁנָ֜ה בֶּעָשׂ֣וֹר לַחֹ֗דֶשׁ בְּאַרְבַּ֤ע עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה אַחַ֕ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֻכְּתָ֖ה הָעִ֑יר בְּעֶ֣צֶם ׀ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה הָיְתָ֤ה עָלַי֙ יַד־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתִ֖י שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, the fourteenth year after the city had fallen, at the beginning of the year, the tenth day of the month—on that very day—G<small>OD</small>’s hand came upon me, and it brought me there.
Transliteration: veesheriym vechamesh shanah legalutenu verosh hashanah veashvor lachodesh veareva eshereh shanah achar asher hukhetah haiyr veetsem hayyvom hazeh hayetah alay yad-yehovah vayave otiy shamah

Hebrew: בְּמַרְא֣וֹת אֱלֹהִ֔ים הֱבִיאַ֖נִי אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְנִיחֵ֗נִי אֶל־הַ֤ר גָּבֹ֙הַּ֙ מְאֹ֔ד וְעָלָ֥יו כְּמִבְנֵה־עִ֖יר מִנֶּֽגֶב׃
Translated: It brought me, in divine visions, to the Land of Israel, and set me down on a very high mountain on which there seemed to be the outline of a city on the south.
Transliteration: vemarevot Elohim heviyaniy el-erets yisherael vayeniycheniy el-har gavoha meod vealayv khemiveneh-iyr minegev

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֨יא אוֹתִ֜י שָׁ֗מָּה וְהִנֵּה־אִישׁ֙ מַרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ כְּמַרְאֵ֣ה נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וּפְתִיל־פִּשְׁתִּ֥ים בְּיָד֖וֹ וּקְנֵ֣ה הַמִּדָּ֑ה וְה֥וּא עֹמֵ֖ד בַּשָּֽׁעַר׃
Translated: It brought me over to it, and there, standing at the gate, was a figure who shone like copper. In his hand were a cord of linen and a measuring rod.
Transliteration: vayavey votiy shamah vehineh-iysh mareehu khemareeh nechoshet ufetiyl-fishetiym veyadvo ukeneh hamidah vehu omed vashaar

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֵלַ֜י הָאִ֗ישׁ בֶּן־אָדָ֡ם רְאֵ֣ה בְעֵינֶ֩יךָ֩ וּבְאׇזְנֶ֨יךָ שְּׁמָ֜ע וְשִׂ֣ים לִבְּךָ֗ לְכֹ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִי֙ מַרְאֶ֣ה אוֹתָ֔ךְ כִּ֛י לְמַ֥עַן הַרְאוֹתְכָ֖ה הֻבָ֣אתָה הֵ֑נָּה הַגֵּ֛ד אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה לְבֵ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He spoke to me: “Mortal, look closely and listen attentively and note well everything I am going to show you—for you have been brought here in order to be shown—and report everything you see to the House of Israel.”
Transliteration: vayedaver elay haiysh ven-adam reeh veeyneykha uveׇzeneykha shema veshiym livekha lekhol asher-aniy mareeh votakhe khiy lemaan harevotekhah huvatah henah haged et-khׇl-asher-atah roeh leveyt yisherael

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֥ה חוֹמָ֛ה מִח֥וּץ לַבַּ֖יִת סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב וּבְיַ֨ד הָאִ֜ישׁ קְנֵ֣ה הַמִּדָּ֗ה שֵׁשׁ־אַמּ֤וֹת בָּֽאַמָּה֙ וָטֹ֔פַח וַיָּ֜מׇד אֶת־רֹ֤חַב הַבִּנְיָן֙ קָנֶ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד וְקוֹמָ֖ה קָנֶ֥ה אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Along the outside of the temple [area] ran a wall on every side. The rod that the figure held was six cubits long, plus one handbreadth for each cubit; and when he applied it to that structure, it measured one rod deep and one rod high.
Transliteration: vehineh chvomah michuts lavayiit saviyv <small></small> saviyv uveyad haiysh keneh hamidah shesh-amvot vaamah vatofach vayamׇd et-rochav havineyan kaneh echad vekvomah kaneh echad

Hebrew: וַיָּב֗וֹא אֶל־שַׁ֙עַר֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר פָּנָיו֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַקָּדִ֔ימָה וַיַּ֖עַל בְּמַעֲלוֹתָ֑ו וַיָּ֣מׇד ׀ אֶת־סַ֣ף הַשַּׁ֗עַר קָנֶ֤ה אֶחָד֙ רֹ֔חַב וְאֵת֙ סַ֣ף אֶחָ֔ד קָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד רֹֽחַב׃
Translated: He went up to the gate that faced eastward and mounted its steps. He measured the threshold of the gate; it was one rod deep—the one threshold was one rod deep.
Transliteration: vayavvo el-shaar asher fanayv derekhe hakadiymah vayaal vemaalvotav vayamׇd et-saf hashaar kaneh echad rochav veet saf echad kaneh echad rochav

Hebrew: וְהַתָּ֗א קָנֶ֨ה אֶחָ֥ד אֹ֙רֶךְ֙ וְקָנֶ֤ה אֶחָד֙ רֹ֔חַב וּבֵ֥ין הַתָּאִ֖ים חָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֑וֹת וְסַ֣ף הַ֠שַּׁ֠עַר מֵאֵ֨צֶל אֻלָ֥ם הַשַּׁ֛עַר מֵהַבַּ֖יִת קָנֶ֥ה אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Each recess was one rod wide and one rod deep, with [a partition of] 5 cubits between recesses; and the threshold of the gate, at the inner vestibule of the gate, was one rod deep.
Transliteration: vehata kaneh echad orekhe vekaneh echad rochav uveyn hataiym chamesh amvot vesaf hashaar meetsel ulam hashaar mehavayiit kaneh echad

Hebrew: וַיָּ֜מׇד אֶת־אֻלָ֥ם הַשַּׁ֛עַר מֵהַבַּ֖יִת קָנֶ֥ה אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: For when he measured it at the inner vestibule of the gate, it was one rod [deep].
Transliteration: vayamׇd et-ulam hashaar mehavayiit kaneh echad

Hebrew: וַיָּ֜מׇד אֶת־אֻלָ֤ם הַשַּׁ֙עַר֙ שְׁמֹנֶ֣ה אַמּ֔וֹת וְאֵילָ֖ו שְׁתַּ֣יִם אַמּ֑וֹת וְאֻלָ֥ם הַשַּׁ֖עַר מֵהַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: Next he measured the vestibule of the gate, and it measured 8 cubits and its supports 2 cubits; the vestibule of the gate was at its inner end.
Transliteration: vayamׇd et-ulam hashaar shemoneh amvot veeylav shetayiim amvot veulam hashaar mehavayiit

Hebrew: וְתָאֵ֨י הַשַּׁ֜עַר דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַקָּדִ֗ים שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה מִפֹּה֙ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה מִפֹּ֔ה מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לִשְׁלׇשְׁתָּ֑ם וּמִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֛ת לָאֵילִ֖ם מִפֹּ֥ה וּמִפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: On either side of this eastern gate there were three recesses, all three of the same size; of identical sizes were also the supports on either side.
Transliteration: vetaey hashaar derekhe hakadiym sheloshah mifoh usheloshah mifoh midah achat lishelׇshetam umidah achat laeylim mifoh umifvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛מׇד אֶת־רֹ֥חַב פֶּתַח־הַשַּׁ֖עַר עֶ֣שֶׂר אַמּ֑וֹת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַשַּׁ֔עַר שְׁל֥וֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה אַמּֽוֹת׃
Translated: He measured the opening of the gate and found it 10 cubits wide, while the gate itself measured 13 cubits across.
Transliteration: vayamׇd et-rochav fetach-hashaar esher amvot orekhe hashaar shelvosh eshereh amvot

Hebrew: וּגְב֞וּל לִפְנֵ֤י הַתָּאוֹת֙ אַמָּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ת וְאַמָּֽה־אַחַ֥ת גְּב֖וּל מִפֹּ֑ה וְהַתָּ֕א שֵׁשׁ־אַמּ֣וֹת מִפּ֔וֹ וְשֵׁ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת מִפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: At the fronts of the recesses on either side were barriers of one cubit; the recesses on either side were 6 cubits [deep].
Transliteration: ugevul lifeney hatavot amah echat veamah-achat gevul mifoh vehata shesh-amvot mifvo veshesh amvot mifvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇד אֶת־הַשַּׁ֗עַר מִגַּ֤ג הַתָּא֙ לְגַגּ֔וֹ רֹ֕חַב עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְחָמֵ֖שׁ אַמּ֑וֹת פֶּ֖תַח נֶ֥גֶד פָּֽתַח׃
Translated: Their openings faced each other directly across the gate passage, so that when he measured from rear of recess to rear of recess he obtained a width of 25 cubits.
Transliteration: vayamׇd et-hashaar migag hata legagvo rochav esheriym vechamesh amvot fetach neged fatach

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־אֵילִ֖ים שִׁשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֑ה וְאֶל־אֵיל֙ הֶחָצֵ֔ר הַשַּׁ֖עַר סָבִ֥יב <small>׀</small> סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He made the vestibule—60 cubits—and the gate next to the support on every side of the court.
Transliteration: vayaash et-eyliym shishiym amah veel-eyl hechatser hashaar saviyv <small></small> saviyv

Hebrew: וְעַ֗ל פְּנֵי֙ הַשַּׁ֣עַר (היאתון) [הָאִית֔וֹן] עַל־לִפְנֵ֕י אֻלָ֥ם הַשַּׁ֖עַר הַפְּנִימִ֑י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: And [the distance] from the front of the outer gate to the front of the inner vestibule of the gate was 50 cubits.
Transliteration: veal feney hashaar (hytvn) [haiytvon] al-lifeney ulam hashaar hafeniymiy chamishiym amah

Hebrew: וְחַלּוֹנ֣וֹת אֲטֻמ֣וֹת אֶֽל־הַתָּאִ֡ים וְאֶל֩ אֵלֵיהֵ֨מָה לִפְנִ֤ימָה לַשַּׁ֙עַר֙ סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֔יב וְכֵ֖ן לָאֵֽלַמּ֑וֹת וְחַלּוֹנ֞וֹת סָבִ֤יב <small>׀</small> סָבִיב֙ לִפְנִ֔ימָה וְאֶל־אַ֖יִל תִּמֹרִֽים׃
Translated: The recesses—and their supports—had windows with frames on the interior of the gate complex on both sides, and the interiors of the vestibules also had windows on both sides; and the supports were adorned with palms.
Transliteration: vechalvonvot atumvot el-hataiym veel eleyhemah lifeniymah lashaar saviyv <small></small> saviyv vekhen laelamvot vechalvonvot saviyv <small></small> saviyv lifeniymah veel-ayiil timoriym

Hebrew: וַיְבִיאֵ֗נִי אֶל־הֶחָצֵר֙ הַחִ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֤ה לְשָׁכוֹת֙ וְרִֽצְפָ֔ה עָשׂ֥וּי לֶחָצֵ֖ר סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים לְשָׁכ֖וֹת אֶל־הָרִֽצְפָֽה׃
Translated: He took me into the outer court. There were chambers there, and there was a pavement laid out all around the court. There were 30 chambers on the pavement.
Transliteration: vayeviyeniy el-hechatser hachiytsvonah vehineh leshakhvot veritsefah ashuy lechatser saviyv <small></small> saviyv sheloshiym leshakhvot el-haritsefah

Hebrew: וְהָרִֽצְפָה֙ אֶל־כֶּ֣תֶף הַשְּׁעָרִ֔ים לְעֻמַּ֖ת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַשְּׁעָרִ֑ים הָרִֽצְפָ֖ה הַתַּחְתּוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: The pavements flanked the gates; the depth of the lower pavements paralleled that of the gates.
Transliteration: veharitsefah el-khetef hasheariym leumat orekhe hasheariym haritsefah hatachetvonah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇד רֹ֡חַב מִלִּפְנֵי֩ הַשַּׁ֨עַר הַתַּחְתּ֜וֹנָה לִפְנֵ֨י הֶחָצֵ֧ר הַפְּנִימִ֛י מִח֖וּץ מֵאָ֣ה אַמָּ֑ה הַקָּדִ֖ים וְהַצָּפֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Then he measured the width of the lower court, from in front of the inner gate to in front of the outer gate—100 cubits.
After the east [gate], the north [gate].
Transliteration: vayamׇd rochav milifeney hashaar hatachetvonah lifeney hechatser hafeniymiy michuts meah amah hakadiym vehatsafvon

Hebrew: וְהַשַּׁ֗עַר אֲשֶׁ֤ר פָּנָיו֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַצָּפ֔וֹן לֶחָצֵ֖ר הַחִיצוֹנָ֑ה מָדַ֥ד אׇרְכּ֖וֹ וְרׇחְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Next he measured the gate of the outer court that faced north: its length and its width,
Transliteration: vehashaar asher fanayv derekhe hatsafvon lechatser hachiytsvonah madad ׇrekhvo verׇchevvo

Hebrew: וְתָאָ֗ו שְׁלוֹשָׁ֤ה מִפּוֹ֙ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה מִפּ֔וֹ וְאֵילָ֤ו וְאֵֽלַמָּו֙ הָיָ֔ה כְּמִדַּ֖ת הַשַּׁ֣עַר הָרִאשׁ֑וֹן חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אׇרְכּ֔וֹ וְרֹ֕חַב חָמֵ֥שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים בָּאַמָּֽה׃
Translated: its three recesses on either side and its supports, as also its vestibule. It measured, like the first gate, 50 cubits in length and 25 cubits in width.
Transliteration: vetaav shelvoshah mifvo usheloshah mifvo veeylav veelamav hayah khemidat hashaar harishvon chamishiym amah ׇrekhvo verochav chamesh veesheriym vaamah

Hebrew: וְחַלּוֹנָ֤ו וְאֵֽילַמָּו֙ וְתִ֣ימֹרָ֔ו כְּמִדַּ֣ת הַשַּׁ֔עַר אֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּנָ֖יו דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַקָּדִ֑ים וּבְמַעֲל֥וֹת שֶׁ֙בַע֙ יַעֲלוּ־ב֔וֹ וְאֵילַמָּ֖ו לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Its windows and [those of] its vestibule, as also its palm trees, corresponded to those of the gate that faced east. [From the outside] one had to climb 7 steps to reach it, and its vestibule was ahead of them.
Transliteration: vechalvonav veeylamav vetiymorav khemidat hashaar asher fanayv derekhe hakadiym uvemaalvot sheva yaalu-vvo veeylamav lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וְשַׁ֙עַר֙ לֶחָצֵ֣ר הַפְּנִימִ֔י נֶ֣גֶד הַשַּׁ֔עַר לַצָּפ֖וֹן וְלַקָּדִ֑ים וַיָּ֧מׇד מִשַּׁ֛עַר אֶל־שַׁ֖עַר מֵאָ֥ה אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: Like the east gate, the north gate faced a gate leading into the inner forecourt; and when he measured the distance from gate to gate, it was 100 cubits.
Transliteration: veshaar lechatser hafeniymiy neged hashaar latsafvon velakadiym vayamׇd mishaar el-shaar meah amah

Hebrew: וַיּוֹלִכֵ֙נִי֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַדָּר֔וֹם וְהִנֵּה־שַׁ֖עַר דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַדָּר֑וֹם וּמָדַ֤ד אֵילָו֙ וְאֵ֣ילַמָּ֔ו כַּמִּדּ֖וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Then he took me to the south side. There was also a gate on the south side, and he got the same measurements as before for its supports and its vestibule.
Transliteration: vayyvolikheniy derekhe hadarvom vehineh-shaar derekhe hadarvom umadad eylav veeylamav khamidvot haeleh

Hebrew: וְחַלּוֹנִ֨ים ל֤וֹ וּלְאֵֽילַמָּו֙ סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֔יב כְּהַחַלֹּנ֖וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ וְרֹ֕חַב חָמֵ֥שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: Both it and its vestibule had windows like the aforementioned ones. It was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide.
Transliteration: vechalvoniym lvo uleeylamav saviyv <small></small> saviyv khehachalonvot haeleh chamishiym amah orekhe verochav chamesh veesheriym amah

Hebrew: וּמַעֲל֤וֹת שִׁבְעָה֙ עֹֽלוֹתָ֔ו וְאֵלַמָּ֖ו לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וְתִמֹרִ֣ים ל֗וֹ אֶחָ֥ד מִפּ֛וֹ וְאֶחָ֥ד מִפּ֖וֹ אֶל־אֵילָֽו׃
Translated: Its staircase consisted of 7 steps; its vestibule was ahead of them, and its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees.
Transliteration: umaalvot shiveah olvotav veelamav lifeneyhem vetimoriym lvo echad mifvo veechad mifvo el-eylav

Hebrew: וְשַׁ֛עַר לֶחָצֵ֥ר הַפְּנִימִ֖י דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַדָּר֑וֹם וַיָּ֨מׇד מִשַּׁ֧עַר אֶל־הַשַּׁ֛עַר דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַדָּר֖וֹם מֵאָ֥ה אַמּֽוֹת׃
Translated: The inner court likewise had a gate facing south; and on the south side, too, he measured a distance of 100 cubits from the [outer] gate to the [inner] gate.
Transliteration: veshaar lechatser hafeniymiy derekhe hadarvom vayamׇd mishaar el-hashaar derekhe hadarvom meah amvot

Hebrew: וַיְבִיאֵ֛נִי אֶל־חָצֵ֥ר הַפְּנִימִ֖י בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַדָּר֑וֹם וַיָּ֙מׇד֙ אֶת־הַשַּׁ֣עַר הַדָּר֔וֹם כַּמִּדּ֖וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: He now took me into the inner forecourt through its south gate. When he measured this south gate, it had the same measurements as the foregoing.
Transliteration: vayeviyeniy el-chatser hafeniymiy veshaar hadarvom vayamׇd et-hashaar hadarvom khamidvot haeleh

Hebrew: וְתָאָ֞ו וְאֵילָ֤ו וְאֵֽלַמָּו֙ כַּמִּדּ֣וֹת הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְחַלּוֹנ֥וֹת ל֛וֹ וּלְאֵלַמָּ֖ו סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ וְרֹ֕חַב עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְחָמֵ֖שׁ אַמּֽוֹת׃
Translated: Its recesses, its supports, and its vestibule had the same measurements. Both it and its vestibule had windows on both sides; it was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide—
Transliteration: vetaav veeylav veelamav khamidvot haeleh vechalvonvot lvo uleelamav saviyv <small></small> saviyv chamishiym amah orekhe verochav esheriym vechamesh amvot

Hebrew: וְאֵלַמּ֖וֹת סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב אֹ֗רֶךְ חָמֵ֤שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֖חַב חָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּֽוֹת׃
Translated: vestibules on both sides, 25 cubits long, 5 cubits wide.
Transliteration: veelamvot saviyv <small></small> saviyv orekhe chamesh veesheriym amah verochav chamesh amvot

Hebrew: וְאֵלַמָּ֗ו אֶל־חָצֵר֙ הַחִ֣צוֹנָ֔ה וְתִמֹרִ֖ים אֶל־אֵילָ֑ו וּמַעֲל֥וֹת שְׁמוֹנֶ֖ה מַעֲלָֽו׃
Translated: Its vestibule, however, gave on the outer court. Its supports were adorned on either side with palms, and its staircase consisted of 8 steps.
Transliteration: veelamav el-chatser hachitsvonah vetimoriym el-eylav umaalvot shemvoneh maalav

Hebrew: וַיְבִיאֵ֛נִי אֶל־הֶחָצֵ֥ר הַפְּנִימִ֖י דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַקָּדִ֑ים וַיָּ֣מׇד אֶת־הַשַּׁ֔עַר כַּמִּדּ֖וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Then he took me to the eastern side of the inner forecourt; and when he measured the gate there, he got the same measurements:
Transliteration: vayeviyeniy el-hechatser hafeniymiy derekhe hakadiym vayamׇd et-hashaar khamidvot haeleh

Hebrew: וְתָאָ֞ו וְאֵלָ֤ו וְאֵֽלַמָּו֙ כַּמִּדּ֣וֹת הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְחַלּוֹנ֥וֹת ל֛וֹ וּלְאֵלַמָּ֖ו סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב אֹ֚רֶךְ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֕חַב חָמֵ֥שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: its recesses, supports, and vestibule had the above measurements. Both it and its vestibule had windows on both sides; it was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide,
Transliteration: vetaav veelav veelamav khamidvot haeleh vechalvonvot lvo uleelamav saviyv <small></small> saviyv orekhe chamishiym amah verochav chamesh veesheriym amah

Hebrew: וְאֵלַמָּ֗ו לֶחָצֵר֙ הַחִ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה וְתִמֹרִ֥ים אֶל־אֵלָ֖ו מִפּ֣וֹ וּמִפּ֑וֹ וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מַעֲל֖וֹת מַעֲלָֽו׃
Translated: and its vestibule gave on the outer court. Its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees, and its staircase consisted of 8 steps.
Transliteration: veelamav lechatser hachiytsvonah vetimoriym el-elav mifvo umifvo ushemoneh maalvot maalav

Hebrew: וַיְבִיאֵ֖נִי אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר הַצָּפ֑וֹן וּמָדַ֖ד כַּמִּדּ֥וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Then he took me to the north gate, and found its measurements to be identical,
Transliteration: vayeviyeniy el-shaar hatsafvon umadad khamidvot haeleh

Hebrew: תָּאָו֙ אֵלָ֣ו וְאֵלַמָּ֔ו וְחַלּוֹנ֥וֹת ל֖וֹ סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב אֹ֚רֶךְ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֕חַב חָמֵ֥שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: with the same recesses, supports, vestibule, windows on both sides, and a length of 50 cubits and a width of 25 cubits.
Transliteration: taav elav veelamav vechalvonvot lvo saviyv <small></small> saviyv orekhe chamishiym amah verochav chamesh veesheriym amah

Hebrew: וְאֵילָ֗ו לֶחָצֵר֙ הַחִ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה וְתִמֹרִ֥ים אֶל־אֵילָ֖ו מִפּ֣וֹ וּמִפּ֑וֹ וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מַעֲל֖וֹת מַעֲלָֽו׃
Translated: Its supports gave on the outer court; its supports were decorated on both sides with palm trees; and its staircase consisted of eight steps.
Transliteration: veeylav lechatser hachiytsvonah vetimoriym el-eylav mifvo umifvo ushemoneh maalvot maalav

Hebrew: וְלִשְׁכָּ֣ה וּפִתְחָ֔הּ בְּאֵילִ֖ים הַשְּׁעָרִ֑ים שָׁ֖ם יָדִ֥יחוּ אֶת־הָעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: A chamber opened into the gate; there the burnt offering would be washed.
Transliteration: velishekhah ufitechah veeyliym hasheariym sham yadiychu et-haolah

Hebrew: וּבְאֻלָ֣ם הַשַּׁ֗עַר שְׁנַ֤יִם שֻׁלְחָנוֹת֙ מִפּ֔וֹ וּשְׁנַ֥יִם שֻׁלְחָנ֖וֹת מִפֹּ֑ה לִשְׁח֤וֹט אֲלֵיהֶם֙ הָעוֹלָ֔ה וְהַחַטָּ֖את וְהָאָשָֽׁם׃
Translated: And inside the vestibule of the gate, there were two tables on each side, at which the burnt offering, the purgation offering, and the reparation offering were to be slaughtered;
Transliteration: uveulam hashaar shenayiim shulechanvot mifvo ushenayiim shulechanvot mifoh lishechvot aleyhem havolah vehachatat vehaasham

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הַכָּתֵ֣ף מִח֗וּצָה לָֽעוֹלֶה֙ לְפֶ֙תַח֙ הַשַּׁ֣עַר הַצָּפ֔וֹנָה שְׁנַ֖יִם שֻׁלְחָנ֑וֹת וְאֶל־הַכָּתֵ֣ף הָאַחֶ֗רֶת אֲשֶׁר֙ לְאֻלָ֣ם הַשַּׁ֔עַר שְׁנַ֖יִם שֻׁלְחָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: while outside—as one goes up toward the opening of the north gate—there were two tables on one side, and there were two tables on the other side of the gate’s vestibule.
Transliteration: veel-hakhatef michutsah lavoleh lefetach hashaar hatsafvonah shenayiim shulechanvot veel-hakhatef haacheret asher leulam hashaar shenayiim shulechanvot

Hebrew: אַרְבָּעָ֨ה שֻׁלְחָנ֜וֹת מִפֹּ֗ה וְאַרְבָּעָ֧ה שֻׁלְחָנ֛וֹת מִפֹּ֖ה לְכֶ֣תֶף הַשָּׁ֑עַר שְׁמוֹנָ֥ה שֻׁלְחָנ֖וֹת אֲלֵיהֶ֥ם יִשְׁחָֽטוּ׃
Translated: Thus there were four tables on either flank of the gate—eight tables in all—at which [the sacrifices] were to be slaughtered.
Transliteration: arevaah shulechanvot mifoh vearevaah shulechanvot mifoh lekhetef hashaar shemvonah shulechanvot aleyhem yishechatu

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעָה֩ שֻׁלְחָנ֨וֹת לָעוֹלָ֜ה אַבְנֵ֣י גָזִ֗ית אֹ֩רֶךְ֩ אַמָּ֨ה אַחַ֤ת וָחֵ֙צִי֙ וְרֹ֨חַב אַמָּ֤ה אַחַת֙ וָחֵ֔צִי וְגֹ֖בַהּ אַמָּ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם וְיַנִּ֤יחוּ אֶת־הַכֵּלִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁחֲט֧וּ אֶת־הָעוֹלָ֛ה בָּ֖ם וְהַזָּֽבַח׃
Translated: As for the four tables for the burnt offering—they were of hewn stone, one and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide, and one cubit high—on them were laid out the instruments with which burnt offerings and sacrifices were slaughtered.
Transliteration: vearevaah shulechanvot lavolah aveney gaziyt orekhe amah achat vachetsiy verochav amah achat vachetsiy vegovah amah echat aleyhem veyaniychu et-hakheliym asher yishechatu et-havolah vam vehazavach

Hebrew: וְהַֽשְׁפַתַּ֗יִם טֹ֧פַח אֶחָ֛ד מוּכָנִ֥ים בַּבַּ֖יִת סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב וְאֶל־הַשֻּׁלְחָנ֖וֹת בְּשַׂ֥ר הַקׇּרְבָֽן׃
Translated: Shelves, one handbreadth wide, were attached all around the inside; and the sacrificial flesh was [laid] on the tables.
Transliteration: vehashefatayiim tofach echad mukhaniym vavayiit saviyv <small></small> saviyv veel-hashulechanvot veshar hakׇrevan

Hebrew: וּמִח֩וּצָה֩ לַשַּׁ֨עַר הַפְּנִימִ֜י לִֽשְׁכ֣וֹת שָׁרִ֗ים בֶּחָצֵ֤ר הַפְּנִימִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֗ר אֶל־כֶּ֙תֶף֙ שַׁ֣עַר הַצָּפ֔וֹן וּפְנֵיהֶ֖ם דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַדָּר֑וֹם אֶחָ֗ד אֶל־כֶּ֙תֶף֙ שַׁ֣עַר הַקָּדִ֔ים פְּנֵ֖י דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַצָּפֹֽן׃
Translated: There were chambers for singers in the inner forecourt: [one] beside the north gate facing south, and one beside the east gate facing north.
Transliteration: umichutsah lashaar hafeniymiy lishekhvot shariym vechatser hafeniymiy asher el-khetef shaar hatsafvon ufeneyhem derekhe hadarvom echad el-khetef shaar hakadiym feney derekhe hatsafon

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר אֵלָ֑י זֹ֣ה הַלִּשְׁכָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר פָּנֶ֙יהָ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַדָּר֔וֹם לַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים שֹׁמְרֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: [The figure] explained to me: “The chamber that faces south is for the priests who perform the duties of the temple;
Transliteration: vayedaver elay zoh halishekhah asher faneyha derekhe hadarvom lakhohaniym shomerey mishemeret havayiit

Hebrew: וְהַלִּשְׁכָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר פָּנֶ֙יהָ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַצָּפ֔וֹן לַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים שֹׁמְרֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ הֵ֣מָּה בְנֵֽי־צָד֗וֹק הַקְּרֵבִ֧ים מִבְּנֵֽי־לֵוִ֛י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה לְשָׁרְתֽוֹ׃
Translated: and the chamber that faces north is for the priests who perform the duties of the altar—they are the descendants of Zadok, who alone of the descendants of Levi may approach G<small>OD</small> to be in attendance.”
Transliteration: vehalishekhah asher faneyha derekhe hatsafvon lakhohaniym shomerey mishemeret hamizevecha hemah veney-tsadvok hakereviym miveney-leviy el-yehovah lesharetvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨מׇד אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֜ר אֹ֣רֶךְ ׀ מֵאָ֣ה אַמָּ֗ה וְרֹ֛חַב מֵאָ֥ה אַמָּ֖ה מְרֻבָּ֑עַת וְהַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לִפְנֵ֥י הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: He then measured the forecourt: 100 cubits long and 100 cubits broad—foursquare. In front of the temple stood the altar.
Transliteration: vayamׇd et-hechatser orekhe meah amah verochav meah amah meruvaat vehamizevecha lifeney havayiit

Hebrew: וַיְבִאֵ֘נִי֮ אֶל־אֻלָ֣ם הַבַּ֒יִת֒ וַיָּ֙מָד֙ אֵ֣ל אֻלָ֔ם חָמֵ֤שׁ אַמּוֹת֙ מִפֹּ֔ה וְחָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת מִפֹּ֑ה וְרֹ֣חַב הַשַּׁ֔עַר שָׁלֹ֤שׁ אַמּוֹת֙ מִפּ֔וֹ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת מִפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He took me into the portico of the temple and measured it. The jambs of the portico were 5 cubits deep on either side. The width of the gate-opening was [14 cubits, and the flanking wall of the gate was] 3 cubits on either side.
Transliteration: vayevieniy el-ulam havayiit vayamad el ulam chamesh amvot mifoh vechamesh amvot mifoh verochav hashaar shalosh amvot mifvo veshalosh amvot mifvo

Hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ הָאֻלָ֞ם עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אַמָּ֗ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ עַשְׁתֵּ֣י עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה אַמָּ֔ה וּבַֽמַּעֲל֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲל֖וּ אֵלָ֑יו וְעַמֻּדִים֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֵילִ֔ים אֶחָ֥ד מִפֹּ֖ה וְאֶחָ֥ד מִפֹּֽה׃
Translated: The portico was 20 cubits wide and 11 cubits deep, and it was by steps that it was reached. There were columns by the jambs on either side.
Transliteration: orekhe haulam esheriym amah verochav ashetey eshereh amah uvamaalvot asher yaalu elayv veamudiym el-haeyliym echad mifoh veechad mifoh

Hebrew: וַיְבִיאֵ֖נִי אֶל־הַהֵיכָ֑ל וַיָּ֣מׇד אֶת־הָאֵילִ֗ים שֵׁשׁ־אַמּ֨וֹת רֹ֧חַב מִפּ֛וֹ וְשֵׁשׁ־אַמּֽוֹת־רֹ֥חַב מִפּ֖וֹ רֹ֥חַב הָאֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: He then led me into the great hall. He measured the jambs, 6 cubits on either side; such was the depth of each jamb.
Transliteration: vayeviyeniy el-haheykhal vayamׇd et-haeyliym shesh-amvot rochav mifvo veshesh-amvot-rochav mifvo rochav haohel

Hebrew: וְרֹ֣חַב הַפֶּ֘תַח֮ עֶ֣שֶׂר אַמּוֹת֒ וְכִתְפ֣וֹת הַפֶּ֔תַח חָמֵ֤שׁ אַמּוֹת֙ מִפּ֔וֹ וְחָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת מִפּ֑וֹ וַיָּ֤מׇד אׇרְכּוֹ֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים אַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֖חַב עֶשְׂרִ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: The entrance was 10 cubits wide, and the flanking walls of the entrance were each 5 cubits wide. Next he measured the depth [of the hall], 40 cubits, and the width, 20 cubits.
Transliteration: verochav hafetach esher amvot vekhitefvot hafetach chamesh amvot mifvo vechamesh amvot mifvo vayamׇd ׇrekhvo arevaiym amah verochav esheriym amah

Hebrew: וּבָ֣א לִפְנִ֔ימָה וַיָּ֥מׇד אֵֽיל־הַפֶּ֖תַח שְׁתַּ֣יִם אַמּ֑וֹת וְהַפֶּ֙תַח֙ שֵׁ֣שׁ אַמּ֔וֹת וְרֹ֥חַב הַפֶּ֖תַח שֶׁ֥בַע אַמּֽוֹת׃
Translated: And then he entered the inner room. He measured each jamb of the entrance, 2 cubits [deep]; the entrance itself, 6 cubits across; and the width of [the flanking wall on either side of] the entrance, 7 cubits.
Transliteration: uva lifeniymah vayamׇd eyl-hafetach shetayiim amvot vehafetach shesh amvot verochav hafetach sheva amvot

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨מׇד אֶת־אׇרְכּ֜וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אַמָּ֗ה וְרֹ֛חַב עֶשְׂרִ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י הַהֵיכָ֑ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י זֶ֖ה קֹ֥דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Then he measured the depth, 20 cubits; and the width at the inner end of the great hall was also 20 cubits. And he said to me, “This is the Holy of Holies.”
Transliteration: vayamׇd et-ׇrekhvo esheriym amah verochav esheriym amah el-feney haheykhal vayomer elay zeh kodesh hakodashiym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥מׇד קִֽיר־הַבַּ֖יִת שֵׁ֣שׁ אַמּ֑וֹת וְרֹ֣חַב הַצֵּלָע֩ אַרְבַּ֨ע אַמּ֜וֹת סָבִ֧יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֛יב לַבַּ֖יִת סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Then he measured the wall of the temple. [It was] 6 cubits [thick] on every side of the temple, and the side-chamber measured 4 cubits [across].
Transliteration: vayamׇd kiyr-havayiit shesh amvot verochav hatsela areva amvot saviyv <small></small> saviyv lavayiit saviyv

Hebrew: וְהַצְּלָעוֹת֩ צֵלָ֨ע אֶל־צֵלָ֜ע שָׁל֧וֹשׁ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים פְּעָמִ֗ים וּ֠בָא֠וֹת בַּקִּ֨יר אֲשֶׁר־לַבַּ֧יִת לַצְּלָע֛וֹת סָבִ֥יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֖יב לִהְי֣וֹת אֲחוּזִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־יִהְי֥וּ אֲחוּזִ֖ים בְּקִ֥יר הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: The side chambers were arranged one above the other, in 33 sections. All around, there were projections in the temple wall to serve the side chambers as supports, so that [their] supports should not be the temple wall itself.
Transliteration: vehatselavot tsela el-tsela shalvosh usheloshiym feamiym uvavot vakiyr asher-lavayiit latselavot saviyv <small></small> saviyv liheyvot achuziym velo-yiheyu achuziym vekiyr havayiit

Hebrew: וְֽרָחֲבָ֡ה וְֽנָסְבָה֩ לְמַ֨עְלָה לְמַ֜עְלָה לַצְּלָע֗וֹת כִּ֣י מֽוּסַב־הַ֠בַּ֠יִת לְמַ֨עְלָה לְמַ֜עְלָה סָבִ֤יב <small>׀</small> סָבִיב֙ לַבַּ֔יִת עַל־כֵּ֥ן רֹחַב־לַבַּ֖יִת לְמָ֑עְלָה וְכֵ֧ן הַתַּחְתּוֹנָ֛ה יַעֲלֶ֥ה עַל־הָעֶלְיוֹנָ֖ה לַתִּיכוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: The winding passage of the side chambers widened from story to story; and since the structure was furnished all over with winding passages from story to story, the structure itself became wider from story to story. It was by this means that one ascended from the bottom story to the top one by way of the middle one.
Transliteration: verachavah venasevah lemaelah lemaelah latselavot khiy musav-havayiit lemaelah lemaelah saviyv <small></small> saviyv lavayiit al-khen rochav-lavayiit lemaelah vekhen hatachetvonah yaaleh al-haeleyvonah latiykhvonah

Hebrew: וְרָאִ֧יתִי לַבַּ֛יִת גֹּ֖בַהּ סָבִ֣יב ׀ סָבִ֑יב (מיסדות) [מוּסְד֤וֹת] הַצְּלָעוֹת֙ מְל֣וֹ הַקָּנֶ֔ה שֵׁ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת אַצִּֽילָה׃
Translated: I observed that the temple was surrounded by a raised pavement—the foundations of the side chambers; its elevation was a rod’s length, or 6 cubits.
Transliteration: veraiytiy lavayiit govah saviyv saviyv (mysdvt) [musedvot] hatselavot melvo hakaneh shesh amvot atsiylah

Hebrew: רֹ֣חַב הַקִּ֧יר אֲֽשֶׁר־לַצֵּלָ֛ע אֶל־הַח֖וּץ חָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֑וֹת וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר מֻנָּ֔ח בֵּ֥ית צְלָע֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר לַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: The outer wall of the side chamber was 5 cubits thick, and that which served as a walk between the Temple’s side chambers
Transliteration: rochav hakiyr asher-latsela el-hachuts chamesh amvot vaasher munach veyt tselavot asher lavayiit

Hebrew: וּבֵ֨ין הַלְּשָׁכ֜וֹת רֹ֣חַב עֶשְׂרִ֥ים אַמָּ֛ה סָבִ֥יב לַבַּ֖יִת סָבִ֥יב <small>׀</small> סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: and the chamber complexes was 20 cubits wide all around the temple.
Transliteration: uveyn haleshakhvot rochav esheriym amah saviyv lavayiit saviyv <small></small> saviyv

Hebrew: וּפֶ֤תַח הַצֵּלָע֙ לַמֻּנָּ֔ח פֶּ֤תַח אֶחָד֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַצָּפ֔וֹן וּפֶ֥תַח אֶחָ֖ד לַדָּר֑וֹם וְרֹ֙חַב֙ מְק֣וֹם הַמֻּנָּ֔ח חָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת סָבִ֥יב <small>׀</small> סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Of entrances to the side chambers giving on the walk, there was one entrance on the north side and one entrance on the south side; and the space of the walk was 5 cubits thick all around.
Transliteration: ufetach hatsela lamunach fetach echad derekhe hatsafvon ufetach echad ladarvom verochav mekvom hamunach chamesh amvot saviyv <small></small> saviyv

Hebrew: וְהַבִּנְיָ֡ן אֲשֶׁר֩ אֶל־פְּנֵ֨י הַגִּזְרָ֜ה פְּאַ֣ת דֶּֽרֶךְ־הַיָּ֗ם רֹ֚חַב שִׁבְעִ֣ים אַמָּ֔ה וְקִ֧יר הַבִּנְיָ֛ן חָמֵשׁ־אַמּ֥וֹת רֹ֖חַב סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב וְאׇרְכּ֖וֹ תִּשְׁעִ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: And the structure that fronted on the vacant space at the [Temple’s] western end was 70 cubits deep; the walls of the structure were 5 cubits thick on every side; and it was 90 cubits wide.
Transliteration: vehavineyan asher el-feney hagizerah feat derekhe-hayam rochav shiveiym amah vekiyr havineyan chamesh-amvot rochav saviyv <small></small> saviyv veׇrekhvo tisheiym amah

Hebrew: וּמָדַ֣ד אֶת־הַבַּ֔יִת אֹ֖רֶךְ מֵאָ֣ה אַמָּ֑ה וְהַגִּזְרָ֤ה וְהַבִּנְיָה֙ וְקִ֣ירוֹתֶ֔יהָ אֹ֖רֶךְ מֵאָ֥ה אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: He measured the [total] depth of the temple, 100 cubits; and the depth of the vacant space and of the structure, with its walls, also came to 100 cubits.
Transliteration: umadad et-havayiit orekhe meah amah vehagizerah vehavineyah vekiyrvoteyha orekhe meah amah

Hebrew: וְרֹ֩חַב֩ פְּנֵ֨י הַבַּ֧יִת וְהַגִּזְרָ֛ה לַקָּדִ֖ים מֵאָ֥ה אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: The front side of the temple, like the vacant space on the east, was 100 cubits wide.
Transliteration: verochav feney havayiit vehagizerah lakadiym meah amah

Hebrew: וּמָדַ֣ד אֹֽרֶךְ־הַ֠בִּנְיָ֠ן אֶל־פְּנֵ֨י הַגִּזְרָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עַל־אַחֲרֶ֧יהָ (ואתוקיהא) [וְאַתִּיקֶ֛יהָא] מִפּ֥וֹ וּמִפּ֖וֹ מֵאָ֣ה אַמָּ֑ה וְהַהֵיכָל֙ הַפְּנִימִ֔י וְאֻלַמֵּ֖י הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translated:
He also measured the width of the structure facing the vacant space in the rear, inclusive of its ledges, 100 cubits.
Both the great hall inside and the portico next to the court—
Transliteration: umadad orekhe-havineyan el-feney hagizerah asher al-achareyha (vtvkyh) [veatiykeyha] mifvo umifvo meah amah vehaheykhal hafeniymiy veulamey hechatser

Hebrew: הַסִּפִּ֡ים וְהַחַלּוֹנִ֣ים הָ֠אֲטֻמ֠וֹת וְהָאַתִּיקִ֤ים <small>׀</small> סָבִיב֙ לִשְׁלׇשְׁתָּ֔ם נֶ֧גֶד הַסַּ֛ף שְׂחִ֥יף עֵ֖ץ סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ עַד־הַֽחַלּוֹנ֔וֹת וְהַחַלֹּנ֖וֹת מְכֻסּֽוֹת׃
Translated: the thresholds—and the windows with frames and the ledges at the threshold, all over the three parts of each, were completely overlaid with wood. There was wainscoting from the floor to the windows, including the window [frame]s
Transliteration: hasifiym vehachalvoniym haatumvot vehaatiykiym <small></small> saviyv lishelׇshetam neged hasaf shechiyf ets saviyv <small></small> saviyv vehaarets ad-hachalvonvot vehachalonvot mekhusvot

Hebrew: עַל־מֵעַ֣ל הַפֶּ֡תַח וְעַד־הַבַּ֩יִת֩ הַפְּנִימִ֨י וְלַח֜וּץ וְאֶל־כׇּל־הַקִּ֨יר סָבִ֧יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֛יב בַּפְּנִימִ֥י וּבַחִיצ֖וֹן מִדּֽוֹת׃
Translated: and extending above the openings, both in the inner temple and outside. And all over the wall, both in the inner one and in the outer, ran a pattern.
Transliteration: al-meal hafetach vead-havayiit hafeniymiy velachuts veel-khׇl-hakiyr saviyv <small></small> saviyv vafeniymiy uvachiytsvon midvot

Hebrew: וְעָשׂ֥וּי כְּרוּבִ֖ים וְתִמֹרִ֑ים וְתִֽמֹרָה֙ בֵּין־כְּר֣וּב לִכְר֔וּב וּשְׁנַ֥יִם פָּנִ֖ים לַכְּרֽוּב׃
Translated: It consisted of cherubs and palm trees, with a palm tree between every two cherubs. Each cherub had two faces:
Transliteration: veashuy kheruviym vetimoriym vetimorah veyn-kheruv likheruv ushenayiim faniym lakheruv

Hebrew: וּפְנֵ֨י אָדָ֤ם אֶל־הַתִּֽמֹרָה֙ מִפּ֔וֹ וּפְנֵי־כְפִ֥יר אֶל־הַתִּמֹרָ֖ה מִפּ֑וֹ עָשׂ֥וּי אֶל־כׇּל־הַבַּ֖יִת סָבִ֥יב <small>׀</small> סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: a human face turned toward the palm tree on one side and a lion’s face turned toward the palm tree on the other side. This was repeated all over the temple;
Transliteration: ufeney adam el-hatimorah mifvo ufeney-khefiyr el-hatimorah mifvo ashuy el-khׇl-havayiit saviyv <small></small> saviyv

Hebrew: מֵהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ עַד־מֵעַ֣ל הַפֶּ֔תַח הַכְּרוּבִ֥ים וְהַתִּמֹרִ֖ים עֲשׂוּיִ֑ם וְקִ֖יר הַׄהֵׄיׄכָֽׄלׄ׃
Translated:
the cherubs and the palm trees were carved on the wall from the floor to above the openings.
As regards the great hall,
Transliteration: mehaarets ad-meal hafetach hakheruviym vehatimoriym ashuyim vekiyr haheykhal

Hebrew: הַהֵיכָ֖ל מְזוּזַ֣ת רְבֻעָ֑ה וּפְנֵ֣י הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ הַמַּרְאֶ֖ה כַּמַּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: the great hall had four doorposts; and before the Shrine was something resembling
Transliteration: haheykhal mezuzat revuah ufeney hakodesh hamareeh khamareeh

Hebrew: הַמִּזְבֵּ֡חַ עֵ֣ץ שָׁלוֹשׁ֩ אַמּ֨וֹת גָּבֹ֜הַּ וְאׇרְכּ֣וֹ שְׁתַּֽיִם־אַמּ֗וֹת וּמִקְצֹֽעוֹתָיו֙ ל֔וֹ וְאׇרְכּ֥וֹ וְקִירֹתָ֖יו עֵ֑ץ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלַ֔י זֶ֚ה הַשֻּׁלְחָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: a wooden altar 3 cubits high and 2 cubits long and having inner corners; and its length and its walls were of wood. And he said to me, “This is the table that stands before G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: hamizevecha ets shalvosh amvot gavoha veׇrekhvo shetayiim-amvot umiketsovotayv lvo veׇrekhvo vekiyrotayv ets vayedaver elay zeh hashulechan asher lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וּשְׁתַּ֧יִם דְּלָת֛וֹת לַהֵיכָ֖ל וְלַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: The great hall had a double door, and the Shrine likewise had
Transliteration: ushetayiim delatvot laheykhal velakodesh

Hebrew: וּשְׁתַּ֥יִם דְּלָת֖וֹת לַדְּלָת֑וֹת שְׁ֚תַּיִם מוּסַבּ֣וֹת דְּלָת֔וֹת שְׁ֚תַּיִם לְדֶ֣לֶת אֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּ֥י דְלָת֖וֹת לָאַחֶֽרֶת׃
Translated: a double door, and each door had two swinging leaves: two for the one door and two such leaves for the other.
Transliteration: ushetayiim delatvot ladelatvot shetayim musavvot delatvot shetayim ledelet echat ushetey delatvot laacheret

Hebrew: וַעֲשׂוּיָ֨ה אֲלֵיהֶ֜ן אֶל־דַּלְת֤וֹת הַהֵיכָל֙ כְּרוּבִ֣ים וְתִמֹרִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲשׂוּיִ֖ם לַקִּיר֑וֹת וְעָ֥ב עֵ֛ץ אֶל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאוּלָ֖ם מֵהַחֽוּץ׃
Translated: Cherubs and palm trees were carved on these—on the doors of the hall—just as they were carved on the walls; and there was a lattice of wood outside in front of the portico.
Transliteration: vaashuyah aleyhen el-daletvot haheykhal kheruviym vetimoriym khaasher ashuyim lakiyrvot veav ets el-feney haulam mehachuts

Hebrew: וְחַלּוֹנִ֨ים אֲטֻמ֤וֹת וְתִֽמֹרִים֙ מִפּ֣וֹ וּמִפּ֔וֹ אֶל־כִּתְפ֖וֹת הָאוּלָ֑ם וְצַלְע֥וֹת הַבַּ֖יִת וְהָעֻבִּֽים׃
Translated: And there were windows with frames and palm trees on the flanking walls of the portico on either side [of the entrance] and [on] the Temple’s side chambers and [on] the lattices.
Transliteration: vechalvoniym atumvot vetimoriym mifvo umifvo el-khitefvot haulam vetsalevot havayiit vehauviym

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִאֵ֗נִי אֶל־הֶחָצֵר֙ הַחִ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַצָּפ֑וֹן וַיְבִאֵ֣נִי אֶל־הַלִּשְׁכָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נֶ֧גֶד הַגִּזְרָ֛ה וַאֲשֶֽׁר־נֶ֥גֶד הַבִּנְיָ֖ן אֶל־הַצָּפֽוֹן׃
