Translated: He took me out, by way of the northern gate, into the outer court, and he led me [westward] up to a complex of chambers that ran parallel to the northern ends of the vacant space and the structure.
Transliteration: vayyvotsieniy el-hechatser hachiytsvonah haderekhe derekhe hatsafvon vayevieniy el-halishekhah asher neged hagizerah vaasher-neged havineyan el-hatsafvon

Hebrew: אֶל־פְּנֵי־אֹ֙רֶךְ֙ אַמּ֣וֹת הַמֵּאָ֔ה פֶּ֖תַח הַצָּפ֑וֹן וְהָרֹ֖חַב חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמּֽוֹת׃
Translated: The width of its façade—its north side, the one from which it was entered—was 100 cubits, and its depth was 50 cubits.
Transliteration: el-feney-orekhe amvot hameah fetach hatsafvon veharochav chamishiym amvot

Hebrew: נֶ֣גֶד הָעֶשְׂרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁר֙ לֶחָצֵ֣ר הַפְּנִימִ֔י וְנֶ֣גֶד רִֽצְפָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֶחָצֵ֣ר הַחִיצוֹנָ֑ה אַתִּ֥יק אֶל־פְּנֵֽי־אַתִּ֖יק בַּשְּׁלִשִֽׁים׃
Translated: At right angles to the 20 cubits of the inner court and to the pavement of the outer court, the complex rose ledge by ledge in three tiers.
Transliteration: neged haesheriym asher lechatser hafeniymiy veneged ritsefah asher lechatser hachiytsvonah atiyk el-feney-atiyk vashelishiym

Hebrew: וְלִפְנֵ֨י הַלְּשָׁכ֜וֹת מַהֲלַךְ֩ עֶ֨שֶׂר אַמּ֥וֹת רֹ֙חַב֙ אֶל־הַפְּנִימִ֔ית דֶּ֖רֶךְ אַמָּ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת וּפִתְחֵיהֶ֖ם לַצָּפֽוֹן׃
Translated: There was an areaway, 10 cubits wide and a road of one cubit, running along the inner-court side of the chamber complex, but its entrances were on its north side.
Transliteration: velifeney haleshakhvot mahalakhe esher amvot rochav el-hafeniymiyt derekhe amah echat ufitecheyhem latsafvon

Hebrew: וְהַלְּשָׁכ֥וֹת הָעֶלְיוֹנֹ֖ת קְצֻר֑וֹת כִּֽי־יוֹכְל֨וּ אַתִּיקִ֜ים מֵהֵ֗נָּה מֵהַתַּחְתֹּנ֛וֹת וּמֵהַתִּכוֹנ֖וֹת בִּנְיָֽן׃
Translated: Here its upper chambers were cut back, because ledges took away from them as construction proceeded backward from the bottom ones and then from the middle ones.
Transliteration: vehaleshakhvot haeleyvonot ketsurvot khiy-yvokhelu atiykiym mehenah mehatachetonvot umehatikhvonvot vineyan

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מְשֻׁלָּשׁוֹת֙ הֵ֔נָּה וְאֵ֤ין לָהֶן֙ עַמּוּדִ֔ים כְּעַמּוּדֵ֖י הַחֲצֵר֑וֹת עַל־כֵּ֣ן נֶאֱצַ֗ל מֵהַתַּחְתּוֹנ֛וֹת וּמֵהַתִּיכֹנ֖וֹת מֵהָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: For they were arranged in three tiers, and they had no columns like those of the chambers in the courts. That is why the rise proceeded by stages: from the ground, from the bottom ones, and from the middle ones.
Transliteration: khiy meshulashvot henah veeyn lahen amudiym kheamudey hachatservot al-khen neetsal mehatachetvonvot umehatiykhonvot mehaarets

Hebrew: וְגָדֵ֤ר אֲשֶׁר־לַחוּץ֙ לְעֻמַּ֣ת הַלְּשָׁכ֔וֹת דֶּ֛רֶךְ הֶחָצֵ֥ר הַחִצוֹנָ֖ה אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י הַלְּשָׁכ֑וֹת אׇרְכּ֖וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: In the outer court, a wall 50 cubits long ran parallel to the chamber complex up to the chambers in the outer court;
Transliteration: vegader asher-lachuts leumat haleshakhvot derekhe hechatser hachitsvonah el-feney haleshakhvot ׇrekhvo chamishiym amah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֹ֣רֶךְ הַלְּשָׁכ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֶחָצֵ֥ר הַחִצוֹנָ֖ה חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֑ה וְהִנֵּ֛ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַהֵיכָ֖ל מֵאָ֥ה אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: for the chambers in the outer court were themselves 50 cubits deep, thus completing 100 cubits alongside the edifice.
Transliteration: khiy-orekhe haleshakhvot asher lechatser hachitsvonah chamishiym amah vehineh al-feney haheykhal meah amah

Hebrew: (ומתחתה לשכות) [וּמִתַּ֖חַת הַלְּשָׁכ֣וֹת] הָאֵ֑לֶּה (המבוא) [הַמֵּבִיא֙] מֵֽהַקָּדִ֔ים בְּבֹא֣וֹ לָהֵ֔נָּה מֵהֶחָצֵ֖ר הַחִצֹנָֽה׃
Translated: Thus, at the foot of that complex of chambers ran a passage—of a width set by the wall in the outer court—that one entered from the east in order to gain access to them from the outer court.
Transliteration: (vmtchth lshkhvt) [umitachat haleshakhvot] haeleh (hmvv) [hameviy] mehakadiym vevovo lahenah mehechatser hachitsonah

Hebrew: בְּרֹ֣חַב ׀ גֶּ֣דֶר הֶחָצֵ֗ר דֶּ֧רֶךְ הַקָּדִ֛ים אֶל־פְּנֵ֧י הַגִּזְרָ֛ה וְאֶל־פְּנֵ֥י הַבִּנְיָ֖ן לְשָׁכֽוֹת׃
Translated: There was another chamber complex to the east of the vacant space and the structure,
Transliteration: verochav geder hechatser derekhe hakadiym el-feney hagizerah veel-feney havineyan leshakhvot

Hebrew: וְדֶ֙רֶךְ֙ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם כְּמַרְאֵ֣ה הַלְּשָׁכ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁר֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַצָּפ֔וֹן כְּאׇרְכָּ֖ן כֵּ֣ן רׇחְבָּ֑ן וְכֹל֙ מוֹצָ֣אֵיהֶ֔ן וּכְמִשְׁפְּטֵיהֶ֖ן וּכְפִתְחֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: likewise with a passage in front—just like the complex on the north side, with which this one agreed in width and depth and in the exact layout of its exits and entrances.
Transliteration: vederekhe lifeneyhem khemareeh haleshakhvot asher derekhe hatsafvon kheׇrekhan khen rׇchevan vekhol mvotsaeyhen ukhemishefeteyhen ukhefitecheyhen

Hebrew: וּכְפִתְחֵ֣י הַלְּשָׁכ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁר֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַדָּר֔וֹם פֶּ֖תַח בְּרֹ֣אשׁ דָּ֑רֶךְ דֶּ֗רֶךְ בִּפְנֵי֙ הַגְּדֶ֣רֶת הֲגִינָ֔ה דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַקָּדִ֖ים בְּבוֹאָֽן׃
Translated: Accordingly, the entrances to the chamber complex on the south side were approached from the east by the entrance at the head of the corresponding passage along the matching wall.
Transliteration: ukhefitechey haleshakhvot asher derekhe hadarvom fetach verosh darekhe derekhe vifeney hagederet hagiynah derekhe hakadiym vevvoan

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י לִֽשְׁכ֨וֹת הַצָּפ֜וֹן לִֽשְׁכ֣וֹת הַדָּרוֹם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י הַגִּזְרָה֒ הֵ֣נָּה ׀ לִֽשְׁכ֣וֹת הַקֹּ֗דֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֹאכְלוּ־שָׁ֧ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־קְרוֹבִ֥ים לַיהֹוָ֖ה קׇדְשֵׁ֣י הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים שָׁ֞ם יַנִּ֣יחוּ ׀ קׇדְשֵׁ֣י הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים וְהַמִּנְחָה֙ וְהַחַטָּ֣את וְהָאָשָׁ֔ם כִּ֥י הַמָּק֖וֹם קָדֹֽשׁ׃
Translated: And he said to me, “The northern chambers and the southern chambers by the vacant space are the consecrated chambers in which the priests who have access to G<small>OD</small> shall eat the most holy offerings. There they shall deposit the most holy offerings—the grain offerings, the purgation offerings, and the reparation offerings, for the place is consecrated.
Transliteration: vayomer elay lishekhvot hatsafvon lishekhvot hadarvom asher el-feney hagizerah henah lishekhvot hakodesh asher yokhelu-sham hakhohaniym asher-kervoviym layhovah kׇdeshey hakodashiym sham yaniychu kׇdeshey hakodashiym vehaminechah vehachatat vehaasham khiy hamakvom kadosh

Hebrew: בְּבֹאָ֣ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים וְלֹֽא־יֵצְא֤וּ מֵהַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ אֶל־הֶחָצֵ֣ר הַחִיצוֹנָ֔ה וְשָׁ֞ם יַנִּ֧יחוּ בִגְדֵיהֶ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־יְשָׁרְת֥וּ בָהֶ֖ן כִּֽי־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הֵ֑נָּה (ילבשו) [וְלָֽבְשׁוּ֙] בְּגָדִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְקָרְב֖וּ אֶל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָעָֽם׃
Translated: When the priests enter, they shall not proceed from the consecrated place to the outer court without first leaving here the vestments in which they minister; for the [vestments] are consecrated. Before proceeding to the area open to the people, they shall put on other garments.”
Transliteration: vevoam hakhohaniym velo-eitseu mehakodesh el-hechatser hachiytsvonah vesham yaniychu vigedeyhem asher-yesharetu vahen khiy-kodesh henah (ylvshv) [velaveshu] vegadiym acheriym vekarevu el-asher laam

Hebrew: וְכִלָּ֗ה אֶת־מִדּוֹת֙ הַבַּ֣יִת הַפְּנִימִ֔י וְהוֹצִיאַ֙נִי֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַשַּׁ֔עַר אֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּנָ֖יו דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַקָּדִ֑ים וּמְדָד֖וֹ סָבִ֥יב <small>׀</small> סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: When he had finished the measurements of the inner temple [area], he led me out by way of the gate that faces east, and he measured off the entire area.
Transliteration: vekhilah et-midvot havayiit hafeniymiy vehvotsiyaniy derekhe hashaar asher fanayv derekhe hakadiym umedadvo saviyv <small></small> saviyv

Hebrew: מָדַ֛ד ר֥וּחַ הַקָּדִ֖ים בִּקְנֵ֣ה הַמִּדָּ֑ה חֲמֵשׁ־[מֵא֥וֹת] (אמות) קָנִ֛ים בִּקְנֵ֥ה הַמִּדָּ֖ה סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He measured the east side with the measuring rod, 500 [cubits]—in rods, by the measuring rod. He turned
Transliteration: madad rucha hakadiym vikeneh hamidah chamesh-[mevot] (mvt) kaniym vikeneh hamidah saviyv

Hebrew: מָדַ֖ד ר֣וּחַ הַצָּפ֑וֹן חֲמֵשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת קָנִ֛ים בִּקְנֵ֥ה הַמִּדָּ֖ה סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: [and] measured the north side: 500 [cubits]—in rods, by the measuring rod. He turned
Transliteration: madad rucha hatsafvon chamesh-mevot kaniym vikeneh hamidah saviyv

Hebrew: אֵ֛ת ר֥וּחַ הַדָּר֖וֹם מָדָ֑ד חֲמֵשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת קָנִ֖ים בִּקְנֵ֥ה הַמִּדָּֽה׃
Translated: [and] measured the south side: 500 [cubits]—in rods, by the measuring rod.
Transliteration: et rucha hadarvom madad chamesh-mevot kaniym vikeneh hamidah

Hebrew: סָבַ֖ב אֶל־ר֣וּחַ הַיָּ֑ם מָדַ֛ד חֲמֵשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת קָנִ֖ים בִּקְנֵ֥ה הַמִּדָּֽה׃
Translated: Then he turned to the west side [and] measured it: 500 cubits—in rods, by the measuring rod.
Transliteration: savav el-rucha hayam madad chamesh-mevot kaniym vikeneh hamidah

Hebrew: לְאַרְבַּ֨ע רוּח֜וֹת מְדָד֗וֹ ח֤וֹמָה לוֹ֙ סָבִ֣יב <small>׀</small> סָבִ֔יב אֹ֚רֶךְ חֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וְרֹ֖חַב חֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת לְהַבְדִּ֕יל בֵּ֥ין הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ לְחֹֽל׃
Translated: Thus he measured it on the four sides; it had a wall completely surrounding it, 500 [cubits] long on each side, to separate the consecrated from the unconsecrated.
Transliteration: leareva ruchvot medadvo chvomah lvo saviyv <small></small> saviyv orekhe chamesh mevot verochav chamesh mevot lehavediyl veyn hakodesh lechol

Hebrew: וַיּוֹלִכֵ֖נִי אֶל־הַשָּׁ֑עַר שַׁ֕עַר אֲשֶׁ֥ר פֹּנֶ֖ה דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַקָּדִֽים׃
Translated: Then he led me to a gate, the gate that faced east.
Transliteration: vayyvolikheniy el-hashaar shaar asher foneh derekhe hakadiym

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֗ה כְּבוֹד֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּ֖א מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ הַקָּדִ֑ים וְקוֹל֗וֹ כְּקוֹל֙ מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֔ים וְהָאָ֖רֶץ הֵאִ֥ירָה מִכְּבֹדֽוֹ׃
Translated: And there, coming from the east with a roar like the roar of mighty waters, was the Presence of the God of Israel, and the earth was lit up by that Presence.
Transliteration: vehineh khevvod elohey yisherael va miderekhe hakadiym vekvolvo khekvol mayiim raviym vehaarets heiyrah mikhevodvo

Hebrew: וּכְמַרְאֵ֨ה הַמַּרְאֶ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאִ֗יתִי כַּמַּרְאֶ֤ה אֲשֶׁר־רָאִ֙יתִי֙ בְּבֹאִי֙ לְשַׁחֵ֣ת אֶת־הָעִ֔יר וּמַרְא֕וֹת כַּמַּרְאֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִ֖יתִי אֶל־נְהַר־כְּבָ֑ר וָאֶפֹּ֖ל אֶל־פָּנָֽי׃
Translated: The vision was like the vision I had seen when I came to destroy the city, the very same vision that I had seen by the Chebar Canal. Forthwith, I fell on my face.
Transliteration: ukhemareeh hamareeh asher raiytiy khamareeh asher-raiytiy vevoiy leshachet et-haiyr umarevot khamareeh asher raiytiy el-nehar-khevar vaefol el-fanay

Hebrew: וּכְב֥וֹד יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּ֣א אֶל־הַבָּ֑יִת דֶּ֣רֶךְ שַׁ֔עַר אֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּנָ֖יו דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַקָּדִֽים׃
Translated: The Presence of G<small>OD</small> entered the temple by the gate that faced eastward.
Transliteration: ukhevvod yehovah va el-havayiit derekhe shaar asher fanayv derekhe hakadiym

Hebrew: וַתִּשָּׂאֵ֣נִי ר֔וּחַ וַתְּבִאֵ֕נִי אֶל־הֶחָצֵ֖ר הַפְּנִימִ֑י וְהִנֵּ֛ה מָלֵ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: A spirit carried me into the inner court, and lo, the Presence of G<small>OD</small> filled the temple;
Transliteration: vatishaeniy rucha vatevieniy el-hechatser hafeniymiy vehineh male khevvod-yehovah havayiit

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁמַ֛ע מִדַּבֵּ֥ר אֵלַ֖י מֵהַבָּ֑יִת וְאִ֕ישׁ הָיָ֥ה עֹמֵ֖ד אֶצְלִֽי׃
Translated: and I heard speech addressed to me from the temple, though that figure was standing beside me.
Transliteration: vaeshema midaver elay mehavayiit veiysh hayah omed etseliy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י בֶּן־אָדָם֙ אֶת־מְק֣וֹם כִּסְאִ֗י וְאֶת־מְקוֹם֙ כַּפּ֣וֹת רַגְלַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֧ר אֶשְׁכׇּן־שָׁ֛ם בְּת֥וֹךְ בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְעוֹלָ֑ם וְלֹ֣א יְטַמְּא֣וּ ע֣וֹד בֵּֽית־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל שֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשִׁ֞י הֵ֤מָּה וּמַלְכֵיהֶם֙ בִּזְנוּתָ֔ם וּבְפִגְרֵ֥י מַלְכֵיהֶ֖ם בָּמוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
It said to me:
O mortal, this is the place of My throne and the place for the soles of My feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the people Israel forever. The House of Israel and their kings must not again defile My holy name by their apostasy and by the corpses of their kings at their death.
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam et-mekvom khiseiy veet-mekvom khafvot ragelay asher eshekhׇn-sham vetvokhe veney-yisherael levolam velo yetameu vod veyt-yisherael shem kׇdeshiy hemah umalekheyhem vizenutam uvefigerey malekheyhem vamvotam

Hebrew: בְּתִתָּ֨ם סִפָּ֜ם אֶת־סִפִּ֗י וּמְזֽוּזָתָם֙ אֵ֣צֶל מְזוּזָתִ֔י וְהַקִּ֖יר בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֵיהֶ֑ם וְטִמְּא֣וּ ׀ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשִׁ֗י בְּתֽוֹעֲבוֹתָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂ֔וּ וָאֲכַ֥ל אֹתָ֖ם בְּאַפִּֽי׃
Translated: When they placed their threshold next to My threshold and their doorposts next to My doorposts with only a wall between Me and them, they would defile My holy name by the abominations that they committed, and I consumed them in My anger.
Transliteration: vetitam sifam et-sifiy umezuzatam etsel mezuzatiy vehakiyr veyniy uveyneyhem vetimeu et-shem kׇdeshiy vetvoavvotam asher ashu vaakhal otam veafiy

Hebrew: עַתָּ֞ה יְרַחֲק֧וּ אֶת־זְנוּתָ֛ם וּפִגְרֵ֥י מַלְכֵיהֶ֖ם מִמֶּ֑נִּי וְשָׁכַנְתִּ֥י בְתוֹכָ֖ם לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Therefore, let them put their apostasy and the corpses of their kings far from Me, and I will dwell among them forever.
Transliteration: atah yerachaku et-zenutam ufigerey malekheyhem mimeniy veshakhanetiy vetvokham levolam {s}

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה בֶן־אָדָ֗ם הַגֵּ֤ד אֶת־בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־הַבַּ֔יִת וְיִכָּלְמ֖וּ מֵעֲוֺנֽוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם וּמָדְד֖וּ אֶת־תׇּכְנִֽית׃
Translated: [Now] you, O mortal, describe the temple to the House of Israel, and let them measure its design. But let them be ashamed of their iniquities:
Transliteration: atah ven-adam haged et-veyt-yisherael et-havayiit veyikhalemu meavonvoteyhem umadedu et-tׇkheniyt

Hebrew: וְאִֽם־נִכְלְמ֞וּ מִכֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֗וּ צוּרַ֣ת הַבַּ֡יִת וּתְכוּנָת֡וֹ וּמוֹצָאָ֡יו וּמוֹבָאָ֣יו וְֽכׇל־צוּרֹתָ֡ו וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־חֻקֹּתָיו֩ וְכׇל־צ֨וּרֹתָ֤ו וְכׇל־תּֽוֹרֹתָו֙ הוֹדַ֣ע אוֹתָ֔ם וּכְתֹ֖ב לְעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם וְיִשְׁמְר֞וּ אֶת־כׇּל־צוּרָת֛וֹ וְאֶת־כׇּל־חֻקֹּתָ֖יו וְעָשׂ֥וּ אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: When they are ashamed of all they have done, make known to them the plan of the temple and its layout, its exits and entrances—its entire plan, and all the laws and instructions pertaining to its entire plan. Write it down before their eyes, that they may faithfully follow its entire plan and all its laws.
Transliteration: veim-nikhelemu mikhol asher-ashu tsurat havayiit utekhunatvo umvotsaayv umvovaayv vekhׇl-tsurotav veet khׇl-chukotayv vekhׇl-tsurotav vekhׇl-tvorotav hvoda votam ukhetov leeyneyhem veyishemeru et-khׇl-tsuratvo veet-khׇl-chukotayv veashu votam

Hebrew: זֹ֖את תּוֹרַ֣ת הַבָּ֑יִת עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָ֠הָ֠ר כׇּל־גְּבֻל֞וֹ סָבִ֤יב <small>׀</small> סָבִיב֙ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קׇדָשִׁ֔ים הִנֵּה־זֹ֖את תּוֹרַ֥ת הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: Such are the instructions for the temple on top of the mountain: the entire area of its enclosure shall be most holy. Thus far the instructions for the temple.
Transliteration: zot tvorat havayiit al-rosh hahar khׇl-gevulvo saviyv <small></small> saviyv kodesh kׇdashiym hineh-zot tvorat havayiit

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה מִדּ֤וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ בָּאַמּ֔וֹת אַמָּ֥ה אַמָּ֖ה וָטֹ֑פַח וְחֵ֨יק הָאַמָּ֜ה וְאַמָּה־רֹ֗חַב וּגְבוּלָ֨הּ אֶל־שְׂפָתָ֤הּ סָבִיב֙ זֶ֣רֶת הָאֶחָ֔ד וְזֶ֖ה גַּ֥ב הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: And these are the dimensions of the altar, in cubits where each is a cubit and a handbreadth. The trench shall be a cubit deep and a cubit wide, with a rim one span high around its edge. And the height shall be as follows:
Transliteration: veeleh midvot hamizevecha vaamvot amah amah vatofach vecheyk haamah veamah-rochav ugevulah el-shefatah saviyv zeret haechad vezeh gav hamizevecha

Hebrew: וּמֵחֵ֨יק הָאָ֜רֶץ עַד־הָעֲזָרָ֤ה הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה֙ שְׁתַּ֣יִם אַמּ֔וֹת וְרֹ֖חַב אַמָּ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת וּמֵהָעֲזָרָ֨ה הַקְּטַנָּ֜ה עַד־הָעֲזָרָ֤ה הַגְּדוֹלָה֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע אַמּ֔וֹת וְרֹ֖חַב הָאַמָּֽה׃
Translated: From the trench in the ground to the lower ledge, which shall be a cubit wide: 2 cubits; from the lower ledge to the upper ledge, which shall likewise be a cubit wide: 4 cubits;
Transliteration: umecheyk haarets ad-haazarah hatachetvonah shetayiim amvot verochav amah echat umehaazarah haketanah ad-haazarah hagedvolah areva amvot verochav haamah

Hebrew: וְהַהַרְאֵ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣ע אַמּ֑וֹת (ומהאראיל) [וּמֵהָאֲרִיאֵ֣ל] וּלְמַ֔עְלָה הַקְּרָנ֖וֹת אַרְבַּֽע׃
Translated: and the height of the altar hearth shall be 4 cubits, with 4 horns projecting upward from the hearth: 4 cubits.
Transliteration: vehahareel areva amvot (vmhryl) [umehaariyel] ulemaelah hakeranvot areva

Hebrew: (והאראיל) [וְהָאֲרִיאֵ֗ל] שְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ בִּשְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה רֹ֑חַב רָב֕וּעַ אֶ֖ל אַרְבַּ֥עַת רְבָעָֽיו׃
Translated: Now the hearth shall be 12 cubits long and 12 broad, square, with 4 equal sides.
Transliteration: (vhryl) [vehaariyel] sheteym eshereh orekhe visheteym eshereh rochav ravua el arevaat revaayv

Hebrew: וְהָעֲזָרָ֞ה אַרְבַּ֧ע עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה אֹ֗רֶךְ בְּאַרְבַּ֤ע עֶשְׂרֵה֙ רֹ֔חַב אֶ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣עַת רְבָעֶ֑יהָ וְהַגְּבוּל֩ סָבִ֨יב אוֹתָ֜הּ חֲצִ֣י הָאַמָּ֗ה וְהַחֵֽיק־לָ֤הּ אַמָּה֙ סָבִ֔יב וּמַעֲלֹתֵ֖הוּ פְּנ֥וֹת קָדִֽים׃
Translated: Hence, the [upper] base shall be 14 cubits broad, with 4 equal sides. The surrounding rim shall be half a cubit [high], and the surrounding trench shall measure one cubit. And the ramp shall face east.
Transliteration: vehaazarah areva eshereh orekhe veareva eshereh rochav el arevaat revaeyha vehagevul saviyv votah chatsiy haamah vehacheyk-lah amah saviyv umaalotehu fenvot kadiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י בֶּן־אָדָם֙ כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה אֵ֚לֶּה חֻקּ֣וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בְּי֖וֹם הֵעָשׂוֹת֑וֹ לְהַעֲל֤וֹת עָלָיו֙ עוֹלָ֔ה וְלִזְרֹ֥ק עָלָ֖יו דָּֽם׃
Translated: Then that figure said to me: O mortal, thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: These are the directions for the altar on the day it is erected, so that burnt offerings may be offered up on it and blood dashed against it.
Transliteration: vayomer elay ven-adam khoh amar adonay yehovih eleh chukvot hamizevecha veyvom heashvotvo lehaalvot alayv volah velizerok alayv dam

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים הַלְוִיִּ֡ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵם֩ מִזֶּ֨רַע צָד֜וֹק הַקְּרֹבִ֣ים אֵלַ֗י נְאֻ֛ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה לְשָׁרְתֵ֑נִי פַּ֥ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֖ר לְחַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: You shall give to the levitical priests who are of the stock of Zadok, and so eligible to minister to Me—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—a young bull of the herd for a purgation offering.
Transliteration: venatatah el-hakhohaniym haleviyim asher hem mizera tsadvok hakeroviym elay neum adonay yehovih leshareteniy far ven-vakar lechatat

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ מִדָּמ֗וֹ וְנָ֨תַתָּ֜ה עַל־אַרְבַּ֤ע קַרְנֹתָיו֙ וְאֶל־אַרְבַּע֙ פִּנּ֣וֹת הָעֲזָרָ֔ה וְאֶֽל־הַגְּב֖וּל סָבִ֑יב וְחִטֵּאתָ֥ אוֹת֖וֹ וְכִפַּרְתָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: You shall take some of its blood and apply it to the four horns [of the altar], to the four corners of the base, and to the surrounding rim; thus you shall purge it and perform purification upon it.
Transliteration: velakacheta midamvo venatatah al-areva karenotayv veel-areva finvot haazarah veel-hagevul saviyv vechiteta votvo vekhifaretahu

Hebrew: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת הַפָּ֣ר הַחַטָּ֑את וּשְׂרָפוֹ֙ בְּמִפְקַ֣ד הַבַּ֔יִת מִח֖וּץ לַמִּקְדָּֽשׁ׃
Translated: Then you shall take the bull of purgation offering and burn it in the designated area of the temple, outside the Sanctuary.
Transliteration: velakacheta et hafar hachatat usherafvo vemifekad havayiit michuts lamikedash

Hebrew: וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּקְרִ֛יב שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים תָּמִ֖ים לְחַטָּ֑את וְחִטְּאוּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר חִטְּא֖וּ בַּפָּֽר׃
Translated: On the following day, you shall offer a goat without blemish as a purgation offering; and the altar shall be purged [with it] just as it was purged with the bull.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hasheniy takeriyv sheiyr-iziym tamiym lechatat vechiteu et-hamizevecha khaasher chiteu vafar

Hebrew: בְּכַלּוֹתְךָ֖ מֵחַטֵּ֑א תַּקְרִיב֙ פַּ֣ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֣ר תָּמִ֔ים וְאַ֥יִל מִן־הַצֹּ֖אן תָּמִֽים׃
Translated: When you have completed the ritual of purging, you shall offer a bull of the herd without blemish and a ram of the flock without blemish.
Transliteration: vekhalvotekha mechate takeriyv far ven-vakar tamiym veayiil min-hatson tamiym

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהִשְׁלִ֨יכוּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים עֲלֵיהֶם֙ מֶ֔לַח וְהֶעֱל֥וּ אוֹתָ֛ם עֹלָ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Offer them to G<small>OD</small>; let the priests throw salt on them and offer them up as a burnt offering to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehikeravetam lifeney yehovah vehisheliykhu hakhohaniym aleyhem melach veheelu votam olah layhovah

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה שְׂעִיר־חַטָּ֖את לַיּ֑וֹם וּפַ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר וְאַ֥יִל מִן־הַצֹּ֖אן תְּמִימִ֥ים יַֽעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: Every day, for seven days, you shall present a goat of purgation offering, as well as a bull of the herd and a ram of the flock; you shall present unblemished ones.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym taasheh sheiyr-chatat layyvom ufar ven-vakar veayiil min-hatson temiymiym yaashu

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים יְכַפְּרוּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְטִהֲר֖וּ אֹת֑וֹ וּמִלְא֖וּ יָדָֽו׃
Translated: Seven days they shall purge the altar and purify it; thus shall it be consecrated.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym yekhaferu et-hamizevecha vetiharu otvo umileu yadav

Hebrew: וִֽיכַלּ֖וּ אֶת־הַיָּמִ֑ים {ס} וְהָיָה֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֜י וָהָ֗לְאָה יַעֲשׂ֨וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ אֶת־עוֹלֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ וְאֶת־שַׁלְמֵיכֶ֔ם וְרָצִ֣אתִי אֶתְכֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And when these days are over, then from the eighth day onward the priests shall offer your burnt offerings and your offerings of well-being on the altar; and I will extend My favor to you—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: viykhalu et-hayamiym {s} vehayah vayyvom hashemiyniy vahaleah yaashu hakhohaniym al-hamizevecha et-volvoteykhem veet-shalemeykhem veratsitiy etekhem neum adonay yehovih {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שֶׁב אֹתִ֗י דֶּ֣רֶךְ שַׁ֤עַר הַמִּקְדָּשׁ֙ הַחִיצ֔וֹן הַפֹּנֶ֖ה קָדִ֑ים וְה֖וּא סָגֽוּר׃
Translated: Then he led me back to the outer gate of the Sanctuary that faced eastward; it was shut.
Transliteration: vayashev otiy derekhe shaar hamikedash hachiytsvon hafoneh kadiym vehu sagur

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלַ֜י יְהֹוָ֗ה הַשַּׁ֣עַר הַזֶּה֩ סָג֨וּר יִֽהְיֶ֜ה לֹ֣א יִפָּתֵ֗חַ וְאִישׁ֙ לֹא־יָ֣בֹא ב֔וֹ כִּ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּ֣א ב֑וֹ וְהָיָ֖ה סָגֽוּר׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to me: This gate is to be kept shut and is not to be opened! Absolutely no one shall enter by it because the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, has entered by it; therefore it shall remain shut.
Transliteration: vayomer elay yehovah hashaar hazeh sagur yiheyeh lo yifatecha veiysh lo-yavo vvo khiy yehovah elohey-yisherael va vvo vehayah sagur

Hebrew: אֶֽת־הַנָּשִׂ֗יא נָ֥שִׂיא ה֛וּא יֵשֶׁב־בּ֥וֹ (לאכול) [לֶאֱכׇל־]לֶ֖חֶם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה מִדֶּ֨רֶךְ אוּלָ֤ם הַשַּׁ֙עַר֙ יָב֔וֹא וּמִדַּרְכּ֖וֹ יֵצֵֽא׃
Translated: Only the prince may sit in it and eat bread before G<small>OD</small>, since he is a prince; he shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gate, and shall depart by the same way.
Transliteration: et-hanashiy nashiy hu eishev-vvo (lkhvl) [leekhׇl-]lechem lifeney yehovah miderekhe ulam hashaar yavvo umidarekhvo eitse

Hebrew: וַיְבִיאֵ֜נִי דֶּרֶךְ־שַׁ֣עַר הַצָּפוֹן֮ אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י הַבַּ֒יִת֒ וָאֵ֕רֶא וְהִנֵּ֛ה מָלֵ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וָאֶפֹּ֖ל אֶל־פָּנָֽי׃
Translated: Then he led me, by way of the north gate, to the front of the temple. I looked, and lo! the Presence of G<small>OD</small> filled the Temple of G<small>OD</small>; and I fell upon my face.
Transliteration: vayeviyeniy derekhe-shaar hatsafvon el-feney havayiit vaere vehineh male khevvod-yehovah et-veyt yehovah vaefol el-fanay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלַ֜י יְהֹוָ֗ה בֶּן־אָדָ֡ם שִׂ֣ים לִבְּךָ֩ וּרְאֵ֨ה בְעֵינֶ֜יךָ וּבְאׇזְנֶ֣יךָ שְּׁמָ֗ע אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִי֙ מְדַבֵּ֣ר אֹתָ֔ךְ לְכׇל־חֻקּ֥וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וּלְכׇל־תּוֹרֹתָ֑ו וְשַׂמְתָּ֤ לִבְּךָ֙ לִמְב֣וֹא הַבַּ֔יִת בְּכֹ֖ל מוֹצָאֵ֥י הַמִּקְדָּֽשׁ׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small> said to me: O mortal, mark well, look closely and listen carefully to everything that I tell you regarding all the laws of the Temple of G<small>OD</small> and all the instructions regarding it. Note well who may enter the temple and all who must be excluded from the Sanctuary.
Transliteration: vayomer elay yehovah ven-adam shiym livekha ureeh veeyneykha uveׇzeneykha shema et khׇl-asher aniy medaver otakhe lekhׇl-chukvot veyt-yehovah ulekhׇl-tvorotav veshameta livekha limevvo havayiit vekhol mvotsaey hamikedash

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֤ אֶל־מֶ֙רִי֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כֹּ֥ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה רַב־לָכֶ֛ם מִֽכׇּל־תּוֹעֲב֥וֹתֵיכֶ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And say to the rebellious House of Israel: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Too long, O House of Israel, have you committed all your abominations,
Transliteration: veamareta el-meriy el-veyt yisherael khoh amar adonay yehovih rav-lakhem mikhׇl-tvoavvoteykhem veyt yisherael

Hebrew: בַּהֲבִיאֲכֶ֣ם בְּנֵי־נֵכָ֗ר עַרְלֵי־לֵב֙ וְעַרְלֵ֣י בָשָׂ֔ר לִהְי֥וֹת בְּמִקְדָּשִׁ֖י לְחַלְּל֣וֹ אֶת־בֵּיתִ֑י בְּהַקְרִֽיבְכֶ֤ם אֶת־לַחְמִי֙ חֵ֣לֶב וָדָ֔ם וַיָּפֵ֙רוּ֙ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֔י אֶ֖ל כׇּל־תּוֹעֲבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: admitting aliens, uncircumcised of spirit and uncircumcised of flesh, to be in My Sanctuary and profane My very Temple, when you offer up My food—the fat and the blood. You have broken My covenant with all your abominations.
Transliteration: vahaviyakhem veney-nekhar areley-lev veareley vashar liheyvot vemikedashiy lechalelvo et-veytiy vehakeriyvekhem et-lachemiy chelev vadam vayaferu et-veriytiy el khׇl-tvoavvoteykhem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת קׇדָשָׁ֑י וַתְּשִׂימ֗וּן לְשֹׁמְרֵ֧י מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֛י בְּמִקְדָּשִׁ֖י לָכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: You have not discharged the duties concerning My sacred offerings, but have appointed them to discharge the duties of My Sanctuary for you.
Transliteration: velo shemaretem mishemeret kׇdashay vateshiymun leshomerey mishemaretiy vemikedashiy lakhem {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ כׇּל־בֶּן־נֵכָ֗ר עֶ֤רֶל לֵב֙ וְעֶ֣רֶל בָּשָׂ֔ר לֹ֥א יָב֖וֹא אֶל־מִקְדָּשִׁ֑י לְכׇ֨ל־בֶּן־נֵכָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֕ר בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Let no alien, uncircumcised in spirit and flesh, enter My Sanctuary—no alien whatsoever among the people of Israel.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih khׇl-ven-nekhar erel lev veerel vashar lo yavvo el-mikedashiy lekhׇl-ven-nekhar asher vetvokhe veney yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־הַלְוִיִּ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר רָחֲקוּ֙ מֵעָלַ֔י בִּתְע֤וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּע֣וּ מֵעָלַ֔י אַחֲרֵ֖י גִּלּוּלֵיהֶ֑ם וְנָשְׂא֖וּ עֲוֺנָֽם׃
Translated: But the Levites who forsook Me when Israel went astray—straying from Me to follow their fetishes—shall suffer their punishment:
Transliteration: khiy im-haleviyim asher rachaku mealay vitevot yisherael asher tau mealay acharey giluleyhem venasheu avonam

Hebrew: וְהָי֤וּ בְמִקְדָּשִׁי֙ מְשָׁ֣רְתִ֔ים פְּקֻדּוֹת֙ אֶל־שַׁעֲרֵ֣י הַבַּ֔יִת וּֽמְשָׁרְתִ֖ים אֶת־הַבָּ֑יִת הֵ֠מָּה יִשְׁחֲט֨וּ אֶת־הָעוֹלָ֤ה וְאֶת־הַזֶּ֙בַח֙ לָעָ֔ם וְהֵ֛מָּה יַעַמְד֥וּ לִפְנֵיהֶ֖ם לְשָׁרְתָֽם׃
Translated: They shall be servitors in My Sanctuary, appointed over the Temple gates, and performing the chores of My Temple; they shall slaughter the burnt offerings and the sacrifices for the people. They shall attend on them and serve them.
Transliteration: vehayu vemikedashiy mesharetiym fekudvot el-shaarey havayiit umesharetiym et-havayiit hemah yishechatu et-havolah veet-hazevach laam vehemah yaamedu lifeneyhem lesharetam

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְשָׁרְת֤וּ אוֹתָם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י גִלּוּלֵיהֶ֔ם וְהָי֥וּ לְבֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְמִכְשׁ֣וֹל עָוֺ֑ן עַל־כֵּן֩ נָשָׂ֨אתִי יָדִ֜י עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וְנָשְׂא֖וּ עֲוֺנָֽם׃
Translated: Because they served the House of Israel in the presence of their fetishes and made them stumble into guilt, therefore—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—I have sworn concerning them that they shall suffer their punishment:
Transliteration: yaan asher yesharetu votam lifeney giluleyhem vehayu leveyt-yisherael lemikheshvol avon al-khen nashatiy yadiy aleyhem neum adonay yehovih venasheu avonam

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִגְּשׁ֤וּ אֵלַי֙ לְכַהֵ֣ן לִ֔י וְלָגֶ֙שֶׁת֙ עַל־כׇּל־קׇ֣דָשַׁ֔י אֶל־קׇדְשֵׁ֖י הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים וְנָֽשְׂאוּ֙ כְּלִמָּתָ֔ם וְתוֹעֲבוֹתָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: They shall not approach Me to serve Me as priests, to come near any of My sacred offerings, the most holy things. They shall bear their shame for the abominations that they committed.
Transliteration: velo-yigeshu elay lekhahen liy velageshet al-khׇl-kׇdashay el-kׇdeshey hakodashiym venasheu khelimatam vetvoavvotam asher ashu

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֣י אוֹתָ֔ם שֹׁמְרֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַבָּ֑יִת לְכֹל֙ עֲבֹ֣דָת֔וֹ וּלְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה בּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: I will appoint them to attend to the duties of the temple, to perform all its chores, everything that needs to be done in it.
Transliteration: venatatiy votam shomerey mishemeret havayiit lekhol avodatvo ulekhol asher eiasheh vvo {f}

Hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים הַלְוִיִּ֜ם בְּנֵ֣י צָד֗וֹק אֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁמְר֜וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֤רֶת מִקְדָּשִׁי֙ בִּתְע֤וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵֽעָלַ֔י הֵ֛מָּה יִקְרְב֥וּ אֵלַ֖י לְשָׁרְתֵ֑נִי וְעָמְד֣וּ לְפָנַ֗י לְהַקְרִ֥יב לִי֙ חֵ֣לֶב וָדָ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: But the levitical priests descended from Zadok, who maintained the service of My Sanctuary when the people of Israel went astray from Me—they shall approach Me to minister to Me; they shall stand before Me to offer Me fat and blood—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehakhohaniym haleviyim veney tsadvok asher shameru et-mishemeret mikedashiy vitevot veney-yisherael mealay hemah yikerevu elay leshareteniy veamedu lefanay lehakeriyv liy chelev vadam neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: הֵ֜מָּה יָבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־מִקְדָּשִׁ֗י וְהֵ֛מָּה יִקְרְב֥וּ אֶל־שֻׁלְחָנִ֖י לְשָׁרְתֵ֑נִי וְשָׁמְר֖וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמַרְתִּֽי׃
Translated: They alone may enter My Sanctuary and they alone shall approach My table to minister to Me; and they shall keep My charge.
Transliteration: hemah yavou el-mikedashiy vehemah yikerevu el-shulechaniy leshareteniy veshameru et-mishemaretiy

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בְּבוֹאָם֙ אֶֽל־שַׁעֲרֵי֙ הֶחָצֵ֣ר הַפְּנִימִ֔ית בִּגְדֵ֥י פִשְׁתִּ֖ים יִלְבָּ֑שׁוּ וְלֹֽא־יַעֲלֶ֤ה עֲלֵיהֶם֙ צֶ֔מֶר בְּשָׁרְתָ֗ם בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֛י הֶחָצֵ֥ר הַפְּנִימִ֖ית וָבָֽיְתָה׃
Translated: And when they enter the gates of the inner court, they shall wear linen vestments: they shall have nothing woolen upon them when they minister inside the gates of the inner court.
Transliteration: vehayah vevvoam el-shaarey hechatser hafeniymiyt vigedey fishetiym yilevashu velo-yaaleh aleyhem tsemer vesharetam veshaarey hechatser hafeniymiyt vavayetah

Hebrew: פַּאֲרֵ֤י פִשְׁתִּים֙ יִהְי֣וּ עַל־רֹאשָׁ֔ם וּמִכְנְסֵ֣י פִשְׁתִּ֔ים יִֽהְי֖וּ עַל־מׇתְנֵיהֶ֑ם לֹ֥א יַחְגְּר֖וּ בַּיָּֽזַע׃
Translated: They shall have linen turbans on their heads and linen breeches on their loins; they shall not gird themselves with anything that causes sweat.
Transliteration: faarey fishetiym yiheyu al-rosham umikhenesey fishetiym yiheyu al-mׇteneyhem lo yachegeru vayaza

Hebrew: וּ֠בְצֵאתָ֠ם אֶל־הֶחָצֵ֨ר הַחִיצוֹנָ֜ה אֶל־הֶחָצֵ֣ר הַחִיצוֹנָה֮ אֶל־הָעָם֒ יִפְשְׁט֣וּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֙מָּה֙ מְשָׁרְתִ֣ם בָּ֔ם וְהִנִּ֥יחוּ אוֹתָ֖ם בְּלִֽשְׁכֹ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְלָֽבְשׁוּ֙ בְּגָדִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְלֹא־יְקַדְּשׁ֥וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם בְּבִגְדֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When they go out to the outer court—the outer court where the people are—they shall remove the vestments in which they minister and shall deposit them in the sacred chambers; they shall put on other garments, lest they make the people consecrated by [contact with] their vestments.
Transliteration: uvetsetam el-hechatser hachiytsvonah el-hechatser hachiytsvonah el-haam yifeshetu et-vigedeyhem asher-hemah mesharetim vam vehiniychu votam velishekhot hakodesh velaveshu vegadiym acheriym velo-yekadeshu et-haam vevigedeyhem

Hebrew: וְרֹאשָׁם֙ לֹ֣א יְגַלֵּ֔חוּ וּפֶ֖רַע לֹ֣א יְשַׁלֵּ֑חוּ כָּס֥וֹם יִכְסְמ֖וּ אֶת־רָאשֵׁיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They shall neither shave their heads nor let their hair go untrimmed; they shall keep their hair trimmed.
Transliteration: verosham lo yegalechu ufera lo yeshalechu khasvom yikhesemu et-rasheyhem

Hebrew: וְיַ֥יִן לֹא־יִשְׁתּ֖וּ כׇּל־כֹּהֵ֑ן בְּבוֹאָ֖ם אֶל־הֶחָצֵ֥ר הַפְּנִימִֽית׃
Translated: No priest shall drink wine when he enters into the inner court.
Transliteration: veyayiin lo-yishetu khׇl-khohen vevvoam el-hechatser hafeniymiyt

Hebrew: וְאַלְמָנָה֙ וּגְרוּשָׁ֔ה לֹא־יִקְח֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם לְנָשִׁ֑ים כִּ֣י אִם־בְּתוּלֹ֗ת מִזֶּ֙רַע֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהָֽאַלְמָנָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה אַלְמָנָ֔ה מִכֹּהֵ֖ן יִקָּֽחוּ׃
Translated: They shall not marry widows or divorced women of the stock of the House of Israel, but only virgins; or they may marry widows who are widows of priests.
Transliteration: vealemanah ugerushah lo-yikechu lahem lenashiym khiy im-vetulot mizera veyt yisherael vehaalemanah asher tiheyeh alemanah mikhohen yikachu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַמִּ֣י יוֹר֔וּ בֵּ֥ין קֹ֖דֶשׁ לְחֹ֑ל וּבֵין־טָמֵ֥א לְטָה֖וֹר יוֹדִעֻֽם׃
Translated: They shall declare to My people what is sacred and what is profane, and inform them what is pure and what is impure.
Transliteration: veet-amiy yvoru veyn kodesh lechol uveyn-tame letahvor yvodium

Hebrew: וְעַל־רִ֗יב הֵ֚מָּה יַעַמְד֣וּ (לשפט) [לְמִשְׁפָּ֔ט] בְּמִשְׁפָּטַ֖י (ושפטהו) [יִשְׁפְּט֑וּהוּ] וְאֶת־תּוֹרֹתַ֤י וְאֶת־חֻקֹּתַי֙ בְּכׇל־מוֹעֲדַ֣י יִשְׁמֹ֔רוּ וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתַ֖י יְקַדֵּֽשׁוּ׃
Translated: In lawsuits, too, it is they who shall act as judges; they shall decide them in accordance with My rules. They shall preserve My teachings and My laws regarding all My fixed occasions; and they shall maintain the sanctity of My sabbaths.
Transliteration: veal-riyv hemah yaamedu (lshft) [lemishefat] vemishefatay (vshfthv) [yishefetuhu] veet-tvorotay veet-chukotay vekhׇl-mvoaday yishemoru veet-shavetvotay yekadeshu

Hebrew: וְאֶל־מֵ֣ת אָדָ֔ם לֹ֥א יָב֖וֹא לְטׇמְאָ֑ה כִּ֣י אִם־לְאָ֡ב וּ֠לְאֵ֠ם וּלְבֵ֨ן וּלְבַ֜ת לְאָ֗ח וּלְאָח֛וֹת אֲשֶֽׁר־לֹא־הָיְתָ֥ה לְאִ֖ישׁ יִטַּמָּֽאוּ׃
Translated: [A priest] shall not defile himself by entering [a house] where there is a dead person. He shall defile himself only for father or mother, son or daughter, brother or unmarried sister.
Transliteration: veel-met adam lo yavvo letׇmeah khiy im-leav uleem uleven ulevat leach uleachvot asher-lo-hayetah leiysh yitamau

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵ֖י טׇהֳרָת֑וֹ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים יִסְפְּרוּ־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: After he has become pure, seven days shall be counted off for him;
Transliteration: veacharey tׇhoratvo shiveat yamiym yiseferu-lvo

Hebrew: וּבְיוֹם֩ בֹּא֨וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ אֶל־הֶחָצֵ֤ר הַפְּנִימִית֙ לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֔דֶשׁ יַקְרִ֖יב חַטָּאת֑וֹ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: and on the day that he reenters the inner court of the Sanctuary to minister in the Sanctuary, he shall present his purgation offering—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: uveyvom vovo el-hakodesh el-hechatser hafeniymiyt lesharet vakodesh yakeriyv chatatvo neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֤ה לָהֶם֙ לְֽנַחֲלָ֔ה אֲנִ֖י נַחֲלָתָ֑ם וַאֲחֻזָּ֗ה לֹֽא־תִתְּנ֤וּ לָהֶם֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲנִ֖י אֲחֻזָּתָֽם׃
Translated: This shall be their portion, for I am their portion; and no holding shall be given them in Israel, for I am their holding.
Transliteration: vehayetah lahem lenachalah aniy nachalatam vaachuzah lo-titenu lahem veyisherael aniy achuzatam

Hebrew: הַמִּנְחָה֙ וְהַחַטָּ֣את וְהָאָשָׁ֔ם הֵ֖מָּה יֹאכְל֑וּם וְכׇל־חֵ֥רֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לָהֶ֥ם יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: The grain offerings, purgation offerings, and reparation offerings shall be consumed by them. Everything proscribed in Israel shall be theirs.
Transliteration: haminechah vehachatat vehaasham hemah yokhelum vekhׇl-cherem veyisherael lahem yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְרֵאשִׁית֩ כׇּל־בִּכּ֨וּרֵי כֹ֜ל וְכׇל־תְּר֣וּמַת כֹּ֗ל מִכֹּל֙ תְּרוּמ֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם לַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים יִהְיֶ֑ה וְרֵאשִׁ֤ית עֲרִסֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ תִּתְּנ֣וּ לַכֹּהֵ֔ן לְהָנִ֥יחַ בְּרָכָ֖ה אֶל־בֵּיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: All the choice first fruits of every kind, and all the gifts of every kind—of all your contributions—shall go to the priests. You shall further give the first of the yield of your baking to the priest, that a blessing may rest upon your home.
Transliteration: vereshiyt khׇl-vikhurey khol vekhׇl-terumat khol mikhol terumvoteykhem lakhohaniym yiheyeh vereshiyt arisvoteykhem titenu lakhohen lehaniycha verakhah el-veytekha

Hebrew: כׇּל־נְבֵלָה֙ וּטְרֵפָ֔ה מִן־הָע֖וֹף וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֑ה לֹ֥א יֹאכְל֖וּ הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Priests shall not eat anything, whether bird or animal, that died or was torn by beasts.
Transliteration: khׇl-nevelah uterefah min-havof umin-havehemah lo yokhelu hakhohaniym {f}

Hebrew: וּבְהַפִּֽילְכֶ֨ם אֶת־הָאָ֜רֶץ בְּנַחֲלָ֗ה תָּרִ֩ימוּ֩ תְרוּמָ֨ה לַיהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> קֹ֘דֶשׁ֮ מִן־הָאָ֒רֶץ֒ אֹ֗רֶךְ חֲמִשָּׁ֨ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ וְרֹ֖חַב עֲשָׂ֣רָה אָ֑לֶף קֹדֶשׁ־ה֥וּא בְכׇל־גְּבוּלָ֖הּ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: When you allot the land as an inheritance, you shall set aside from the land, as a gift sacred to G<small>OD</small>, an area 25,000 [cubits] long and 10,000 wide: this shall be holy through its entire extent.
Transliteration: uvehafiylekhem et-haarets venachalah tariymu terumah layhovah <small></small> kodesh min-haarets orekhe chamishah veesheriym elef orekhe verochav asharah alef kodesh-hu vekhׇl-gevulah saviyv

Hebrew: יִֽהְיֶ֤ה מִזֶּה֙ אֶל־הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֛וֹת בַּחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת מְרֻבָּ֣ע סָבִ֑יב וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֔ה מִגְרָ֥שׁ ל֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Of this, a square measuring a full 500 by 500 shall be reserved for the Sanctuary, and 50 cubits for an open space all around it.
Transliteration: yiheyeh mizeh el-hakodesh chamesh mevot vachamesh mevot meruva saviyv vachamishiym amah migerash lvo saviyv

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַמִּדָּ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ תָּמ֔וֹד אֹ֗רֶךְ (חמש) [חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה] וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְרֹ֖חַב עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת אֲלָפִ֑ים וּבֽוֹ־יִהְיֶ֥ה הַמִּקְדָּ֖שׁ קֹ֥דֶשׁ קׇדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Of the aforesaid area, you shall measure off, as most holy and destined to include the Sanctuary, [a space] 25,000 long by 10,000 wide;
Transliteration: umin-hamidah hazot tamvod orekhe (chmsh) [chamishah] veesheriym elef verochav asheret alafiym uvvo-yiheyeh hamikedash kodesh kׇdashiym

Hebrew: קֹ֣דֶשׁ מִן־הָאָ֜רֶץ ה֗וּא לַכֹּ֨הֲנִ֜ים מְשָׁרְתֵ֤י הַמִּקְדָּשׁ֙ יִֽהְיֶ֔ה הַקְּרֵבִ֖ים לְשָׁרֵ֣ת אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֨ה לָהֶ֤ם מָקוֹם֙ לְבָ֣תִּ֔ים וּמִקְדָּ֖שׁ לַמִּקְדָּֽשׁ׃
Translated: it is a sacred portion of the land; it shall provide space for houses for the priests, the ministrants of the Sanctuary who are qualified to minister to G<small>OD</small>, as well as holy ground for the Sanctuary.
Transliteration: kodesh min-haarets hu lakhohaniym mesharetey hamikedash yiheyeh hakereviym lesharet et-yehovah vehayah lahem makvom levatiym umikedash lamikedash

Hebrew: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ וַעֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִ֖ים רֹ֑חַב (יהיה) [וְֽהָיָ֡ה] לַלְוִיִּם֩ מְשָׁרְתֵ֨י הַבַּ֧יִת לָהֶ֛ם לַאֲחֻזָּ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים לְשָׁכֹֽת׃
Translated: Another [space], 25,000 long by 10,000 wide, shall be the property of the Levites, the servants of the temple—twenty chambers.
Transliteration: vachamishah veesheriym elef orekhe vaasheret alafiym rochav (yhyh) [vehayah] laleviyim mesharetey havayiit lahem laachuzah esheriym leshakhot

Hebrew: וַאֲחֻזַּ֨ת הָעִ֜יר תִּתְּנ֗וּ חֲמֵ֤שֶׁת אֲלָפִים֙ רֹ֔חַב וְאֹ֗רֶךְ חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף לְעֻמַּ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְכׇל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Alongside the sacred reserve, you shall set aside [a space] 25,000 long by 5,000 wide, as the property of the city; it shall belong to the whole House of Israel.
Transliteration: vaachuzat haiyr titenu chameshet alafiym rochav veorekhe chamishah veesheriym elef leumat terumat hakodesh lekhׇl-veyt yisherael yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְלַנָּשִׂ֡יא מִזֶּ֣ה וּמִזֶּה֩ לִתְרוּמַ֨ת הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ וְלַאֲחֻזַּ֣ת הָעִ֗יר אֶל־פְּנֵ֤י תְרֽוּמַת־הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ וְאֶל־פְּנֵי֙ אֲחֻזַּ֣ת הָעִ֔יר מִפְּאַת־יָ֣ם יָ֔מָּה וּמִפְּאַת־קֵ֖דְמָה קָדִ֑ימָה וְאֹ֗רֶךְ לְעֻמּוֹת֙ אַחַ֣ד הַחֲלָקִ֔ים מִגְּב֥וּל יָ֖ם אֶל־גְּב֥וּל קָדִֽימָה׃
Translated: And to the prince shall belong, on both sides of the sacred reserve and the property of the city and alongside the sacred reserve and the property of the city, on the west extending westward and on the east extending eastward, a portion corresponding to one of the [tribal] portions that extend from the western border to the eastern border
Transliteration: velanashiy mizeh umizeh literumat hakodesh velaachuzat haiyr el-feney terumat-hakodesh veel-feney achuzat haiyr mifeat-yam yamah umifeat-kedemah kadiymah veorekhe leumvot achad hachalakiym migevul yam el-gevul kadiymah

Hebrew: לָאָ֛רֶץ יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֥וֹ לַאֲחֻזָּ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹא־יוֹנ֨וּ ע֤וֹד נְשִׂיאַי֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וְהָאָ֛רֶץ יִתְּנ֥וּ לְבֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְשִׁבְטֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: of the land. That shall be his property in Israel; and My princes shall no more defraud My people, but shall leave the rest of the land to the several tribes of the House of Israel.
Transliteration: laarets yiheyeh-lvo laachuzah veyisherael velo-yvonu vod neshiyay et-amiy vehaarets yitenu leveyt-yisherael leshiveteyhem {f}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה רַב־לָכֶם֙ נְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל חָמָ֤ס וָשֹׁד֙ הָסִ֔ירוּ וּמִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה עֲשׂ֑וּ הָרִ֤ימוּ גְרֻשֹֽׁתֵיכֶם֙ מֵעַ֣ל עַמִּ֔י נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: Enough, princes of Israel! Make an end of lawlessness and rapine, and do what is right and just! Put a stop to your evictions of My people—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih rav-lakhem neshiyey yisherael chamas vashod hasiyru umishefat utsedakah ashu hariymu gerushoteykhem meal amiy neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: מֹֽאזְנֵי־צֶ֧דֶק וְאֵֽיפַת־צֶ֛דֶק וּבַת־צֶ֖דֶק יְהִ֥י לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Have honest balances, an honest ephah, and an honest bath.
Transliteration: mozeney-tsedek veeyfat-tsedek uvat-tsedek yehiy lakhem

Hebrew: הָאֵיפָ֣ה וְהַבַּ֗ת תֹּ֤כֶן אֶחָד֙ יִֽהְיֶ֔ה לָשֵׂ֕את מַעְשַׂ֥ר הַחֹ֖מֶר הַבָּ֑ת וַעֲשִׂירִ֤ת הַחֹ֙מֶר֙ הָאֵיפָ֔ה אֶל־הַחֹ֖מֶר יִהְיֶ֥ה מַתְכֻּנְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: The ephah and the bath shall comprise the same volume, the bath a tenth of a ḥomer and the ephah a tenth of a ḥomer; their capacity shall be gauged by the ḥomer.
Transliteration: haeyfah vehavat tokhen echad yiheyeh lashet maeshar hachomer havat vaashiyrit hachomer haeyfah el-hachomer yiheyeh matekhunetvo

Hebrew: וְהַשֶּׁ֖קֶל עֶשְׂרִ֣ים גֵּרָ֑ה עֶשְׂרִ֨ים שְׁקָלִ֜ים חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֣ים שְׁקָלִ֗ים עֲשָׂרָ֤ה וַחֲמִשָּׁה֙ שֶׁ֔קֶל הַמָּנֶ֖ה יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: And the shekel shall weigh 20 gerahs. 20 shekels, 25 shekels [and] 10 plus 5 shekels shall count with you as a mina.
Transliteration: vehashekel esheriym gerah esheriym shekaliym chamishah veesheriym shekaliym asharah vachamishah shekel hamaneh yiheyeh lakhem

Hebrew: זֹ֥את הַתְּרוּמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּרִ֑ימוּ שִׁשִּׁ֤ית הָאֵיפָה֙ מֵחֹ֣מֶר הַחִטִּ֔ים וְשִׁשִּׁיתֶם֙ הָאֵיפָ֔ה מֵחֹ֖מֶר הַשְּׂעֹרִֽים׃
Translated: This is the contribution you shall make: One-sixth of an ephah from every ḥomer of wheat and one-sixth of an ephah from every ḥomer of barley,
Transliteration: zot haterumah asher tariymu shishiyt haeyfah mechomer hachitiym veshishiytem haeyfah mechomer hasheoriym

Hebrew: וְחֹ֨ק הַשֶּׁ֜מֶן הַבַּ֣ת הַשֶּׁ֗מֶן מַעְשַׂ֤ר הַבַּת֙ מִן־הַכֹּ֔ר עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת הַבַּתִּ֖ים חֹ֑מֶר כִּֽי־עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת הַבַּתִּ֖ים חֹֽמֶר׃
Translated: while the due from the oil—the oil being measured by the bath —shall be one-tenth of a bath from every kor.—As 10 baths make a ḥomer, so 10 baths make a ḥomer.—
Transliteration: vechok hashemen havat hashemen maeshar havat min-hakhor asheret havatiym chomer khiy-asheret havatiym chomer

Hebrew: וְשֶׂה־אַחַ֨ת מִן־הַצֹּ֤אן מִן־הַמָּאתַ֙יִם֙ מִמַּשְׁקֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְמִנְחָ֖ה וּלְעוֹלָ֣ה וְלִשְׁלָמִ֑ים לְכַפֵּ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And [the due] from the flock shall be one animal from every 200. [All these shall be contributed] from Israel’s products for grain offerings, burnt offerings, and offerings of well-being, to make expiation for them—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vesheh-achat min-hatson min-hamatayiim mimashekeh yisherael leminechah ulevolah velishelamiym lekhafer aleyhem neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ל הָעָ֣ם הָאָ֔רֶץ יִהְי֖וּ אֶל־הַתְּרוּמָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את לַנָּשִׂ֖יא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: In this contribution, the entire population must join with the prince in Israel.
Transliteration: khol haam haarets yiheyu el-haterumah hazot lanashiy veyisherael

Hebrew: וְעַֽל־הַנָּשִׂ֣יא יִֽהְיֶ֗ה הָעוֹל֣וֹת וְהַמִּנְחָה֮ וְהַנֵּ֒סֶךְ֒ בַּחַגִּ֤ים וּבֶחֳדָשִׁים֙ וּבַשַּׁבָּת֔וֹת בְּכׇֽל־מוֹעֲדֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הֽוּא־יַעֲשֶׂ֞ה אֶת־הַחַטָּ֣את וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֗ה וְאֶת־הָעוֹלָה֙ וְאֶת־הַשְּׁלָמִ֔ים לְכַפֵּ֖ר בְּעַ֥ד בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: But the burnt offerings, the grain offerings, and the libations on festivals, new moons, sabbaths—all fixed occasions—of the House of Israel shall be the obligation of the prince; he shall provide the purgation offerings, the grain offerings, the burnt offerings, and the offerings of well-being, to make expiation for the House of Israel.
Transliteration: veal-hanashiy yiheyeh havolvot vehaminechah vehanesekhe vachagiym uvechodashiym uvashavatvot vekhׇl-mvoadey veyt yisherael hu-yaasheh et-hachatat veet-haminechah veet-havolah veet-hashelamiym lekhafer vead veyt-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ בָּֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ תִּקַּ֥ח פַּר־בֶּן־בָּקָ֖ר תָּמִ֑ים וְחִטֵּאתָ֖ אֶת־הַמִּקְדָּֽשׁ׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: On the first day of the first month, you shall take a bull of the herd without blemish, and you shall cleanse the Sanctuary.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih varishvon veechad lachodesh tikach far-ven-vakar tamiym vechiteta et-hamikedash

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח הַכֹּהֵ֜ן מִדַּ֣ם הַחַטָּ֗את וְנָתַן֙ אֶל־מְזוּזַ֣ת הַבַּ֔יִת וְאֶל־אַרְבַּ֛ע פִּנּ֥וֹת הָעֲזָרָ֖ה לַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְעַ֨ל־מְזוּזַ֔ת שַׁ֖עַר הֶחָצֵ֥ר הַפְּנִימִֽית׃
Translated: The priest shall take some of the blood of the purgation offering and apply it to the doorposts of the temple, to the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and to the doorposts of the gate of the inner court.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen midam hachatat venatan el-mezuzat havayiit veel-areva finvot haazarah lamizevecha veal-mezuzat shaar hechatser hafeniymiyt

Hebrew: וְכֵ֤ן תַּֽעֲשֶׂה֙ בְּשִׁבְעָ֣ה בַחֹ֔דֶשׁ מֵאִ֥ישׁ שֹׁגֶ֖ה וּמִפֶּ֑תִי וְכִפַּרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: You shall do the same on the seventh day of the month to purge the temple from impurity caused by unwitting or ignorant persons.
Transliteration: vekhen taasheh veshiveah vachodesh meiysh shogeh umifetiy vekhifaretem et-havayiit

Hebrew: בָּ֠רִאשׁ֠וֹן בְּאַרְבָּעָ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם הַפָּ֑סַח חָ֕ג שְׁבֻע֣וֹת יָמִ֔ים מַצּ֖וֹת יֵאָכֵֽל׃
Translated: On the fourteenth day of the first month you shall have the passover sacrifice; and during a festival of seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten.
Transliteration: varishvon vearevaah ashar yvom lachodesh yiheyeh lakhem hafasach chag shevuvot yamiym matsvot eiakhel

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה הַנָּשִׂיא֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא בַּעֲד֕וֹ וּבְעַ֖ד כׇּל־עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ פַּ֖ר חַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: On that day, the prince shall provide a bull of purgation offering on behalf of himself and of the entire population;
Transliteration: veashah hanashiy vayyvom hahu vaadvo uvead khׇl-am haarets far chatat

Hebrew: וְשִׁבְעַ֨ת יְמֵי־הֶחָ֜ג יַעֲשֶׂ֧ה עוֹלָ֣ה לַיהֹוָ֗ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת פָּ֠רִ֠ים וְשִׁבְעַ֨ת אֵילִ֤ים תְּמִימִם֙ לַיּ֔וֹם שִׁבְעַ֖ת הַיָּמִ֑ים וְחַטָּ֕את שְׂעִ֥יר עִזִּ֖ים לַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: and during the seven days of the festival, he shall provide daily—for seven days—seven bulls and seven rams, without blemish, for a burnt offering to G<small>OD</small>, and one goat daily for a purgation offering.
Transliteration: veshiveat yemey-hechag yaasheh volah layhovah shiveat fariym veshiveat eyliym temiymim layyvom shiveat hayamiym vechatat sheiyr iziym layyvom

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָ֗ה אֵיפָ֥ה לַפָּ֛ר וְאֵיפָ֥ה לָאַ֖יִל יַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וְשֶׁ֖מֶן הִ֥ין לָאֵיפָֽה׃
Translated: He shall provide a grain offering of an ephah for each bull and an ephah for each ram, with a hin of oil to every ephah.
Transliteration: uminechah eyfah lafar veeyfah laayiil yaasheh veshemen hiyn laeyfah

Hebrew: בַּשְּׁבִיעִ֡י בַּחֲמִשָּׁה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֤וֹם לַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בֶּחָ֔ג יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה כָאֵ֖לֶּה שִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים כַּֽחַטָּאת֙ כָּעֹלָ֔ה וְכַמִּנְחָ֖ה וְכַשָּֽׁמֶן׃ {ס}
Translated: So, too, during the festival of the seventh month, for seven days from the fifteenth day on, he shall provide the same purgation offerings, burnt offerings, grain offerings, and oil.
Transliteration: vasheviyiy vachamishah ashar yvom lachodesh vechag yaasheh khaeleh shiveat hayamiym khachatat khaolah vekhaminechah vekhashamen {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַר֮ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִה֒ שַׁ֜עַר הֶחָצֵ֤ר הַפְּנִימִית֙ הַפֹּנֶ֣ה קָדִ֔ים יִהְיֶ֣ה סָג֔וּר שֵׁ֖שֶׁת יְמֵ֣י הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֑ה וּבְי֤וֹם הַשַּׁבָּת֙ יִפָּתֵ֔חַ וּבְי֥וֹם הַחֹ֖דֶשׁ יִפָּתֵֽחַ׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: The gate of the inner court that faces east shall be closed on the six working days; it shall be opened on the sabbath day and it shall be opened on the day of the new moon.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih shaar hechatser hafeniymiyt hafoneh kadiym yiheyeh sagur sheshet yemey hamaasheh uveyvom hashavat yifatecha uveyvom hachodesh yifatecha

Hebrew: וּבָ֣א הַנָּשִׂ֡יא דֶּ֩רֶךְ֩ אוּלָ֨ם הַשַּׁ֜עַר מִח֗וּץ וְעָמַד֙ עַל־מְזוּזַ֣ת הַשַּׁ֔עַר וְעָשׂ֣וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים אֶת־עֽוֹלָתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־שְׁלָמָ֔יו וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוָ֛ה עַל־מִפְתַּ֥ן הַשַּׁ֖עַר וְיָצָ֑א וְהַשַּׁ֥עַר לֹא־יִסָּגֵ֖ר עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: The prince shall enter by way of the vestibule outside the gate, and shall attend at the gatepost while the priests sacrifice his burnt offering and his offering of well-being; he shall then bow low at the threshold of the gate and depart. The gate, however, shall not be closed until evening.
Transliteration: uva hanashiy derekhe ulam hashaar michuts veamad al-mezuzat hashaar veashu hakhohaniym et-volatvo veet-shelamayv vehishetachavah al-mifetan hashaar veyatsa vehashaar lo-yisager ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ עַם־הָאָ֗רֶץ פֶּ֚תַח הַשַּׁ֣עַר הַה֔וּא בַּשַּׁבָּת֖וֹת וּבֶחֳדָשִׁ֑ים לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The common people shall worship before G<small>OD</small> on sabbaths and new moons at the entrance of the same gate.
Transliteration: vehishetachavu am-haarets fetach hashaar hahu vashavatvot uvechodashiym lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְהָ֣עֹלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֥ב הַנָּשִׂ֖יא לַיהֹוָ֑ה בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֗ת שִׁשָּׁ֧ה כְבָשִׂ֛ים תְּמִימִ֖ם וְאַ֥יִל תָּמִֽים׃
Translated: The burnt offering that the prince presents to G<small>OD</small> on the sabbath day shall consist of six lambs without blemish and one ram without blemish—
Transliteration: vehaolah asher-yakeriv hanashiy layhovah veyvom hashavat shishah khevashiym temiymim veayiil tamiym

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָה֙ אֵיפָ֣ה לָאַ֔יִל וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֥ים מִנְחָ֖ה מַתַּ֣ת יָד֑וֹ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן הִ֥ין לָאֵיפָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: with a grain offering of an ephah for the ram, a grain offering of as much as he wishes for the lambs, and a hin of oil with every ephah.
Transliteration: uminechah eyfah laayiil velakhevashiym minechah matat yadvo veshemen hiyn laeyfah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְי֣וֹם הַחֹ֔דֶשׁ פַּ֥ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֖ר תְּמִימִ֑ם וְשֵׁ֧שֶׁת כְּבָשִׂ֛ים וָאַ֖יִל תְּמִימִ֥ם יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: And on the day of the new moon, it shall consist of a bull of the herd without blemish, and six lambs and a ram—they shall be without blemish.
Transliteration: uveyvom hachodesh far ven-vakar temiymim vesheshet khevashiym vaayiil temiymim yiheyu

Hebrew: וְאֵיפָ֨ה לַפָּ֜ר וְאֵיפָ֤ה לָאַ֙יִל֙ יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה מִנְחָ֔ה וְלַ֨כְּבָשִׂ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּשִּׂ֖יג יָד֑וֹ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן הִ֥ין לָאֵיפָֽה׃
Translated: And he shall provide a grain offering of an ephah for the bull, an ephah for the ram, and as much as he can afford for the lambs, with a hin of oil to every ephah.
Transliteration: veeyfah lafar veeyfah laayiil yaasheh minechah velakhevashiym khaasher tashiyg yadvo veshemen hiyn laeyfah

Hebrew: וּבְב֖וֹא הַנָּשִׂ֑יא דֶּ֣רֶךְ אוּלָ֤ם הַשַּׁ֙עַר֙ יָב֔וֹא וּבְדַרְכּ֖וֹ יֵצֵֽא׃
Translated: When the prince enters, he shall come in by way of the vestibule of the gate, and he shall go out the same way.
Transliteration: uvevvo hanashiy derekhe ulam hashaar yavvo uvedarekhvo eitse

Hebrew: וּבְב֨וֹא עַם־הָאָ֜רֶץ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָה֮ בַּמּוֹעֲדִים֒ הַבָּ֡א דֶּרֶךְ־שַׁ֨עַר צָפ֜וֹן לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֗ת יֵצֵא֙ דֶּרֶךְ־שַׁ֣עַר נֶ֔גֶב וְהַבָּא֙ דֶּרֶךְ־שַׁ֣עַר נֶ֔גֶב יֵצֵ֖א דֶּרֶךְ־שַׁ֣עַר צָפ֑וֹנָה לֹ֣א יָשׁ֗וּב דֶּ֤רֶךְ הַשַּׁ֙עַר֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣א ב֔וֹ כִּ֥י נִכְח֖וֹ (יצאו) [יֵצֵֽא]׃
Translated: But on the fixed occasions, when the common people come before G<small>OD</small>, whoever enters by the north gate to bow low shall leave by the south gate; and whoever enters by the south gate shall leave by the north gate. They shall not go back through the gate by which they came in, but shall go out by the opposite one.
Transliteration: uvevvo am-haarets lifeney yehovah vamvoadiym hava derekhe-shaar tsafvon lehishetachavot eitse derekhe-shaar negev vehava derekhe-shaar negev eitse derekhe-shaar tsafvonah lo yashuv derekhe hashaar asher-va vvo khiy nikhechvo (ytsv) [eitse]

Hebrew: וְֽהַנָּשִׂ֑יא בְּתוֹכָ֤ם בְּבוֹאָם֙ יָב֔וֹא וּבְצֵאתָ֖ם יֵצֵֽאוּ׃
Translated: And as for the prince, he shall enter with them when they enter and leave when they leave.
Transliteration: vehanashiy vetvokham vevvoam yavvo uvetsetam eitseu

Hebrew: וּבַחַגִּ֣ים וּבַמּוֹעֲדִ֗ים תִּהְיֶ֤ה הַמִּנְחָה֙ אֵיפָ֤ה לַפָּר֙ וְאֵיפָ֣ה לָאַ֔יִל וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֖ים מַתַּ֣ת יָד֑וֹ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן הִ֥ין לָאֵיפָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: On festivals and fixed occasions, the grain offering shall be an ephah for each bull, an ephah for each ram, and as much as he wishes for the lambs, with a hin of oil for every ephah.
Transliteration: uvachagiym uvamvoadiym tiheyeh haminechah eyfah lafar veeyfah laayiil velakhevashiym matat yadvo veshemen hiyn laeyfah {f}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יַעֲשֶׂה֩ הַנָּשִׂ֨יא נְדָבָ֜ה עוֹלָ֣ה אוֹ־שְׁלָמִים֮ נְדָבָ֣ה לַיהֹוָה֒ וּפָ֣תַֽח ל֗וֹ אֶת־הַשַּׁ֙עַר֙ הַפֹּנֶ֣ה קָדִ֔ים וְעָשָׂ֤ה אֶת־עֹֽלָתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־שְׁלָמָ֔יו כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת וְיָצָ֛א וְסָגַ֥ר אֶת־הַשַּׁ֖עַר אַחֲרֵ֥י צֵאתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The gate that faces east shall also be opened for the prince whenever he offers a freewill offering—be it burnt offering or offering of well-being—freely offered to G<small>OD</small>, so that he may offer his burnt offering or his offering of well-being just as he does on the sabbath day. Then he shall leave, and the gate shall be closed after he leaves.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yaasheh hanashiy nedavah volah vo-shelamiym nedavah layhovah ufatach lvo et-hashaar hafoneh kadiym veashah et-olatvo veet-shelamayv khaasher yaasheh veyvom hashavat veyatsa vesagar et-hashaar acharey tsetvo

Hebrew: וְכֶ֨בֶשׂ בֶּן־שְׁנָת֜וֹ תָּמִ֗ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה עוֹלָ֛ה לַיּ֖וֹם לַיהֹוָ֑ה בַּבֹּ֥קֶר בַּבֹּ֖קֶר תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Each day you shall offer a lamb of the first year without blemish, as a daily burnt offering to G<small>OD</small>; you shall offer one every morning.
Transliteration: vekhevesh ven-shenatvo tamiym taasheh volah layyvom layhovah vavoker vavoker taasheh otvo

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָה֩ תַעֲשֶׂ֨ה עָלָ֜יו בַּבֹּ֤קֶר בַּבֹּ֙קֶר֙ שִׁשִּׁ֣ית הָאֵיפָ֔ה וְשֶׁ֛מֶן שְׁלִישִׁ֥ית הַהִ֖ין לָרֹ֣ס אֶת־הַסֹּ֑לֶת מִנְחָה֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה חֻקּ֥וֹת עוֹלָ֖ם תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated: And every morning regularly you shall offer a grain offering with it: a sixth of an ephah, with a third of a hin of oil to moisten the choice flour, as a grain offering to GOD—a law for all time.
Transliteration: uminechah taasheh alayv vavoker vavoker shishiyt haeyfah veshemen sheliyshiyt hahiyn laros et-hasolet minechah layhovah chukvot volam tamiyd

Hebrew: (ועשו) [יַעֲשׂ֨וּ] אֶת־הַכֶּ֧בֶשׂ וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֛ה וְאֶת־הַשֶּׁ֖מֶן בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֑קֶר עוֹלַ֖ת תָּמִֽיד׃ {ס}
Translated: The lamb, the grain offering, and oil shall be presented every morning as a regular burnt offering.
Transliteration: (vshv) [yaashu] et-hakhevesh veet-haminechah veet-hashemen vavoker vavoker volat tamiyd {s}

Hebrew: כֹּה־אָמַ֞ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה כִּֽי־יִתֵּ֨ן הַנָּשִׂ֤יא מַתָּנָה֙ לְאִ֣ישׁ מִבָּנָ֔יו נַחֲלָת֥וֹ הִ֖יא לְבָנָ֣יו תִּֽהְיֶ֑ה אֲחֻזָּתָ֥ם הִ֖יא בְּנַחֲלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: If the prince makes a gift to any of his sons, it shall become the latter’s inheritance; it shall pass on to his sons; it is their holding by inheritance.
Transliteration: khoh-amar adonay yehovih khiy-yiten hanashiy matanah leiysh mivanayv nachalatvo hiy levanayv tiheyeh achuzatam hiy venachalah {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִתֵּ֨ן מַתָּנָ֜ה מִנַּחֲלָת֗וֹ לְאַחַד֙ מֵֽעֲבָדָ֔יו וְהָ֤יְתָה לּוֹ֙ עַד־שְׁנַ֣ת הַדְּר֔וֹר וְשָׁבַ֖ת לַנָּשִׂ֑יא אַ֚ךְ נַחֲלָת֔וֹ בָּנָ֖יו לָהֶ֥ם תִּהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: But if he makes a gift from his inheritance to any of his subjects, it shall only belong to the latter until the year of release. Then it shall revert to the prince; his inheritance must by all means pass on to his sons.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yiten matanah minachalatvo leachad meavadayv vehayetah lvo ad-shenat hadervor veshavat lanashiy akhe nachalatvo vanayv lahem tiheyeh

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִקַּ֨ח הַנָּשִׂ֜יא מִנַּחֲלַ֣ת הָעָ֗ם לְהֽוֹנֹתָם֙ מֵאֲחֻזָּתָ֔ם מֵאֲחֻזָּת֖וֹ יַנְחִ֣ל אֶת־בָּנָ֑יו לְמַ֙עַן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָפֻ֣צוּ עַמִּ֔י אִ֖ישׁ מֵאֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: But the prince shall not take property away from any of the people and rob them of their holdings. Only out of his own holdings shall he endow his sons, in order that none of My people may be dispossessed of their holdings.
Transliteration: velo-yikach hanashiy minachalat haam lehvonotam meachuzatam meachuzatvo yanechil et-vanayv lemaan asher lo-yafutsu amiy iysh meachuzatvo

Hebrew: וַיְבִיאֵ֣נִי בַמָּבוֹא֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־כֶּ֣תֶף הַשַּׁ֒עַר֒ אֶל־הַלִּשְׁכ֤וֹת הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ אֶל־הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים הַפֹּנ֖וֹת צָפ֑וֹנָה וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֣ם מָק֔וֹם (בירכתם) [בַּיַּרְכָתַ֖יִם] יָֽמָּה׃
Translated: Then the guide led me into the passage at the side of the gate to the sacred chambers of the priests, which face north, and there, at the rear of it, in the west, I saw a space.
Transliteration: vayeviyeniy vamavvo asher al-khetef hashaar el-halishekhvot hakodesh el-hakhohaniym hafonvot tsafvonah vehineh-sham makvom (vyrkhtm) [vayarekhatayiim] yamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֔י זֶ֣ה הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יְבַשְּׁלוּ־שָׁם֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים אֶת־הָאָשָׁ֖ם וְאֶת־הַחַטָּ֑את אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֹאפוּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה לְבִלְתִּ֥י הוֹצִ֛יא אֶל־הֶחָצֵ֥ר הַחִיצוֹנָ֖ה לְקַדֵּ֥שׁ אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: He said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the reparation offerings and the purgation offerings, and where they shall bake the grain offerings, so as not to take them into the outer court and make the people consecrated.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay zeh hamakvom asher yevashelu-sham hakhohaniym et-haasham veet-hachatat asher yofu et-haminechah leviletiy hvotsiy el-hechatser hachiytsvonah lekadesh et-haam

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִיאֵ֗נִי אֶל־הֶחָצֵר֙ הַחִ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה וַיַּ֣עֲבִרֵ֔נִי אֶל־אַרְבַּ֖עַת מִקְצוֹעֵ֣י הֶחָצֵ֑ר וְהִנֵּ֤ה חָצֵר֙ בְּמִקְצֹ֣עַ הֶחָצֵ֔ר חָצֵ֖ר בְּמִקְצֹ֥עַ הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translated: Then he led me into the outer court and led me past the four corners of the court; and in each corner of the court there was an enclosure.
Transliteration: vayyvotsiyeniy el-hechatser hachiytsvonah vayaavireniy el-arevaat miketsvoey hechatser vehineh chatser vemiketsoa hechatser chatser vemiketsoa hechatser

Hebrew: בְּאַרְבַּ֜עַת מִקְצֹע֤וֹת הֶחָצֵר֙ חֲצֵר֣וֹת קְטֻר֔וֹת אַרְבָּעִ֣ים אֹ֔רֶךְ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים רֹ֑חַב מִדָּ֣ה אַחַ֔ת לְאַרְבַּעְתָּ֖ם מְׄהֻׄקְׄצָׄעֽׄוֹׄתׄ׃
Translated: These unroofed enclosures, [each] 40 [cubits] long and 30 wide, were in the four corners of the court; the four corner enclosures had the same measurements.
Transliteration: vearevaat miketsovot hechatser chatservot keturvot arevaiym orekhe usheloshiym rochav midah achat learevaetam mehuketsavot

Hebrew: וְט֨וּר סָבִ֥יב בָּהֶ֛ם סָבִ֖יב לְאַרְבַּעְתָּ֑ם וּמְבַשְּׁל֣וֹת עָשׂ֔וּי מִתַּ֥חַת הַטִּיר֖וֹת סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: [On the inside,] running round the four of them, there was a row of masonry, equipped with hearths under the rows all around.
Transliteration: vetur saviyv vahem saviyv learevaetam umevashelvot ashuy mitachat hatiyrvot saviyv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י אֵ֚לֶּה בֵּ֣ית הַֽמְבַשְּׁלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר יְבַשְּׁלוּ־שָׁ֛ם מְשָׁרְתֵ֥י הַבַּ֖יִת אֶת־זֶ֥בַח הָעָֽם׃
Translated: He said to me, “These are the kitchens where the temple servitors shall boil the sacrifices of the people.”
Transliteration: vayomer elay eleh veyt hamevasheliym asher yevashelu-sham mesharetey havayiit et-zevach haam

Hebrew: וַיְשִׁבֵ֘נִי֮ אֶל־פֶּ֣תַח הַבַּ֒יִת֒ וְהִנֵּה־מַ֣יִם יֹצְאִ֗ים מִתַּ֨חַת מִפְתַּ֤ן הַבַּ֙יִת֙ קָדִ֔ימָה כִּֽי־פְנֵ֥י הַבַּ֖יִת קָדִ֑ים וְהַמַּ֣יִם יֹרְדִ֗ים מִתַּ֜חַת מִכֶּ֤תֶף הַבַּ֙יִת֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית מִנֶּ֖גֶב לַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: I was led back to the entrance of the temple, and I found that water was issuing from below the platform of the temple—eastward, since the temple faced east—but the water was running out at the south of the altar, under the south wall of the temple.
Transliteration: vayeshiveniy el-fetach havayiit vehineh-mayiim yotseiym mitachat mifetan havayiit kadiymah khiy-feney havayiit kadiym vehamayiim yorediym mitachat mikhetef havayiit hayemaniyt minegev lamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִאֵ֘נִי֮ דֶּרֶךְ־שַׁ֣עַר צָפ֒וֹנָה֒ וַיְסִבֵּ֙נִי֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ ח֔וּץ אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר הַח֔וּץ דֶּ֖רֶךְ הַפּוֹנֶ֣ה קָדִ֑ים וְהִנֵּה־מַ֣יִם מְפַכִּ֔ים מִן־הַכָּתֵ֖ף הַיְמָנִֽית׃
Translated: Then he led me out by way of the northern gate and led me around to the outside of the outer gate that faces in the direction of the east; and I found that water was gushing from [under] the south wall.
Transliteration: vayyvotsieniy derekhe-shaar tsafvonah vayesiveniy derekhe chuts el-shaar hachuts derekhe hafvoneh kadiym vehineh-mayiim mefakhiym min-hakhatef hayemaniyt

Hebrew: בְּצֵאת־הָאִ֥ישׁ קָדִ֖ים וְקָ֣ו בְּיָד֑וֹ וַיָּ֤מׇד אֶ֙לֶף֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וַיַּעֲבִרֵ֥נִי בַמַּ֖יִם מֵ֥י אׇפְסָֽיִם׃
Translated: As that figure went on eastward with a measuring line in his hand, he measured off a thousand cubits and led me across the water; the water was ankle deep.
Transliteration: vetset-haiysh kadiym vekav veyadvo vayamׇd elef vaamah vayaavireniy vamayiim mey ׇfesayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇד אֶ֔לֶף וַיַּעֲבִרֵ֥נִי בַמַּ֖יִם מַ֣יִם בִּרְכָּ֑יִם וַיָּ֣מׇד אֶ֔לֶף וַיַּעֲבִרֵ֖נִי מֵ֥י מׇתְנָֽיִם׃
Translated: Then he measured off another thousand and led me across the water; the water was knee deep. He measured off a further thousand and led me across the water; the water was up to the waist.
Transliteration: vayamׇd elef vayaavireniy vamayiim mayiim virekhayiim vayamׇd elef vayaavireniy mey mׇtenayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇד אֶ֔לֶף נַ֕חַל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־אוּכַ֖ל לַעֲבֹ֑ר כִּֽי־גָא֤וּ הַמַּ֙יִם֙ מֵ֣י שָׂ֔חוּ נַ֖חַל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יֵעָבֵֽר׃
Translated: When he measured yet another thousand, it was a stream I could not cross; for the water had swollen into a stream that could not be crossed except by swimming.
Transliteration: vayamׇd elef nachal asher lo-ukhal laavor khiy-gau hamayiim mey shachu nachal asher lo-eiaver

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלַ֖י הֲרָאִ֣יתָ בֶן־אָדָ֑ם וַיּוֹלִכֵ֥נִי וַיְשִׁבֵ֖נִי שְׂפַ֥ת הַנָּֽחַל׃
Translated: “Do you see, O mortal?” he said to me; and he led me back to the bank of the stream.
Transliteration: vayomer elay haraiyta ven-adam vayyvolikheniy vayeshiveniy shefat hanachal

Hebrew: בְּשׁוּבֵ֕נִי וְהִנֵּה֙ אֶל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַנַּ֔חַל עֵ֖ץ רַ֣ב מְאֹ֑ד מִזֶּ֖ה וּמִזֶּֽה׃
Translated: As I came back, I saw trees in great profusion on both banks of the stream.
Transliteration: veshuveniy vehineh el-shefat hanachal ets rav meod mizeh umizeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י הַמַּ֤יִם הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ יוֹצְאִ֗ים אֶל־הַגְּלִילָה֙ הַקַּדְמוֹנָ֔ה וְיָרְד֖וּ עַל־הָעֲרָבָ֑ה וּבָ֣אוּ הַיָּ֔מָּה אֶל־הַיָּ֥מָּה הַמּוּצָאִ֖ים וְנִרְפּ֥אוּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: “This water,” he told me, “runs out to the eastern region, and flows into the Arabah; and when it comes into the sea, into the sea of foul waters, the water will become wholesome.
Transliteration: vayomer elay hamayiim haeleh yvotseiym el-hageliylah hakademvonah veyaredu al-haaravah uvau hayamah el-hayamah hamutsaiym venirefu hamayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה כׇל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֣ה <small>׀</small> אֲֽשֶׁר־יִשְׁרֹ֡ץ אֶ֣ל כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר֩ יָב֨וֹא שָׁ֤ם נַחֲלַ֙יִם֙ יִֽחְיֶ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה הַדָּגָ֖ה רַבָּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד כִּי֩ בָ֨אוּ שָׁ֜מָּה הַמַּ֣יִם הָאֵ֗לֶּה וְיֵרָֽפְאוּ֙ וָחָ֔י כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יָ֥בוֹא שָׁ֖מָּה הַנָּֽחַל׃
Translated: Every living creature that swarms will be able to live wherever this stream goes; the fish will be very abundant once these waters have reached there. It will be wholesome, and everything will live wherever this stream goes.
Transliteration: vehayah khׇl-nefesh chayah <small></small> asher-yisherots el khׇl-asher yavvo sham nachalayiim yicheyeh vehayah hadagah ravah meod khiy vau shamah hamayiim haeleh veeirafeu vachay khol asher-yavvo shamah hanachal

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ (יעמדו) [עָמְד֨וּ] עָלָ֜יו דַּוָּגִ֗ים מֵעֵ֥ין גֶּ֙דִי֙ וְעַד־עֵ֣ין עֶגְלַ֔יִם מִשְׁט֥וֹחַ לַחֲרָמִ֖ים יִֽהְי֑וּ לְמִינָהֿ֙ תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה דְגָתָ֔ם כִּדְגַ֛ת הַיָּ֥ם הַגָּד֖וֹל רַבָּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Fishermen shall stand beside it all the way from En-gedi to En-eglaim; it shall be a place for drying nets; and the fish will be of various kinds [and] most plentiful, like the fish of the Great Sea.
Transliteration: vehayah (ymdv) [amedu] alayv davagiym meeyn gediy vead-eyn egelayiim mishetvocha lacharamiym yiheyu lemiynahֿ tiheyeh degatam khidegat hayam hagadvol ravah meod

Hebrew: בִּצֹּאתָ֧ו וּגְבָאָ֛יו וְלֹ֥א יֵרָפְא֖וּ לְמֶ֥לַח נִתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: But its swamps and marshes shall not become wholesome; they will serve to [supply] salt.
Transliteration: vitsotav ugevaayv velo eirafeu lemelach nitanu

Hebrew: וְעַל־הַנַּ֣חַל יַעֲלֶ֣ה עַל־שְׂפָת֣וֹ מִזֶּ֣ה ׀ וּמִזֶּ֣ה ׀ כׇּל־עֵֽץ־מַ֠אֲכָ֠ל לֹא־יִבּ֨וֹל עָלֵ֜הוּ וְלֹֽא־יִתֹּ֣ם פִּרְי֗וֹ לׇחֳדָשָׁיו֙ יְבַכֵּ֔ר כִּ֣י מֵימָ֔יו מִן־הַמִּקְדָּ֖שׁ הֵ֣מָּה יוֹצְאִ֑ים (והיו) [וְהָיָ֤ה] פִרְיוֹ֙ לְמַאֲכָ֔ל וְעָלֵ֖הוּ לִתְרוּפָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: All kinds of trees for food will grow up on both banks of the stream. Their leaves will not wither nor their fruit fail; they will yield new fruit every month, because the water for them flows from the temple. Their fruit will serve for food and their leaves for healing.”
Transliteration: veal-hanachal yaaleh al-shefatvo mizeh umizeh khׇl-ets-maakhal lo-yivvol alehu velo-yitom fireyvo lׇchodashayv yevakher khiy meymayv min-hamikedash hemah yvotseiym (vhyv) [vehayah] fireyvo lemaakhal vealehu literufah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה גֵּ֤ה גְבוּל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתְנַחֲל֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ לִשְׁנֵ֥י עָשָׂ֖ר שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יוֹסֵ֖ף חֲבָלִֽים׃
Translated: Thus said the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>: These shall be the boundaries of the land that you shall allot to the twelve tribes of Israel. Joseph shall receive two portions,
Transliteration: khoh amar adonay yehovih geh gevul asher titenachalu et-haarets lisheney ashar shivetey yisherael yvosef chavaliym

Hebrew: וּנְחַלְתֶּ֤ם אוֹתָהּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ כְּאָחִ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־יָדִ֔י לְתִתָּ֖הּ לַאֲבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם וְנָ֨פְלָ֜ה הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את לָכֶ֖ם בְּנַחֲלָֽה׃
Translated: and you shall share the rest equally. As I swore to give it to your fathers, so shall this land fall to you as your heritage.
Transliteration: unechaletem votah iysh kheachiyv asher nashatiy et-yadiy letitah laavoteykhem venafelah haarets hazot lakhem venachalah

Hebrew: וְזֶ֖ה גְּב֣וּל הָאָ֑רֶץ לִפְאַ֨ת צָפ֜וֹנָה מִן־הַיָּ֧ם הַגָּד֛וֹל הַדֶּ֥רֶךְ חֶתְלֹ֖ן לְב֥וֹא צְדָֽדָה׃
Translated:
These are the boundaries of the land:
As the northern limit: From the Great Sea by way of Hethlon, Lebo-hamath, Zedad,
Transliteration: vezeh gevul haarets lifeat tsafvonah min-hayam hagadvol haderekhe chetelon levvo tsedadah

Hebrew: חֲמָ֤ת <small>׀</small> בֵּר֙וֹתָה֙ סִבְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁר֙ בֵּין־גְּב֣וּל דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וּבֵ֖ין גְּב֣וּל חֲמָ֑ת חָצֵר֙ הַתִּיכ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֶל־גְּב֥וּל חַוְרָֽן׃
Translated: Berathah, Sibraim—which lies between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath—[down to] Hazer-hatticon, which is on the border of Hauran.
Transliteration: chamat <small></small> vervotah siverayiim asher veyn-gevul dameshek uveyn gevul chamat chatser hatiykhvon asher el-gevul chaveran

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה גְב֜וּל מִן־הַיָּ֗ם חֲצַ֤ר עֵינוֹן֙ גְּב֣וּל דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וְצָפ֥וֹן <small>׀</small> צָפ֖וֹנָה וּגְב֣וּל חֲמָ֑ת וְאֵ֖ת פְּאַ֥ת צָפֽוֹן׃
Translated: Thus the boundary shall run from the Sea to Hazar-enon, to the north of the territory of Damascus, with the territory of Hamath to the north of it. That shall be the northern limit.
Transliteration: vehayah gevul min-hayam chatsar eynvon gevul dameshek vetsafvon <small></small> tsafvonah ugevul chamat veet feat tsafvon

Hebrew: וּפְאַ֣ת קָדִ֡ים מִבֵּ֣ין חַוְרָ֣ן וּמִבֵּין־דַּמֶּ֩שֶׂק֩ וּמִבֵּ֨ין הַגִּלְעָ֜ד וּמִבֵּ֨ין אֶ֤רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן מִגְּב֛וּל עַל־הַיָּ֥ם הַקַּדְמוֹנִ֖י תָּמֹ֑דּוּ וְאֵ֖ת פְּאַ֥ת קָדִֽימָה׃
Translated: As the eastern limit: A line between Hauran and Damascus, and between Gilead and the land of Israel: with the Jordan as a boundary, you shall measure down to the Eastern Sea. That shall be the eastern limit.
Transliteration: ufeat kadiym miveyn chaveran umiveyn-dameshek umiveyn hagilead umiveyn erets yisherael hayareden migevul al-hayam hakademvoniy tamodu veet feat kadiymah

Hebrew: וּפְאַת֙ נֶ֣גֶב תֵּימָ֔נָה מִתָּמָ֗ר עַד־מֵי֙ מְרִיב֣וֹת קָדֵ֔שׁ נַחֲלָ֖ה אֶל־הַיָּ֣ם הַגָּד֑וֹל וְאֵ֥ת פְּאַת־תֵּימָ֖נָה נֶֽגְבָּה׃
Translated: The southern limit shall run: A line from Tamar to the Waters of Meribath-kadesh, along the Wadi [of Egypt and] the Great Sea. That is the southern limit.
Transliteration: ufeat negev teymanah mitamar ad-mey meriyvvot kadesh nachalah el-hayam hagadvol veet feat-teymanah negevah

Hebrew: וּפְאַת־יָם֙ הַיָּ֣ם הַגָּד֔וֹל מִגְּב֕וּל עַד־נֹ֖כַח לְב֣וֹא חֲמָ֑ת זֹ֖את פְּאַת־יָֽם׃
Translated: And as the western limit: The Great Sea shall be the boundary up to a point opposite Lebo-hamath. That shall be the western limit.
Transliteration: ufeat-yam hayam hagadvol migevul ad-nokhach levvo chamat zot feat-yam

Hebrew: וְחִלַּקְתֶּ֞ם אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את לָכֶ֖ם לְשִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: This land you shall divide for yourselves among the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: vechilaketem et-haarets hazot lakhem leshivetey yisherael

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה תַּפִּ֣לוּ אוֹתָהּ֮ בְּנַחֲלָה֒ לָכֶ֗ם וּלְהַגֵּרִים֙ הַגָּרִ֣ים בְּתוֹכְכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹלִ֥דוּ בָנִ֖ים בְּתוֹכְכֶ֑ם וְהָי֣וּ לָכֶ֗ם כְּאֶזְרָח֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִתְּכֶם֙ יִפְּל֣וּ בְנַֽחֲלָ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: You shall allot it as a heritage for yourselves and for the strangers who reside among you, who have begotten children among you. You shall treat them as Israelite citizens; they shall receive allotments along with you among the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: vehayah tafilu votah venachalah lakhem ulehageriym hagariym vetvokhekhem asher-hvolidu vaniym vetvokhekhem vehayu lakhem kheezerach viveney yisherael itekhem yifelu venachalah vetvokhe shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה בַשֵּׁ֔בֶט אֲשֶׁר־גָּ֥ר הַגֵּ֖ר אִתּ֑וֹ שָׁ֚ם תִּתְּנ֣וּ נַחֲלָת֔וֹ נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall give the strangers an allotment within the tribe where they reside—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehayah vashevet asher-gar hager itvo sham titenu nachalatvo neum adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת הַשְּׁבָטִ֑ים מִקְצֵ֣ה צָפ֡וֹנָה אֶל־יַ֣ד דֶּֽרֶךְ־חֶתְלֹ֣ן <small>׀</small> לְֽבוֹא־חֲמָ֡ת חֲצַ֣ר עֵינָן֩ גְּב֨וּל דַּמֶּ֤שֶׂק צָפ֙וֹנָה֙ אֶל־יַ֣ד חֲמָ֔ת וְהָיוּ־ל֧וֹ פְאַת־קָדִ֛ים הַיָּ֖ם דָּ֥ן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated:
These are the names of the tribes:
At the northern end, along the Hethlon road, [from] Lebo-hamath to Hazar-enan—which is the border of Damascus, with Hamath to the north—from the eastern border to the Sea: Dan—one [tribe].
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot hashevatiym miketseh tsafvonah el-yad derekhe-chetelon <small></small> levvo-chamat chatsar eynan gevul dameshek tsafvonah el-yad chamat vehayu-lvo feat-kadiym hayam dan echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל דָּ֗ן מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛ים עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה אָשֵׁ֥ר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Dan, from the eastern border to the western border: Asher—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul dan mifeat kadiym ad-feat-yamah asher echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל אָשֵׁ֗ר מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛ימָה וְעַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה נַפְתָּלִ֥י אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Asher, from the eastern border to the western border: Naphtali—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul asher mifeat kadiymah vead-feat-yamah nafetaliy echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל נַפְתָּלִ֗י מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛מָה עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Naphtali, from the eastern border to the western border: Manasseh—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul nafetaliy mifeat kadimah ad-feat-yamah menasheh echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛מָה עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה אֶפְרַ֥יִם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Manasseh, from the eastern border to the western border: Ephraim—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul menasheh mifeat kadimah ad-feat-yamah eferayiim echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל אֶפְרַ֗יִם מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛ים וְעַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה רְאוּבֵ֥ן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Ephraim, from the eastern border to the western border: Reuben—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul eferayiim mifeat kadiym vead-feat-yamah reuven echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל רְאוּבֵ֗ן מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛ים עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה יְהוּדָ֥ה אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Reuben, from the eastern border to the western border: Judah—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul reuven mifeat kadiym ad-feat-yamah yehudah echad

Hebrew: וְעַל֙ גְּב֣וּל יְהוּדָ֔ה מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֖ים עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֑מָּה תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה הַתְּרוּמָ֣ה אֲֽשֶׁר־תָּרִ֡ימוּ חֲמִשָּׁה֩ וְעֶשְׂרִ֨ים אֶ֜לֶף רֹ֗חַב וְאֹ֜רֶךְ כְּאַחַ֤ד הַֽחֲלָקִים֙ מִפְּאַ֤ת קָדִ֙ימָה֙ עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֔מָּה וְהָיָ֥ה הַמִּקְדָּ֖שׁ בְּתוֹכֽוֹ׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Judah, from the eastern border to the western border, shall be the reserve that you set aside: 25,000 [cubits] in breadth and in length equal to one of the portions from the eastern border to the western border; the Sanctuary shall be in the middle of it.
Transliteration: veal gevul yehudah mifeat kadiym ad-feat-yamah tiheyeh haterumah asher-tariymu chamishah veesheriym elef rochav veorekhe kheachad hachalakiym mifeat kadiymah ad-feat-yamah vehayah hamikedash vetvokhvo

Hebrew: הַתְּרוּמָ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּרִ֖ימוּ לַיהֹוָ֑ה אֹ֗רֶךְ חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְרֹ֖חַב עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: The reserve that you set aside for G<small>OD</small> shall be 25,000 long and 10,000 wide.
Transliteration: haterumah asher tariymu layhovah orekhe chamishah veesheriym elef verochav asheret alafiym

Hebrew: וּ֜֠לְאֵ֜֠לֶּה תִּהְיֶ֣ה תְרוּמַת־הַקֹּ֘דֶשׁ֮ לַכֹּהֲנִים֒ צָפ֜וֹנָה חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֣ים אֶ֗לֶף וְיָ֙מָּה֙ רֹ֚חַב עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת אֲלָפִ֔ים וְקָדִ֗ימָה רֹ֚חַב עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת אֲלָפִ֔ים וְנֶ֕גְבָּה אֹ֕רֶךְ חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָ֑לֶף וְהָיָ֥ה מִקְדַּשׁ־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּתוֹכֽוֹ׃
Translated: It shall be apportioned to the following: The sacred reserve for the priests shall measure 25,000 [cubits] on the north, 10,000 on the west, 10,000 on the east, and 25,000 on the south, with G<small>OD</small>’s Sanctuary in the middle of it.
Transliteration: uleeleh tiheyeh terumat-hakodesh lakhohaniym tsafvonah chamishah veesheriym elef veyamah rochav asheret alafiym vekadiymah rochav asheret alafiym venegevah orekhe chamishah veesheriym alef vehayah mikedash-yehovah vetvokhvo

Hebrew: לַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים הַֽמְקֻדָּשׁ֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י צָד֔וֹק אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמְר֖וּ מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֑י אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־תָע֗וּ בִּתְעוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּע֖וּ הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: This consecrated area shall be for the priests of the line of Zadok, who kept My charge and did not go astray, as the Levites did when the people of Israel went astray.
Transliteration: lakhohaniym hamekudash miveney tsadvok asher shameru mishemaretiy asher lo-tau vitevot veney yisherael khaasher tau haleviyim

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֨ה לָהֶ֧ם תְּרוּמִיָּ֛ה מִתְּרוּמַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קׇדָשִׁ֑ים אֶל־גְּב֖וּל הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: It shall be a special reserve for them out of the [total] reserve from the land, most holy, adjoining the territory of the Levites.
Transliteration: vehayetah lahem terumiyah miterumat haarets kodesh kׇdashiym el-gevul haleviyim

Hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֗ם לְעֻמַּת֙ גְּב֣וּל הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים חֲמִשָּׁ֨ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ וְרֹ֖חַב עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת אֲלָפִ֑ים כׇּל־אֹ֗רֶךְ חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְרֹ֖חַב עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: Alongside the territory of the priests, the Levites shall have [an area] 25,000 long by 10,000 wide; the total length shall be 25,000 and the breadth 10,000.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim leumat gevul hakhohaniym chamishah veesheriym elef orekhe verochav asheret alafiym khׇl-orekhe chamishah veesheriym elef verochav asheret alafiym

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִמְכְּר֣וּ מִמֶּ֗נּוּ וְלֹ֥א יָמֵ֛ר וְלֹ֥א (יעבור) [יַעֲבִ֖יר] רֵאשִׁ֣ית הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: None of it—the choicest of the land—may be sold, exchanged, or transferred; it is sacred to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velo-yimekheru mimenu velo yamer velo (yvvr) [yaaviyr] reshiyt haarets khiy-kodesh layhovah

Hebrew: וַחֲמֵ֨שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֜ים הַנּוֹתָ֣ר בָּרֹ֗חַב עַל־פְּנֵי֙ חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף חֹֽל־ה֣וּא לָעִ֔יר לְמוֹשָׁ֖ב וּלְמִגְרָ֑שׁ וְהָיְתָ֥ה הָעִ֖יר בְּתוֹכֹֽה׃
Translated: The remaining 5,000 in breadth by 25,000 shall be for common use—serving the city for dwellings and pasture. The city itself shall be in the middle of it;
Transliteration: vachameshet alafiym hanvotar varochav al-feney chamishah veesheriym elef chol-hu laiyr lemvoshav ulemigerash vehayetah haiyr vetvokhoh

Hebrew: וְאֵ֘לֶּה֮ מִדּוֹתֶ֒יהָ֒ פְּאַ֣ת צָפ֗וֹן חֲמֵ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ וְאַרְבַּ֣עַת אֲלָפִ֔ים וּפְאַת־נֶ֕גֶב חֲמֵ֥שׁ (חמש) מֵא֖וֹת וְאַרְבַּ֣עַת אֲלָפִ֑ים וּמִפְּאַ֣ת קָדִ֗ים חֲמֵ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ וְאַרְבַּ֣עַת אֲלָפִ֔ים וּפְאַת־יָ֕מָּה חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וְאַרְבַּ֥עַת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: and these shall be its measurements: On the north side 4,500 cubits, on the south side 4,500, on the east side 4,500, and on the west side 4,500.
Transliteration: veeleh midvoteyha feat tsafvon chamesh mevot vearevaat alafiym ufeat-negev chamesh (chmsh) mevot vearevaat alafiym umifeat kadiym chamesh mevot vearevaat alafiym ufeat-yamah chamesh mevot vearevaat alafiym

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה מִגְרָשׁ֮ לָעִיר֒ צָפ֙וֹנָה֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתַ֔יִם וְנֶ֖גְבָּה חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתָ֑יִם וְקָדִ֙ימָה֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתַ֔יִם וְיָ֖מָּה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
Translated: The pasture shall extend 250 cubits to the north of the city, 250 to the south, 250 to the east, and 250 to the west.
Transliteration: vehayah migerash laiyr tsafvonah chamishiym umatayiim venegevah chamishiym umatayiim vekadiymah chamishiym umatayiim veyamah chamishiym umatayiim

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֨ר בָּאֹ֜רֶךְ לְעֻמַּ֣ת ׀ תְּרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֗דֶשׁ עֲשֶׂ֨רֶת אֲלָפִ֤ים קָדִ֙ימָה֙ וַעֲשֶׂ֤רֶת אֲלָפִים֙ יָ֔מָּה וְהָיָ֕ה לְעֻמַּ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְהָיְתָ֤ה תְבֽוּאָתֹה֙ לְלֶ֔חֶם לְעֹבְדֵ֖י הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: As for the remaining 10,000 to the east and 10,000 to the west, adjoining the long side of the sacred reserve, the produce of these areas adjoining the sacred reserve shall serve as food for the workers in the city;
Transliteration: vehanvotar vaorekhe leumat terumat hakodesh asheret alafiym kadiymah vaasheret alafiym yamah vehayah leumat terumat hakodesh vehayetah tevuatoh lelechem leovedey haiyr

Hebrew: וְהָעֹבֵ֖ד הָעִ֑יר יַעַבְד֕וּהוּ מִכֹּ֖ל שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: the workers in the city from all the tribes of Israel shall cultivate it.
