Transliteration: vehaoved haiyr yaaveduhu mikhol shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַתְּרוּמָ֗ה חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָ֑לֶף רְבִיעִ֗ית תָּרִ֙ימוּ֙ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ אֶל־אֲחֻזַּ֖ת הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: The entire reserve, 25,000 square, you shall set aside as the sacred reserve plus the city property.
Transliteration: khׇl-haterumah chamishah veesheriym elef vachamishah veesheriym alef reviyiyt tariymu et-terumat hakodesh el-achuzat haiyr

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֣ר לַנָּשִׂ֣יא מִזֶּ֣ה <small>׀</small> וּמִזֶּ֣ה <small>׀</small> לִתְרֽוּמַת־הַקֹּ֣דֶשׁ וְלַאֲחֻזַּ֪ת הָעִ֟יר אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י חֲמִשָּׁה֩ וְעֶשְׂרִ֨ים אֶ֥לֶף <small>׀</small> תְּרוּמָה֮ עַד־גְּב֣וּל קָדִ֒ימָה֒ וְיָ֗מָּה עַל־פְּ֠נֵ֠י חֲמִשָּׁ֨ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ עַל־גְּב֣וּל יָ֔מָּה לְעֻמַּ֥ת חֲלָקִ֖ים לַנָּשִׂ֑יא וְהָֽיְתָה֙ תְּרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וּמִקְדַּ֥שׁ הַבַּ֖יִת בְּתוֹכֹֽה׃
Translated: What remains on either side of the sacred reserve and the city property shall belong to the prince. The prince shall own [the land] from the border of the 25,000 of the reserve up to the eastern boundary, and from the border of the 25,000 on the west up to the western boundary, corresponding to the [tribal] portions. The sacred reserve, with the Temple Sanctuary in the middle of it
Transliteration: vehanvotar lanashiy mizeh <small></small> umizeh <small></small> literumat-hakodesh velaachuzat haiyr el-feney chamishah veesheriym elef <small></small> terumah ad-gevul kadiymah veyamah al-feney chamishah veesheriym elef al-gevul yamah leumat chalakiym lanashiy vehayetah terumat hakodesh umikedash havayiit vetvokhoh

Hebrew: וּמֵאֲחֻזַּ֤ת הַלְוִיִּם֙ וּמֵאֲחֻזַּ֣ת הָעִ֔יר בְּת֛וֹךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לַנָּשִׂ֖יא יִהְיֶ֑ה בֵּ֣ין ׀ גְּב֣וּל יְהוּדָ֗ה וּבֵין֙ גְּב֣וּל בִּנְיָמִ֔ן לַנָּשִׂ֖יא יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: and the property of the Levites and the city property as well, shall be in the middle of the [area belonging] to the prince; [the rest of the land] between the territory of Judah and the territory of Benjamin shall belong to the prince.
Transliteration: umeachuzat haleviyim umeachuzat haiyr vetvokhe asher lanashiy yiheyeh veyn gevul yehudah uveyn gevul vineyamin lanashiy yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְיֶ֖תֶר הַשְּׁבָטִ֑ים מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛ימָה עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה בִּנְיָמִ֥ן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: As for the remaining tribes: From the eastern border to the western border: Benjamin—one.
Transliteration: veyeter hashevatiym mifeat kadiymah ad-feat-yamah vineyamin echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל בִּנְיָמִ֗ן מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛ימָה עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה שִׁמְע֥וֹן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Benjamin, from the eastern border to the western border: Simeon—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul vineyamin mifeat kadiymah ad-feat-yamah shimevon echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל שִׁמְע֗וֹן מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛ימָה עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה יִשָּׂשכָ֥ר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Simeon, from the eastern border to the western border: Issachar—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul shimevon mifeat kadiymah ad-feat-yamah yishashkhar echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל יִשָּׂשכָ֗ר מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛ימָה עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה זְבוּלֻ֥ן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Issachar, from the eastern border to the western border: Zebulun—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul yishashkhar mifeat kadiymah ad-feat-yamah zevulun echad

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ גְּב֣וּל זְבוּלֻ֗ן מִפְּאַ֥ת קָדִ֛מָה עַד־פְּאַת־יָ֖מָּה גָּ֥ד אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Adjoining the territory of Zebulun, from the eastern border to the western border: Gad—one.
Transliteration: veal gevul zevulun mifeat kadimah ad-feat-yamah gad echad

Hebrew: וְעַל֙ גְּב֣וּל גָּ֔ד אֶל־פְּאַ֖ת נֶ֣גֶב תֵּימָ֑נָה וְהָיָ֨ה גְב֜וּל מִתָּמָ֗ר מֵ֚י מְרִיבַ֣ת קָדֵ֔שׁ נַחֲלָ֖ה עַל־הַיָּ֥ם הַגָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: The other border of Gad shall be the southern boundary. This boundary shall run from Tamar to the Waters of Meribath-kadesh, to the Wadi [of Egypt], and to the Great Sea.
Transliteration: veal gevul gad el-feat negev teymanah vehayah gevul mitamar mey meriyvat kadesh nachalah al-hayam hagadvol

Hebrew: זֹ֥את הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־תַּפִּ֥ילוּ מִֽנַּחֲלָ֖ה לְשִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ מַחְלְקוֹתָ֔ם נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: That is the land that you shall allot as a heritage to the tribes of Israel, and those are their portions—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: zot haarets asher-tafiylu minachalah leshivetey yisherael veeleh machelekvotam neum adonay yehovih {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה תּוֹצְאֹ֣ת הָעִ֑יר מִפְּאַ֣ת צָפ֔וֹן חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֛וֹת וְאַרְבַּ֥עַת אֲלָפִ֖ים מִדָּֽה׃
Translated: And these are the exits from the city: On its northern side, measuring 4,500 cubits,
Transliteration: veeleh tvotseot haiyr mifeat tsafvon chamesh mevot vearevaat alafiym midah

Hebrew: וְשַׁעֲרֵ֣י הָעִ֗יר עַל־שְׁמוֹת֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שְׁעָרִ֥ים שְׁלוֹשָׁ֖ה צָפ֑וֹנָה שַׁ֣עַר רְאוּבֵ֞ן אֶחָ֗ד שַׁ֤עַר יְהוּדָה֙ אֶחָ֔ד שַׁ֥עַר לֵוִ֖י אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the gates of the city shall be—three gates on the north—named for the tribes of Israel: the Reuben Gate: one; the Judah Gate: one; the Levi Gate: one.
Transliteration: veshaarey haiyr al-shemvot shivetey yisherael sheariym shelvoshah tsafvonah shaar reuven echad shaar yehudah echad shaar leviy echad

Hebrew: וְאֶל־פְּאַ֣ת קָדִ֗ימָה חֲמֵ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ וְאַרְבַּ֣עַת אֲלָפִ֔ים וּשְׁעָרִ֖ים שְׁלֹשָׁ֑ה וְשַׁ֨עַר יוֹסֵ֜ף אֶחָ֗ד שַׁ֤עַר בִּנְיָמִן֙ אֶחָ֔ד שַׁ֥עַר דָּ֖ן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: On the eastern side, [measuring] 4,500 cubits—there shall be three gates: the Joseph Gate: one; the Benjamin Gate: one; and the Dan Gate: one.
Transliteration: veel-feat kadiymah chamesh mevot vearevaat alafiym usheariym sheloshah veshaar yvosef echad shaar vineyamin echad shaar dan echad

Hebrew: וּפְאַת־נֶ֗גְבָּה חֲמֵ֨שׁ מֵא֜וֹת וְאַרְבַּ֤עַת אֲלָפִים֙ מִדָּ֔ה וּשְׁעָרִ֖ים שְׁלֹשָׁ֑ה שַׁ֣עַר שִׁמְע֞וֹן אֶחָ֗ד שַׁ֤עַר יִשָּׂשכָר֙ אֶחָ֔ד שַׁ֥עַר זְבוּלֻ֖ן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: On the southern side, measuring 4,500 cubits, there shall be three gates: the Simeon Gate: one; the Issachar Gate: one; and the Zebulun Gate: one.
Transliteration: ufeat-negevah chamesh mevot vearevaat alafiym midah usheariym sheloshah shaar shimevon echad shaar yishashkhar echad shaar zevulun echad

Hebrew: פְּאַת־יָ֗מָּה חֲמֵ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ וְאַרְבַּ֣עַת אֲלָפִ֔ים שַׁעֲרֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֑ה שַׁ֣עַר גָּ֞ד אֶחָ֗ד שַׁ֤עַר אָשֵׁר֙ אֶחָ֔ד שַׁ֥עַר נַפְתָּלִ֖י אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: And on the western side, [measuring] 4,500 cubits—there shall be three gates: the Gad Gate: one; the Asher Gate: one; the Naphtali Gate: one.
Transliteration: feat-yamah chamesh mevot vearevaat alafiym shaareyhem sheloshah shaar gad echad shaar asher echad shaar nafetaliy echad

Hebrew: סָבִ֕יב שְׁמֹנָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אָ֑לֶף וְשֵׁם־הָעִ֥יר מִיּ֖וֹם יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: Its circumference [shall be] 18,000 [cubits]; and the name of the city from that day on shall be “G<small>OD</small> Is There.”
Transliteration: saviyv shemonah ashar alef veshem-haiyr miyyvom yehovah <small></small> shamah
